text: Has the Crazy Alfredo it's amazing! If you like pasta with a little spice you have to try it. I went on a Saturday so the wait for our food was a little long but if your into cocktails have a lemon drop and you'll be fine ;-).

Found this restaurant on a recent trip to Vegas. Great food and atmosphere. Prices were not crazy. We ate at a lot of places on the Strip but I thought this was the best food I had during the entire vacation. If you go, try the Lemon Drop martini!! It was amazing to watch the bartender make this specialty drink. It's not like any other one you have ever tried!

By reading the other reviews , I am guessing I went there on a bad night.
I see lots of people complimenting their marinara sauce, so it can't be that bad.. but the one I was served was either the end of the batch of they ran out and had to use some baught in the store.
Their pasta were very bland, nothing out of the ordinary, store baught pasta are just as good.
The worst part, to me , was their garlic bread. i refuse to believe that what i was served is what they normally serve. I look, and tasted, like frozen garlic bread from the store, only with more garlic and more cheese added.
I had a garlic taste lasting for days after that one..
Like I said , after reading the other reviews, something must have been wrong when I was there , was the chef off ? maybe they didn't receive some deliveries ? Maybe they had tons of cooks calling sick ? 
I am not sure , but I will have to come back , for sure it won't be as bad..

Only had the pizza here and the arancini ( and some of the crazy alfredo ). All were excellent. Flavorful sauce, great crust and topping on the pizza ( I had the "salami" pizza ). I will be going back for more !

Soooooooo delish!  Smells wonderful as you approach the doors of this hidden gem.  Don't let the strip mall location fool you, this is wonderful, friendly authentic Italian!

Decided already this will be among our favorite dining spots.  We topped by for an early dinner prior to a show, the place was filling fast on a weeknight, so call ahead to reserve your table!

So busy!! Make a reservation. I ordered the cheese ravioli with vodka sauce and a side of meatball and sausage just to try. All of it was delicious and the service was great. The live music was a nice touch as well.

The place is very casual but fantastic food...I am a born and bread NEw Yorker and to find such fine Italian food out in Vegas is unreal!!! I had the Veal chop parmigiana which was out of this world!!!  Food 5 stars decor only 3...but that is not what this place is about.

This place is great! We came from CA with the kids and we are coming back! I don't care about any reviews this place is awesome.  Great food, great service, I might just drive back from LA for the food.

If I could assign"zero" stars I would. Absolutely horrible. Service......bad. Food.......worse. No attention at all is given after you're seated. Had to get up and find my server for a knife! Had to get up and find my server for drink refills. And I still left 20% grat. Used to frequent the original Nora's back in the 90's. They lost their way from those days. But the place was packed so I'm sure they will not change. However they will go forward without my business or that of my friends unless they do change. ASAP!!!

Unsure why this restaurant is rated so high.  The young boys who greet guests at the door and bus the tables were lovely and adorable but the food was really average or less than average.

I visited Nora's many years ago and was disappointed but after hearing so many positive things, I decided to go back - eager, hungry and with an open mind.  I figured I must have visited on an "off" night before.

Nope.  Quite mediocre.  Food quality seemed greasy and cheap.

Fried Calamari:  Greasy but certainly edible (2.5 stars)
Caprese Salad: Mozzarella (5 stars), tomatoes (less than 1 star)
Tortellini with Vodka Sauce and added chicken:  pretty tasty (3.5 stars)
Garlic Bread:  Tasty but cheap and I am huge bread fan (2.5 stars)
Chicken Parm - terrible, way too salty (1 star)

Soda: crisp and bubbly (5 stars)
espresso:  strong with great flavor (5 stars)

Ambience: bustling, a bit noisy because they are so busy, jubilant crowd during baseball game on bar TV, pleasant staff....This is a regular ol' family restaurant.

Since Nora's moved to their new location, there has been a major parking issue. The parking lot is too small; there is an inadequate amount of parking spaces. My husband and I were forced to parallel park on the street next to the restaurant at 5:30 pm on Tuesday night, Dec. 6th, 2016, which led to us getting into a frightening altercation with another motorist.

Although the food is excellent, we will not be returning to Nora's restaurant until they resolve the parking issue---either by expanding their parking lot, or offering valet parking.
The food was well priced and the actual location wasn't too bad.  My wife had the spaghetti and meatballs and I had the lasagna.  Both were really salty.  Probably won't go back.

I had eaten there many times with the same friend and after an absence of many months the two of returned. The waitress recognized us and gave a friendly greeting. I asked for chicken erbi fini and the waitress said it was no longer on the menu, but it would be no problem. So far so good. 

When the chicken came it was a bit over cooked and I thought the spaghetti sauce not up to par, but it was still pretty good. 

It was my friend's turn to pay and he gave the waitress his credit card. She returned and apologized and said since we hadn't been there in a while she would have to see his ID. My friend was not put off by this, but I was. I would have been very annoyed if that had happened to me, especially if I was bring someone there for business and they recognized me as a returning customer and still wanted to see my ID. I left not eager to return. WHEN I MENTIONED THIS CREDIT CARD ISSUE TO MY FRIEND MUCH LATER, HE TOLD ME THAT HIS WIFE INSISTS ON WRITING ON THE BACK OF EACH OF HIS CREDIT CARDS, "PLEASE DEMAND TO SEE MY ID." So, I think what happened is that the waitress obviously didn't look at the back of his credit card, the cashier did and just told the waitress w/o explanation to check that customer's ID. This goes to show how it can be tough to please in a service industry such as a restaurant.
I've been coming here for many years and it's just as wonderful today as the first time! Always have stellar service & delicious food...especially love when they have piano players!

Great place in Las Vegas for good food at a reasonable price.  In the past i ahve had the Crazy Alfredo and Shrimp Scampi both were great.  This time i had the Frutti Di Mare it was great.  The Antipasto is very good.  All the portion are generous.  You won't leave hungry.  They had a special Osso Bucco special that a couple in our party had that they said was very good.  Overall i try to hit this place everytime i am in vegas.

A friend told me that this was a very good Italian Restaurant & i have to say I was a little disappointed..they gave you garlic bread that was very hard. The calamari was a little chewy. The baked rigatoni was over cooked. The restaurant itself is a little outdated. I sat near the bar and they have this ceiling to floor curtain that look like it hasn't been cleaned in 20 years..The service was ok. I owned pizzerias and I made better Italian food than this so called really good local Italian restaurant..I am sure they will never see me again

The uber driver's navigation couldn't get us there, but Google came to the rescue and we made our reservation. 

We were seated immediately and our server, Ed, came to greet us with a smile. He made good recommendations and we were pleased. 

Starters were tasty. The shrimp scampi was very good. Lots of tasty garlic bread to sop up the sauce. Would I make the bread crispier? Yes
Did I eat it? Yes
Would I order it again? Yes

The Mozzarella Cambrese was fine. Cheese was on the edge of grainy....not awesome, but fine.

The Osso Bucco was outstanding. Tender but not overcooked. Delicious and sumptuous.

The crazy alfredo was excellent, although a little stingy with the protein, but still, quite tasty.

Veal Parm was solid.

The surprise of the table was salmon piccata. As dish that would be easy to mess up...they didn't. They married those hard to meld flavors into something special.

While I have no need to return to Vegas this year, if I do...we will return.

Have lived in Summerlin for 14 years and am a total foodie. Ate at Nora's years ago before Yelp and had a great meal. Super excited to try the new location for my 22nd wedding anniversary after having tried all of the DTS restaurants and nearby restaurants in the Summerlin area, i.e., T-Bones, Vinter's Grill, Andiron, Echo and Rig. While the food was pretty darn good (enough to overcome sending back the Veal and Molten cake because they were too cold), the biggest bummer was the service. She made no attempt to help us celebrate our anniversary or remedy the not so perfect temperature of the food. And the only reason I am even writing this is, they forgot to bring us our leftovers!!

Went on a surprisingly busy Tuesday night of the Election.  We had made reservations for 6:30 pm, but because we were a little bit hungrier than expected, we arrived at 6:00 pm.  Obviously, we were a bit too early so we waited for no longer than ten minutes to get seated for dinner.  Not a problem.  When we finally got the chance to sit down, we were immediately greeted by assistant waiters who eagerly got our drinks order.  Again, it was a busy Tuesday night so the wait for the drinks was a little bit longer but wasn't waaaay too long.  It gave us just enough time to say dinner prayers so we were thankful for that.  I ordered the Puttanesca as my entree and while it was deliciously hot and tasty, it was somewhat lacking the anchovies which I was looking forward to.  Mom ordered a Riesling from the wine collection and it was dynamite.  So good.  Ramon was our waiter and my goodness, what a terrific server.  He asked us first if we had any questions about the menu after we spent about ten minutes with the menu before he came over to take our order.  What a rare treat!  We are also grateful for the hostesses who accommodated us.  Forgive us for not remembering their names, but we do remember their faces.  We are coming back soon.

When ever i am Vegas, i make an effort to go to Nora's Italian Cuisine.  Its a quiet oasis off the strip for good ole italian food.  The antipasto salad is one of the best.  The pastas are excellent and well proportion.  I rarely have room for dessert.  but i try that's for sure.  

Do not be intimidated by the strip mall location.  once inside the doors, the restaurant brings you back in time to the local italian meals that i remember my parents take us for a special night out.  Make sure you ask to be seated the same room as the bar - a bit more atmosphere on that side of the "house".

The best Antipasto Salad!!! It's best to eat it at the restaurant instead of taking it home. If you take it home, the salad soaks a bit and will not be the same. Since it is a local favorite, be sure to call to reserve your seat. It is always packed.

Two stars only for the food. The food was great, the service was TERRIBLE. They told us there was a two hour wait when we arrived even though there were empty tables everywhere. Then we went online while there made a reservation for the same time and was seated. The wait time is a lie. They always have empty seats. Then they told the couple behind us 45 and another couple was seated right away. They are completely selective. They also charge four dollars to change sauces. The experience was terrible, only the food made up for it.

The Veal Parma Entree is amazing.  That is my go to dish every time I am here.  The garlic bread is terrific, the only problem is they cany keep your bread basket full as your group will surely eat the bread faster then the servers can fill it.  I love this place.

Had dinner with friends here last night and everything far exceeded my expectations. We had the steak bruschetta and spinach farro salad for app's and both were so delicious. We all loved our main courses, two of us had very picky specifications and they got both of our changed dishes perfect. Such an enjoyable meal. Then we shared their homemade cheesecake for dessert and it was to-die-for. Our server was good too, don't remember his name. Next time I am in town I will definitely be back!

The Food is fantastic! The staff is very personable and make the experience that much better! I highly recommend locals and visitors of las Vegas visit this restaurant for food and drinks they will never forget!

Crazy Alfredo.

There is one thing on this menu that is incredibly delicious, and that is the "Crazy Alfredo". First off it is a massive portion, should be eaten by two people, or one really hungry person.  It also travels as a to go item pretty well.  It's a mix of jalapeno, chicken, sausage, cheese and a great alfredo sauce. Very flavorful.  

if you are there for lunch during the week, they do a great Ribeye with salad lunch portion that has fantastic flavor as well at a great lunch price.

Most people while visiting Vegas tend to eat in a restaurant right on the strip or in their hotel. However, my friends and I decided to venture elsewhere and jumped on Yelp for reviews. This is when we found this little gem. 

We called ahead and made a reservation and was seated promptly upon arrival. They gave us a seat outside and even though it was 100 degrees that day, they had these little cool fans pointed our way so it didn't feel bad at all. My favorite thing about this restaurant was that it just felt like an Italian restaurant instead of being a flashy place to eat in Vegas. The crowd was a little older and there was a band playing music as we dined.

The servers were attentive and the food arrived promptly. We ordered the fried calamari to start which had a nice crunch to it. My main dish was the Primavera which was good. Everyone seemed to enjoy their dish and portions were big so we all had leftovers to take home. If I'm back in Vegas one day, I would check this place out again.

Ordered take away Spaghetti & meatballs and extra serve of garlic bread - said it would be 45m (at 8.30p), so I thought I would give it a go due to the great reviews. Kids were sleepy so I went in 15m later to see if it would happen to be early and luckily it was ready for pick up - 30m more and it would've been cold.  Got home and found a small box of pasta with two meatballs.  Luckily I ordered extra garlic bread (1st one free) because I would've still been hungry!

Pasta and sauce were average - meatballs were tasty and garlic bread was too garlicky...the kind that leaves your breath humming for a day hahaha and I am a garlic lover!!

Sad to say I probably won't be back, but had to try - just too many other options.
Come hungry! The garlic bread is delicious and the entree portions are huge. Excellent service as well.

My husband found this place and told me that it was one of his favorite Italian restaurants and that we would have to go the next time we were in Las Vegas together. Well, that time recently happened, and he was RIGHT! The food was delicious! He had the rigatoni special and I had steak sandwich for lunch. We thought that going there for lunch would be not as busy, but it was pretty full with the locals enjoying their lunches too! I'm looking forward to going back the next time we're in Vegas for sure! Will try their pizza, but I have no doubt it will be good! Clean restaurant too. It's not on the strip, but not everything good is there, remember that!

We were looking for great Italian food and we found the best! We had a shrimp pesto dish, linguini with clams, cannelloni, and eggplant spinach with pasta. Every single dish was delicious. We had a wine from Sicily that went well with all of our dishes. The service was superb. Our waiter was originally from Sicily, and was friendly and attentive! The dessert looked decadent,but none of us ordered any as our entrees were very generous portions. If you are in Las Vegas this is the perfect Italian restaurant!!

Went here on a recommendation and had a great meal. Frutti di mare was terrific - ask for it spicy! The fettucine alfredo with shrimp was also good, though it could have used more garlic. Can never have enough garlic!  Very good wine list, well priced with great variety. Food was yummy, service was professional and the evening was great value compared with the top rated Italian places on the strip. I look forward to going back and trying more of the menu.
Good food nice atmosphere, Will come back to try more yummy stuff

By far this IS the BEST Italian restaurant just off the strip. Don't let the outside of the place fool you. It looks small and somewhat uninviting. But once in side, great atmosphere. Very clean with cloth tablecloths. Excellent service!  The wait staff are well versed on the dishes. Your water glass never stays empty. Food portions are decent sized but not over the top. Absolutely wonderful. We will definitely be back!

We ordered Calamari, Lasagne, Linguini and Clams, and Shrimp Scampi for lunch. While the food was good, we faced a few logistical issues while ordering and with our order. We wanted the lunch portion of the Linguini and Clams which was priced at $9.95 on the online Lunch Menu at the time of the order. However, while placing the order via the phone, the hostess on the line said that there was no lunch size for the dish. I let her know that she should ask management to take that off the menu to prevent further confusion. After picking up our food and driving back to our hotel room, we noticed that the Shrimp Scampi had no linguini! It only had shrimp and sauce! We called to let them know, but all they could say was that we could go back for another Scampi dish. We would have liked a refund since the dish was $19.95. Unfortunately, our flight was later that day and we could not make it back to the restaurant. Hopefully they update their menus online soon to make sure the price of all of their items are accurate.

Best Pesto in town, hands down.  Garlic bread is clinically addictive.  Is built into a strip-mall, so the exterior doesn't look like much, but inside is a great atmosphere, classy, perfect for a nice night out.  Occasional live jazz.  Be sure to reserve ahead-of-time - this place is always booked!
It was my first time visiting this restaurant and I only have great things to say. Baked Rigatoni was exceptional. I've never had ricotta this creamy. We will be back next time we're in Vegas. YUM!
Don't get there often enough! Food is wonderful, wine too!! LOVE their spinach/farro salad.
Nora's was somewhere I really wanted to try while in Vegas. I read reviews that the vodka sauce was to die for. And it did not disappoint. Our service however was lacking.

Im a italian and live in Ct. And we are spoiled with our Italian eateries but been traveling to Vegas every year for 9 years now. My aunt who lives out in Vegas now brought us there and we were totally astonished. We make it to Nora's at least twice while we are there. The atmosphere and service are great. We always try to order something new and different each time we go and nobody has been disappointed. Even me who is a chef and is very weary about ordering pasta at a restaurant even though a simple dish to make can turn into a catastrophe with a poorly made sauce loves the baked ziti. I can go on and on but u get my drift. If you are in Vegas and you are looking for a great place to eat and drink this is the place. P.s Even my mother who wont eat anybody's sauce but her own loves this place and if you knew her you would really take that into consideration. Lol

BEST ITALIAN EVER!!! I have been coming here for years. The Arancini is the best thing on the menu. I get it every time and it's always amazing. Absolutely the best Chicken Marsala - but ask for no marinara on the side pasta, that way you can mix the pasta with the chicken. I love this restaurant. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Food is amazing. But......
Hostess is too busy flirting to seat anyone  and bartender is anywhere but actually at the bar. Food keeps this place going because there is no service. Be sure to carve out a large portion of your day.
The food is amazing, I can honestly say this my favorite authentic Italian food spot,
Lasagna was ok but they killed it with tooo much cheese baked on top. not enough sauce either.

Intimate dining, thus need reservation or you will wait. Food was excellent, service was pleasant. Prompt service, did not have to wait more than 10 mins for food. Drink refills were very timely. Prices were reasonable. Only negative, garlic breadsticks were not very fresh. Other than that it was a good experience.

Good place to get good food, I got the crazy Alfredo and it certainly was a good helping of it.  The bread was also really good, I'd have come again to try other items so I could give a more detailed review but from what I tried the food was good, service was great.

Chicken soup was average. Pasta was average. Price....moderate. Only compliant was when I called they said the wait was 35 mins or reservation. The reservation soonest available was an hour away from the time I called. When we arrived it was only about 35% occupancy. I give it a 2 1/2 star average.

Went on a Monday night and it was packed! The food is delicious!!! The staff was very helpful making suggestions and explaining items when necessary. The atmosphere was warm and inviting. Will definitely be back soon!!

This is easily my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. I love that it is a locals restaurant. The bar is a great place to hang out and get some wine before you eat. If you plan on going during dinner time I would recommend getting a reservation first as they are pretty busy. 

The food is great and has not yet disappointed me. I usually get  the gnocchi with vodka sauce which is my favorite. The Ossobuco here is also amazing and I highly recommend it.  

The service here has always been great even on the busier nights i've been there. The also do take out orders which is awesome when I want great Italian food after work. I just call when I get off and pick it up on the way home. The Pizzas are also supposed to be good but I have yet to try them. I do see a lot of people ordering them for take out when I am there.
I absolutely love Nora's. With their sauce you can't go wrong with pasta and meatballs or lasagna.  Great classic cocktails and some of the best live music in Vegas.

If you love Italian Food you'll love Nora's! We were a table of three, my sister had the Shrimp Scampi, my husband had the Alfredo Fettuccine w/Shrimp & I had the Angel Hair Pasta w/Meatballs & Marinara. Delicious! As a rule I'm not normally a Fettuccini fan but I liked it! Our server, Bernadette & the rest of the team were wonderful - very friendly & professional! Next time we plan to sit on the bar side...more cozy w/the game on for my husband! If you are in the area stop by Nora's Italian Cuisine you'll be glad you did!

This is my favorite Italian restaurant! I've been here a few times already and have brought friends who fall in love with the food just like I have.

I went to Nora's a few nights ago with a friend who also shares my love for Italian food. We made a reservation for 7:30PM (I highly recommend making a reservation!) and were seated within 5 minutes. We had the calamari fritti and a regular sized house salad with Italian dressing to start. We also received a basket of complimentary garlic bread to nibble on. These starters didn't fill us up which I was happy about because I was waiting for my main entree! 

My friend had the chicken parmigiana which had spaghetti, tomato sauce & the chicken was not breaded (like you see in other restaurants). I got to steal a bite and the chicken was tender & juicy! I had the Alla Nora which consisted of spaghetti noodles, eggplant, meat sauce with pesto and parmesan cheese sprinkled on top. The eggplant seemed too crisp, but all of that put together just works! 

The restaurant that night was busy and loud. To me, that felt like home.

Comfortable setting, good lighting, pleasant serving staff, special menu with very high quality meat and speciality salads. Great desserts and a rich variety of wines for sampling and enjoyment.

Definitely will return when seeking high quality foods, excellent service that is memorable. Older crowd that is mellow and happy.

Overall 8.6/10 atmosphere 8.5/10 service 8.2/10 food 8.8-8.9/10 value 9
It's hard to impressive me for Italian food
But I think this restaurant is top 3 Italian restaurants in Las Vegas at this price!

The decor was nice, our server Will had a very handsome beard and a keen wit, though he was a bit tall for my tastes.  He drew a robot on my wife's to go bag (because the dishes are so large and she likes robots), which I really saw as going the extra mile to ensure guest satisfaction. The bartenders didn't seem to be fans of straws but my wife pilfered one before leaving the bar for our table. Our server Will encouraged her to recycle her last straw which really showed a lot of responsibility for the earth. I could see voting for this man in the next four years, though he politely withheld his political views. He recommended the cannoli and I must say the cannoli came and kept coming. The Pinot noir was delightful with blackberry notes and a hint of old Italian leather belts, like grandpa used to wear.

Located in a strip mall north of strip.
Best bruschetta.  Ravioli and chicken Alfredo were delicious.

Took guests there Friday with reservations, did not seat us in 45 minutes.  They have managed to change a great neighborhood intimate restaurant into a mess hall food court.

Avoid this place.

The food is TO DIE FOR! Great Italian! Crazy Alfredo makes me drool just thinking about it! If you haven't been here then I urge you to GO! AND BRING FRIENDS BECAUSE YOU WILL LOVE IT! Friendly service, beautiful romantic setting. AAAHhh!

Even though I barely come to Vegas now, if I ever visit, I will definitely come here. Their calamari was delicious nice and crispy, so good. I loved the chicken marsala too. Everything about it was just perfect. The dessert here was unbelievable. Other desserts at chain Italian restaurants like Pasta Pomodoro and Macaroni and Grill are ok but these were awesome. The oreo ice cream was really unique and tiramisu, I could've just eaten a million slices of it. If you're visiting Vegas anytime soon, this is must to eat here.

Overall: 
Fantastic food for the price, a great find off the strip. From what I've heard, this is where Vegas chefs to go eat :) 

Ambiance/Location: 
Strip mall, but worth the drive off the strip. When you walk in you see chefs making pizzas which sets a nice tone. We sat in the room with the bar and were able to see the end of game 4 of the NBA finals :) Typical dim lighting of an Italian restaurant. 

Food: 
Fantastic! Per our waiter's recommendation, here is what we ordered: 
- garlic bread (one basket complimentary) - fresh soft bread, tasty, crispy 
- House salad - the regular portion was split between 4 people, but if you're big on salad you might want to get your own. A nice blend of lettuce, mozzarella, olives, pepperocinis, tomatoes with a oil and vinegar dressing. 
- Alla Nora (with angel hair pasta) - hearty red sauce not too tart or overwhelmingly tasting of tomatoes. The eggplant was breaded and fried adding a crispy texture. The ground beef did not overwhelm either. My favorite of the dishes we had. 
- Mt. Etna - chicken with multiple layers of tomatoes, fried onion strings, on a bed of red potatoes in balsamic reduction -- chicken was a bit dry, but good flavors 
- Chicken Carfucio - the flavors of the capers and artichokes rule this dish which is overall pretty light and allows the fresh tomatoes to balance the dish. This dish is more about the separate ingredients merging than about the sauce (which is mainly oil and garlic) 
- Crazy Alfredo - rich and creamy with multiple fun additions including jalapenos! My mom's favorite, and it was indeed a dish to be ordered again. 
- warm chocolate cake - you need to preorder this (when you order dinner) and we got 2 for 4 people, which was perfect. I've had others which were creamier and had a more molten center, but this one was unique. the cake was a bit more coarse but very flavorful, and it was topped with crushed pistachios which added a salty crunch, and surrounded but a white cream sauce. I'm used to eating this ala mode, and I think ice cream would also have paired well with this. 

Wine list: extensive both by the glass and bottle. 

Service: 
Friendly waiters and busboys, we had to ask once to get our water refilled though. 

Price: 
Entrees $12-20, Dessert $4.50-6.50, Wines from $7.50/glass

I had the Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. 
I had it to go. The girl that took my order was very friendly. I picked up my food, it was ready as promised. It smelled good but the real test is in the taste. 
I would give it an EXCELLENT! Next time I will ask for more sauce. This place is a MUST revisit! Hey, I know Italian food... I'm from Brooklyn! Lol

Great place to try!!!
Call in advance to reserve a table.
It's not in a nice area, but it is a free standing building with a great food and service

Everyone has to go to Nora's.  The menu is very well rounded with different proteins and salads.  
The tiramisu was the best I have ever
Had.  I will being my family here when they visit  Las Vegas.

I took a local's word that this was a great place for Italian food-BIG MISTAKE.... If this is one of the best Vegas has to offer, they don't know anything about good Italian food. The "kitchen sink" alfredo was unlike anything I have ever tasted-and not in a good way. Unfortunately I invited 2 friend to go along. One had the gnocci (sp)-it was VERY "doughy". We were all very disappointed, I spent the rest of the night apologising to everyone for my poor choice.  AND CHARGING $1.75 FOR 2 SMALL HOT DOG BUNS CUT IN HALF FOR 4 PEOPLE??????? Had the runs the next day also. What a ripoff of a place. Bad, bad, bad

Great place.  We had a lovely meal.   We had an extraordinary halibut dish.   I had chicken marsala.  Kids had lasagna and pasta carbonara. We also had calamari that was divine.   Service matched the food.   Why anyone would go to a chain restaurant with this jewel in Vegas? Beats me.   Just superb!

The new building and space is very nice, the food delicious, however the service left something to be desired. My friend and I recently had lunch and were treated with a warm welcome, however the more time we spent the more the team seemed to be confused about who should be doing what, we had 4 different people serve us and not in a timely manner in the end we asked for a dessert menu and decided not, not knowing how long it would take to get desert. Then being in the event industry we asked to see the event space upstairs, a young lady from the hostess desk showed us the space and was very curtious in the beginning however then forgot about us in the end with no warm goodbye wishes she just walked away. I haven't been to Nora's for a little awhile and the first time to the new building-maybe they are trying to get used to their new space. Wont be rushing back, a little disappointed. Especially since I recently recommend to someone based on previous experience.

This would be a 5 Star review if Nora's hadn't removed Wild Boar from the menu when they moved to their new location.  We were told that the new kitchen was not conducive to the preparation of that dish.  I don't understand why they wouldn't be able to prepare this item.  It was amazing, rich, red, meat & sauce over pasta.  The flavor was phenomenal!  PLEASE bring it back, Nora's!

Update:  I was contacted by the manager and told they are still serving Wild Boar.  That's great news, I appreciated the response, and I have adjusted my stars to 5!

Pros: Amazing food, large portion sizes, great service, well priced
Cons: sometimes long waits

Overall: must try!

This was a great YELP find.  In Vegas and we wanted to find an Italian Restaurant where we could get take-out.  So to YELP I looked and found Nora's.  The menu looked good so we ordered.  When I arrived to pick up my food, I was skeptical when I saw it was in a strip mall.  But once I walked through the doors, I felt like I was transported to a NYC Italian restaurant. From the checkerboard floor and exposed brick walls to the servers rushing around with plates of food, I was immediately excited for what I had found.  As I waited for my order, I was surprised at how busy this place was.  It appeared if you did not have a reservation, it would be a long wait.  It was fun watching this place move.  I even snapped some photos to show my wife back at the hotel.  It really did feel like I was somewhere else.  And the food was awesome!  We got the large (or huge) Antipasto salad, the penne with Gorgonzola sauce with chicken, penne with marinara and yummy meatballs, steak bruschetta, and some delicious garlic bread.  And the hostess to took my order and got me my food was really friendly and helpful.  5-stars...and this is from a guy who doesn't really like Italian.

I was looking for a basic, reasonably priced low key place for dinner on a Tuesday night with a coworker.  He didn't have any suggestions, so Yelp to the rescue.  This place was great: good value for the cost.  The quality of the food was good for the price, portion size was good: generous without being crazy.  I ordered the Eggplant Parmesan, my coworker had another pasta dish, I don't remember which one, but it had a meat sauce.  We split a Caesar Salad.  Wine selection was fine: plenty of options, good prices.  We didn't have room for dessert, but it looked tasty.  
The garlic bread is garlic-y and yummy.  The service was excellent on this surprising busy night (we didn't have reservations, but opted to be seated immediately over by the kitchen).  Water got refilled promptly, people came by often to ensure we didn't need anything (almost, but not quite, too often).

Overall, I'd recommend this place for anyone looking to get a good quality, reasonably priced meal off the strip.  It's not super trendy or fancy, just solid food and service in a relaxed atmosphere.

Edited to add: it's not a bad idea to get a reservation if you're planning ahead.  We were fine sitting off by the kitchen, but if it were even just a little busier, we'd likely have had to wait for a table.

The food here is awesome...like, seriously awesome. I've tried several of the dishes and haven't had a bad meal yet.  Also awesome: the wait staff. I find that here in Las Vegas its hard to find good service (which is odd because I would have thought the opposite) so I love coming here to dine in because its always a very pleasant experience. Ask for Anthony or Don they are both fantastic and friendly servers. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because their dining rooms are extremely crowded when busy and it feels very claustrophobic in those situations. It won't stop me from going back though!

My daughter, her friend, and I are on vacation in Vegas. We ate here yesterday and it was the BEST Italian food we have ever had! It was so good, we went back today and recommended it to a couple on the way back to the Venetian. We will NEVER visit Vegas again without a visit to Nora's!

LOVED the OLD place. This new place, not so much. Poor customer service, food not up to par and too noisy. They used to pride themselves on an upscale bar, but no more. They've cut back on high priced liquor (Tanqueray). Too much attempt to Manhattan-ize when old place exuded warm family, great food, and in-style just because of the whole atmosphere. 
Won't go there again.

We had heard stories of noras having some of the best pizza in town so we decided to try it out, we tried a white spinach pizza, with ricotta, parmesan, and mozzarella, also we added pep, and onion.......boy this pizza was awesome, one of my favorites, excellent flavor and only twenty five bucks for a big 18 in, we are definitely coming back, super gourmet quality!

Absolutely awful.  I've heard nothing by great things about Nora's so was excited to finally eat here.  First off the parking is terrible, had to circle the lot a few times to find a space.  The garlic bread was amazing (only reason for even one star).  Next we got the rice balls, they were served cold and the rice wasn't cooked.  I ordered the Chicken Parm, I noticed it had a funny taste.  There was no way I could eat it so I sent it back, I asked the waitress if they put fennel in it and she said no, they put mint in the breadcrumbs.  I have never in my life had Chicken Parm with mint.  The ordered the Chicken Marsala, and again, not your normal Marsala, it was very sweet and the sauce thick, tasted more like molasses than Marsala.  Needless to say, we won't be back.

Wow!! This place deserves five stars but I took one away due to the location, which isn't too great!!  However, the food here is spot on and delicious!!!  You'll love the ambience with the old crooners singing in the background..  This place is legitimately Italian!!  You've got to give it a try!!  The food is five stars all the way!!  You'll love it!! Journey on Yelp peeps!!  :-D. Until next time!

Mi familia and I rarely go out for Italian food. Mainly because my son only eats cheese pizza and my daughter angel hair with butter and Parmesan cheese. What? I'm gonna spend twenty bucks on that? Sorry kids, no. We're eating in. 

But we were on vacation. My buddy read up on this place and convinced me to join him and his family. And I'm glad I did. 

Yeah, the kids got cheese pizza and angel hair with butter. Man, are they REALLY my kids? When are they gonna expand their palates? But the rest of us went for it on the menu and I have to say I was fairly impressed. 

The garlic bread they drop off at the table is warm, chewy and garlicky. Nice start. And they kept it coming.  Me loves that.  Lots.

Hands down best calamari I've ever had in an Italian restaurant. The accompanying sauce wasn't just boring ol' marinara, it was a nice, complex side that went well with the light and crunchy squid.   My buddy ate all the tentacles.

Solid house salad. Nothing amazing, but good, fresh ingredients and a tangy dressing.  Perfect soaked up with the bread. 

The so-so. (There won't be a bad category). The chicken parm was on the small side. Good enough, but not outstanding. Don't order it. Same for the special veal chop. It looks impressive and the price isn't bad - 28 bucks - but it didn't make any of us at the table scream  "Mangia, mangia!" 

The good. My son's cheese pizza.  Really awesome crust and blend of cheeses. And made for a good breakfast the next day. My wife had the pesto. Perfect. Absolutely perfect. And my linguine with clams? A ton of clams and garlic, nicely proportioned. I cleaned my plate happily. 

I'm a former waiter and I have to say, the service was pretty good. Apparently, the night we went, the place got slow, so they let a few servers go. Then they got slammed. While we did have to wait, the waiter and bus staff kept their cool, never running around like chickens with their heads cut off. That showed professionalism and didn't ruin our dining experience. 

Though on the flip side, why didn't the manager just call up a waiter? Tell them, "Get your butt back here, we got slammed!"   That happened to me back in the day.

Finally, the bill came. And considering all the food we had, I thought we got out of there cheap. We didn't drink much alcohol, but nine people were stuffed to the gills. 

Grazie, Nora! 

Ciao!

Nice, went here yesterday, my wife got the Crazy Alfredo and loved it.  Quiet, comfortable, good service!  Thank you!

I have never had a bad experience at this restaurant. The people are great, fast service, excellent food, OK, this is Las Vegas and its supposed to be this way!  Too bad many other restaurants don't get it.  So, all you restaurant owners that want to see how its done RIGHT, check this place out.

We were seated promptly
We did had a longer than usual wait between the appetizer and our main course 
Food was tasty 
Had : Crazy Alfredo was pretty impressed with twist they gave with chicken, sausage, shrimp and jalapeños

I was recommended by a friend to eat at this restaurant.   There was quite a few people eating. And place looks rustic.  I wanted to try one of their appetizers, but they ran out.  I was disappointed.  My entree was good, but not great.  I cannot eat anything spicy and they sprinkled it with a hint of red peppers, even though it did not say spicy on their menu.  Certainly pretty average Italian food for me.

Nora's - ate there once and no-mora! Food was fair, not great at all. Pizza - no real flavor to the dough, and ziti was half assed . If you want Italian food better than this you can find it at Parma 's  all day long. But make a reservation if more than four.  I'm Italian  - ate it all my life - don't set your expectations too high if you must eat at Nora's   Just because people say 3 generations of business doesn't always mean its good - I know some real shitty plumbers that have been in business longer!

Always enjoy our meals at Nora's.  It is a Las Vegas favorite and institution. Lunch is a really good value and a lot quieter.  Place is always crowded and tends to be a bit noisy.  That said both my husband and I enjoy the food and recommend dining there.
I've been going to Nora's for over 25 years. Great to see a nice family business succeed the way they have!  Great food for a fair price!  Keep it up for many more years!

Hubby and I wanted a good Italian place and thanks to Yelp....we found it! I ordered the eggplant parmesan with spaghetti and they were cooked perfectly. The marinara sauce was excellent and the garlic bread heavenly. My husband ordered the linguine and clams and it was devine.  One of the best I ever tasted. We also ordered two glasses of sangria and it was wonderful. For dessert we ordered the cannoli. There are no words in the English language to describe the amazing flavor. The cream was made from scratch and was very light and not overly sweet. The atmosphere is pleasant and the service is great. The staff is very friendly. You can see the open kitchen when you walk in and they create amazing dishes in such a small kitchen. We will definitely come back.

The arancini (risotto balls) were excellent! I ordered the Frutti Di Mare which had generous amounts clams, shrimp, mussels and calamari over linguine pasta in a red sauce and it was exceptional! The serving size was a very generous portion and my unfinished portion came home in a take out. The service is both friendly and attentive. They also had live entertainment  (blues/jazz) which made the dining experience enjoyable. I definitely recommend this place and I feel their pricing is fair considering the portions.

The food is great. Service was slow. A little pricey but nice atmosphere.  Make sure you have reservations or you will be waiting.... It is definitely a place to go for the food! It's busy every night.

Wow! This place was great! Service was amazing and the food quality matched. I never had to ask for a refill or wait for our waiter to come, even though it was a packed house.

We were seated by the kitchen, which is open in the center of the restaurant. Normally I don't like being seated by the kitchen, but it was kinda fun watching how organized and fluid they were when working. 

I ordered the huge ribeye steak (16 oz), calamari, and tirimisu for dessert. The calamari is a large portion and the dipping sauce was out of this world with a beautiful basil flavor. The steak was juicy and tender and flavored well. The tirimisu was good too. I would definitely recommend this restaurant, but I would encourage you to make a reservation to be safe because it was packed on a Monday night that we went. I'm sure the weekend would be a long wait otherwise.

Nora's restaurant is always excellent, the antipasto is the best in town.food is always delicious, however not happy they charge if you want a second basket of garlic bread and they do not serve cream for the coffee.

Everything about Nora's was an amazing experience!

We walked in, were seated right away, and the staff was very attentive to our needs. 

Checked in on the Yelp app and received a glass of wine! Free wine = AMAZEBALLS!

Started off with the house garlic bread. It was very good. You could tell this was homemade, not some frozen loaf coming from a distributor. Just that principle of not having frozen cheap appetizer had me already falling in love. 

Then we moved to the bruschetta. It came served on a large slide of soft bread. This was some of the best bruschetta I've ever had. It was not your average sampling, this is what I've been missing my entire life. 

My entree was the rigatoni gorgonzola with chicken. Similar to the bruschetta, this was done right! The pasta was perfectly textured and consistent throughout. The sauce on this was heavier than my liking, but it fit very well with the dish. The biggest surprise here was the blue cheese on top. I've never heard of pasta being topped with blue cheese, but I fell in love with it! 

By this point we were stuffed and ready to fall asleep in our carb coma.
Great night At Noras. music was great. Great friends , Dinner,  Music and dancing. Fun fun fun

We went to Nora's for the first time yesterday, for a late lunch. The food is absolutely amazing! Best Veal Scallopini I've ever had! Ambience is very warm and appealing. 

HOWEVER... The service is horrible!!!

First of all the hostess is more concerned with blatantly flirting with other staff members than doing her job.  It was almost disgusting to see.

We were sat at a nice table and waited for our server. And we waited and waited and waited. After about 10+ minutes a waiter shows up and asks for our drink order. No apology for making us wait. He brings us water and our drinks and disappears. After about another 10 minutes another waiter comes and asks for our food order.  Again no apology for waiting and not even a hello.  Anything we needed - like more water - we had to flag our waiter down as he couldn't seem to notice more than one of his tables each time he was in the dining area.  He continually disappeared and we were left waiting, for everything. We wondered if this was his very first shift waiting tables.  There were two busboys who seemed to be working very hard but some how never made it to our table. 

So finally our food arrives. And it is absolutely outstanding! Service might be horrible but the food is most definitely worth the visit. Just don't go unless you have time for a leisurely meal. 

Word to management: train your wait and hostess staff! And then manage them!! The food is fantastic but you are losing guests due to horrible service.

With our server Angela was the best.. Really informative and willing to give her suggestions or recommendations. The food was delicious and the staff was on point.
Classic Italian dishes new contemporary Flair.

I had a very yummy pizza at Nora's tonight.  The crust was crisp and flaky.  The toppings were perfect with just the right amount of red sauce.  I got pepperoni, sausage, bell peppers, and onions on the pizza. All the toppings were solid.  They also gave me a complimentary basket of garlic bread, which was topped with actual minced garlic!  Very big fan!  Was reasonably priced at around 15 dollars for my 12 inch pizza!  Thanks!

Not a local but know a few here in town. I love the quaint feel of this place and the food is amazing. Wether sitting at the bar for a meal a table tucked in the corner the service and food are great.

Great food and atmosphere.  This is really good Italian food for lunch or dinner.  Make sure to make a reservation if you're going for dinner, as this place gets pretty busy.  Also try some of the specialty cocktails.

I'm so glad my bf knows people that know great places that serve up good food. 

Overall experience here is definitely four stars. Came here not knowing what to expect-- it was busy, small but had that feeling of authenticity, friendly staff, tables covered with butcher paper. Although  I almost felt out of place walking in here.My bf and I came here wearing  jeans, t-shirt and flip flops and everyone else looked so fancy. But we were able to be seated immediately without being given a hard time so I guess dress code wasn't an issue. 

Service was quick despite of the traffic. We immediately started off with calamari which was excellent, and also the garlic bread--nicely toasted with some butter and ofcourse garlic. With the help of our server, I got myself a cocktail called the "berry explosion."And it was excellent, not too strong and was berry delicious.
For the entree, my bf ordered the "Crazy Alfredo"--sausage, chicken, mushrooms, and shrimp. That was actually real good, I say better than what I ordered, which was the Orange Roughy with angel hair pasta. It was a wee underflavor and wow that fish was fishy. Not a big fan of it but yet again there's plenty of food to choose from and there will be a next time. 

The place is not that cheap either. 70 bucks including tip for this dinner but it was worth it, minus the fish.. sort of. And we thought it was busy when we got here, but it was mad busy on the way out. They do take reservations and I highly recommend that.

Just tried this 
Place for lunch 
Food was amazing 
I used to go to the one one the rest side 
In summerlin before they closed 
This was worth the drive
Awesome food. Great service! Other reviews mentioned a long wait, that was not the case for us. Atmosphere and music set this place apart. Will definitely return.
Not usually looking for Italian- especially for lunch- but what a nice Friday afternoon surprise! Have to check it out for dinner soon

As you read this review I want you to remember the old Italian Mobsters and have the Godfather music playing in your head.... OK here we go..

This small, cozy, romantic, Italian restaurant is definitely one to put on your list to eat at. I was shocked of the lay out as it just didn't have the feel of a fine dinning restaurant I mean it felt like I walked into the kitchen of mobsters house! When you first walk in The front counter covers the open bar kitchen with a few seats then seemingly in a whole other room there is dining. Its weird but cozy!

The waiter we had did OK, I mean I have had better service I think he was new not sure but he got the job done! 

On to the menu. Wow what a full menu with so many options to choose from! I went with there super Alfredo plate and let me tell you it was delicious. The sauce was creamy and full of flavor and the fixing in the Alfredo was like a pizza! It had everything in there and was a great mix too. I was a little concerned at first since I mean seriously was a combination pizza with noodles!! The plate was huge and was not limited on the goods inside. I barley could finish it but I couldnt stop eating!!

When it comes to Italian food this is a must try place. It will bring you the feel of a mobster paradise and fill your belly like your the Don!

My husband and I didn't want to eat on the strip as they are often overrated and overpriced. After looking into Italian foods (I wanted pasta) here on Yelp, we decided to eat at Nora's.  Pretty easy to find, but I agree that the exterior didn't really do its justice for what was offered inside.  

PROS:
The food was pretty decent for Vegas and for its price.  I had the "crazy" alfredo (due to my pregnancy hormones, I had to substitute the chicken for clams).  NOT BAD AT ALL!!!  The Jalapenos actually worked really well in this dish. The portions were pretty big.
Had the warm chocolate cake for dessert...it was ok.  I mean, can't really go wrong with chocolate but I've had better.  

CONS: 
Had to wait at least 15 mins for a table even though it was obvious that there were empty tables around.  The hostess never offered an explanation as to the wait.  As she stepped away, a random waitress had to search for the hostess to seat us..as she wonders why we had to wait.  
The lasagna.  My husband didn't really like the ricotta cheese...instead he helped me finish my pasta.  

Though they mixed up my food (the substitution in my pasta), they seemed really apologetic...and the service was great.  I didn't get our server's name but he was friendly and actually took the lasagna off our bill (we didn't even had to ask!).  SO all in all, it was a good experience...yeah we would go back...I would recommend it to others...especially if you just want to casually dine off the strip.
Wow just amazing , great service truly a great family restaurant . Looking forward to their new location .

I will definitely be returning! From the appetizer (steak bruschetta), to the yummy red sangria and the food that my family and I had.....AH-FREAKIN-MAZING! So tasteful, very nice atmosphere with servers who don't let your glass go half empty! Everyone was so nice and the atmosphere is romantic without the overkill and lovely ambient lighting! When you're excited about eating left overs....you know the place is one in a million!

Food was typical Italian American. Three in our party ordered the Alla Nora. One of the orders didn't have any eggplant in it which was a key ingredient, so this was a huge disappointment. I ordered the Puttanesca, which was tasty but wasn't able to eat much due to the saltiness. If you like salty food, then I would recommend this dish. 

The kitchen was extremely slow on the weeknight we visited. It was not a busy night, as there were empty tables. It took more than an hour (one hour and 15 minutes to be exact) to receive our order which was fairly straightforward. No sides, no appetizers, just five main courses. We could see other diners expressing frustration with the same delays in their food. Wine helped.

The wait staff was excellent beyond compare. Everyone was friendly, courteous, apologetic and tried their best to entertain us while we waited and waited and waited for our food.

We like to patronize locally owned restaurants, but were disappointed with our experience. I hope it was just an off night for the restaurant and not typical.

Loved it! Best Italian I have had in this town in the longest time. Very romantic atmosphere, lovely music and the service was superb! I had ordered the angel hair with meatball to be simple and the sauce was soooo good. The meatballs were tender and flavorful. My husband ordered the frutti di mare and it was absolutely delicious! Very impressed and will be back for date night soon.

This place is so overrated.  What a disappointment!  We were sent here on some very high recommendations.  I just can't figure out all the fuss??

The garlic bread is a soggy sliced sub roll with butter and no real garlic flavor.  The fried calamari was terrible!  Soggy and greasy, no crunch at all and a pool of grease on the bottom of the plate.  The chicken parm was another disappointment.  2 small chicken tenders, a little sauce, a little cheese, a little pasta, and a pool of water on the bottom of the plate.  An Italian restaurant that serves pasta swimming in water??  C'mon that ain't right.

It's not overly expensive, but for the portion and the quality, it's still a rip-off!

Oh, and the parking is a joke.  I suppose its because the place is so crowded (no idea why), or maybe its the bar, or maybe the fast food place... whatever the reason, good luck finding a parking place.

No reason to give this place a second try.

We were at Nora's years ago before they built and opened this Nora's. What an experience - sat at the bar which we prefer but there is plenty of seating.  Rudy, the bartender, is a real bartender, not just someone who draws beer and mixes Gin and Tonics. There are fresh herbs at the bar that are used in cocktails. His service along with Michele were awesome! Oh yes the food - outrageously great! Fairly priced place not far from the strip. We were there on a Monday night - can't imagine how busy they are on Friday's and Saturdays. Highly recommended.

We have never been disappointed here and always make it a point to order the crazy Alfredo as one of our entrees. The osso buco is fab. Won't find better Italian food anywhere. A little noisy and a little away from the strip but worth it.

If you want to make Americans happy when they dine out, serve up big portions at moderate prices.  The food doesn't have to be great, just decent and a lot of it.  If you don't believe me, look at the runaway success of Outback Steakhouse.  Las Vegas locals are no exception, which is why Nora's managed to get so many glowing 5-star reviews.

I started with the fried calamari - better than your average calamari, but that's not saying much.  The batter was nice & crispy, the dipping sauce was OK (actually better without the sauce, I thought), and the portion was plentiful for the price ($10.95).  I also got the fettuccine carbonara and requested it extra al dente.  It came out just somewhat al dente, but the quality of the pasta was better than most Italian restaurants.  It wasn't true carbonara, just pasta with lots (and LOTS) of ham thrown on top and then drowned in a very generic cream sauce.  There was so much ham, must've been almost a pound of it in the dish, that I actually left quite a bit of in the bowl.  But for $13.95, you had your protein fix for the week.  I couldn't decide between two desserts, so I just ordered both (judge not lest ye be judged).  The salted chocolate panna cotta is more like a dark chocolate pudding than a true panna cotta, and yes, it's salty, but the saltiness works.  I also got the pistachio cannoli, requested it without chocolate chips, but got the chocolate chips anyway.  After picking off the chips, I really enjoyed this dessert - crisp shell, good vanilla ricotta filling, complemented by ground pistachios.  The desserts were a notch above the appetizer and main and also the reason I bumped the rating up a star to A-OK.

There is far better Italian food in Las Vegas (Allegro at the Wynn is good, Sinatra at Encore is better, Verandah at the Four Seasons is outstanding), but it's also a lot pricier.  I spent half, maybe even less, at Nora's compared to a similar meal at a Strip Italian restaurant.  If you want decent Italian at great prices, go to Nora's.  If you want great Italian, go elsewhere.
Brought my son and bro for first time. As usual, best Italian food around! Only complaint , we shared dishes. Crazy Alfredo had two shrimp and there was 3 of us! Other than that Bomb.com!

We love Nora's.  We've been eating here for many years, and it is our go-to spot for special occasions.  Nora's catered a 50th Anniversary party that we threw in our home, and everyone raved about the food.  Portions are more than generous, and the food quality is outstanding.

The atmosphere is exciting. The drinks are great. The location is a hole in the wall. The gossip about the place is worthy. The food is absolutely Amazing. We have been coming here for many years and this is the first since I began yelping. I cannot say anything but make a reservation.
Made 7:30 PM reservations and had to wait until 7:48 to be seated after asking the hostess 3 times. Food has always been good but I was disappointed on service.

All I have to say is " Forget about it"! This place is Great ! Beautiful new building, all the workers enjoy the new location. Service is great , food is authentic & excellent ! Didn't want to give my Las Vegas secret away, but here it is, Enjoy !

Unfortunately, I did not have a chance to try Nora's Cuisine due to a bartender that was so rude to my date and I, that we both decided it would be best to leave. We had arrived for our reservation early and was told by the host that it would be just a moment for our table to be ready. As a result, we decided to go into the bar and have a cocktail before dinner. After waiting at the end of the bar for a period of time with the bartender aware of us waiting, we watched the bartender clean the bar, talk with other guests and walk over to talk to the other bartender before he finally made eye contact with us and signaled us to come to him at the middle of the bar with a wave of his head. When we walked over, I mentioned, "I didn't think you saw us", to which he gave a rude smirk. Without any prior interaction with this bartender, we were at a loss as to why we were treated this way. Seeing how this was our first visit to Nora's, we did not want to chance sitting down and possibly having the same treatment from other members of their staff and ruining our evening so, we thought it best to just leave and have dinner elsewhere.

Wow! Definitely among the best service I've had.
But the food. I couldn't stop myself from desert after how Devine the calimari and veal parmesan was prepared. I couldn't wait to finish chewing so I could take another bite. I eventually started choking because I started swallowing whole thinking it would be a good idea. 
Cannoli still leaves me speechless. The presentation hand in hand with the taste is more than imaginable.
Being originally from Philadelphia and having a large portion of my family being Italian I was under the assumption I knew Italian food well. Don't tell ma but this place is some hidden competition.
Great food but I'm from the west coast and don't like the crowded atmosphere of the New York style restaurant with the tables too close together.
Loved it. Good pasta. Make sure to try this place, its as good as anywhere else.  The scampi was great. It was reasonably priced.

Honestly the best dinner I had in Vegas considering all the great restaurants in town.  I was in town for business and tired of eating on the strip, so 3 of my colleagues and I got this recommendation from a cocktail waitress at Aria... thanks Thea!

Local spot off the strip, great atmosphere, great service, and even better food.  We had to wait about 45 for a table, but definitely worth it and drinks helped kill the time.  

I had the Chicken Marsala... excellent.  Someone else got "Crazy" Alfredo... super good and very popular dish.  Seriously, anything you order there would be good.  I would recommend this place to anyone and can't wait to go back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  
Excellent job Nora's... keep it up!

Stayed at palms place nora"s is just down the street and is also well worth the cab ride from any where on the strip if you are looking for great Italian food. The veal was the best and the crazy alfredo is great This place is not on the edge of fantastic it is fantastic The drinks by rudy are made great ,he and all the staff are great .Stayed in vegas 8 nights was the best meal we had and 30% less money than all the others meals .
My husband and I consider this our romantic date night spot:) Great food and drinks every time, and we've been loyal customers for almost 8 years! Love Nora's!
I was unsure about this place because of location but it was very good. The service was excellent! Food and pricing were good.

Some of the best Italian food I've had in a while! Husband and I decided to try it out for my birthday on Saturday and definitely weren't disappointed. The wait wasn't very long and we enjoyed 2-for-1 sangria (check in on yelp!) at the bar while they got a table ready for us. Everything we ordered came out quickly and was hot and delicious! We will definitely be back!

We were looking for an Italian restaurant that wasn't crazy expensive, and we found it. From the outside, Nora's doesn't look like much, but don't be fooled. The food is easily the best we had in Vegas, and was really reasonably priced. I had the Alla Nora and will be dreaming about it when I'm back home!

The atmosphere was decent. We were there late on a Friday night, and there was a jazz trio playing. Very cool, but way too loud for the small space. It was difficult to hear my husband over the music. 

I will absolutely come back here the next time I'm in Vegas. Great food for a great price at a fine family establishment.

I absolutely love the ambiance here! The food is spectacular, the staff is very knowledgeable. The cocktail and wine list is legit. Try the osso bucco if you like veal, it's not on the menu, so ask your server if it's available for the day! Muah!!!

Never again..... 7PM Table for 4 this place was so loud that we had to yell at each other.  Forget a nice enjoyable meal here!  Food was terrible. Of the 4 dinners we ordered 2 were sent back and 2 were not eaten. The Rib Eye steak was ordered medium rare.  It came  45 mins. later "extra well-done"  I couldn't even cut it, tough as leather! 30 mins. later another one came and it was cooked perfect.  But, still very tough. Cheap grade of beef !!
My friend ordered Clams and Linguine. Surprise she got 1/2 cup of pasta & 3 clams in a big bowl that was so super salty she couldn't eat it.  That was sent back too.  The waiter suggested she try the Octopus instead. That was interesting when it came to the table there were 5 tiny round pieces the size of a quarter, weird sauce and 1/2 cup of cooked green lettuce in the center. Again not-edible.. Next  came the no taste Osso Buco ( from a crock pot) and the grand finale was my husbands so called Lasagna. There were about 6 bites hidden under  2 inches of melted cheese on the top.
What a total waste of money almost $ 200 for only 4 so called dinners ( we did not order drinks or anything else).  Talk about feeling ripped off!
I have never written a review before but, I really feel that if you are considering trying to have dinner here DON'T do it.

If you know you're going to Nora's make a reservation at least a day before.. otherwise you'll be eating pretty late or waiting a long time. Otherwise, the bar is first come first serve. I actually prefer the bar because service is better and more prompt. Besides, the drinks here are AMAZING! My personal favorite is the Sicilian mule.

Location: The place is always busy, if you're going to relocate, why not make the restaurant larger to accommodate more people instead of having people leave due to the wait or if you call to make a reservation, not have any availability until late the night of. 

Food: All the food I have tried here has been good. The fettucini carbonara, crazy alfredo, and wild boar pappardelle are great options for pasta, I also liked the Nduja pizza. They also bring out a basket of garlic bread to start, and don't be shy to ask for more. For dessert, the cannoli is soo good- I really enjoyed the mascarpone/ricotta filling.  

Service: Like I mentioned before, the service is good at the bar, but at the table it can be hit or miss. Sometimes the server is attentive but sometimes you'll see them come by once in a blue moon. I've also come another time when one of our orders was not properly made, and when we spoke to the server and manager about the issue, neither handled the situation well. For a "classy" establishment, customer service should be top notch. Remaking the food is a must, but the dish should have been comped or at least provided some form of discount since the one person in our group didn't end up getting the remade order until AFTER we were almost finished with our meal.

Unfortunately I've had much better Italian food and service at other restaurants. My friend from out of town and I were both craving Italian food for her last dinner here! We stumbled on Nora's from Yelp and decided to give it a go. Like I said, I've had better service but it wasn't the worst. I will say the restaurant staff did keep up with refilling our waters, which was awesome! One of my pet peeves is when servers are not on top of water refills..I drink a lot of water while I eat. 

So onto the food...hmm. Well the garlic bread was good. Hot and crispy! The first basket is free which is nice. Maybe I'm just stingy, but I was just a tiny bit annoyed to pay $2.50 more for another basket of bread. We decided on mozzarella sticks for an appetizer. They were hot and tasted like any other plate of mozzarella sticks. Tasty but nothing special about them. 

My main dish was the most disappointing :( I was stuck between trying their Alfredo sauce or their pesto! I asked our waitress which one she preferred, and she just suggested I do a creamy pesto sauce to have a little of both! I thought...oooh perfect! When it came out it smelled amazing and looked like it was going to be a great dish. I took the first bite, it was okay..then I took another and was I a little confused if I liked it or not. As I kept eating all I could taste was pesto and maybe a tiny bit of cream sauce. And the pesto sauce just did not WOW my taste buds what-so-ever. I honestly took at most 10 bites and was over it..I was hoping for a wonderful Italian dinner here, and didn't find it. Instead of trying another dish, I will just try another restaurant. Sorry Nora's!

So my family and I decided to try to do a place of the strip this weekend and saw the reviews for Nora's and thought we would give it a try.  We had reservations at 8 and did not get seated unit 8:45.  When we sat down it seemed we only had one waiter for the half of the entire restaurant.  Even though she was very friendly it seemed like they were very understaff. Never once got asked if we needed a refill or another drink.  Can not complain about the food however it was very delicious.  So all in all I probably will not come back due to the fact that it is a $20 cab ride and the service was not great at all.

I love this place so much, I took my mom for her first time my 10th. The service is five stars and the food is great I will always choose Nora"s for a nice dinner with my honey or even just a nice place to go for no reason at all.

I hardly write a bad review but I think this restaurant definitely deserve the review and 2 stars... Here's what my boyfriend & I experienced while we we're here...

Made an 8:30pm reservations. Arrived at 8 which is early and we didn't mind waiting.  We checked-in at the front to let her know that we're there.  The table got ready at 8:15 but the lady keep calling the wrong name, first of all if you take down the name and we checked in providing the same name you figure she will get it right, but NO! She keep calling the wrong name so we ended up seated down at 9pm.

we sat down near the kitchen which is not bad as we witness the in and out of the waiters & servers. The waiter was nice and took our order and we trusted that he got all of our order right.  But NO! He forgot the most important order the "desert" 

we got our first order which is an appetizer, it took 30min for it to arrive and when it did it was cold . The food was good but it was cold. 
then our second order did not come until 30-45 min after the first course.  The second course was better, but what we didn't like is the manager. The Manager was standing by the kitchen watching his cooks, I have never seen a manager do that! most of the restaurant manager walks around and check people that are eating making sure that their customer is/are happy but not this one he was by far the most HORRIBLE MANAGER we have encountered and gives you an attitude (what the...) when you check your food, who does that! 

If you want good Italian food then come here but be prepared on the bad service specially the MANAGER.  The 2 stars is for the food!

Also, did I mentioned that their food is not cheap, you figured that the money they charge they will give you a better service, NOT!

I will not comeback here ever again!!!

Oh, Nora's... A quasi-old Vegas hole in the wall. If you are not there by 5PM, consider yourself screwed. If you ARE there by 5pm, you can enjoy being somewhat screwed by waiting patrons rubbing their chest against your back while you are sitting at the bar, who are also being rubbed inappopriately by the patrons behind them. My party of three and I shared the gnocchi with pesto and the cheese ravioli with vodka sauce. It was ridiculously delicious, since pasta has a tendency to be boring. The house salad was hardly boring and the desserts (yay for my birthday) should be declared illegal by the FDA for being capable of jump-starting a myocardial infarction. We tasted the tiramisu and the chocolate molten cake... I am not a dessert person but these were worth trying. Save your mothers from preying on the waiters/barstaff like starved cougars and leave them at home.

This is THE go to place for me and my friends when we want Italian food. You pretty much can't go wrong with anything on the menu and they have two separate dining areas so if you would rather have a more intimate dinner or lunch you can avoid the families and opt for the other room. Reservations are a good idea here.

Some of my favorite dishes here: Baked Ziti (this is the best thing ever), Lasagna, Arancini

But like I said, you really can't go wrong, everything is good. They also have a good selection of wine and the staff is fairly knowledgeable so feel free to ask for recommendations.

If you have a craving for Italian this is the place to go. Don't settle for less than Nora's!

Great dinner and service. We had the Rigatoni Gorgonzola and Chicken, Linguini with clams, a vegetarian pizza and whole wheat penne with Alfredo sauce.  Everything was great. 
We ordered the red sangria that was really fine.  I'm not a big sangria fan so I wasn't expecting much.  I usually think of sangria as cheap red wine with soda.  I was pleasantly surprised that the sangria was made with good wine and beautiful fruit.
Overall a very nice dinner.
Expensive!  The pasta is not handmade, and the quality of food was not good at all..  Very Disappointed..  the antipasto and garlic bread are good!!

This place have the best pizza in town! I keep taking my friends there. Great costumer services. They get busy around dinner time so I will recommend to call ahead. Five stars!!!  keep going back there every time I feel like having a good pizza.

Always good !  Tried the pizza for the first time - excellent!!!  The only problem was no room for all of my angel hair and vodka sauce. It is packed every evening so make a reservation or be ready to wait.
Alfredo pasta is out of this world! Good ambience. Live music. Garlic bread is good. Highly recommend.

Since my boyfriend and I moved to Vegas we've been in search of a good, decently priced Italian restaurant. After seeing all the amazing reviews for Nora's we decided to give it a shot. We really wanted to like it. But our search continues.
We got there and immediately decided we should have scheduled a reservation. We waited almost an hour for a table, which we expected. I'm not complaining about this, it's just a fact.
We got our table and ordered our food. And barely saw our server after that. Which would have been fine if the food had been as as good as we were expecting it to be, especially for the price. The complimentary garlic bread we got was okay, but it tasted a lot like the Texas Toast you buy in the freezer section at the grocery store.. My boyfriend ordered the Spaghetti with meatballs and I ordered the Chicken Alfredo. The spaghetti was pretty bland and tasted exactly like the can of Chef Boyardee we all ate as children. The Alfredo would have been okay but there was so much olive oil pooled at the bottom of the dish that it was hard to stomach. 
As I said, we really wanted to like it, and if you like it that's great. But personally, I would never eat there again.

My buddy and I returned from hiking in the Great Basin National Park and we both were craving eggplant parmesan.  Checked here on Yelp and found many good reviews for Nora's.  I will now add my own glowing review.  Food came piping hot and delicious.  Both of us agreed on how good it was.  The cannolis were also great and huge.  It would have been perfect if the place had cheaper in-house wine by the carafe.  Al in all, the culinary highlight of our trip.

As good as it gets in Vegas.  They do a fabulous spaghetti & meatballs, which to me is always the true test of an Italian restaurant.  Great marinara, which they'll spice up with crushed red peppers if ya ask 'em.

The garlic bread is fantastic.

My wife's a veal lover, and she's never been dissappointed there, francaise, parm or special.

Oh yeah,  don't forget a cannoli.  Freshly filled to order.  Gotta quit ... making myself hungry.

You know when you go to a city and you want to know the secret spots only the locals know? Nora's Cuisine is that secret place!
Forget the super fancy Italian restaurants at the strip that charge you so much that you might as well sell your blood to afford your next meal. Here at Nora's, the food tastes a hundred times more expensive than its price, the service is topnotch and friendly, the atmosphere is great, the bar is cozy and nice, and the occasional live music on its small stage is pleasing to the ears. What are you waiting for? Call Nora's now and reserve a table for tonight.

Nora's used to be my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. It was a little jewel in a couple of store fronts. The place was adorable, the staff was great and the food was off the charts. It was one of my "go to" places on every trip to Las Vegas.

Fast forward one year: Nora's has built a multi-million new building 3 blocks east of their old location. It is state of the art and magnificent! What they left at the old location was good service and great food.

When we arrived, we encountered two young hostesses at the front desk with an aura of disdain and boredom. They told us there would be a 30 minute wait, or we could eat at the bar or on the patio. It was a beautiful evening, so we chose immediate seating at the patio. It was lovely on the patio.

We waited for about 20 minutes and flagged a passing waiter. He said our waiter was too busy, but he would try to take our order and pass it along. Yes this really happened. Another 30 minutes go by and we inquire about the status of our  dinner and drinks, the waiter apologizes and about 10 minutes  later our drinks arrive.

Our waiter finally shows up with Nora's signature garlic bread. It was cold and soggy, yeech!
Then our dinner arrived, even worse! It was tepid, aesthetically unpleasing and cold. It was actually awful.

We then tried to find grated cheese for our pasta, but gave up after ten minutes, asked for a check and paid for our mostly un-eaten, disgraceful meal.

Nora has really gone from the Ritz to the pits. A sad excuse of a restaurant. 

Please bring back the good old days when Nora was the best Italian restaraunt around. Today it is a pretty shell with awful food and worse service. It actually makes Olive Garden look appealing.

2 words... Osso Bucco. Best in town! Wait, best ever! I usually have to call to see if they're offering it for the night, but it's phenomenal! No joke. It's fantastic. I don't even like eating meat, and I will crave this dish! Antonio and Rudy behind the bar are amazing mixologists and have created some of the coolest cocktails I've ever had!
Good food but service sucks. Unless you look "Rich" you'll get great service. Very very rude
Excellent crazy alfredo wife loved chicken parm Trey was great waiter

I feel bad for giving 1 star at this place because it is one of my mom's favorite Italian restaurant. But me and my boyfriend went here and ordered calamari, pizza, and clam linguine.
