The calamari was ok, not that much flavor and their marinara sauce looked weird. The pizza was ok too, it was bland no flavor at all. The clam linguine disappointed us the most! The dish was swimming in water, filled with chopped up clams (I bet it's not even fresh) and it was really really bland, no flavor at all! Worst clam linguine I've ever had! And the service was slow too. 

We were really disappointed at this place and we're never going back. Just a bad dining experience over all.
Best Italian Food Ever.! Local spot..! Only eat here if you want really good good...BW

Wow! Stopped in tonight for dinner and was very impressed. I was looking for a neighborhood place and this certainly was it. I was by myself, so sat in the bar and the bartenders, Angela (her doppelgänger is Lea Michele)  and Rudy were great. Their menu recommendations were perfecto. Traveling by yourself can be a downer, especially when you are staying at the LVH.  It is nice to get off the strip and find a place with great food at decent prices. I will certainly make this a destination on future trips to Las Vegas.

I've been here a couple times and it's just what you want in an Italian restaurant. You feel like you are having dinner cooked by mom. I've had several pasta dishes here and you really can't go wrong. When I'm in Vegas, I try and go here.

We always loved Nora's but yet had a chance to check out the new location so we decided to celebrate Valentine's Day there. Made a reservation online. With the only options 4pm, 4:15pm and 4:30pm, we picked 4:30pm. When we got there at 4:20pm, not only the restaurant was full, the reception area was also full of people. When we finally made it through the crowd and get to the hostess, we were told that they just need to clear up a couple of tables then it'll be our turn. 

After couple minutes into the wait, I realized pretty much EVERYONE around us HAS MADE reservations. I hate to assume they overbooked but I guess I'd never find out what really was going on. Because we left empty stomach after standing in the annoyed crowd after an hour. By the way, my husband did check with them one last time before we left. The answer was the same, "We just need to clear couple tables."

Well, my three stars are for 1. The hostesses kept their sweet smile on even they knew everyone was hating them. 2. They dedicated one employee to serve the waiting crowd sparkling wine and she always came back with more. 3. Our love for Nora's based on our past experiences.

So obviously we were not happy and really disappointed with this one experience so I decided to leave this review and only three stars. Hopefully the owner and the management will notice their overall rating is going south since they moved into this new location and do something about it. Check out other reviews if you will. 

We will definitely go back in a month or two. That's enough time for them to fix the problems. Hopefully they will bring back the Nora's we've always loved.

There is nothing better than trying out new authentic italian restaurants. I googled this place the other night, never heard of it and decided we'd try it out. As soon as I walked in, the feeling of a fine, classy, sophisticated, elegant italian place is the vibe you get. Not to mention, for its "space", it's adorable. Nice bar, live italian music playing and a good amount of well-dressed people have let me know this is a decent place.
We didn't have to wait very long which was nice. While we did wait, we were able to watch the cooks preparing authentic italian food. When we sat down everything was formal, almost as if we were on a  spot on the strip. Though the room started to remind me a little bit of an office building, the decor made up for it as the ceilings were decorated and the walls were dressed as if it may be your own grandmothers dining room. Cute. 
I enjoy when the servers are wearing vests because I know I will get the quality I want. But downfall was the server took a long time at first. The complimentary italian garlic bread is a bit buttery for my own diet but the fact it wasn't just a basket of butter packets and bread made this place a little different then the others & also, the fact that it had fresh, chopped garlic on it  as well made up for the too much butter .When we got our dishes the food was perfect and just enough. One of the dishes we ordered was the 'Alla Nora' and I'd recommend it if you like a robust meat sauce (bolognese)  with breaded eggplant - fried. Comes with spaghetti obviously. Not bad if this is one of their signature dishes -assuming.
For the lack of perfect service the girl made up for it by bringing us a complimentary dessert. Or was it because we told her it was our first time there? :) Either way, Tiramasu is definitely not my type of dessert but its the thought that counts.
I'd recommend this restaurant for a special birthday or a romantic, quiet dinner. I would definitely come back to try out something different on the menu since I was satisfied with the other menu items. I'd recommend this place also with another couple or a date because it's definitely one of the more intimate places to go, even if it's just to have a glass of wine and listen to the live italian music.

Horrible service ruined this much anticipated experience. Made a reservation. Arrived 10 minutes early. Was able to see tables needed to be cleaned however no staff around to do it. Waited over 20 minutes past my reservation time to be seated due to no clean tables. Waitress treated us like an inconvenience however once we only ordered water for our beverage, I could tell by the look on her face that she knew it wasnt going to be a big ticket meal and she was annoyed. Waited another 15 minutes for bread. When she finally brought it she practically threw it on the table while walking by us. A different person brought us our food. She only followed up with us after a different person took our plates to bring us our check. Didnt even ask if we wanted anything else or dessert. 

I was hoping a manager would be circulating the room to ask us how our dining experience was. No such luck. I witnesses a short Asian guy in a grey suit running back and forth in front of the cooks but he NEVER approached a guest. 

My impression was this would be a classy place however the hostess is wearing nothing short of her work out clothes. I would have thought the hostess would have at least been dressed business casual or put on some real pants, maybe a pair of slacks but I guess this is the poor standard for Nora's.

I am a full time uber/lyft driver. I get tourists asking on a daily basis what are the good local restaurants. Once I saw Nora's had moved into their new location I thought I would try it out. I brought my Nephew who was visiting from out of state to try it with me. He is a waiter while finishing his last year of college. He was even disappointed with the service. 

I will not be eating here again. I will definitely NOT be recommending any business to Nora's. Too much competition in Las Vegas to waste my time to give them a second try. Its a shame they opened this beautiful location however forgot they are in the service industry.

The restaurant is very authentic Italian. The food was phenomenal and the wait staff was great. Jesseka Stephens was our waitress and was so polite and friendly. She had us laughing. We had a special request and the chef honored it without complaint. The restaurant is great for a romantic dinner as well as family. We came on a Saturday night but they got to seem very quickly. I would highly recommend the spinach cannoli  topped off with bread pudding for dessert.
This place was recommended to us by a local and it did not disappoint. Excellant ambiance and food. Don't miss this place!

Ate at Nora's for the first time tonight. My wife and I were seated immediately around 5:45. We each had  dinner salad and an iced tea. The dinner salad was fantastic, the tea was fresh and delicious. We each had an entrée. She ordered spaghetti and meatballs and I had linguine and clam. Each entrée was perfect. We also ordered a side of green olives in a special oil, they were really great. I am hard to please, yet had no complaints. The restaurant was run efficiently and appeared clean and spotless. All servers were professional and friendly. We never asked for a refill and were offered more garlc bread often. My wife and I  have found a new favorite Italian restaurant!  5 stars in every category: service, atmosphere, food quality, and authenticity. By the time we left the place was full and on a Monday night to boot.

The food was fair.  Over baring with garlic and I like garlic.  Six of us for dinner at 5:00pm.  Three said food was okay, but not great.  The other three did not care for the food.  Been to the "old" place few times and food much better there.  The worst part about the pl be missing ace is the noise level.. Okay when arrived, but at 6:00pm you could not talk across the table.  VERY poor design with no sound deterrence.  Worst than t he old place.  But, if you like a very loud and noise place - enjoy.  The place was packed, so I might missing something.  I would like to see a small salad with the food.  I would like to try it again in a few months, but there is no way my wife will go.  Shrimp scampi worst dish for our group.

I finally found a decent local Italian restaurant. The complimentary garlic bread served in the beginning put us to a great start.  The food was good but nothing special about it. The grapefruit juice I ordered was not what I expected; I did not enjoy it at all.. I'll be back another time to try some more dishes
My wife and I love this place. Great food, drinks, atmosphere and service. We will be returning here I wish it was in a better location.

I had heard so much about this restaurant and was really looking forward to going there. However, our whole group was fairly disappointed by the experience. The prices are reasonable, but I expected so much more on the taste of the dishes. I ordered the gnocchi and my husband had the alla nora, which is supposed to be one of their specialties. Both of these dishes were just ok; they weren't anything special at all. The tomato sauce on top of the gnocchi honestly reminded me of Chef Boyardee. The house salad that we ordered was also nothing special. The only good part of the meal was the pesto that my sister ordered. The service was inconsistent. The guy who brought our drinks and bread was very friendly and nice. However, the waitress and the person who dropped off our entrees were indifferent. The woman who served our entrees basically just dropped the plates on our table without a word or smile. The restaurant was super busy, so I don't know if it was just our table that wasn't having a great time, but I was expecting so much better from this place.

We love it here. The food is excellent. 

HOWEVER, even though we made reservations we had to wait endlessly for a table. We thought the new somewhat larger location would alleviate the wait problem, but I guess they just can't get organized. We may not return because of this.

After waiting with a crowd of people who had no reservations, near the door which was continuously cold & uncomfortable, we were finally seated last evening.  Still, until I saw that the manager (who was at the bar with other patrons) happened to notice that we were sitting there without water, bread or anyone acknowledging us or coming to the table,  a waitress magically appeared.  That was about 10 minutes.

To top it off, after the long uncomfortable wait, we were seated near a large noisy birthday party - a few of them were actually toasting above my husband's head.  I was waiting to see if they'd spill wine or food on him. - Private Parties?  Make them take a private room.

So, we'll give it one more shot because of the food and  as usual I will make reservations.  If it continues that they can't alleviate the uncomfortable long waits, we will avoid coming here despite liking the exceptional food.

Best Italian food I've had in years.  Reviews are spot on! The Veal and Salmon delicious. It's another must stop and pricing is very reasonable. 

Thank you for experience

This is my favorite place when I just need to sit down for a while and eat my problems. I really love their service and selection of food. Some of the hostesses are a little crazy, but hey, it's okay. I like the food and the location is splendid!

Excellent Italian food, had the baked ziti which is a house favorite, my wife had one of the veal specialties which was awesome as well. For desert, I had the canoli and shared a tiramisu with my wife, both deserts were very delicious. Overall, I'd go again and recommend it to anyone looking for great, homestyle Italian food.

Took parents for anniversary/birthday celebration on Xmas eve.  Arranged ahead of time for Chef's seafood menu and was offered wine pairing with meal which we opted for.  Seafood meal was incredible 5 course meal, huge portions, delicious.
Was extremely special evening.  Not cheap but great value nonetheless given outstanding food and wine and very attentive service.
We'll be back when we next visit Sin City.

I came here for the first time with my family  after reading the rave reviews. Has the management changed recently? We had a horrendous experience. The server took orders and brought food to tables seated after us and took an eternity for our food. My girlfriend ordered the house salad and calamari which she enjoyed. My mom and I ordered the spaghetti which was way too salty. The server knew we didn't like the food and service so she brought us complimentary ice cream which was nice of her but I still won't come back here. There are plenty of Italian restaurants in Las Vegas that will offer you great service and food.

The right side Dining room is greatly decorated and the bar is as well, but the left side of the building dining room looks like a third grader decorated it.  HOWEVER, put that aside because the food here for the price is a great deal.

When you walk in, your senses come to life with some great Italian cooking.  I have only been there for lunch, but having said that, I would love to try the dinner menu.  The lunch specials are very well priced and the quality of the food is above average.  The staff was friendly and very attentive to your needs.  I would definitely come back to eat again.  Reasonable prices and good quality food.

This is one of most best places that not to many people know about, but let me tell you if you want great Italian cuisine this a must try, I grew up in NJ my grandfather was a chef and I am sure he would have loved this place, from the outside it doesn't look like much and the parking is limited because of the other businesses in the same strip, don't let this fool you the food is awesome the staff is attentive and friendly, I have been there quite a few times now and have yet to find anything I didn't like. Bottom line is if you don't give Nora's a try you are missing out on a great meal.

OMG! Italian food at its best! Okay, first i'm not the biggest fan of Italian food but this place is hands down the best. First, when you burn the top of your mouth off with the pasta (in my case the Fettuccini Alfredo w/chicken) it's served hot and with lots of chicken. Never had that happen at other Italian restaurants. I've come to Vegas every year and never heard of this place until Yelp found it for me. This is now my secret spot for Italian food now. The service was excellent, the server knew the menu and how the food was prepared extensively and the ambiance was nice and quiet. Others in my party had ordered the Eggplant Parmigiana, pasta and sausage and it all looked tasty. We will definitely return on our next visit!

Place was hopping for a Thursday night (make reservations).  Appletinis, wine and margaritas were stupendous.  Service was better than average.  Food was wonderful: We had a party of 6 and all were satisfied.  Started out with a antipasto salad--amazing.  Our table ordered spaghetti & meatballs, baked rigattoni, chicken parmesian and a fettuccine with mushrooms & capers..all pastas were fresh.  Can't say anything bad, wonderful experience!

The food was great but the service was terrible!!
The bus boys were sweet but the waitress was incredibly rude 
She was very impatient and would just walk away from our table before we could ask a question 
Everyone at the table spoke about how bad the service was 
At bill time I put the money in the check folder and she took it away and then came back and asked if I needed change! Of course we did - it was really uncomfortable
Great food. I leaved in Italy four years and it felt like being back   Wonderful

Meh,
They used to be better. Now the prices gone up slightly and the quality lessened. Even in their heyday they were only "As good as it gets in Vegas" but that's coming from someone who grew up on good Italian American Cuisine.

We recently returned to Las Vegas and went back to a favorite in years past, Nora's. The food and atmosphere was a wonderful as before. Our waiter, Anthony, was professional and delightful. Our server Kacey also made us feel very welcome. I think that Nora's is one of the best Italian restaurants in Vegas. My favorite dish is Alla Non which is a huge portion of eggplant/meat sauce and pasta. Its delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant, and ask for one of Anthony's tables, he takes good care of you as does Kacey. Good job to Nora's for great employee's and even greater food.

This place was awesome! We loved the food. The calamari was delicious and their antipasto salad was perfect. Loaded with meats and cheese. We were satisfied with our main dishes, but the group didn't seem too impressed. Maybe we just loaded up on their delicious garlic bread :)

The only issue we ran into was that we had taken a cab to the restaurant and were unable to find a cab for 5 people to take us back. The restaurant has an agreement with a cab company that only has cars.

The only thing I formerly didn't like about Nora's was the location. They got rid of that place and have a nice, new, facility about a block away. Same great menu, in an an awesome upscale facility. I am a fan and I will keep coming here.

Have loved this place for years.......is always great......yum,yum,yum.!!
For people that give a bad review......suggest you try again,or quite simply,you don't know good food.

Excellent Italian food.
Not on the Strip. 
They get busy and always try to seat you at the bar. 
Good red sauce (not too sweet)
Tender meats. 
Reasonable prices. 
Good wine list.

BEST meal we had in Vegas!!!  We wanted to find an authentic Italian restaurant for dinner on Xmas Eve.  WE"RE ITALIAN and want soul food for the holiday!!!  WE ARE SO HAPPY we found Nora's!!!!!  Food is wonderful and AMPLE!  We shared a salad and 2 entrees and still had food to take home for Xmas morning!  If you are visiting Vegas - GET OFF THE STRIP and go for GREAT food at GREAT prices!!!  We will go to Nora's EVERY time we visit Vegas from now on!!!
Favorite dinner when I visited Las Vegas. So. good. Recommend the wild boar pasta.

I think the hype is what killed it for me.  Having seen Nora's on TV and reading all the positive reviews, I expected the best Italian food in town.  Especially since "this is where all the chefs go to eat", as per the Food Network.

We wanted to order the pasta puttanesca but the bartender insisted we order the house special pork chops.  So it was fried calamari, some kinda fried risotto balls with saffron, and the aforementioned pork chops.

The calamari was typically mediocre, the same kind you'd get at Cheesecake Factory and the like.  The risotto balls were decent, though there wasn't much cheese or saffron in it.  We felt like tools for listening to the bartender about the pork chops though.  It reminded me of Kitchen Confidential where the chefs try to push out the last of old meats on the customers.  At least the garlic bread was good, but they charge you for any additional baskets beyond the first.

Boyfriend brought me here for my birthday. It was AMAZING. Garlic bread was to die for and so were our dishes. I had the Rigatoni Gorgonzola and he had the veal. Both of is were satisfied. It was my first time dining at Nora's but this might be one of my fave places already.
A real gem. Can't say anything bad for this place. All the food was magnificent - the pastas, pizzas and the steak.

Oh Nora's. You have long been my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. That was until today. I made an online reservation on March 20 for March 30 at 5:45pm. I called today, March 30, to see if I could change the time. I was told by the snarky hostess that I did not have a reservation. I was also told that I made it for a different day even though I have the email record of my reservation. I hung up to check my email, called the restaurant back, and got the manager. He found the reservation with no problem and confirmed that the time could not be changed. At this point I was a bit put out by the hostess's attitude and we decided to go somewhere else. I called back to cancel the reservation and got to talk to Miss Snarky once again. She was just as snarky as she was before but even more so. Should couldn't find the reservation once again, but finally did using my last name (she never asked me my last name when I called the first time). I thanked her very forcefully for her excellent customer service. Needless to say, you have lost our business for good now.

One of our favorite spots to go as a family or a quick get away without the kids ! Its decently priced, servers are pretty decent its alot busier then it used to be, so I recommend making a reservation ahead of time. Their new location looks really nice but kinda miss some of the original servers that used to be at the older one.

Exceptional evening at this unassuming spot way off the strip.  In the private room our group  enjoyed the white pizza, Caesar salad, veal Marsala, carbonara, chicken parm and cannelloni.  Service was spot one..not too intrusive, well timed and friendly without being obsequious.  Traditional Italian dine extremely well.
Handsome staff (lol), delicious food, patient with big parties, delicious Italian food. 9/10 would go again.
The food and hostesses were fantastic, the bar was friendly and comfortable. I'll definitely be bringing the rest of my family in the future since we've been looking for a good Italian restaurant.

Great place &  great service from Nina but the truffle fries could have been better. Nina was very nice, personable & attentive. I had the pan seared salmon that was cooked to perfection. I'll definitely be coming back :)

I've been going to Nora's for a while now. I absolutely love the food I can not complain about the food but I do have to complain on the service. March I was making a reservation I call the day of for a 6 o'clock reservation, I show up at the restaurant and I tell them I have a reservation and the lady says "I'm sorry i don't have a reservation for that name. Are you sure you called ?" She calls over another lady and they start to talk and I pulled out my phone and show then the call and how long it was and I named the person I talked to. The ladies seemed bothered but they apologize and still sat us. After that our waiter was super nice. My dad asked if they had this dish call chicken piccata because it wasn't on the menu and the waiter was super kind and said he would ask the chef. Turns out the chef could and honestly it's one of the best things I've eaten there. I'm never disappointed in the food but always something with the costumer service. This recently happened where we were seated the waiter came greater took our drinks then we waited for about 20 mins and our waiter never came back we had to ask a buster to call him the busters are always super nice.
Do yourself a favor do not go !! The food is pathetic !! And the service is even worse !! I really don't have anything good to say I'm sorry !!

Why eat "Italian" on the Strip when you can mosey over to a locals place? I've eaten at Nora's multiple times on multiple trips now - I am as big a fan as ever. 

It's in a strip mall (what isn't in LV?) - and the decor is average. What kills it is the food. Their meatballs make me cry. The pasta isn't cooked until a toothless person can easily gum it - it is al dente like pasta is supposed to be. 

The arancini (Rice Balls) is very tasty.

As others have noted, you will not leave here hungry. I am famous  (infamous?) for being able to finish my food and any others' leftovers - not here.

I worked at a family owned checkered table cloth Italian place which has since closed - if I lived in LV, Nora's would definitely be at least a weekly ritual.
Chicken Parmigiana was awesome.   Great  customer service all around.   The environment was a little loud.

This place was packed and gave me the impression that we were in for a treat. However, the folks eating there must have been heavy smokers because their taste buds had to gone. That's right this place was a solid OK. I can't believe the yelp team couldn't identify average food! The salad was something you buy at the grocery store in a bag. As for the meatballs, it tasted as though they had been made 3 days ago and simply heated. They tasted old and manufactured like something you would eat at a potluck for retired people. The best part of the dinner was the wine. Bottom line, if you want a place that isn't going to break the bank and you are craving Fazoli's, go to Nora's on W. Flamingo. If you are looking for a good Italian meal on the west side . . . try Mastrioni's.

We had garlic bread and caesar salad to start. Followed up with Veal Parm and Chicken Erbe Fini. Total bill was $40. Food was good and it's a decent value compared to other Italian joints in town. Although, I didn't feel it was special enough for a repeat visit.
I've been here alot and I'll go back a lot more. The food is ridiculously good. I usually get some variety of veal. Old school atmosphere, too. My favorite.

If you are from new york, philly, boston. san fran or anywhere else where great southern italian food can be found at every other streetcorner restaurant do not eat here.  you will be disappointed with the bland sauces, overly garliced dishes and awful desserts.  A total waste of time and money.
Always loved this place. Everything is always amazing, and the wait staff is always friendly. If you're in the neighborhood, don't miss out on this opportunity.

I was hoping for a better experience at Nora's because it is a popular, independent, family owned place, generally the kind of restaurant I like to support. 

There were three of us and we had a reservation for 7:30 PM on a weekday evening. We were quickly seated and given menus. The waiter kept prompting us to order drinks but only one of us wanted a glass of wine. We received a small basket of garlic bread which was OK. It was quite a while before our food order was taken and by the time our food arrived we had been there for 50 minutes. Two of us had the "Crazy Alfredo." The third person had the pasta with broccoli. That dish was so salty as to be inedible and was sent back. It was another 15 minute wait for it to be replaced.  The two of us who had the Crazy Alfredo both thought it was OK but nothing special. Same opinion from the person who had the pasta with broccoli.

Around 8:30 a female vocalist and her male musician accompanist began performing from a small stage at the front of the room. Mostly blues and song titles from the 40s & 50s. That was enjoyable.

Menu prices here were average for a restaurant of this caliber. Drink prices seemed high. A glass of "house red wine" was $9.50. Sorry to say, but there was just not much here to draw me back again.

Came here for my anniversary on the recommendation of a friend who had been coming here regularly for years. So glad I did. Let me add our voices to the chorus singing the praises of the Crazy Alfredo, which was amazing. The blend of flavors on this dish is excellent and understandably their most popular dish. Everything else was excellent, but the flourless chocolate cake (make sure you preorder it!) deserves special mention. I'm not even a chocolate lover, but the molten center combined with the pistachios in the sauce make this a wonderful treat. A great meal, and great staff and service. Make sure you make a reservation, as the secret is out and it can be hard to get a seat otherwise at this off the strip gem. Will definitely be back here the next time I'm in Vegas.

Really great italian food with unregrettable garlic bread, the kind that goes home with you and you wake up with garlic breath the morning after. I had the veal marsala and the veal was cooked perfectly. I wanted extra pasta to soak up the delicious sauce.

 If you are looking for authentic italian food at reasonable prices, Nora's is the place to go.

I was there with my wife and a few friends on Saturday 4/22  Reservation was for 4:30pm and we were promptly seated by the very nice host. My first impression: The restaurant's decorative was warm and inviting. Just beautiful! After the "free" garlic bread, we ordered drinks and Cesare salad for everyone (5 adults). The salad was excellent. The garlic bread was so and so. I then ordered the veal chop with spaghetti on the side. My wife, the Crazy shrimp Alfredo. A pepperoni pizza for the kids(2). But anyway, I think, no, I am sure, this Italian restaurant is over-rated! My veal chop was super salty and I mean "salty" and so was my wife's Alfredo. These dinners aren't inexpensive by any means and they totally blew it. There was nothing special about this place, except for the nice looking layouts and nice atmosphere. I am not going to speak for my friends here. Oh well, maybe we were paying for just "being there". My friends told me to let the host know of my disappointment. But, nahhh!!! I just won't be back, even for free. 2 Stars are generous! But 5 Stars for the nice looking restaurant! Just for your info., I've been to a lot of nice Italian restaurants here in Vegas and elsewhere. So, I am no stranger to Italian foods. But this place was just...very average at best and way below average if you factor in their prices.

It's hard to find Italian food being raised Italian, and knowing how to make the dishes from scratch. This place is the only place I go for solid Italian. 

Well ran, food comes fast, Nick one of the servers is very professional. 

My brother in law got an over cooked ribeye they swapped it out, and I tried a piece, and it was melt in your mouth.

5 stars, great place!

Nora's is one of my go-to spots for friends visiting, and each time everyone is always impressed.  It's close enough to the strip for friends to meet up which is always a bonus.  The flavors are great and very rich.  Most of the pasta choices are heavier on the cream-side.   My top choices are the veal, chicken mt. edna, and the crazy alfredo.  I would not come here from the pizza though.  It's not bad, but just ok. 

Great for sharing and large crowds, and the prices are just right!

We found this local place solely based on the amazing high reviews on Yelp. We were very satisfied and my only regret is that we didn't have a refrigerator in our hotel room to bring home leftovers (hugs portions!). We made a reservation (highly recommended) this place gets packed. There is a bar to get a drink in case you need to wait for a table. We started with the bruschetta (very delicious) and salads. Word to the wise: the small size portion of yet salad is plenty to split between two. I ordered the carbonara which was so delicious. Lots of prosciutto and the sauce was perfect. We also got yey chicken Milanese. This is the only reason I don't give a 5 because the Milanese wasn't great. Not pounded thin enough at all. Got the Oreo tartuffo for dessert. Def try it! 
Parking can be challenging. We had to drive around the lot a few times before finding a spot. We will def eat at Nora's again when we are in town.
Excellent food and excellent service!  Took our parents their as part of a gift and they loved the food!  They aren't kidding when they say the lemon drop cocktail is good, it's my favorite!

In the quest to find an Italian restaurant that can be a staple in my weekly diet, I have had to travel across town to the corner of Flamingo and Jones in a strip mall to find a hidden gem called  Noras. 

Appetizer: The ,arancini  are stuffed deep-fried risotto balls  This is the perfect appetizer that you crave.

Main Course: Make your own pasta dish with your preferred pasta, sauce, and add-ons.  ie. Linguini with arrabiata sauce and chicken.

Dessert: Did not try dessert.  Will explore in my future visits.

If there are any 5 star Italian restaurants between Noras and Henderson
 please let me know.

Dinner at Nora's was a hit! We made reservations which I would definitely recommend, because the place filled up quickly for the dinner rush. The service was very good and the pacing of the courses was right on track.

Arancini and calamari were both cooked perfectly and were delicious. Nora salad was not my favorite, but I'm not a big roasted pepper fan. Garlic bread was delicious. They also have a full bar with plenty of specialty drinks.

I had the gnocchi in vodka sauce which was tasty but I wish the gnocchi's were a little more firm. Other dishes ordered at the table were eggplant parmesan, angel hair with meatballs and linguine with clam sauce. Everyone enjoyed their selections and the portions were just right.

We topped it all off with chocolate chip & pistachio cannoli for desert and cappuccino.

Overall, we had a very nice experience at Nora's. It's a little bit pricey, but not bad considering what you would probably pay for lesser quality food at any of the Italian chains. I will definitely be back and would like to try their pizza.

I got an email from a person from Nora's telling me that they don't have beef and what I ate was actually pork. 

Sorry for the mistake. Though I must say, it's rather telling that it was a mystery meat situation.

A Vegas local recommended this place highly and said, "You will have the best Italian in Vegas."  We rolled the dice, since you never know, we ended up with snake eyes.  From the poor service to horrible food, I have no idea why this place has four stars.  Waiter rarely around, other server brought wrong course to our table, no apology a third random server over head my complaint as I was asking for our server to fix the issue and brought us the same salad with additional toppings.  A bus boy dropped plates and drinks where liquid got on me, waiter laughed it off and only checked on me as after thought.
Pasta not home made and I am skeptical about the sauces.  Long story short, don't believe the hype, all flash no substance.  A few reviews have said this place isn't good, I am always concerned with those reviews, but in this case it is a fact.  Save your money.

Nora's was suggested to me by a friend who has lived in Vegas for over 30 years. The thing about Nora's is everything on the menu tastes great. That includes the free Garlic bread. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is the food is a bit heavy but hell what Italian food isn't heavy. A must is the Tiramisu. Absolutely fantastic. On occasions there is a live band playing. Took my wife their for her birthday.

The food was ok. The highlight of the meal was the molten chocolate cake with pistachio anglaise. However, it came 20 minutes after the meal was over and it was pre-ordered per their request. I understand that it was made fresh but being a chef I know they had plenty of time. What should be the restaurants bread and butter  the red sauce  tasted like watered down Ragu. The place is also a fire hazard you can't even get to the bathroom because the tables are so jammed together. Nora's used t be much better and they can do better.
Yelp had great buy 1 get 1 Sangria deal which was great for girls night. Loved calamari, caprese salad, and basil penne pasta. Good price great food!

We had a large party at this restaurant and least to say our experience wasn't pleasant.  Our server barely smiled the entire time and didn't anticipate our needs. The drinks weren't refilled and there was an hour wait in between 1st and main course. The dessert was served 7 minutes before we had to leave the restaurant. The manager had to remind us in a very unprofessional way that we have to leave at the exact time because they have to prepare for the next party. 

The food was excellent but the bad customer service from the manager down to the servers made our dining experience in this restaurant very unpleasant. Will I go back or recommend this restaurant to anyone? Not a chance!

They have a nice variety of items, the food was wonderful BUT either we went on a bad night or it's typical for the food to take 45 minutes? Could be that the server forgot to ring it in OR the kitchen crashed. Whatever the case, it's not exceptable. 
My other issue was too many tables crammed into the restaurant. There is not enough room for that volume. The table next to us had 10 people around what should be a table for 6 MAX. One poor woman was right in the walkway with barely enough room to walk past her. 
I was quoted 45 min to a hour wait...that was more like 20 minutes. (Maybe she ment  the food would take 45 minutes.) Quote times should be more accurate. 
VERY disappointed a manager or key wasn't walking around checking on the guest or was even sent to our table, my body language spoke volumes of how upset I was getting.
I've worked in the F&B industry for 25 years, and I can say, I've had a better experience at an Applebee's and that's 1 step up from fast food.
I may give it another shot because the food was GREAT....when it finally got there. I will also make sure I make a reservation, even on a Wednesday night.
Food is delicious and fresh! Cozy environment, hidden treasure. Nora's is by far a favorite-a must try!
New favorite Italian spot! The food was absolutely to die for and the best glass of Moscato I've ever had!

Maybe I had set my expectations too high, as I really enjoy a good Italian-American meal, but my dinner left me a little disappointed.  
The place was packed at 6pm and even with reservations there was a wait, a less-than-friendly hostess and long waits between courses once we were seated.  Entrees were served so brusquely that even though I immediately noticed I was missing utensils the server had turned away without a word.
The food was good, but not great and the noise level was rather loud.

Another amazing Meal at Nora's.  Food was amazing and the staff was very attentive.  We tried the rigatoni and it was perfectly cooked with the pasta sauce having an impeccable balance between sweetness and acidity

Had dinner on sunday night. Great experience, atmosphere was perfect runners were fast and attentive. Melrose pasta and branzino was . Deff recommend to everyone check this place out!! Can wait to go back.

3 visits to Nora's Cuisine this week .......love this place. 10 minutes off the "strip" and a world away from the plastic bullshit that is Las Vegas. The food is absolutely first class, the service is terrific, the noise level is low, pricing is so reasonable. Do yourself a favor , escape the Vegas tourist traps, try Nora's, you will love it

Tried out this hidden gem the other day. It was busy on a Friday night, but we got seated on the patio right away. The service was good and everyone was friendly. 

The calamari was a good appetizer. We also had the Crazy Alfredo, which was a very interesting (and delicious!) spin on the dish. We also had the Chicken Marsala - the marsala sauce was a bit too sweet for us (it had a strong "maple syrup" taste). It came with a side of pasta, with a simple marinara sauce that was not great. Even though it was a great atmosphere, the food was slightly underwhelming for the price.

I used to come here ALL the time when I lived in the city, it was THE best low-key Italian restaurant off-strip. When I visited recently with two friends I had been raving to about Nora's for months, we were all super-disappointed. Sad to say, the service has gone supremely downhill over the last few years. We arrived and waited at the bar for our reservation. Then they sat us at a table in the bar, DIRECTLY next to the stage. It took practically years for us to get any water, then the musicians started filtering in. A tip jar was set up literally in FRONT of our table. My friend complained to the server about moving tables and was given a flat-out refusal. I then went to the hostess and complained, and we were moved to a spot next to the kitchen. The food took about an hour and a half to get to us and we were practically begging for water from anyone who walked by. Food was ok, I've definitely had better, and I don't think I will be back :'(

CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE!!!!!!

Order the chocolate cake - you have to order it with your entree so it's ready for dessert.  Mere words cannot describe it's deliciousness.

The food is delicious and I love the staff.  It took longer than usual to get our food in the new location but I just contributed that to the fact that it was a bigger crowd and perhaps the chefs are just adjusting to cooking for more people at once.  I'm addicted to the veal Scallopini and they make it gluten free if you ask. Be sure to sign up for their email club and get their olive appetizer for free.

Last day in Vegas so figured that Vegas has a lot of good Italian since there not much back home. Through yelp, found this place. Gave it a try. It was lunch hour when we arrived so the restaurant was busy. We had spaghetti meatballs, rigatoni and I ordered crazy alfredo. While waiting for our order we were served with garlic breads. It was unusual as it was the first. Normally restaurants would give you a plain bread with butter or some kind of dipping while waiting. 
Loved loved the garlic breads. It was cut into a bite sized and it was yummy and crispy. Not long afterwards came our menu. Mine sure look a lot lol...it's crazy alfredo with chicken, bell peppers, shrimp minus the sausage. It was rich and creamy...gosh....I'm in pasta heaven...it sure a class of its own. Kudos for the chef who cooked my yummy pasta. Halfway I was full but I know I gotta finish and savor it as I won't be able to taste it again in the near future. So I made it and licked the plate clean. Before we left we ordered cannoli. It's been a while since we had it in New York and yeah a big giant cannoli answered our prayer. It was filled with chocolate chips on one side and pistachios on the other. It was enough to fill all of us. Yeah...we left with a full belly and happy smiles
Thank you Vegas for the great food we had it beat all that expensive buffets that being served everywhere in those casinos esp bellagio. They got a very bland Asian dishes. Only good for steak and desserts...urrgghhh...

Amazingly delicious!!! Every we ordered was so so good... the filet I ordered was cooked to perfection, salmon my friend ordered was supper tasty, the pasta dishes absolutely amazing... and let's not forget the drink literally every single drink we had was so great... I highly recommend everyone try this place when in Las Vegas

This restaurant was amazing!!!  We had Chicken Marsala, Melrose Pesti, Alla Nora, Cannelloni....  Every single bit of food was amazing!!  We had drinks and recommend the Italian Mule and the Il Fragolino... Also amazing!!!  Ambiance was beautiful.  Waiting staff was attentive and friendly. Best start to our Vegas trip for a 21st birthday!!!

Great atmosphere.  We came on a Saturday night, there's a live band playing easy listening music. 

Their famous dish here is the Crazy Alfredo. Which is a fettuccine in Alfredo sauce with other red sauce ingredient to arrive at the perfect combination of the two sauces.  Nothing fancy about this place, but the food was good.  Check it out if you're looking to get off the strip and pay non-strip price quality food.

We came just a bit before closing with a real craving for good Italian. They seated us happily, and didn't rush us at all. Our server was great, and the cooks made our food wonderfully. 
We ended up splitting a chicken parm, the serving size was generous! It was crispy and thin, as it should be, and the sauce was delicious. We will definitely be back.

Holy cow - last time I reviewed Nora's was 2008 ?!?! GF cravin' to-go Italian as we hibernate another weekend evening ( we are definitely way too ant-social these days ) 

I gotta believe I've been to Nora's at least 10 times since the last review so it gives you an idea how much I like the place.  What surprises me the most is the pricing - though I haven't been to Olive Garden in a long time I bet Nora's pricing is similar.

We went with the aracini rolls for an app, the crazy fettucini and spaghetti and meatballs for main event ( I was chastised for not getting a dessert .. next time ) - total cost $42 ( darn good value ) 

the food ?  gf felt the risotto rolls were "old" - I call BS on that - what do you want - make the risotto fresh, roll them up and put them in the fryer ?  she thought the oil might be old ...whatever, more for me !

the spaghetti and meatballs - above average - the balls might have been a little too dense ( ie no filler ) - sauce decent could have been a little thicker ( personal preference ) 

The crazy fettucini - your basic fettucini but they add sausage, chicken, shrimp and for a little bite - jalapeno's.  I liked it though maybe a little too much going on.

order came with garlic bread - my guess an entire head of garlic in one roll ! whew

pics attached

also, the place was packed when I picked up the order - Nora's continues to rock
Great food! Best Italian food in Vegas! Try the homemade tortellini with Alfredo. It's amazing! Everyone says they have the best vodka sauce they have ever had but I can't go without getting Alfredo.

Once again Nora's delivers. Every time I am in Vegas on business or otherwise i have to go to Nora's. Recently opened, their brand new location is conveniently located very near their original location. Their new location is beautiful and well layout out. Their menu has expanded to include foods cooked over a wood grill which are amazing and the quality of the food is terrific. The staff is always friendly and eager to please.  Keep up the good work Nora's, I will see you all soon.

My godfather recommended this place. He's lived in Vegas for 16 years and took us here. He ordered us the anti pasta salad for us and recommended the seafood dishes. I'm not a huge fan of seafood if at all so I stuck with the pasta dishes. They have so many classic options and twists on classics as well. I decided for chicken Marsala which was really good. One of the better ones I have had. I will say it comes with a side of pasta but it was weird that it came with red sauce on top. Typically when I order chicken Marsala the wine sauce is served over pasta. The garlic bread they bring out is outstanding and we could have eaten that for an entire meal. The dessert was good too, we got the chocolate lava cake. The vanilla sauce is just so good.
We love this restaurant. They have live music on the weekends. The food is good, we would like to see some more vegetarian selections.

Being second generation Italian, people ask me where my favorite Italian place in Vegas is, and Nora's is it.   But not the whole menu.  For me Nora's is about one thing, and that thing is the eggplant parmigiana (and the cannolli).

I'll get to the parm in a sec, but definitely start your meal out with one of Nora's family style salads.  We get the house salad, and even the generous portion is polished off easily by a group of four.  The garlic bread is a take it or leave it thing.  I've taken people here who thought it was great, and others thought it was okay.  The garlic ensures that you definitely need a breath mint after just one slice, and if you plan on locking lips with someone later on you may want to pass on it. 

I've eaten in Italian restaurants all over the country and they serve the best eggplant parm I've ever had.  Thickly cut with a meaty texture, fried to perfection and topped with a generous portion of mozzarella cheese, then popped in the oven (or salamander) it's to die for.  Maybe they put a little too much cheese on top, but I'm the type of guy that says you really can't put too much cheese on anything.  Also I'd get a side order of meatballs, they're top notch.

If you don't like eggplant I'd go with the baked ziti. It's served a little different, with balls of ricotta covering the top of the ziti.  The pizza is solid, but not NYC style, so if that's what you're used to, just order the eggplant.  They do make a white pizza which is kinda hard to find in Vegas. I would not order the chicken parm or the chicken Marsala, it's not made the way people are accustomed to, and besides, I told you to order the eggplant, so why are you looking at other menu items?


At the end of your meal I deplore you not to leave this joint without ordering cannoli.  They're just like momma made 'em, crisp shells filled with a sweet but not too sweet, creamily delicious ricotta, topped on one side with pistachios and the other chocolate chips.  I've also tried the tiramisu, which is very good, but takes up precious cannoli space in my stomach so I usually don't order it.

For me, going to Nora's and not getting the eggplant is like going to a steakhouse and ordering a side of veggies.  This is my go to place for some just how momma made it eggplant, meatballs and cannoli.

Giovanni and Marcello make the restaurant completely authentic.  One of them can sing opera! Some of the best Italian food in Las Vegas (Cafe Parma is great, too).  Ordering any pasta dish will be a winner and don't forget the Grappa (strong after dinner drink) to complete the meal!

This is a great little Italian restaurant.  The food and cocktails were excellent and the decor is beautiful.  Service was just average.  Bartenders seemed more interested in talking to one another than taking care of us.  Plenty of parking and I suggest getting there early to avoid waiting.

on vacation in vegas, got sick of buffets so i looked this place up, i think it was on some food network show, regardless it was tasty.  i got the nora alla, a baked spaghetti with ground beef, pesto and eggplant on the top, perfectly crispy and delicious.  my wife went with pasta and meatball, in their really good house red sauce, one of the better meatballs i've tried.

we also ordered calamari and a side salad, which were mediocre but not distasteful.  we would go back if we were ever in vegas again.

GET OFF THE STRIP! Really, there is more to Vegas than Celeb Chefs and over priced strip restaurants. 

Had the Calamari app, very tender, well seasoned. The Mozzarella Caresse was not the best i've had, but still tasty. 
Highlight was the Crazy Alfredo think Alfredo Fettuccine, then add sausage, jumbo shrimp, mushrooms, bell peppers, sun dried tomatoes, and wait for it...Jalapenos. 

definitely will be a return visit on the next trip out.

I gave heard about Nora's for years but never made it. Boy I sure missed out. I loved everything about this place. The restaurant is beautiful it reminds me if a Napa Valley fine eatery. We order a Cesar salad for two and split a baked rigatoni. The portion are huge. Excellent. The garlic bread is very tasty. Come with a big appetite as I'm sure you will over eat. Can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu. Yum. Service was great. Reservations a must
I enjoyed the Veal Scaloppini and panna cotta for dessert. It was a busy night but our server did the best she could with all the tables she had. I would definitely come back!

Love their new location as always service, food and drinks were exceptional.the fettuccini sea food plate just awesome ,they are also one of the few restaurants in town that carry bols gin.
Always a great experience

Great evening at Nora's.  Don't forget to make a reservation...like us.  Quick service at the bar and we were able to grab a quick bite.  Service was amazing!  Started with the Caprese salad.  Mozzarella was fresh and great flavor.  Split the Crazy Alfredo and it was wonderful too.  Perfect portion for two.  Special attention from the owner put the exclamation mark on the evening.  We will definitely be back anytime we're in Vegas.

I love this restaurant. The food was amazing and our server was fantastic.   So the reason for the low score is the extremely rude hostess. An older blonde hair lady. Who stood near our table clicking her pen or flicking the pen cap while very loudly speaking that she needed our table table for a six top.   We were  a party of four who ordered drinks apps entrees and desserts.  We were there for two hours.  I have worked in food service for a long time and I think this behavior is completely unacceptable.   Basically this woman ruined the night. That is the last memory I have of your restaurant.   Not sure if I will be back there are many great spots in this town that I can spend my money at.

I have been to this restaurant twice and both times I was pleased with the food. The first time the service was a little slow, but the second time was great.
My biggest complaint (and it might just be me) is the restaurant is a little noisy.
The absolute best place in Las Vegas for italian! I come at least once a week and have never been disappointed. !
Great food, start to finish, we will be back many times, thank you

We really loved it. I looked on Google and find it. Happy I did. My mom and I shared the salmon and it was really good. One of my twin son had the cheese ravioli and loved it. The other twin had a pizza. It was really yummy. And last- They are very friendly and patient. Our server was lovely.

We ordered the calamari for an appetizer. It was good and big portions. Bread was very tasty. We order pasta with clams dish. It was good but a little on the salty side. I would go again, but try something different.
I haven't found anything on their menu that I don't like. Suggestion: don't miss the Arancini (it is the best that you will ever have).

Wow, originally I was going to give it a top rating however, yesterday (my 3rd time in 3 weeks)
I got food poisoning.  The only food I ate was oatmeal for breakfast and then to Nora's for lunch.  Not sure what did it but both my wife and I shared the chicken Marsala, along with spaghetti, and a side of the chicken wings.  We both were infected last night.  We won't chance this place again.

Came here for an evening meal, not sure what to expect at all. First thing I noticed, LIVE MUSIC! Instantly liked  the place. Complimentary bread and even got a free glass of wine for checking in through Yelp. Fantastic. The food was similar to Olive Garden but seemed a little more genuine Sicilian taste. Will be back.

My husband and I ordered food to go. The place was packed at 5:45pm on a Wednesday when we went to pick it up. If dining in I would suggest reservations. We ordered gnocchi with vodka sauce, lasagna, and a side of meatballs. It came with a small loaf of garlic bread that we both could have done without.....way too much garlic for us. The gnocchi and lasagna were nothing special but the meatballs were excellent! Overall prices were pretty reasonable. Might try it again.

The five stars crazy Alfredo.  I brought my dad here. He is very picky. He cannot stop basting it is good it is good. I am so happy. 

Love it. And will come back again when I am in town.

Wanted to eat somewhere off the strip. Just picked a random Italian place and was pleasantly surprised. 

Wonderful food and great service.  

Great place

Absolutely incredible!  This place was so good.  Crazy Alfredo was probably the best Alfredo I have ever had and had a nice kick.  Totally full of flavor and load with chicken shrimp sausage sun dried tomatoes and other stuff that brings it all together.  The marinara sauce was really good as well.  Garlic beard come right out of the pizza over and the Caprese was a good way to start the meal.  They have an Orchard mule seasonal cocktail was so outstanding complements the start of fall perfectly.

Great ambience! Very lively patrons because it a place you want to visit more than once. Service and food very friendly and very good. Prices are very reasonable. 4 course meal and drinks $82.  Best panna cotta ever. If you are looking for Italian take an uber or an easy 15 minute bus ride from the flamingo straight to their door.  You won't be disappointed. Make an online reservation. Waited 2 minutes to be seated. Nice.

Food is excellent and atmosphere was excellent. The only issue I had was the lighting. The lighting was low where we were sitting, but it was romantic, I just could not read the menu from where I was sitting. The webpage does provide in detail the menu which helped for me because I knew what I was going to have before I went in.
A+ food and drink.. Real home cooked Italian food, the whole experience was inviting..Will definitely return , whether with a date or with the family.

Had lunch here with the hubby a few weeks ago. We were sat in a private room that was being reset from an event. No one else was sat there, only us. We were ignored for a few minutes, as if no one knew who our server was. Then 3 people came to talk to us and take our order. Just weird.
The last server approached the table when my husband was on the phone. We had been waiting for about 10 min, but apparently that was our problem. He stopped talking to pay attention to her and place his order.
Appetizers took too long to come out, and by the time our entrees were ready, we had to leave for an appt. We had to ask a staff to find our server and get our check. We waited a few minutes and the server came to the table. Instead of being check ready, she made a comment about giving us a note explaining why we were late...what? Idk if that was her attempt at being funny, but she wasn't! Then she excused herself and went to get our check. 
The whole experience was painful. I'll go to Capo's next time I crave Italian.

I'm born and raised in vegas. I ate here when it first opened in the 90's. It def is not what it used to be "back in the day". Still good food but way too busy and long waits for service. Last visit march 2014. I guess if you want good service dont come here during peak hours. The night of my visit the patrons were pretty saucy and loud. I guess people feel this type of resturaunt is cool with drunk cackling bimbos and loud rambling.

Excellent food and the wine is superb! The hosts are young and arrogant and my rating would have been 5 stars if it wasn't for that. There is always a wait but for good reason. This place is fantastic

New location still serving great food. My wife and I went on our first date at Nora's original location and we just celebrated our 4 year anniversary here at their new location. The ambience is great and the service was good but a little slow. We were seated right away but it took what seemed like 10 minutes before anyone asked us for drinks and apps. Our waiter was hosting a few large parties celebrating birthdays but once the waiter did come around all was well. I had the roasted octopus app. which I really enjoyed. For dinner I had the chicken Marsala, the sauce was sweet and chicken cooked perfectly. For dessert we had the chocolate Oreo tartufo, one word delicious! Overall w had a great experience and would definitely recommend to anyone craving Italian food.
Chicken Alfredo, Crazy Alfredo, Garlic bread, house salad and rigatoni special. Cannoli is he best.
Had a dinner with my husband tonight and really liked the place. They were full of people on Sunday evening. The place was good for drinks too. Will definitely come again!

CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE CHOCOLATE CAKE!!!!!! H.K.L.'s review was right!(make sure you order it as you sit down to dinner, and leave room for a taste!)

Great neighborhood joint, felt like a long island restaurant, run by an Italian family that cares. Casual setting with good food.

Nice wine selection and the prices were good.

Okie doke, I've ate here twice, had the Lasagna and Chicken Parm. Both times I wasn't impressed. Lemme start by saying in my opinion, great Italian food starts with the sauce. If the sauce is plain or has nothing memorable about it then fahgettaboutit.

So steps in boring Lasagna and (non breaded?) Chicken Parm so bland that I'm pretty sure I could make it myself. My GF and her mom had the clam pasta dish and neither raved about it, finished half or asked for a to-go box. Afterwards me and my gf went for drinks and then... secret pizza; if that says anything. This wasn't the worst meal ever, especially with the lemon thyme drink, but I wouldn't go back here with so many other options in Vegas.

0/2
-service
-prices (expensive)
-atmosphere
-food quality 
+the "Lemon Thyme" drink was good
+proximity to the Palms (lol)

Ok had to say at the end that this place stays packed and theres alot of great reviews. But I seriously tried twice people! Twice!!! 

Maybe its just me

Been coming here for at least a decade & always consistent delicious authentic Italian food.  Love the renovations & bigger space. The Caramel rimmed Apple Martini is divine & smells like an apple pie.  Come expecting to be full for days after. 

Four baskets of garlic buttered bread, two bowls of linguine w/ or garlic shrimp scampi & meatball app, I was satisfied, but was talked into more pasta.  Pasta alla vodka, meat lasagna, veal scaloppini, wine & to top it off tiramisu!   

Highly recommend all of this in this order.   Absolutely A+.  Ma & pa's w/ live Italian music.

Another great experience at Nora's! Came here with my boyfriend at 8:00pm still really busy but there was space at the bar. Table for two they said was approx 40min to 1 hr wait, but the tip is to sit at the bar and eat which is first come first serve.

Service: (6 stars out of 5) 6 stars for Michelle our waitress bartender!! She was very attentive and really funny. Awesome service way above average. Make sure you get her! Nails were also on point!

Friendly waiters, good music(the standards) of course. Love the garlic bread, ordered the mozzarella caprese, delish and fresh. The Angus rib eye was nice and fatty, and the crazy Alfredo was big and sloppy with lots of sausage flavor. For desert we got the chocolate cake,  it was rich and hot it was drizzled in butter vanilla sauce and crushed pistachio.
As good as it gets! Daniel was awesome! Totally accomadating, made me a special dish of cooked veggies, tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese. Delish! Cool place

The food was good however, I made reservations 4 hours prior to going and when I got there my reservation was not ready which didn't fly by me. 

Also as soon as we sat eventually the waitress didn't seem to customer friendly and when she asked to see our ID's for alcoholic beverages she said that she couldn't tell the difference between the IDs (assuming she thinks all Asians look alike) which also bothered me because the initial issue was lingering. 

I like that they give you an extra glass of sangria with the purchase of one and as long as you check in. 

Keep in mind I reserved a dinner for 7 because it was one of my family members birthday and I wanted to take her out. 

When dinner was finally served everyone got their food except me! Apparently they just forgot to put it in. 

When I got the final bill I noticed she didn't charge me for certain things I'm assuming cause she knew I was upset. 

Fortunately I'm not an asshole(excuse the language) and still tipped her about 18%. 

The food was great I enjoyed my meal, two calamaris we ordered for appetizers. The portions are great I guess personally the restaurant didn't give me a positive vibe.

I heard about this place on a local radio station. They were mentioning the top pizza places in throughout the nation. Nora's took first place and of course, being the pizza lover I am, I had to try this place. After finally planning our Vegas trip I said we had to try this place before we left to see if its really the #1 best pizza in the USA (San Diego took #2 woohoo). We got there exactly at the time they opened to beat the lunch crowd. At first it was empty, but immediately got packed for the lunch hour.  We already know what we wanted since we had browsed through the menu on their website. After being seated, the bus boy offered us water along with any other beverage. A few minutes later, our waitress greeted us with fresh garlic bread (Which was to die for!!) We started off with a Caesar Salad then ordered our pizza. We went for the Snow White pizza and added mushrooms and prosciutto (per hubby's request). I must say this is probably the best pizza I've ever had. The ricotta on the pizza was so fresh it would melt in your mouth. The dough was just perfect. Not too heavy, not too doughy, not too thin, not too thick. I'm usually not too crazy about prosciutto, its just too salty for me to enjoy, but this one was perfect!! It had the right texture, not too chewy or salty. Overall, I had a wonderful experience and I can totally see myself coming back if I'm ever in Vegas again.

Amazing food, great staff! LOVED this place! We wanted to eat good Italian food off the strip and we found it with Nora's! Located in a strip mall (take a cab if from out of town), the setting is not fancy (yet nice) and we felt as if we were taken care of by the best. My husband had the Carbonara and said he hadn't tasted one that good since being in Italy! The pizza was excellent and there are a variety of choices. We noticed that this place was frequented by local returnees, always a good sign (especially since many were obviously local Italians!).  Will definitely return.

This is probably my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. The food is delicious and truly authentic in terms of Italian taste. The decor is nice, waiters dressed lovely. I must say however,  as a resident and frequent visitor of the restaurant it is extremely busy so beware of wait times to exceed 2hrs. In addition during these busy times the front door host staff really struggle with the intensity of the traffic and tend to be really rude, short, curt and out-right offensive. Instead of greeting you or welcoming you to Nora's what you will tend to hear as you step up to the host is "the wait time is....." in the most frustrating tone imaginable. I spoke with the manager on duty in one of these instances who apologized and explained it was really busy which I understood and advised him that good customer service can never be undermined despite the greatest of food. I am a local and choose to come here also during the slow times of day when Nora's is pretty empty and tourists are out enjoying Las Vegas therefore my money and my business really matters. He again apologized and explained he would speak with the hosts. You decide, if you come in the evening between the hours of 6-10pm expect chaos, long wait times, limited seating as you wait, rude hosts and great food.

Pros: Food tasted good, service was prompt (probably need reservations on a weekend), dinner comes with bread sticks (dipped in olive oil?), staff was friendly, abundant portions (lots of doggie bags). Had Caesar salad (meh), Crazy Alfredo (tasty but oily),  glass of wine, and a cannoli (very good).  With tip: $52!!! (One person).

Cons: Place is really noisy. No real parmesan cheese, but rather the cheap stuff you get at Pizza Hut. Waiter will suggest a salad, but does not tell you it is extra. 

For $52 I expect a better dining experience.

One word... Amazing! We are from out of town and found Nora's on Yelp and decided to give it a try. It was a fantastic choice. Wonderful atmosphere, incredible bread, and outstanding food, and a very reasonable price! (I highly recommend the Pasta Carbonara!) Our waitress, Nina, was also very personable and very efficient! She went above and beyond to make sure we had an excellent experience. I highly recommend Nora's to any local residents and/or out of towners. (And ask for Nina!)

We came to this restsurant for our 10 yeat anniversary. The atmosphere was great with jazz playing throughout the restaurant. The server was great, she was attentive witjout being overbearing. I loved the lasagna, just wished it had more meat or I could change it to sausage. My wife had calamari and som shrimp carbanara, she loved the calamari and the cabanara not so much. Overall it was great

So I'm a Vegas local and huge foodie. Took my girlfriend there as she had never been last weekend on Sunday night. Sat on the bar side because we wanted the music to add to our experience. Took 10 mins to be greeted by our server(male) and was rushed to order drinks and apps. Rest of experience was like we weren't even there. Waiter wasn't busy, a non caring attitude, and all around a bad server. I'm in the business and I tolerate a lot but no excuse for this server. Talking to his busser like he was below him. I wanted to say something but my girlfriend wouldn't let me. 

Only reason I gave Nora's a 3 star rating is because the food is always amazing. Hopefully they don't take this server to the new location! Ruined our date night...

my boyfriend and i went here for lunch and we were impressed with how well kept the restaurant is.  the atmosphere is perfect.  the food was extremely tasty and we even left with leftovers when we ordered off the lunch menu.  the prices are great and so is the calamari!  we will be back when we're in vegas!

I brought my wife here for a special meal.  I mean, after all, the reviews were very kind and so I figured it would be a nice place to come. They sat us right away and I was expecting a nice Italian dinner.  The waitress was very nice, however, the food lacked completely.  My wife and I both ordered fettuccine alfredo, and I'm sorry to report that there was absolutely no taste in the food.  There was no garlic, no flavors that you would expect in a (expensive) Italian meal.  When the waitress asked how everything was, we were very honest.  I explained that there was no flavor in the food, to which she apologized.  She brought terimisu (sp?) out complementary at the end, but again, even that lacked flavor.  I hate to say it, but Olive Garden has more flavor, and we despise going there!  This is my suggestion - go to the grocery store, buy your own ingredients, buy a bottle of wine, and have a stay at home date with your partner.  Not only will it be cheaper, but the flavors you can create yourself will beat this restaurant any day.
Best Italian in Vegas. Good quality food for slightly better prices than the Strip Restaurants.

Impressive Italian restaurant, always filled with the locals.  when you enter check out the wine wall on the right, very impressive. the restaurant was filled to capacity, they had a gathering outside as well. I went to the second floor for a private party, Awesome. they also had a private balcony, which has electric and gas heaters to keep you warm on a cold night as well as a cozy private room that could hold 30 to 50.  They hav an elevator or stairs to get up to the second floor. The restrooms have a sink with an faucet that also is connected to an air dryer, first time for me. Impressed with the appetizers and the rack of lamb.  Desserts were great too!
Finally made it to the new location. Let me tell you it's beautiful and the staff is just as good as before. We will be back. We also tried a new red wine tonight and it was awesome!

Was anticipating a nice dinner at their new and larger location. Hostess area confused, not enough waiting room near front, and felt like I was at a banquet hall. Chain restaurants have a better layout. Waiters are great. Garlic bread along with caeser salad was drenched. My pasta dish was average. Took an hour to get our main entrees. They need to get their act together. Will not go back.
Good service.  Intimate warm setting. Good food.  Caprese was great.  Impressed.

Steak and arugula bruschetta, Tigers blood cocktail (not available last visit), Rigatoni special.

Excellent musical choices to round out the atmosphere!

The ambiance here is amazing.  We always sit in the dining room where the bar is located as opposed to the seating area located where the kitchen is or the far side.

The food is absolutely delicious.  On our first trip here, near the end of the meal we were approached by a lifelong New Yorker who had moved to Las Vegas later in life and had NOT found an Italian restaurant worthy of frequenting UNTIL this day.  He asked us if we enjoyed our food and of course we did!  He then told us this was the only Italian restaurant worthy of a New Yorker.

While visiting family in a nearby neighborhood, we stopped in after finding Nora's on yelp. It did not disappoint! The service was wonderful and the food was great. We had a gluten free penne, the baked rigatoni and a rigatoni special. Everything was delicious.
This was the first time I eat here. It was a treat! The service was excellent! It was prompt and friendly! The food was great. The portions were large and prices were very fair. I will be back!

I am amazed that this little gem is in Las Vegas! We have come a long way from the typical, run of the mill, chain food restaurant. The restaurant is beautifully decorated, well lit and excellent for a private event, a date or a nice night out with friends or family. The exposed brick is breathtaking.We were seated right away. The waiter was very friendly and took special care to provide the most excellent service we have had in years.y husband and I agreed that of all the places we have tried in our four years of marriage, he was one of the two waiters that provided the most excellent customer service. Our busboy was also very friendly and between the both of them, our drinks were never empty and our plates were promptly provided. We ordered the calamari, which our waiter recommended we have with a spicy sauce..delicious. The kitchen worked hard to get our meal out fast, so fast in fact that it was pipping  hot when we received it. You can tell it was not just sitting around waiting on someone to notice it was ready like at most restaurants. The shrimp melrose was fragrant, creamy and perfectly cooked. A little in the more oily side with the pesto but I loved it! The spaghetti with meatballs my daughter ordered were delicious and my husbands fettuccine alfredo was so creamy and tasty! I highly recommend this place. All in all, with our appetizer, three meals, a few drinks and a to die for cheesecake, we spent about $100.00 not bad for a three course meal for three. We will certainly be back.
Great dinners, excellent waiter, very poor bartender. Bartender took a very long time taking our orders didn't seem to care

We ate here with my son and granddaughter back in early July.  The fruiti de mare was sooooo good that I told my wife that I wanted to have it for our 48th wedding anniversary!  Hopefully they will have an opening this Thursday afternoon so we can come back and 
I can have this dish to celebrate our anniversary!

The dining area to the left of the entrance is super noisy. I wish that I had requested seating to the right (bar area), which seemed less utilized and therefore tolerable. This was my only complaint.

I made reservations for 4 at 9pm on a Monday night. No problems with being seated when we got there despite the packed house. Our apps included calamari, Italian hot wings and a Caesar salad. The calamari was decent but the side sauce and regular marinara was raved about by my dinner mates. The wings smelled quite spicy but enjoyable. The Caesar salad was delicious.

Two people ordered the Crazy Alfredo (one without pork, allergy). The modification had a noticeable color difference to the sauce but otherwise both dishes were said to be amazing. One ordered the Branzino, and WOW it looked so delicious! The entire plate was cleaned, even the arugula side (impressive for a man who would prefer to only eat meat/fish). Another ordered the shrimp scampi. The shrimp was said to be great but the pasta was okay.

Overall a great meal! I would come here again. I'd only want to be placed in an area where I can hear my dinner mates without all the noise.

I haven't come here in a while but this was my favorite Italian spot when I was living in this area. They moved closer to the street but they're still in the same complex on Jones and Flamingo. The new restaurant is much nicer and more modern looking with more capacity as well. However, it seems they kept the same layout. There is still a bar on one side of the restaurant so you can sit and have a drink while wait for a table. They have some very fancy signature cocktails so make sure you check out their cocktail menu. The service and the food are still great just as I remember. The ambiance is classy and cozy. It is good for both date night and family dinner. I will come back more often and definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a good local Italian restaurant.

Stopped for dinner tonight, heard great things about Nora's, at best it was ok nothing to get excited about. Chicken was dry and ceaser salad was wilted. Would not run back to this place, service was ok, our busboy Marco was outstanding though

We came here for like 5 times before everything was awesome!. BUT las night we ate there 5 ppl and we ALL feeling sick and THROWING UP  all night long, we will probably go to UMC but you need to be carful from this place!!
Maybe it's time for the health department to check this place!

Highly suggested italian place to go to when asked among people on yelp and friends. So decided to try this one day when trying to decide what was for dinner. 

Located on the north side of flamingo, a little east of jones, came here on a Friday Night around 630 PM. The place was pretty full but luckily i guess we got there before the dinner rush so we got our table pretty quick. 

A LITTLE NOTE : uhh i think this place may have or rather should have some sort of dress code... i think we were the most underdressed table in the entire restaurant.. me and my friend were ok but my other friend had a bright blue t shirt.. lol uhh id suggest to dress a little nicer for this place... 

The restaurant is family owned. opened since 1991 starting with 12 seats ! quite expanded since then.. restaurant decorated with family pictures i believe which is nice. 

We were greeted by the server and got our drinks pretty quick. We had noticed that with a check in on yelp, you get a complimentary glass of wine :D 

After we ordered, it took a little while before the food came and we were starving.. they gave us some Garlic Bread which the first batch was free, but if u wanted more, i dont remember it being that expensive. It was yummy ! pretty much pieces you'd see if you split a loaf of french bread in half, baked it, and cut it into 1-2" pieces down the split loaf. it was slightly baked.. I LOVE GARLIC BREAD ! their's still had a soft center with the exterior crust still being crunchy but not hard no wont pierce the inside of your mouth. 

When the food came... its was piping HOT !! i had the alla nora myself. which was a baked spaghetti with eggplants, ground beef, pesto, tomato sauce and cheeses.
