When i "broke through" the top, oh man there was a lot of steam ! not complaining ! very good thing that i rarely experience ! all the ingredients were fresh and seasoned well. egg plants were slightly fried but not over fried so still quite juicy and moist but soft. tomato sauce was fresh and delicious. sweet, tangy but savory? 

My friends had the rigatoni special and the crazy alfredo. i didnt really get to try either of them but im pretty sure you'd find a nice review on here somewhere. I tasted the veggies of the rigatoni special. Very fresh and sweet. Not overcooked so they still had a nice bite to it. The crazy alfredo looked delicious. Packed with various ingredients all with a creamy alfredo sauce ! i wanna get that next time ! 

But all in all.. great place.. highly suggested. reservations are available if needed. would suggest to all who ask and take more here :D

Noras was amazing! From the drinks at the bar to apps and dinner then dessert and after dinner drinks everything was amazing. We always love the anti pasta. My husband had the frutti DeMare and I had veal Parm. Both were absolutely amazing. Our service was outstanding. Our waiter, Sebastian, was awesome. We were celebrating our 10 year anniversary and he made sure it was extra special. He suggested their peanut buttercup after dinner drink and omg it was sooo good. If you haven't been to Nora's

I have been a Nora's customer for as long as they've been around. Finally was able to visit the new restaurant and have lunch with a girlfriend. Just a beautiful restaurant (Congratulations)! Great service... William was our server, he was so awesome! Besides the great service he gave us girls time to chit-chat and didn't rush us out we felt very comfortable taking our time hanging around drinking our wine at the table. The food was excellent as usual, I love that they offer the half portions! Highly recommend for a nice relaxing lunch to catch up with the girlfriends.

A very, very good Italian restaurant with excellent service.

We started with a mozzarella caprese salad.  The mozzarella and tomatoes were fresh.  I had a frutti di mare which had an ample amount of sea food and a rich thick sauce.  My wife had a custom made pasta dish, also excellent.

The service was excellent and the prices quite good for Las Vegas.

Upscale classy Italian restaurant setting. Brought my lady on a date and we were blown away with the first impression. 100000x better than Olive Garden that's forsure lol. If you want amazing fine dining service with one of the best Italian dishes you'll ever taste, you gotta check this place out. Make sure to bring your date here. ;)
Great food!  Ask for penne arrabiata- it is the best sauce you will ever have!  I get it with a Nora's salad.

The best combo of food, service, and ambiance in Las Vegas.  Everything is good here and don't miss the specialty cocktails.  Great place for a great meal with family, friends, or business associates.

First time here for us ~ and most likely we won't be returning~As its a bit of a drive for us and we just didn't enjoy the food that much.
   It's a nice, diverse Italian menu and none of the 4 of us ordered the specials so that could have been the issue. The Arranchinis were pretty good but I couldn't recommend Nora's based on our experience
    They are in the process of building a large new restaurant about 2 blocks away so we obviously have missed something ~ the 2 stars were for the cocktail which were quite good and our server was knowledgeable & pleasant.

This place is not at all what you expect. Found this place on Yelp when arriving to where my gps is telling me where it is we drove by the restaurant three times not even knowing it because of the poorly lit sign we ended up calling to see where it was to found out we were parked right in front of it not even knowing. I expected to get some good home cooked Italian food... WRONG. If you can mess up the simplest dish like lasagna how can you really call your self an Italian restaurant. The service was incredibly slow seeing that they weren't even busy. We had to ask two different servers for our check because our waiter was no where to be found. Save your self the headache don't go to this place there's many many more Italian restaurants in Las Vegas that will live up to your expectations.

We came to find Nora's Cuisine through Yelp and the excellent reviews.  While the strip shopping center location is so-so, you forget about it once you're inside.  This place reminds you of your favorite local spot - a great diversion from the strip.  It's well decorated and the right side of the restaurant has an impressive bar and even live music.   

Service was very efficient.  Everything was great, from ordering, getting our food, checking on us to having left overs boxed up.  

The food is wonderful.  During two separate visits, we've tried the Veal Chop Parmesan, Shrimp Scampi, Rigatoni Gorgonzola with Chicken and Baked Rigatoni - all portions were large and every dish was outstanding. The only small nit was that while the Shrimp were tasty and perfectly cooked, the sauce seemed to be missing something.  

We will definitely return the next time we visit Las Vegas.

My favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas. Have worked through most of pasta dishes on the menu but my clear favorite is the fettuccine carbonara. Generous portions. The Caesar salad is terrific. Come hungry. In fact, for many couples, splitting a Caesar and an order if pasta would be enough.
Nora always impresses me !   Wish the place is located somewhere with better parking.Their food is always great and priced right.

The pastas are great and friendly service. This last visit though I got the salmon piccata. It was drenched on oil and so salty. Barely any lemon flavor it was just so oily and salty I couldn't finish it there was literally half a cup of oil at the bottom of it. I'll stick to their pastas from no

Went there on the advice from a waitriss and was very pleased, found out you should have a reservation though, but we got in no problem. special was a little high priced but well worth the money. This place is still cheeper than a buffet on the strip.

a little slice of heaven in a not- so-great location....but don't let that stop you from enjoying the friendly service and great food - everything we had was wonderful, especially the service - the rice balls were divine as was the chicken with artichokes and linguine with clams....don't miss the cannoli's for dessert......and a bargain to boot!

I'm a fan.  Love this place because it was off the strip and an old school Italian restaurant.  Did not care for the garlic bread.  It wasn't warm and tasted alittle stale to me.  We ordered a large antipasto salad which was amazing.  My husband got a huge plate of raviolis, large bowl of spaghetti and we shared a pizza.  They were all delicious.  Service was great and the prices were affordable.   We'll be back the next time we're in Las Vegas.

Mmmm what Italian food dreams are made of. Delicious no matter what I order, I personally love the eggplant parm, the caprese, the garlic bread is amaze, the chicken piccata and the veal Milanese. Good service and vey good food.

I have been Dining @ Nora's since the 90's ( Nora & Geno were there daily ) . I just devoured another Excellent Pizza ! Hand tossed with Pepperoni & Sausage ..mmmmmm  Doesn't get any better. I usually take it to go.

If you are planning on Dining there, I would recommend Resevations ! especially Dinner. The Lasagna and other Pasta Dishes are Delicious. Not to mention the Fresh Hot Garlic Bread.
Getting Hungry ??? Give this Hole in the Wall, Diamond in the Rough Italian Restaurant a shot, You will Not regret it.

I've been to Nora's years ago and it was ok, but my dining experience last night was perhaps the worst restaurant experience I've had in a LONG time. 

Quick note about the ambiance. This location has WAAAAY too many tables crammed in. It's not intimate at all. It was loud and crowded. I had to shout to speak across the small table. This was an immediate turn off to me. They've clearly packed in as many tables as possible to maximize the number of guests that they can seat, however, the sacrifice is poor service and poor atmosphere.

Yesterday was my wife's birthday and we made reservations at 6:30pm. Her parents and her arrived at the restaurant on time and I arrived about 25 minutes later. They had already placed their order and there were some appetizers on the table when I got there. I have to say that the salad dressing had way too much vinegar in it for my taste. The calamari was good. The waiter came by to take my order. I ordered the rib-eye steak medium-well and substituted the fries for veggies. Nearly an hour later my steak comes out burnt to a crisp. I took one bite and flagged the waiter down to tell him that it was not edible. He takes it back and tells me that that's how they make a medium-well steak. I told him.."ok..make it medium-rare because I don't want a burnt piece of meat." I wait another 30 minutes for a new steak to come out. This replacement was much better but still burnt around the edges. It was odd to me because it had even thickness all around but the outside ring was way more done (brown) than the center (bleeding). I'm thinking perhaps this was frozen and not properly thawed prior to being cooked. So I ate the $30 steak and was not very impressed because it had almost no taste and I was not offered any sauce to compliment it. Also, the "veggies" that I got were literally a small cup with some poor excuse for broccoli, sauteed tomatoes, and mushrooms. At this point my wife and her parents have been done with their food and it's already in boxes. They ordered a couple of pasta dishes and they seemed pleased with the food but did not rave about it. We decide to get a couple desserts (canolli and cheesecake) and a couple of cappuccinos. The cappuccinos came out in about 5 minutes alone. We didn't want them to get cold, so we drank them. The cappuccinos were actually VERY good. I'm sure they have a fancy espresso machine in the back. Then about 15 minutes later the desserts came out. While they tasted good, it would've been a much better experience if I would've gotten my cappuccino with my dessert. Overall I was EXTREMELY disappointed with entire dining experience. My family and I will be avoiding Nora's in the future as a result of this experience. In Las Vegas there is so much competition for Italian food and this experience really turned me off to this place.

Edited to add that I would've liked it if the manager on duty would've stopped by to ask about our service because I would've given them an earful. My wife was against me going to find the manager myself to give feedback because it was her birthday dinner and she just wanted to leave.

Wish I could've said one good thing but the truth is the truth this place sucks even from their other location. It's just so unpleasant the food isn't what it looks like yet alone authentic servers are nice but when you ask for a wine bucket for sparkling  water they act like it's all good and ignore you ; finally when they bring it after being disconnected with the meal it's a full watered down sparkling water melted ice they wanted to put the bucket on the floor!!!
My father in Law loves his baked ziti but what does a  86yr old poppa know. Sloppy food over drowned sauces . Generic garlic toast bread hotdog rolls . Not original good Italian bread at all WE'll STICK WITH CAFE MASTRONI's

Great food, very good service and friendly atmosphere. The prices are more than fair.  The bread is amazing as is the spicy seafood pasta. My husband loved the linguine with calm and it was delicious. Definitely give it a try.

I m pretty confident I have been to a lot of good Italian restaurants in the past and I m so glad I found this one in Vegas. I will give 4.5 stars but well I can't. Tho it's a very nice atmosphere for dining with friends family or couples! Good service wonderful food I will say. Really love the lemon calms, almost the best I ever had, also pasta are yummy!! Only one thing is I don't think I really enjoy the entree of Italian restaurant, not only this one but most of the Italian I have been to... seems they just not really know how to cook steak... anyway definitely a to go place for me when I m craving Italian food. Make sure u make reservation as they are always packed.
Nora's is one of my favorite local spots of Italian. It's always crowded at night so I recommend making a reservation. Their food is so delicious and anything with ricotta cheese is my favorite!

We actually had Nora's catered for our holiday party - so my review is strictly based on the food as I cannot speak on the atmosphere and service of the restaurant. The food was pretty good though, so I'm sure I will be updating my review at some point in the future to comment on the actual restaurant!

The food that we had catered was the Chicken Parmesan, Meatballs, Fettuccine Alfredo and Penne with Marinara. 

The chicken Parmesan were smaller than I have typically had, but still delicious. I think it's because I am used to restaurants pounding the chicken flat and Nora's seemed to just cook the chicken breasts as they are. No big deal though as they were still flavorful. 

The meatballs were average sized and also had a good flavor to them - lots of red sauce, yum! 

The fettuccine Alfredo was great! The sauce was not to thick nor too runny - perfectly creamy and flavorful! The penne seemed a little dry to me for some reason though. 

Overall I really enjoyed the food and am looking forward to stopping in for dinner one night!

Never had a less than experience at Nora's.  The food is always yummy and consistent. We enjoy going on a Friday or Saturday about 9pm. Sit in the bar and they always have live entertainment. Intimate and enjoyable.

I have been here many times. Always consider it as treating myself when ever I come here.  Have no complaints.  Sometimes I come back the very next day.  Don't bother ordering the steak.  Isn't worth it.  But everything else is amazing.

22 years ago my favorite Italian Reataraunt closed. Since then i have never found a place that used quality ingrediants, with recipes cooking techniques that were worthy of my effection. Today, i found Noras..she holds crown.

Good food, great cocktails, ok service, don't go on a holiday. 

We made reservation and took our mom to Nora's on mother's day. While we may come back in the future it will definitely not be on a holiday. They definitely added tables and overwhelmed the staff trying to get every penny out of the holiday they could. We touched elbows with the tables next to us and basically shared conversations. It also took 45 min for someone to bring water and ask us if we wanted drinks. 


Food was good but not amazing. The desserts must have been made the day before to handle the holiday as they didn't taste fresh.  

I think the only reason I would go back is because of their passion fruit mint julep. I tip my hat to their mixologist for making this Divine cocktail.

To start off we ordered the arancini and the pomordoro bruschetta and it was absolutely amazing the bruschetta was deliciously seasoned, nice and fresh, on a lightly toasted but soft Italian bread, highly recommend it! The arancini was absolutely to die for! Down to the basil it was served with, bellissimo! That alone got my five stars! Lol then we went on and order the baked rigatoni and the spinach and farro salad, OMG THE RICOTTA , on top of the rigatoni was the best! So creamy and fulfilling. the salad a nice balance of bitter salty and acidic favors . I was disappointed only at the fact I got so full cause I really wanted to try their canolis lol delish delish delish is all I can say!

Nora's is my New spot for Italian in Vegas .been hearing about it for a while. went last week , nothing but good things , Excellent Food , outstanding service , and very reasonably  priced. Had the lasagna, Excellent , bur friends Had the Baked Ziti and It looked unreal. can't wait to try it  .

You are so beautiful to me. Can't you see? You're everything I hoped for, you're everything I need. You are so beautiful TO ME! I'm pretty sure this song was written about pasta. I mean how could it not be? 

SO this is a Las Vegas gem! It's in a super random location but it's worth the drive anywhere you live. The inside of the restaurant is clean (although the bathroom sinks are kind of awkward - like they tried to be high tech but it didn't work really well...it's a sink/hand dryer combo) and they have a wall wine (so obvi I'm already a fan). Okay enough about the inside, time for the food.

We ordered: pomodoro bruschetta, crazy pasta, and frutti di mare (subbed with arriabiata (sp?) sauce). Everything was so delightfully delicious! The seafood in the frutti was perfectly cooked and the combination of all the flavors in the crazy pasta worked oddly well (I only had a bite of the crazy pasta but my mind went crazy - I'll have to order it next time). 

The service was great! And big points to Nora's for having my favorite beer (Hitachino white ale)!

How did this place get a 4 star rating? The food is mediocre at best. The tomato sauce is lame. The eggplant parm had a bitter after taste from the skin that was left on. It was smothered in poor quality cheese that stuck together and binded itself to the food in a very unappetizing manner. The spaghetti it came with was nothing special. The house salad I could have made better at home and the dressing was not memorable. The garlic bread was overcooked as was the pizza ordered by someone else at my table. The crust was burnt and they still served it?! What the heck? Did not even want to try the dessert. Came on a recommendation and left knowing I would never rely on the person who had recommended it for restaurant selection in the future. Wasted my last meal in Vegas here! Darn.

My husband had the pork tenderloin and was disappointed that it was overcooked and sliced with the grain, the combination making it less than tender.  The accompanying baked tomato and grilled potatoes were very good, but there was an overwhelming amount of arugula piled in the center of the plate. I had the veal parmesan, and it was burnt along the edges.  When we told the waiter what we thought, he didn't even offer us a  free cup of coffee as compensation.   We've been to Nora's many times and I'm worried they've gotten too big for themselves.
The best italian restaurant in town. My favorite angel hair with meat sauce. Great service.

Good italian resto the restaurant is nicely and more of an upscale style bistro. The food is good, comparable to other good italian restaurant doesnt really have the extra oomph where i can say that they are better  than other italian resto's in the valley.

Frutti di Mare and Shrimp Scampi main courses were excellent. Very well done.

Service was friendly and attentive.

If I could critique Nora's on any one thing, it would be "charm." That *something* was missing. What happens at a lot of Italian restaurants is that after a certain period of time, the family goes new school. They're no longer hands on, yet want to portray the image that the grandkids are running around the restaurant and grandma's making meatballs. That's likely what happened here. The restaurant was only Italian in the food, but overall vibe was not that.

Great food. Great service. If anyone at Nora's who's been there for a while reads this, they'll know what I mean by "charm" and "something."

You cannot go wrong at Nora's 
The Bread, the Ziti, the wine, the music!!!!!! 
If you've ever opted out because of the undesirable strip mall location. Please think again!!!! Once you walk in you will be a fan for life! The food, service and quality are all wonderful. This place gets even more fun if go on a Friday or Saturday evening, catch the live music and hang out at the bar. A favorite of mine since the first time a friend took me!!!

We came across this wonderful restaurant while visiting Vegas. The food was excellent and value for money. The staff are very friendly and professional, this is truly a hidden gem.
We had the pizza and pasta dishes which were outstanding, make sure you leave room for dessert as the cheesecake and cannoli are the best ever. If you live in Vegas or just visiting make sure you eat at Nora's.

I have been looking at this place on yelp and had it bookmarked for so long. I finally went and it was amazing.The new location is so nice and elegant. The server was very knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive. she offered different wines to taste, which was helpful when selecting a wine to go with dinner. the Salad was super crisp and fresh. The entree was phenomenal. I will definitely be coming here again.
Amazing food and service! Our waiter Sebastiano was on top of it! Can't wait to be back and bring family!

My wife and I went to Nora's because her sons were regulars there.  We were suppose to meet them there as they were treating us to dinner.  We got there before my step son's did and tried to tell Nora's we were in their party but was greeted with disdain.  They mistreated us so poorly we almost walked out.  

Soon my step son's arrived.  When Nora's saw who they were, they changed their tune.  All of a sudden, we were okay.  That didn't sit well with me.  I can't tell you if the food was good because my appetite was ruined.

Note to Nora's.  Since that happened, we have never been back and that was about ten years ago.  You should have treated us with respect like your regulars because we could have been new regulars.  Now you lost a potential regular and your old regular.

The food is delicious and the atmosphere is lovely.  Every dish was great but the Eggplant Parm was my favorite.  The wine cellar is impressive.  The staff did not rush our party even though we stayed beyond their closing time.  A great night out

Went with a friend and we weren't disappointed! New digs and it is gorgeous! Food, service and ambience were great. It was very busy on a Sunday night but the waiter we had was very attentive. Outdoor and indoor seating available. We started with the antipasto salad, calamari and arancini for appetizers and did family style for the main dishes so we could taste a little of everything. We shared the wild boar parpadelle, crazy alfredo & pork tenderloin. Crazy Alfredo had a zip to it which we liked and not too creamy. Tons of leftovers but there were only three in our party. We would definitely recommend to friends and come back here next time we are in Vegas!

I came here from a recommendation from my boyfriend as we both travel a lot for work. I read the reviews and saw many people rave about the vodka sauce. I am a huge fan of vodka sauce as it may be my favorite or close behind meat sauce. I have tried several Italian places in Las Vegas, and none of them have very good vodka sauce. 

I enjoyed the gnocchi with vodka sauce and it was amazing. I think it was one of my favorite vodka sauces I have had. They give you fresh garlic bread which was used to soak up every last bit of the sauce. It was that good. The gnocchi were perfectly cooked.

Nora's is really busy, even at 8 pm on a Monday night. I sat at the bar and the service was great.

I was 100% dissatisfied with this establishment. My girlfriend and I went there tonight looking for good food, comfortable surroundings  and soft Italian music so I could woo my girl. Didn't happen. This entire eatery is all hard surfaced, causing major echoes. The tables are crammed. It is more like a cheep buffet,than an Italian restaurant. Food was good. The music was turned up over the noise, than the noise powered out the music. Not a good night. The old place was better. I willing find a different Italian place to do my wooing.
This place is delicious. A little far from the strip but worth the drive. I recommend Penne a la vodka, baked rigatoni and their cannoli for desert!

Great Food! I have never been disappointed in the food or the wait staff. Hopefully Nora's will pay more attention to their hostesses. They really shoulg get them uniforms and teach them how to be more polite and empathetic. It seems like these girls know they can say anything they want and get away with it.
Amazing food at great prices. This is a little hidden gem here in las vegas. A great place for a first date or as a weekly hangout!... 5 Stars!

Love the ambience, the food not so much.

The food "looks" great but...

If nothing, it's nice that we have a lot of Italian options - after all, we need a lot more average restaurants to make the bell curve.

They might have had a better chance if they knew what al dente means, but I get it, it's all United States thing...

Looking for phenomenal home style Italian food? This is a great place to go in Las Vegas. My favorite is the linguine and clams in white sauce. My husband stands by the broccoli penne. Don't forget to save room for a homemade cannoli!
Love this place!! The food is delicious and the service is excellent. Truly a jem! Loved the menu selection and the alfredo is a must! cooked to perfection and absolutely delicious!

I had lunch today at  Nora's.  It's been on my foodie list for two years.  While Italian food isn't my most favorite cuisine, I do like it.  Now?  Nora's has made me love it.  And if I have anything less in taste than what I had today, I will feel sorely cheated.

For lunch, the menu is quite extensive.  I settled on the individual Nora's salad. Field greens with roasted green and red peppers in a lovely and light balsamic vinaigrette.  I also ordered the appetizer of Arancini.  These are four crisply fried balls of deliciousness.  Inside is saffron risotto, peas and mozzarella.  The base was a tasty and authentic tomato sauce that was definitely not Ragu-esque.  I wish my stomach had more room because I definitely wanted to try another dish.  

I will definitely keep Nora's on my Vegas foodie rotation.

Just had a wonderful dinner at Nora's. This place is always busy and for good reason the food is good and the prices are reasonable. The atmosphere was great in the bar and the dining area. Our server could have been a little more attentive to OUR needs  rather than huddling with two other servers by the cash register but all in all a very pleasurable experience.
Love the atmosphere. The chicken alfredo is by far the greatest in town! AMAZING!

Have to downgrade this after an over-salted meal with my family. The garlic bread was especially funky and everything just seemed to taste off--a sign of staleness I believe. So this spot is 1 for 2 which is enough for me to try some other Italian places in town.

Antipasto is the best that I have ever had. I would return just for this.

Ribeye steak had a good flavor, but tough and chewy. Sad, because it wasn't cheap.
I've been coming here since I moved here in Las Vegas. 12 yrs. now. Every time I come the quality of the food have been excellent. I would recommend the ala Nora!!  Best Italian in town!

Great food , great atmosphere , service was also very professional .... Bartender Rudy  did a great job mixing cocktails n interacting with guest....
Arancine was tasty , farro salad needs a lil bite more to work on it , linguini with clams good .. 
I will totally coming back to try something different ..!!

It's hit or miss. Been here 10 times 8 out of the 10 it was excellent. Service was good, food was great. I guess it just depends on who you get. I'll keep coming back hoping that the two times I went and got bad service was a fluke. Try the crazy Alfredo!
Very pleasant staff, Nina was wonderful and fun. She made the place very enjoyable, and the food was great.

New Location , same great service and solid Italian food at reasonable prices. The new place has a great vibe and atmosphere with an open kitchen and a great bar. It get's very crowded early and seems always busy.
The food was amazing as always! We had an amazing dinner and service was just as great!! I only gave 4 stars because the table busers were awful and had attitudes

Just want to say one thing in the middle of earring the dinner we saw a cockroach next to are feet after we eat are food we showed the manger the picture and we show the waitress the moving cockroach we  talk to him and he was so rude to us about it he said well he can come from people that walk in or from the outside we told him yes but what do you mean you don't take responsibility for your resturant he said to us good night and the Coffe is on the house lol

First time diner. I & wife had baked zitti. good taste, nice and hot. small portion imho. cuz had spagetti/meatballs, looked good and he said it was fine. his wife had the tortellini and she liked it too. i feel the portion size was what turned me off, maybe i expected to much. for a monday it was very busy and seems very popular. service was ok, nothing exceptional. overall ok, but when in L.V. i won't make a special trip to return.

I really hope that the hype behind this place is that it once was much better and people are latching on to the nostalgia. This was one of the most mediocre restaurants I have visited. 
We made reservations for 8:45pm on a Saturday night and the place was packed. It is located in a small strip mall and would be easy to miss. We were promptly seated and that is when everything started to go downhill. It took ~15 minutes to even get acknowledged and place our drink order. Their gnocchi and pasta are not made in house. I am not sure what would compel someone to pay $12 for gnocchi out of a package when I can get delicious gnocchi from Trader Joe's and toss in some pancetta for $5. I opted for their Frutti di Mare ($21) which was linguini in runny arrabiata sauce with an assortment of seafood. The husband had their carbonara which ranks among the worst I have ever had in the states. I am not even comparing this to Italy standards. While two of the three members of the party were still eating, one of the people's plates got taken away to be boxed up. Awkward. The server ignored our table pretty much most of the time and then rushed us out at the end. I would not come back nor recommend this place. It is all hype.

I can't speak highly enough about this restaurant. I've been here a handful of times and thoroughly enjoy myself every time. The food is amazing, the service is perfectly acceptable (especially considering they're usually packed!) and they have an excellent selection of food and drinks.

My favorite entree is the Frutti de Mare, but you honestly can't go wrong with menu selection. The Osso Bucco is phenomenal as well, although they only have it during the winter. For drinks, the cappuccino martini is wonderful, as is the sangria. 

I love Nora's, it's absolutely a favorite.

You have many choices while in Las Vegas, so driving away from the strip is probably not the first thing you might consider...however the drive to Nora's is worth it.  We've tried several items on the menu and it's all good!!  Ask to sit in Matthew's section for excellent service. Enjoy!!
The food, the wine, and service are always amazing! This is definitely my go to Italian spot.
The crazy Alfredo is really bomb!! If u really like garlic the garlic bread is pretty tasty too.

I definitely liked the Ambience of the old Nora's much better. We asked if we could dim the lights considering it felt like we were in a baseball Stadium but guess they couldn't figure it out. The food was good but they definitely changed the way they cooked the ribeye on the menu. The old pan seared ribeye 1000 times better! Are server was really good ill definitely give it another chance after the tweaks are worked out. Don't fix stuff that wasn't broken 


Ps. Management fighting right next to our table by the kitchen with his co-worker saying he's going to fight you outside is what gave you three stars

First time at this place, and it is so close to one of the offices im sure I will show up again. We will start from dessert (the end) and work our way forward. The cannoli they make there is very tasty, so much I would be happy just coming into this joint for cannoli and coffee. 

I came during lunch so I took advantage of the lunch menu, and although when the dishes came out things looked small, they were far from it. It reminded me of strega nona and her endless pot of noodles. I ordered the spaghetti and meatball (1) for 5.99 and was truly satisfied.

The bread is tasty they bring out, nice and garlicky and full of butter. The server for our table was the bartender, she was very attentive and took care of us well. 

The other people in the party ordered veal parm and baked ziti, everyone was happy. :)

I love Nora's! The food is always good and service
Is great. The crazy alfredo is my favorite. My friend had the eggplant parmigiana and she loved it. Their Moscow mules are delish. I recommend to always make a reservation since they are always busy. Definitely my favorite Italian restaurant in town.

We had our rehearsal lunch here for our wedding and have been going back since. All the food we tried was good, staff was on top of things for a large party. Every time we have gone since, the smell of pizza gets us every time. Love the white pizza, garlic pizza. Was a little bit disappointed by the halibut. It was good but I thought for the price it should come with some pasta or mashed potato, not just the fish and spinach. Otherwise, the Italian food we have had here we enjoyed and the prices are fair.
so good we went 2x. Highly recommend it if you're in Vegas for a great italian meal at reaonable prices

The hostess in the front got us seated in 30 minutes like promised no reservations. They allow reversations- highly recommended! Very busy! Patio was really comfortable in 105 degree weather. I had the crazy seafood alfredo with sausage,  spicy lost the taste of alfredo, lasagna was hot and cheesy, steamed clam a bit too buttery could not taste the wine. Ambience is rustic modern Italian can both be romantic and family friendly. Priced right for the food and service. Don was on point. Sangria potent and delicious. Can't wait to try dessert!
Favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas. Chicken Marsala, aranchini, and clams linguini with spicy red sauce are staples.

Just all right, but maybe I ordered wrong. Called to make a takeout order and girl says it will take about 35 minutes. Im driving in traffic and get there late in 45 minutes and still had to wait 15 minutes. It wasnt even that busy, but having to wait over an hour for a take out order is pretty ridiculous. The arincini was great, but the crazy fettucini was disappointing especially since everyone says its so good. The portion was huge- enough for 2-3 people, but sauce was watery and mostly filled with sausage. I only got 3 pieces of shrimp and some chicken. I love Italian food so maybe I will come back and get something better.

Nora's is a traditional locals' favorite. I just went to the new location and I had a great dinner.  All the food was on point and the drinks were good as well. I ordered the grilled branzino and it was amazing. My husband ordered the ribeye steak and it was perfectly cooked and great taste. On top of great food, they had live entertainment which made the atmosphere amazing, just perfect to want to stay and hang out. Love this place!

went to the new location after going to there old hole in the wall spot many times in the past.  good ambiance and same tasting food was my experience.  price seemed about the same as well.  this has been my go to spot for italian/pasta and will continue to go here as their food is fresh.   only reason for 4 star is their service.  its been inconsistent in my visits starting with the host up front then servers.  most servers have been ok but with the new location and a new look, i hope they focus more towards the experience of customers to match their excellent food.   seafood linguine is to die for!  their mussell appetizer with their garlic bread is another killer combo.  my toddler loved the cheese ravioli

Great classic Italian cuisine!

I used to work around the corner from this place and ordered out all the time because they had amazing spaghetti and a great lunch special and after a few years I ended up back here for a lunch meeting. Nothing has changed. The food was just as good as it always had been and the service is also always great.

The one negative for me is the ambiance. It's a very plain looking place and there's not much to it. Once again this is a place I would love to makeover. The food is always key for me and service is next so I still highly recommend this place for classic Italian dishes. Some of my favorite items are the antipasto, chicken Milanese and spaghetti with meatballs.

The manager reached out to me about my previous comment, which is very pleasing. Assured me it was an isolated incident so I returned with friends from out of town. The Crazy Alfredo was bomb! I missed that so much. Our experience was 5 star! Food like always was perfect, service as well. Manager appreciated me coming back and showed us, by taking care of our appetizers and first round. This just shows you that when an A+ establishment get a bad review and reach out to you, it speaks much louder. He completely restored my faith in Nora's and I will be returning soon!

This is my favorite restaurant when we go to Vegas with my family.. Love the atmosphere the friendly servers and the tasty and delicious plates..My kids love it as well.I can say we have tried Calamari, fruchetta, Cesar salad, soups, pastas, pizzas and deserts. They also have a variety selection on  wines. I really recommend this place is not to long of a drive  from the vegas strip. You would not regret. : D

After exposing my tastebuds to the disaster of Roma Grill, I had to reset with some more Italian.  A local had suggested Nora's so i gave it a try.  Great choice!  I was there on a Saturday night and the place was packed.  I was in town on business, so decided to eat at the bar.  Met a lot of nice local people who had been going there for years.  The bartender was friendly and I sampled a couple of different wines from their excellent list.  There were many good choices on the menu but I settled on the pasta Alla Nora, which was excellent.  I would have tried the meatballs but they make theirs with beef and pork and I prefer the beef and veal recipe.  The salad was excellent and they accommodated me with a side of broccoli.  I can't wait to go back to try the pizza, which I understand is excellent.   Nora's has a great family restaurant atmosphere, the staff is pleasant and the decor is comfortable.  I will be back!

Always delicious and the service was excellent. Try the Melrose pasta; linguine with a creamy pesto, sun dried tomatoes, zucchini and pine nuts. You can add chicken or shrimp too. They have a gluten free option on the pasta but only in penne.

Nora's is one of those places that is consistently good but somehow never on my radar unless I'm driving by- usually right after eating somewhere else. Luckily, a coworker insisted on dinner here so I finally got a chance to visit since their relocation, which puts their great food and attentive service (especially from Don!) in a suitably beautiful setting.

Started with a round of house salads, fresh with a great house dressing, plus their house garlic bread I raved about on my initial visit (spoiler alert: it's still amazing!). Tried the decadent carbonara, which I'll definitely be back for, but ultimately opted for my old standby, the Alla Nora (baked spaghetti topped with eggplant, meat sauce, and pesto) and was not disappointed. Kicked it up with a third course of chicken marsala and lamb shank, which was a huge, beautiful portion, perfectly cooked.  Might as well go big and have dessert after all that; the panna cotta topped with fresh berries was just sweet enough. I have no idea what witchcraft keeps me from thinking of Nora's when I want old-school carbs, but I'll be making a concentrated effort to visit more often.

NOTE: They seem even busier since moving, if that's even possible, and by 6PM on a weeknight there was a serious wait list. Reservations recommended, or snag a spot at the bar!
Best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas! Eggplant Parmesan is great! Spinach pizza is awesome! Beautiful new location will be back for sure.

We went to Nora's last night because it was recommended to us.  We were SO disappointed!!  The food was nothing special - I had the Frutes di Mar & my husband had the shrimp scampi.  Neither was what we expected and neither was very good.  The service was also awful.  Our glasses went empty for a good 10 minutes and we were not there when the restaurant was full.  We won't be going back.
Too long  of a wait food did not worth the wait , Veal was too dry on top of  dry spaghetti  noodles .

This is by far my favorite Italian restaurant in town. I love that they are family owned. The service is always exceptional and their prices are very reasonable. Their baked rigatoni and white spinach pizza are the best I've ever had, anywhere. I've eaten at many of the overpriced Italian places on the Strip and none even come close.

Very good old-school Vegas restaurant. Growing up, my family became very familiar with the staff, and they made specials for me, even long after they left the menu.

Great staff, AMAZING classic food, and lovely ambience. I agree about the garlic bread, and the lasagna is also a classic.
Nora's is great value however the service has been going down hill.

We waited for 45 minutes to get seated, so ended up just sitting and ordering at the bar. Given we did walk in around 7:15pm, dinner peak hours. The two hostesses were super sweet and friendly regardless of some of the rude guests. The food is always so delicious and worth the wait! We love to order the linguini with clams and calamari. The garlic bread basket is so tasty as well. One of our all time favorites to eat at for Italian food.
We were introduced to this place by a business friend and now we take business friends there when we're in town. We've never had anything bad here.

We went to Nora's on Friday because of all the wonderful reviews.

We had a reservation, but when we got there they made us wait until "they fixed the table".  After about 10 minutes we were led to a table.  We saw there were 5 other tables in the section already set and empty.  Our table we were led to didn't have all the silverware, where the others did.  

After being seated, we saw a group of three arrive, with an elderly woman who was using a walker.  They were made to sit in the lobby for about a half hour, until the people at the table next to us left, and that table was cleaned off.  That was with the 5 tables still empty.

We ordered, and I ordered the "Crazy Alfredo".  It was described to be loaded with jumbo shrimp, chicken and sausage.  It showed up with two shrimp, two pieces of chicken, and some sausage.  It had a tasteless alfredo sauce on it, that was just warm starch.

My wife had Chicken Marsala, which I tried a bite of, and found it to be much too sweet.

Our waitress came by to take our order, and that was the last we saw of her.  Someone else brought out the garlic bread, (which was just ok), and the meals.  She did come to bring us the check and we decided to pay in cash rather than wait for the seasons to pass, and her to return to pick up and deliver a credit card.

I met a friend, a Vegas local, at Nora's per her suggestion. It's very close to the Gold Coast where I usually stay (I'm a bingo addict) and away from all the Strip madness. The atmosphere is still great even if the neighborhood isn't all that nice. 

The food is pretty good. Not the most fantastic stuff I've ever had, but I've enjoyed every dish I've had there. It's definitely better than Fiamma in MGM and about half the price. Vodka penne has been my favorite so far. 

What really stands out are the cocktails. They have some interesting house cocktails on the menu that were really delicious. I have a decent knowledge of liquors thanks to my cocktail-enthusiast husband, but Nora's had a few things I've never heard of that were fun to try. I loved their Pimm's Cup --so refreshing during summer in the desert.

I just realized I've never had dessert here. Gotta go back on my next visit!

Always impressed by the superb food and eloquent service staff. Nice mix of authentic dishes with innovative touches. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great meal and memorable experience. Save room for dessert! Thanks again to all the staff for yet another great dinner and congratulations on the new location. I will be back!

Get the Crazy Alfredo. It was excellent!  My wife had the Melrose and it was just as good. Great service from Marla, thank you!

We'll be back for sure!

Good food at a reasonable price :) also when the restaurant starting getting busy, so did our waitress. We really didn't mind, but she came at the end and gave us tiramisu and apologized if we had felt forgotten! :):) it was really sweet.

In all the times we have visited Nora's we have never had a bad meal and we are Italian and no good food. Jo-Mar is a Great asset to the success of this restaurant because he Loves what he does. Always a gentleman when greeting you at the door or coming to say hi to us at the table and smiling away. I love the Frutti Di Mare and it is always a wonderful dish with plenty to take home. My wife love the Alfredo and a few others too. We got a Pizza appetizer one time and even that was a great pie. You will never get a bad meal here, believe me.

This was a dining experience.  The food was amazing, the ambience is old Vegas style.  The service was excellent and the portions were huge.  We were there for lunch and the restaurant was not too busy.  It seemed as if mostly locals ate there.  We are locals and have never dined here before.  They are opening at a new location soon and we're looking forward to dining there.  They are the real deal and the food is true authentic Italian.
The rigatoni is my favorite.  I've also had their pizza.  My spouse likes their eggplant.  They are consistently good. Customer service is excellent.

Visiting Las Vegas from New York City and I'm very DISAPPOINTED!!! While I was eating dinner with few friends we saw a cockroach walking next to our table, I obviously lost my appetite and couldn't finish my dinner. We asked to move outdoor because at that point we could no longer sit inside. We ask to speak to the manager "Joe" and explained to him the situation. His replied was "it can come from the kitchen, from people and anyone could bring this with him", I was shocked by his answer and was really offended to see a manger who isn't willing to take responsibility for it, I feel bad for the owners who pay someone to take care of their place and instead they ruined it. He gave us the coffee on the house. It was really embarrassing and the way he treated us was really rude. Would never recommend this place or step foot here ever again.

I have been going to Nora's since I was a child and I have always loved it. They never change. (which is great) We try to sneak in for lunch at least once a month when we are in town. They are always very busy so be patient. Perfection takes time. The staff is always freindly.

I just had a wonderful lunch.  My first time here and I got the $6.50 spaghetti lunch special (with meat sauce) and a Nora's salad.  The salad was ample, with lots and lots of roasted peppers marinated with garlic, just like I make at home, but rarely bother to do.  The pasta portion was fine for me, having started with a salad, but I would have been wishing for more if that was the only thing I had ordered.  The pasta was cooked perfectly, while the sauce was tomatoey goodness.  I soaked up every bit with the complimentary garlic bread.  The food came out quickly and the waiter kept my iced tea refilled.  I was surprised at  how nice the dining room was, with white tablecloths and big windows letting in the sunlight.  The quality of my experience was way above the price I paid.  I'm looking forward to returning with a friend and maybe sitting at the lovely bar.

I had the Penne pasta for my entrée and the Tiramisu for dessert. Everything about the restaurant was perfect. The service, the atmosphere and the food was superb and worth every penny. Cozy yet classy, professional, attentive wait staff, not having to wait forever for your food and never having to flag down anyone for a refill. Cost wise, it was about 110.00 for lunch for two people but it was worth the money as it was the best Italian restaurant I have been to in a long time. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who likes Italian food and is looking for a nice night or afternoon out.

Went last night with friends.  Our table of 6 was ready 15 minutes early, ambience is very nice with a jazz band performing live after 9 p.m.  Service was very good except for the fact that each couple was served at separately rather than get help to bring out everyone's course at the same time.

As to the food, the steak bruschetta is very good as an appetizer but the caesar salad was terrible.  Hardly any dressing and very little parmesan cheese with no fresh pepper as a topper.  My wife ordered a chicken alfredo with boiled chicken and small portions compared to the mound of noodles with little sauce.  Her chicken was not seasoned at all.  I ordered the veal marsala which had great portions but was way overseasoned to the point I was chugging water and the spaghetti was not that good.

Dessert was tiramisu which is good but a little sweet.  Pricing is certainly the best part, our dinner was $83 for the 2 of us which included wine and dessert.  Liked the free glass of wine at check-in but we left underwhelmed considering the number of restaurants here in Vegas.

Love Nora's! It's tucked away in a non-descript strip mall and doesn't look much from the outside. Once you step inside you're greeted with the enticing smell of roasted garlic and fresh baked pizza. 

The salads, pasta and dishes are all fantastic, you really can't go wrong. The fettucini carbonara satisfied my craving and I had plenty to take home. I highly recommend Nora's for a casual lunch or dinner out. It's family style and a bit noisy, but definitely will not disappoint! Buon Appetito!

Service was pretty bad, where my family and I had waited 15 minutes before getting any attention, and they weren't busy enough to warrant us being ignored. The food was good, but our actual server served us less than the other waiters around us, who were responsible for giving us our bread, water, and napkins. It was probably just our server, but at the same time, what kind of place allows a server to give such minimal service?

Went in with my friend at lunch time sat on the right side of the bar waited ten minutes for a server who was rude and quite obviously didn't want to be our server. Food was adequate at best. Spend your money somewhere else .
Great food and environment, went for my anniversary and me and my wife loved it. We were recommended from a friend.

Love the new location ! Although it is super noisy (I blame the floor) we had to wait till 845 for a reservation..which turned to almost 9., but I think it was so worth it! First the garlic bread came so promptly and our drinks too! We had the Nora's salad which was so good! I tried the veal parmigiana and my friend had the chicken parmigiana. So good! We were celebrating a birthday.. it was amazing- they gave  cannoli and some tiramisu. We had enough for leftovers and they even have a extra loaf of garlic bread to split !! Thanks again Nora's!

My spouse and I use to eat at the old Nora's and this is the first time at their new location. The old Nora's was a much smaller intimate establishment and this one is many times the size with the noise level to match. We made reservations and when we arrived we were seated immediately. As mentioned the noise at times can be deafening. The waitress was excellent and was very efficient. The other couple with us commented that their dishes like ours was excellent. Our friend mentioned to the waitress that her dish needed more pasta sauce which the waitress brought out. Why not 5 stars? When the bill arrived we were charged $4 for the "extra sauce"!  The bill with a tip for the four of us was $160 and they wanted $4 for extra sauce!  We protested and although it was taken off the bill it left a "bad taste" in a otherwise good dining experience.
Love this place! Get the linguine and clams. The garlic bread is delicious too.

We were craving Italian & wanted to try somewhere new so we jumped on Yelp to help us find a place & Nora's came up a couple times. It was Friday night around 5:30pm so I called to see I could a reservation on short notice bc we have a 1 year old and by 9 she's not very pleasant to be around. Lol. The next Res wasn't until 9:30 but for a party of 5 was about a 30 min wait right now. So we drove over & was told 30-45 min wait. As soon as you walk in the place smells amazing & you are greeted to an open kitchen right in front of you & the dining room to the left & bar to the right. It only took about 20 for our table to be ready. 

We ordered to Yelp recommendations, crazy Alfredo, shrimp scampi dinner, chicken Marsala & eggplant parm. The complimentary garlic bread is delicious & even their plain white bread is tasty (for the baby).

Everything was so good & the portions are huge. We had left overs for each dish. You can easily share one dish between two people. We will definitely be coming back but will know to make reservations.

This place was a breath of fresh air, and in Vegas, you can use all the fresh air you can get.  Imagine my surprise when after paying $20 for a burger and fries on the Strip (shame on you, Smash Burger), I treated myself to a first real veal parm dinner for $18.95 at Nora's. And it was pretty damn good, too.  The veal was cooked perfectly, and it came with a side of spaghetti, cooked al dente.  Perfect.  The sauce was not the best I ever had, but then again, I was not cooking it in the kitchen myself.  Making matters better, the basket of garlic bread was never allowed to run dry, nor was my iced tea.  The service was fantastic and pleasant.  Smiles all around.  

The short lesson here is that if you are willing to move a few miles off the strip, you end up in a different, and much better food universe.  I would go back to Nora's in a nanosecond.

Their on-line reservation system can create problems. We made reservations on-line and it was submitted and seems fine until we arrived and had no reservations. They explained that since that time wasn't available it automatically made the reservation for the following night??? They did fit us in. The place was busy but dinner took us 2 1/2 hours. They messed up the cocktails twice. When asked where they were, she went back to check and never came back. The manager (not sure since he didn't his position) came over to ask if there was anything we need and I explained how my cocktail never arrived and that I had asked our server about it. He said he'd check. I said that if it was up already to just cancel it since the wine that we ordered should be arriving soon. Never heard back but the wine arrived 15 minutes later. Unfortunately the food didn't. When it did it was good which is normal for Nora's. Then the computer system supposedly when down and our bill took another 20 minutes to get to us. Overall, not a good experience. As the events continued to spiral out of control, the server nor the night manager ever came over to keep us updated nor to just say sorry for the missteps. The front of the house doesn't seem to have a good handle on what's going on or maybe they don't value their customers dining experience???

Poor slow service, takes forever to get seated, to get water and bread..a disappointment
!

The bartenders do a great job of keeping one nice and toasted before other diners arrive. The garlic bread is good but i wouldnt call it the best i've ever had. That goes to Parma but i'm not here to compare places i'm here to review this one. So lets do it!

I was already pretty toasted by the time we sat and ordered the food. Free glass of Chianti with yelp check-in so we all cashed in on it. 

I ended up ordering the Crazy Alfredo because in my boozed up state i completely forgot about the Osso Buco they also serve.

Regardless the Crazy Alfredo is pretty damn amazing and damn crazy. It's got A LOT of things going on for one dish and A LOT of pasta for a decent price.

YUM! This place is great. Make sure you go to the new location and not the old. It was super busy on a Friday night, so I was glad I made a reservation! Super cute location with an awesome wine fridge against the front wall. I got the special, which was the pappardelle with wild boar...amazing. Cant wait to come back!

My husband and I went to Nora's back when it was a tiny hole in the wall, now they have moved and apparently they are just too good now to care about their customers.
 It makes me sad, but we are extremely disappointed with our experience and food last night. First, I remembered having soup back in the day and it was yummy, so my sweet husband called to see about placing a to-go order since I am with a cold. First without even hearing what we want, the girl on the phone says "It will be an hour & half for togo orders" WTF.... ok but we just want soup. Which she replied "ok anything else but that and I can't do it" umm ok at this point I told my husband just hang up but he is way nicer then me to put up with that. SO we order for pickup 3 soups, 2 bowls and 1 cup (small was for my son), he brings it home and much to our dismay all were exactly 4 oz. of soup!!!!! 4 oz!!!!!!!! Seriously !!!!! it was a tiny little cup and he was told "we don't do cups of soup anymore" OK but where is the soup if this is your "bowl" of soup!!!!! I don't want a shot of soup! 

In regards to the food, that was sad sad excuse for a shot of soup I've ever had!!!! 
I can make chopped up onion & celery here at home, add water, salt & a crap load of pasta noodles and call it soup!!!!!! 

Today I will make my own soup and enjoy!!! 
Hey Nora's want me to bring some over to show your cook what real soup looks like!!! (a real chef would never make soup like they did - hence cooks!) 

PASS PASS.

The parking lot is small. Our server seemed like she was only paying attention to half of the table, like she would walk away and we weren't finished talking to her. Horrible because we were there to celebrate a birthday. Based on experience I'd rate them a 3 because of the tiny salt and pepper shakers, I mean come on even Olive Garden has salt and pepper grinders on the table. Also their grated cheese is in those glass bottles that you would expect at a casual pizza place but not at a nice restaurant. They get a 4 because the food was good but I'm not in a hurry to go back.

Nora's was recommend by a friend and I will never doubt her recommendations again. This place is amazing food was superb, the drinks were top notch, the price point was way below what the food is worth. Hope that doesn't change when they move into their new digs. I will definitely be returning sooner than later.

Fantastic? Good size portions, even as a lunch entree. Nora's maintains high quality any day of the week.
A treat for sure.

Love this place! Every time we are in town we make sure to come to Nora's and escape the strip!!  Our favorite is the Crazy Alfredo, which is spiced with this Alfredo sauce with chicken, shrimp and sausage! Lasagna is ok but we've had better! Love the antipasto salad is the bomb, tons of pepperoni cheese, olives with a wonderful house dressing! For those of you who are gluten-free they have gluten-free penne pasta too!

Originally from NYC and living now in Henderson, I had a difficult time finding  "REAL ITALIAN FOOD"! Nora's reminds of back home where you have delicious Mom & Pop Italian restaurants. You can keep all the famous chef's trying to be Italian restaurants on the strip.
Nora's is the best you'll get in this town.

I could smell the wonderful aromas as I write this. YUM!

My wife and I had lunch at Nora's today
I ordered chicken Parm and my wife ordered steak with salad.
My chicken Parm was over cooked and the gravey tasted like it just came out of a can.
My wife ordered salad dressing on the side. The salad was served on the same plate with the steak and the dressing.
I only want to have small bite and a beer, lady said no, we close at 11... I show her the time on website, still no service....
My favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. I have been going here for over 12 years and still look forward to every trip. Great quality and affordable!

I've been going to Noras for years now, and when they announced they were moving to a new location down the street (last year) I was worried.   I've seen so many smaller restaurants ruined by "upsizing".  Unfortunately it happened at Noras too.   

First the new location, while beautiful was horribly designed from a noise perspective.  You literally cannot hear people across the table from you...when I leave I sigh in relief because the din of the dozens of conversations at once has ended.   

I mentioned this on my first dining at the new location to the manager... I work in the studio sound business and I recommended Paul Tan or Acoustic consultants.    I noticed this trip one wall has tapestries on it, but they need some Rockwool (Roxul) or sound soak behind them.   We're not talking a bunch of money here....a few thousand bucks for a noticeable reduction in noise.   Though if they really did it right, it could cost close to $25K for maximum reduction

Nora's, the noise IS hurting your business.   Once the newness of the new location is gone...people like me may not come as often.  

I love your food please call an acoustic consultant... you'll get 2 stars more from me if you do.

Nora's has been on my list of places to eat for years now. I finally got the chance last night for a birthday celebration! Walking in, it has an old Tuscan feel to it. It's dimly lit, bar is situated in the middle, and it gets pretty noisy. Our server was great! I think his name was Don. He kept our drinks and garlic breadsticks full! Speaking of the garlic breadsticks...omg they are the best thing ever. And they're complimentary! 

Onto the food!

Calamari: Yum! Fried and seasoned perfectly. It wasn't oily at all! I really enjoyed the sauce it came with. I'm not sure exactly what the sauce was but it tasted like a marinara and it was a nice change from the typical creamy, white sauce most other places give. 

Grilled octopus: I wished it had more of that char taste I was looking for. The texture itself was nice but it wasn't the most flavorful dish. I would probably skip next time. 

Lasagna: omg so. much. cheese! I did wish it had more meat sauce (l like saucy lasagnas). This is definitely not for someone who's lactose intolerant. But then again, who takes that seriously? Lol kidding. 

Crazy Alfredo: I really enjoyed this dish! It has a nice kick of spice from the jalapeños. The pasta was cooked perfectly and the dish had the right amount of sauce on it. 

Osso bucco: this was so tender! Comes with mashed potatoes. 

Ribeye (came with truffle fries): We asked for it to be cooked medium and it was perfect! It had the nice char and wasn't chewy at all. It comes with a side of truffle fries which I am all about! 

Most of the entrees could be shared, such as the osso bucco and crazy Alfredo. They're huge! 

Overall I do recommend this place. It's nice that it's not on the Strip and the prices are reasonable. The food and service was excellent. Only thing I wasn't down for was the noise level. It gets LOUD. I found myself shouting a few times across the table...but I don't know if that's saying much because I generally have a small voice haha.

OK, so I have this little problem: When I go to Nora's I obsess over the last meal and ALWAYS end up here AGAIN within 2-3 days for another round!

We bring out-of-town guests here and they love the ambiance and the food.

We always sit in the bar area and I never get a bad look when I'm there in jeans and sweatshirt (yes, sometimes when your tummy is yelling for Nora's you just go!)

Our favorites:
1. Antipasto Salad
*Romaine lettuce, mozzarella, pepperoncini, olives, onions, tomatoes, topped with
ham, provolone, and salame, in our homemade Italian dressing.
-FOR REALLLLL.  Little pinwheels of meat and chesse?!  OMG-YUM!
2. Caesar Salad
*Romaine Lettuce, topped with Italian croutons and Nora's own Caesar's dressing.
-Just tastes better than your normal Caesar.  My husband swears by this one!
3. Cheese Ravioli w/ Vodka Sauce
*Might sound plain, but this is the only entree I've ever gotten and its DELICIOUS!
4. Penne w/ Arrabiata sauce & sausage.
*Husband LOVES this one.  The arrabiata sauce is fabulous- not too spicy, but more flavor then your regular red sauce.  They make their sausage in-house!

I'm hoping to one day venture out of the "ravioli box" and try one their pizza's or maybe some seafood?  But I love what get every time, that it's so hard to try something different!

They bring out yummy garlic bread (on the house) but the next round is $1.50.

NOTE: Make reservations on SATURDAY!!!  They get crazy busy, even at 5:00pm!

They have GREAT takeout (especially for lunch!)

Have been a regular at Nora's for many years. I really don't want to write a negative review but was highly disappointed with our experience last week.  Noras recently moved to a new location just a few blocks east of where they've been forever . Beautiful restaurant and excellent decor. Place is stunning . Had a 645 reservation on a Tuesday for a 30th b day party. Only four of us.  Wasn't seated until 700pm. Had to flag down the manager and ask why walk ins were being seated before us?  Eventually he sat us and bought us a round of drinks. Don was our server as he has been for many other visits and did a great job as always. Appetizers came out in a timely fashion 10-12 minutes but we waited a full hour to get our entrees. This is not an exaggeration . Manager Dan was apologetic and compensated our table with many rounds of drinks and a reduced bill, but that's not why we visit Nora's.  I did not want a free drink (was drinking sprite) i wanted to enjoy my meal.  The food is always spot on but they were not ready to open at the new building. The kitchen was buried , one hour for entrees is inexcusable.  He said they are working on getting ready for the Grand Opening which is in a couple weeks which made us feel unimportant.  That is why you run a play day and a soft opening with friends and family of the employees to work out the kinks before opening to the public.  It was an awkward dinner to say the least.  We will return eventually but not any time soon.  I put this on the owner of Nora's not on the manager or server.  Don't open unless you are prepared
Bestest pizza ever.! One of my favorite italian restaurant in vegas. They also have sangria!

When I went there was a hour and 15 min wait, clearly this place is popular. Sat at the bar and was well worth it, got a whole basket of delicious garlic bread. Most authentic Italian cooking I've had in years, the portions are huge.

This place has a nice vibe and feel to it. Garlic bread was amazing, super garlicky just how I like it. We also had the steak and arugula bruschetta and that was really delicious also. 

I ordered the linguine and clam as my entree and this is where I was a bit disappointed. The sauce was bland and not garlicky enough for me and had some gritty stuff in the sauce.

All in all i would like to give this place another try.  Oh and free sangria with a checkin isnt all that bad.
Based off the rating my expectation was not met. The shrimp scampi app was Delish. We also had veal and chicken parm. Sauce was not up to par - breaking was falling off and it was a bit dry

Absolutely incredible. The garlic bread is to die for, along with the wings. I ordered the pasta fagioli, which was the best I have ever had. I also ordered chicken marsala. It had the most amazing sauce and I enjoyed every bite! This is definitely the best Italian restaurant I have EVER been to. I will be coming back soon!
New location and building, same great service and food! The crazy alfredo is my go-to dish every time. Happy to see the new spot packed as usual. Well done!!

If you are looking for a light, low cal, healthy option in Italian dining-go elsewhere-you won't find it at Nora's. The food is good in that carb laden, dripping in cheese and sauce way that is absolutely yummy to eat, but requires a double trip to the gym the next day to work off the guilt. Additionally, the portions are large so the overindulgence brings on the required nap afterward. One of the best lemon drop martinis in a long while, however my pizza was very good in flavor, but too heavy in crust and cheese-almost dripping-and while i favor a thicker crust-it was almost like eating a loaf of bread which was too much for my taste. Prices are right, service is prompt, taste is good, just will keep this for a very very occasional if the goal is to eat a bit lighter.

Food and service was excellent. Had the crazy fettuccine, arancini, mozzerella caprese, and bread pudding for dessert. Would highly recommend this spot as well as all of these menu items. First time visit and will definitely go back.
I just had the Melrose (linguine pesto with shrimp) excellent dinner here as always! And such friendly classy service.

Wonderful service, yummy food, great atmosphere. I had the baked rigatoni, added meatballs and substituted vodka sauce. It came out just as I ordered, and was absolutely amazing! I reheated the leftovers later that evening, lo and behold it was even more delicious! In my opinion, you really can't go wrong with this ricotta laden baked dish!!!

One of my absolute favorite restaurants in Vegas. I have been going to Nora's since it was only the now middle room and it has been great ever since. The food is amazing it's a cute restaurant with great service. Everything I have eaten there has been delicious including- chicken Alfredo, Veal, pretty much any pasta is awesome! And OMG the pistachio chocolate is to die for!!! The best dessert you will ever have if you like pistachios and chocolate. You have to order it early because they make it fresh when ordered so I recommend ordering it right when u sit down to make sure there won't be a wait when you are ready for it. It's got a warm melty center and soft outside drizzled in the pistachio sauce. I cannot tell you how good this is. This restaurant has been my favorite for years and will continue to be as long as they keep doing what they are doing! There is also a room for large parties in the back that is really nice and the doors close if you want it more of a private party. There is live music on the weekends not sure about weekdays. It gets a little cramped but not too bad. Overall awesome place to eat!
Came in for lunch, had the seafood misto and antipasto salad.  Food was very good.  Service was fair, had to ask multiple times for more bread.  Finally came after we had finished.  Would try again.

Woman at the jacuzzi said they make Italian like "mama used to" here. So I ventured out here to find out what my Italian mama would've made.

So I step inside and the first face I see is old baby blue eyes. It's too bad that this and a street name is all we got left of him in Vegas.

The hostess was distracted with takeout orders when I entered and I was left waiting for more than five minutes at the front. After I was seated, I was greeted by the server, who addressed me as "sir", which would normally be awkward for me but came off as polite in this instance.

My bread and drink came out relatively quickly. The bread was a garlic toast which was a little on the soggier side and not so garlicky. 

I ordered the "crazy" Alfredo, which is the standard fettuccine Alfredo with jalapeños, sausage, chicken, and mushrooms. I guess somebody was eating pizza and decided the toppings would be just as well in a pasta. The peppers really did overpower everything else in the dish as it was hard to even taste the Alfredo sauce. The pasta was cooked correctly but the taste was not all that great.

The check took a while to come out so I would say that the service is inconsistent here.

I guess this would be the point where mama would hit me in the back of the head with a spatula for this review.

I have been here on several occasions. I've had some truly excellent dishes. Yesterday, however, was not one of those days.

I ordered the fettucine carbonara, a usually, well-balanced dish. They missed the mark yesterday. Where do I begin? The pasta was not cooked properly, some was al dente and some was close but under done...how do you do that? Perhaps they realized they didn't put enough in the pot and added some a few minutes later...? Who knows. They use ham in the carbonara. It was like they rolled up a bunch, cut it and threw in the. They didn't separate the pieces. There was so much ham I couldn't taste anything else. I spoke to the manager and showed him my plate. He agreed that there was too much ham in the dish. We didn't discuss the other issues. He asked me if I wanted it remade but I didn't. I had to go in search of a manager because I couldn't get the waiter to come to my table. No one asked me if I needed more water. No one came to inquire about my satisfaction with my dish. Had someone done so early on I might have had them remake it. As it was the manager took the pasta off the bill. I would have preferred enjoying my meal. Maybe I'll try again but at the moment I am undecided.

I have eaten here a dozen times. Food is fantastic but service varies. Sometimes really good sometimes rushed but more often than not service with an attitude. This place is very small reservation recommended. They really could expand and still stay full. Food is so delicious it over rides any negatives.

I've been here a few times over the past 3 years and it's been consistently good! The wait staff is knowledeable about the menu and very happy to accommodate any special requests. 
 For Appetizers I've had the Calamari which was deliciously seasoned and served with a tasty blush type of tartar sauce however I asked for a side of marinara that was gladly and promptly brought to me.  The Arancini were tasty and nicely seasoned. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside with a good amount peas, meat sauce and mozzarella on the inside. The presentation was beautiful with basil leaves on top and served over some marinara (which was way too skimpy of an amount but they'll gladly give you more!)
My friend and I had the Eggplant Parmigiana and Veal Parmigiana both of which were delicious. The eggplant was breaded and fried lightly with just enough marinara and melted mozzarella on each slice. The veal was tender and well seasoned as well.  They've also got a nice wine list with  reasonable prices. I also like the way they redecorated the dining room with multicolored ceiling tile and the Trinacria. This place is always busy so I'd suggest a reservation especially if you have a larger party.
From the time you step in the door to the time you walk out expect extreme service, amazing cocktails,  and the best Italian cuisine vegas has to offer.

I met my friend Rachel and her hubs here for dinner on 12/20/15. I made a reservation for 4 people at 6:30 and we arrived right on time. Unfortunately for us, they made us wait for a bigger table because Rachel brought her son. I didn't think that it was necessary to make a reservation for 5 people because he's a toddler and sits in a high chair, but whatevs. We had to wait an additional 15-20 minutes to be seated because of this, so by the time we sat down I was hangry. 

Our server was nice, but service was slow the whole time. We ordered drinks and then ordered our food. We didn't receive appetizers, salads or bread for *at least* 30 minutes. The bread was good, super garlicky and buttery. The salad was yummy, and I enjoyed the house Italian that came on top. Finally after what seemed like forever, our main courses came. I had the chicken parmesan with spaghetti alfredo, and my boyfriend had the baked rigatoni special and a side of meatballs. The baked rigatoni and the rigatoni special are separate entrees. The rigatoni special has meat and the baked rigatoni does not, but he asked if he could have both put together and they accommodated him. It looked so cheesy and delicious, but I was too busy enjoying my delicious cheesy chicken parm to even ask for a bite. He said it was amazing. The meatballs I tried and they were good, but a little cold on the inside. We all sat in silence for a good 15 minutes eating. We all agreed that it was a delicious meal and no one had any complaints.

Even after all that food, Rachel and I ordered the chocolate lava cake for dessert, because YOLO. The cake has to be ordered when you order your entrees, because they are made to order. This cake was nothing short of delicious. It came hot out of the oven, garnished with pistachio crumbs and a sweet vanilla sauce. When I dug into the cake, I got a spoonful of hot, creamy chocolate and it was divine. This cake was the perfect end cap to wonderful dinner with wonderful frands.

Get some hostesses over 18 or IQ Over 50 and you might actually have some semblance of something more competent than a Chinese fire drill.  Especially when having a reservation.    Good thing food is decent or this place would be a one and done.     Bar mixologists are well trained  a positive.     The  hostesses were a solid zero tonight. Look at other reviews.   The hostesses are killing you guys.  Find someone with experience.

What a great restaurant. This is definitely a 'local' gem and if you want to get some high quality Italian at a reasonable price while in LV definitely check out this place. Normally I don't rave about Italian places but this place is worth it. Good service, quality food, and nice atmosphere. Go here for a romantic dinner that won't empty your wallet.
Excellent food as always. We used to make it an annual restaurant to visit when we're on this side of town. May have to increase the frequency.

This place used to be one of my favorite Italian restaurants in town. I have to say I changed my mind since they moved in this new - and upgraded - building.
This new facility is a great place. They did a good job with the decor.
But let's get to the main thing for a restaurant: food. This is an Italian restaurant, and my pasta was overcooked. It's the second time I go there bringing a large party with me, and I have to say the quality is not as expected. I don't know what changed when they moved, but I'm kind of regretting the old location now. OK, this one's bigger, brighter, bolder, but again the food is not as good as it used to be. The staff is very nice though.

This restaurant feels like one of the old world Italian restaurants in Little Italy, in Manhattan NY.  Very rustic and very cozy- it's perfect for a laid back date.  If you're looking for a fussy, hipster/trendy place, this restaurant is not it.

The restaurant was bustling when my date and I arrived, but we were sat immediately.  Somewhat annoying where we got placed though, which was a seat near the server's station.
