They should move that table further down.  During the busiest hours, I'm sure it'd be annoying with servers going around you, "excuse me, excuse me, coming through, whoops."

Food was fine.  I've had better Italian, but the food is fine for its price.  Nothing mind-blowing, the pasta could be softer, but that's just my preference.  Other than that, the seafood and the sauce was spot on.  My date got just regular chicken alfredo.  She hadn't tried that restaurant (although it was she who suggested the place).  She also would've liked her pasta softer, so maybe it isn't just me.

If you like Italian food as much as I do, try this place.  Oh, and be seated far from the kitchen/server's station- it'll help you dine with no interruptions.

I'm not a big fan of pizza but my husband is. He took me here the other day. I had the shrimp scampi and it was ok. I finally tried his pizza and I was like omg. I have never had pizza like this. Suffice to say I ate his food instead of mine. I'm not giving 4 stars because of the scampi but for the lack of service from our server. My brother in law joined us and was given a glass and of water. He started to nibble and the server saw that. He didn't bother to offer him some of his own settings to eat with. Thank goodness we had a fork that we didn't use. The biggest issue was when he was done eating he didn't have a napkin either to wipe his mouth and hands. Thank goodness he had his handkerchief, but still it was annoying he had to use it. It wouldn't have been necessary had the server given him his own napkin and settings.  Our server should have been more observant. It's all about the service. Just that little slip on the servers part caused Nora's to lose a star. I will be back for the pizza  and hopefully I will be able to update my review to 5 stars

Nora's is worth the trip off the strip. My family's been coming here for years whenever we visit our extended family in town. We eat at Nora's at least once. We always order the antipasta salad for the table and get our own entrees. It's the way to go to save a liitle money as well as not over eat. 

Their garlic bread is pretty bomb. Just don't plan on making out with anyone after. The huge chunks of garlic will repel anyone. 

I recommend the fetachini sauce or linguini because they're both amazing!

Call for reservations because it does get pretty crowded.

My boyfriend and I went to visit this place based on all the yelp reviews - I didn't find the food particularly appealing.

The salad was over dressed the pizza was something you could find at a nearby Domino's but the server was great! She was very nice and accommodating. 

The tiramisu is okay too... there was just not anything particularly memorable about this experience.

It's worth a casual visit any day but by no means would I take someone here for their birthday.

We went there for dinner two times. The first time we went it was excellent!! It was a Friday at about 9pm. The service was terrific and I had ordered the fettuccine Alfredo and my husband ordered the lasagna. Both dishes were amazing! We loved it so much, we definitely wanted to go back. So the second time we went was on a Friday again, but this time it was about 6pm. I ordered the chicken fettuccine Alfredo and my husband ordered their special which was called crazy Alfredo. This time our waitress was okay, but seemed to be more interested in having a long conversation to the man sitting at the table next to us. The chicken fettuccine Alfredo was just okay this time, nothing special that made me want more. My husbands crazy Alfredo was not very good. There was still the tails attached to the shrimp which he had to remove and the shrimp flavor over powered the whole dish instead of complementing it. It was as if everything was cooked in the same pan with the shrimp. We were very disappointed this time. Maybe it was a different chef on the second visit because it just was not that good this time.

Nice place when we got their yes it was busy so they offered us to sit outside and we agreed. Not bad but would of really liked to see a  view instead of the parking lot. The food is very Delicious 1 plate is enough for 2 people. Great service would recommend going there again.

I don't live in Vegas anymore, but during the time I lived there I frequented this place at least a few times a month. Awesome food. You have to sit in the back at the bar for the best experience. The bartenders are awesome and remembered me every time I came in. The staff that tended to the front room was OK but not the same atmosphere as you get at the bar. The live music nights were always good....another reason to sit in the back at the bar. Great local spot away from the awful strip. Good date night place!

Came for my son's birthday dinner.  First time.  Husband was thoroughly impressed.  He ordered the spaghetti and side of sausage.  I had the brazino which was perfectly cooked,  moist and crispy skin on both sides! Son had canneloni. The waiter surprised him with bday dessert off tiramisu. Great ambiance.  Best service. Deducting a star because we paid cash and waiter brought back $20 change instead of the $60 we were owed . When we brought it to his attention he didn't hesitate to give us the $40 immediately. Which made us think he was pocketing the $40. So go there and enjoy yourself and you'll have a great meal only make sure when the bill comes that it's correct and you get the proper change .

Nora's deserves 10 stars for sure!!!!  Best Italian in town, I've been going to Nora's for over a decade and am never disappointed!!!  The staff is great and the food is what you expect and want out of an Italian restaurant.  The osso bucco is one of my favorites along with their lemon drop martini!!  The bartenders are all fabulous and know how to handle the crowd as they are usually serving a full house from open to close!!!  If you are planning on getting a table best bet is making a reservation otherwise you can usually find a couple seats open at the bar.

This is my fourth, or fifth, time here. Once with my family, and the rest for business.  

When you drive up to it, on the outside it's a dump; a typical strip center that's seen the better years behind it. Once inside, it's cozy, especially the side with the bar. 

The food is excellent as is the service.  Great Negronis and a decent wine list at reasonable prices. In fact, all the prices are reasonable. 

It's a homey place great for the whole family. 

My favorite place in town is still Panevino, but this is my second favorite. 

And the espresso is wonderful, too.

I could not be happier finding this restaurant on Yelp.  My family & I were tired of eating food in all the hotels.  Nora's was what we were looking for.  Great food, wine and reasonable.  Tip, reservations or go there before 6pm.

This is probably one of my favorite local spots for Italian food. The food is delicious, the portions are big enough to take another meal or 2 home, the service is quick, and an awesome atmosphere. 

Just recently checked out their newer location and it is so much better as before you had to wait 20-30 minutes before getting seated (even if you had a reservation). This last time my family and I went we were seated right away with our reservation and the space is much bigger. There is staff everywhere and they're very attentive no matter who's table it is! 

The food portions are HUGE, but delicious and quite rich for those of you who plan to order their marinara sauce. They are accommodating to vegetarians as they have a couple dishes on the menu...

Wine selection is good, but prices are a slightly high. Always worth it for a good time, though and you can take the bottle home if you don't finish it. 

Will definitely come here more often now that they have a bigger space!

Amazing! We walked in the door and the aroma tantalized our taste buds We ordered house salad that came with marinated olives and finely chopped mozzarella and the house Italian dressing it was delicious We also ordered the spaghetti with meat sauce and a side of meatball and the chicken Alfredo The lunch portions are plenty large enough. The Alfredo sauce was the perfect mix of creamy and garlicky and the chicken was incredibly tender The meat sauce was delicious and the meatball was perfect. I am spoiled now this was the best Italian food I have ever had Family owned is always best! Thank you Nora and family for a wonderful dining experience

Our dinner last night at Nora's was our fourth since we discovered it about ten years ago when we asked an Italian employee at the Venetian where to get great Italian food in Las Vegas. He said quite assuredly, "Let me tell you about all the restaurants in the Venetian." Then he leaned in and whispered, "Now let me tell you where to go eat. Nora's." 

His recommendation was a good one! 

Our first visit to Nora's was probably our best experience - the flush of "first love" for what was at the time a little known, truly "mom and pop" venture located about four miles off the strip and tucked behind an Arby's in a strip mall.. There were four of us, close friends, we walked in on a Friday night without reservations and ate in the bar...which may even have been the only eating area at the time...where we had a wonderful pasta entrees, shared appetizers and desserts and with bottle of Sicilian red wine and the entire bill was just about $100. 

Time marches on, Nora's has been discovered (even it seems through a visit from Food Network - alas).  Reservations are not only recommended but essential.  The wine prices have gone WAY up. The menu seems to have been pretty static for each of our four visits to Nora's  and while our meal last night was good, and we still recommend it to those who want traditional Southern italian food, there are so many options now in Las Vegas for Italian fare that our visit last night may have been our last to our "old friend". (One of those options is Nora's Wine Bar, owned by the "sons of Nora".) 

The low point of the meal for two at Nora's last night was the antipasta.  Nora's preparation, with Italian deli meat, canned black olive slices and grated mozzarella on top of blandly dressed lettuce, just didn't "cut it".

But the linguini friutti di mare that followed was wonderfully prepared with succulent mussels, clam (not in shells), shrimp and calamari rings and tentacles (yesssss) in a well seasoned red sauce. A glass of Barbara and a glass of Nebbiolo plus two desserts (espresso tartufo and cannoli) brought our bill to about $75 which we thought was a good value for the quality of the meal and the friendly service. 

The yelp reviewers who have cheered about the chocolate cake are right...the Valrohna chocolate cake with the molten center that is served warm is delicious. But the espresso tartufo, coated in a chocolate shell, and the cannoli are both worthy contenders.  The tartufo may be among the best we've ever had of that dessert option. 

We noted that on a Tuesday night in a bad economy, Nora's was still doing gangbusters. all tables full by about 8:00 in a mix of what seemed to be local regulars and tourists like us. The enduring popularity of this little place is well earned.

I went to this place while in town for a convention and was pleasantly surprised at how great it was. I ended going there again my last night in town. The Crazy Alfredo is easily the best pasta dish I have ever had, and that's saying a lot. The garlic bread and Ceasar Salad are delicious as well. I haven't tried anything else but I can guarantee that you can't go wrong. Service was great and the atmosphere was relaxed and would be a great place for a quiet romantic dinner. Also, a nice getaway from the craziness of the strip. Will be making this a regular spot of mind whenever in town from now on!

My experience at Nora's was great! It was my first time here, but a lot of my friends had recommended the place to me. We had the octopus (grilled, delicious), arancini (fried risotto balls with tomato sauce), carbonara (creamy, perfectly cooked pasta), and the veal canneloni (fresh pasta, veal was amazing). The only gripe i had was the rib-eye we ordered was not salted enough, but I happen to have a saltier palate. Overall though, with the amount of food and drinks that we ordered, the meal was surprisingly affordable. Will return!

I've been coming to this restaurant since it opened. There is no exaggeration on that. The old location used to be a tiny kitchen with only about 4 tables to eat at. They expanded twice and now have moved to a completely new location. I have dined in all the locations and have never been disappointed 

Nora's is the best Italian food I have ever had. I have tried countless Italian restaurants and nothing compares. I used to complain that other Italian food was gross and actually wouldn't even eat any other Italian food for a while. Not only is it the best in Vegas, but it also holds as the best over many other restaurants in other cities. 

Spaghetti and meatballs are a classic but the best I've ever had. Penne ala vodka is amazing. Penne with broccoli sauce and chicken (not on the menu but they always make it for me) is so good. Really I'm not even going to continue because everything on the menu is divine. 

The Mauro family is amazing. They've always taken care of my family and I, and we are so grateful for that. Not only do they put out the best Italian food in Vegas, but even in their homes. Their rich Italian culture has been brought out in their loving natures and food-filled parties. 

Truly the best Italian restaurant (and one of the best restaurants in general) in Vegas, backed up by one of the best families!!!

Over the past month we have been lucky enough to have two of the best Italian meals of our lives. One at Lola and Giuseppe's in Columbus, OH (see review) and one at Nora's!

Service
Overall very polished! We had a reservation on a Monday night and were seated about 10 minutes after our time. The place was packed!  We were promptly greeted by the server, and he was attentive throughout always refilling our soft drinks quickly. The meal was well-paced and not rushed nor slow. Fresh silverware was provided after each course - a small touch, but don't you hate going to a restaurant and being told to "keep your fork!" as if they only allow one per guest. A bus boy graciously packed our leftovers for us which we appreciated. 

Ambiance 
Sorry Lola, Nora wins here hands down. Modern upscale interior. Extremely classy. No booth seating, however, so when it's crowded it doesn't feel too intimate or private.  

Food
Truly exceptional.  Lola might have the slenderest advantage, but wow it's a close call. We started with two wonderful cocktails including a peach Bellini. Tasty and great presentation. We had some soft drinks too which were constantly refilled. We had arancini as an appetizer which was ok.  A bit mushy on the inside. Then a Caesar salad which was very good. Truly tasty dressing and fresh lettuce. The garlic bread was exceptional!  We had read on Yelp only one basket per table was allowed, but we asked for more which wasn't an issue at all (no charge). It would honestly be pretty gauche for a place like this to charge for more bread. Entrees were... amaze balls! Chicken Parmesan and pork fillet. Wow. Huge portions (see photos) and both were flavorful tasty meat. The pasta with the chicken was wonderfully al dente.  Very large portions (plenty leftover for both). For dessert a slice of spumoni (so so tasty and flavorful) and bread pudding. The bread pudding - wow!  Not like the typical dry bread but so soft and moist like a custard. Lola's is similar, so this must be an Italian style bread pudding. So delicious - you mustn't pass this up!!

Mojo
Overall an outstanding place with great service and exceptional Italian food. Lola's might take a slight edge for its homey authentic atmosphere and overall taste, but if you aren't up for a trip to Ohio you must (really you MUST) eat at Nora's!!  Total bill for two cocktails, an appetizer and a salad, two entrees, and two desserts was about $100. Very reasonable for the quality of the food!
Love this place. One of my favorites in town. Service is always wonderful and baked ziti is amazing everytime! It can definitely get crowded and that's a good thing!

We have been going to Nora's at the old location for approximately 15 years. The food and service has always been very good. They have moved to a new location. The new building is very Italian in design with lots of parking. We were served our appetizer and salad quickly and then waited well over a half an hour for our main course. I ordered linguini with clam sauce and it was so salty, I was unable to eat any of it. My partner's chicken Parmesan was also very salty and he only ate 1/2. It took our server another 30 minutes to stop by to see how our meal was. We immediately asked for the check and expressed out disappointment in their service and quality of the inedible meal. Never to return

So, not the best Italian, like others claim it is, but still really good. I am totally in love with the ambience in this place. It's dark and they play oldies music like Sinatra and Sammy. I ordered a lasagna and it did have a bit too much cheese in it for my liking, but it was good. The staff was a 5-star.... super nice guys!

The entire time I was there (work dinner), I was envisioning myself coming back, sitting at the bar, drinking red wine and eating yummy apps. Yes, I will go back & have to do this.

FOOD: Ok

SERVICE: Poor... Very poor. 

CLEANLINESS: The appearance and cleanliness is very good. 

Beyond the above, this was our "wish we can hop in a DeLorean and go back in time to avoid this place" experience. Just a note: it's fairly long, which is why I already put the key things above. So read beyond this if you'd like. If not, I totally understand. 

This was our wedding anniversary. At our hotel, an employee recommended this place to us. We do have this one other place we absolutely love, but I'll get into that later.... So, we decided to give Nora's a try.  We made reservations for four.  Upon arrival, we were seated in a timely manner. But this is where things came go a stop....That's exactly how it felt from the moment we were seated. 

We waited. Waited. And waited. Finally, someone asked for our drink order. Another stoppage moment. Waited. And waited. A waiter, I think Sebastian or Sebastia, hurriedly comes to our table and repeatedly apologizes for the long delay. Oh yes. This dude was very aware of our wait. He went on how he has to cover the other side of the restaurant. Not a few tables in the same section. But the other side that you cannot see from where we are sitting. Apparently, he's the only Italian speaking waiter and this large party on the other side who spoke Italian, needed attending to. 

Okay. Our only thought was "So, why doesn't management or the owner step in?" Why don't they be proactive and have someone cover his tables while he attends to something they are unable to do?"  Makes sense, right? I mean, if he has to step away because he is the only Italian speaking waiter, this will take time away from his other customers. This was not done. And boy did we pay the price. 

Here's the deal... we waited ONE FULL HOUR till our food arrived at the table. Yes, you read that right... one hour. I even told him "do you realize your repeated 'sorry, but you have to do something else' had us waiting for one hour?"  And I kid you not, this was his answer... "I'm so sorry." I don't know what was more sorry... choosing Nora's or this guy's attitude to put on a disappearing act followed by the only line in his one-man show: "I'm sorry."  I mean, it was that bad!  

In Los Angeles the stereotypical thing is that many waiters are  "actors". So I'm guessing being in Vegas, Sebastia, has a desire to be a magician and one day headline his own show on the Strip. I mean, he has certainly mastered the art of illusion with his service. David Copperfield, if you're looking for a protege, this is your guy. I can vouch for his disappearing act. 

In the end... Families. Couples. Out-of-towners. Newlyweds. Honeymooners.... we would not recommend this to anyone at all. This was a horrible experience for us. It didn't help that the food was just ok, too. But that service... by far the longest wait we have ever experienced. And the lack of having someone, whether it's management or anyone of authority to recognize this and be more proactive about the situation... talk about being complacent.  The respect for the paying customer: Zero. 


So back to that one place we absolutely love.... There is a silver lining to this whole thing. You see, no matter how crazy or unprofessional these moments might seem at times, always know this: You have the ultimate decision to do whatever it is you want to do. So rather than making this wedding anniversary dinner at Nora's spoil our Vegas trip, the next evening, we decided to return to the place we love... PIERO'S. The host has always been incredibly professional. The servers: A whole different level of service, and I'm talking amazing service . If you were to peak behind you at times, you would notice another staff standing by to make sure you were attended to. You know how you sorta look around, and they catch this, then someone says, "Yes, is there anything I can get for you?"  And best part of Piero's... being this was our anniversary all over again - the host sat us at the booth they used in the movie "CASINO". 
The scene where Robert De Niro and Sharon Stone sitting at their booth. Although the movie used a different name, this was the restaurant, Piero's. 

Good luck to all. It is your money. It is your valuable time; especially to those from out of town, time is very short and you want to make the best of it.

Really 4 1/2 stars. Complimentary garlic bread. Amazing. Very garlicky (I love garlic). The pizzas are huge but great for leftovers. Antipasto salad with house Italian dressing was very good. I tasted my friend's pasta Carbonara which was quite good if a little salty. Very nice atmosphere & decor. You forget that you are in a strip mall as soon as you step in the door. Very professional yet friendly staff. I will definitely return next time I'm in Vegas

They used to have a much smaller location like a minute down the road.  Honestly kinda miss that place.  But the "new" location is very nice and classy.  Service has always been on point each time I've been there.  

I'm a creature of habit.   I basically get the same thing every time.  They start you off with garlic bread which hits the spot soooo hard.   Love it, plus it's complimentary.  And I know it's just garlic bread, but damn it's tasty.   

Next I split the truffle fries ($5.50) which whomever I happen to be eating with.   The sauce the give you is delicious and I always have to ask for a bonus sauce.  

For the main course it's either the cannelloni with ricotta and spinach or baked ziti (they use a different kind of noodle but basically same stuff).  Both are really good.   This place Is very borderline 5 stars.  Love me some noras.   Prices are reasonable and portions are solid.

I  have always rated nora's 5 stars, but last night
for the first time there i ordered linguine aglio et olio (garlic and oil) well this is not at all what i was expecting, it appears they used jarred minced garlic-- gag !!!-- terrible-- one would expect to be served this at a small highway dinner or cracker barrel---
not at nora's. is it that much trouble to take several cloves of garlic, slice them and roast them in olive oil for three minutes pour over the pasta ad some parsley---come on man--- it sure left me with a bad taste in my mouth for this place.
sorry nora but you dropped the ball on this one !!!!

My bf and I have dined here twice in 2 weeks. Love the atmosphere, service, value and delicious Italian! The first time we went was on a Tuesday night and waited an hour for a table for two. Very busy and happy for them! ;) they take reservations an hour after the time you call so just call ahead!

OK, still the same. The best Italian restaurant in Vegas plus the best name. This time we were seated in a dining area, the room without the bar. We waited for the food for quite some time, they were busy so no sweat, I understand. We thought the food is the same, excellent! Note that from the promotional flyer/banner at the door, they're moving to a bigger location right around the area. We got confirmation from the wait staff, so the next time we're in Vegas, we'll visit their new location. I had my super-duper mouthwatering seafood pasta and hubby got his veal. We went with hubby's Uncle so he ordered Eggplant Parmesan and that looked delicious too. After the meal we were blasted by this cute chocolate dessert! *:)  Thanks Nora! You got my name and you stole my heart!

We have been customers of Nora's for years at their previous location and always enjoyed the food and the service.  We have recommended this location to many. Our first visit to this new location will be our last. We visited at around 3pm on a Thursday. We were seated quickly and that was the last quick thing this afternoon.  I'm not going to give the details but the service was sloooooow. I had to get up to ask to get acknowledged. 1.5 hours to get out of there. Kudos to Isabell the busser who was on her job and assisted in serving us.

This place is very good! I love chicken alfredo and like to try it nearly every Italian place I go and this place did not disappoint. The place is nice but gets packed as its such a good spot to eat so I recommend making a reservation. This is one of the best Italian restaurants I have been to in Las Vegas or anywhere for that matter.

Pretty dang good food here! 

Called a little a head of time to make reservations that night. We pulled up to a strip mall, next to a bowling store.. OK so the outside wasn't fancy, but as soon as you get in the doors you understand why people aren't scared to return. The interior is decorated very upscale, except for the white paper table cloths. Our party walked in around 6pm and the place was packed, already people waiting for tables to be seated.. As soon as you enter the restaurant a wall of deli shes garlic smells make your mouth water. As we waited the few minutes, we got to enjoy watching the cooks, cook in the kitchen, which is placed right in the middle of the restaurant. We got seated near the bar and got to watch all the locals sit down and wind down. It looked like they had some fancy martini's if your into that kind of stuff.. 

As soon as we sat down we were served a huge bowl of garlic bread, no extra cost. And they didn't skimp at all, I mean this was a huge basket of really yummy garlic bread. Our wait staff was on their game this evening, filling glasses of water, and refilling the garlic bread basket a few times. We also ordered a small salad for an app. The salad was no where near small, it feed the four of us. 

We all ordered our food, someone got chicken Marsala's, another got the lasagna, and I got the Alfredo Carbon. The portion sizes where huge, and the food was great! We all had enough leftovers for a second meal, which we nicely boxed up. Nicely done Nora's! Still feeling stuffed! :)

The waiting time and congestion to dine there has improved since they moved to a larger space, dining has been consistent. Food is great and service needs a little push to compliment the food.
Over all a wonderful experience.

we had reservations at another place but ended up here on a tip from our cab driver....Thank you MR. cab driver! the food was great and the prices are moderate ( way less than any place on the strip) the crazy alfredo and chicken gorganzola pasta was AMAZING and the chicken ceasar salad was great too...The service was good, but i recommend reservations...we got lucky since it was just two of us.

Boy it kills me to rip this place up, but I have to. The old Nora's is dead and gone. I was a long time regular at the old spot, and disappointed that I only see a few familiar faces in the new location. 

We had a resi at 8 on a Sunday, and waited about 10 minutes passed that for a table. Once we were sat we weren't greeted. Ever. Not by a busser, not by a manager, and definitely not by a server. 

We were right up front by the hostess stand, so we asked one of the 4 girls standing there if maybe our server didn't know we had been sat, and they assured us one would be right there. After nearly 15 min, we abandoned ship to dine at the bar. If we hadn't had our hearts set on the meal, we would have left for sure! Our equally unattended neighbors were jealous that we had found 3 seats, especially since they had been sat before we even walked into the building. 

Once we secured some service, we found that Adam was a fantastic bartender, and the only redeeming thing about the visit. He was prompt, attentive, and personable. We appreciate that he took care of a round in apology for the slow service. 

Food was good as always, even if it was missing a certain je ne sais quoi. 


I think what bothered me the most is that after we sat and waited unacknowledged for so long at a table, we saw tons of staff standing around and holding up the walls for the duration of the meal. The chefs looked unoccupied, 3 waiters and bussers milled about while the bartender's trash can overflowed (even after he asked for a clean up), and none of the signature Nora's service quality was present. No folded napkins when guests went to the restroom, a woman dropped her pepper flake shaker and went unassisted with 2 young waiters remarking that someone had broken a plate (couldn't be bothered to break off their conversation and pick it up), and just general lack of genuine interaction that I loved before. It used to be like dining at the mob's table, and now it's a one-off Cheesecake Factory. 

I'll try again if only to sit with Rudy, Danny, and Adam- but it's getting hard to recommend as a top spot on Las Vegas

Food was good and reasonable. We shared a mozzarella caprese salad. The mozzarella and salad were wonderful, but the tomatoes sub- par. The beau had orange ruffey and enjoyed his meal. I had shrimp scampi, not bad, but it doesn't compare to Cheesecake Factory. We shared a chocolate souffle. Who serves souffle without vanilla ice cream? But if they did, it would be the best I've ever had, hands down! Its so sweet you'll either need a glass of milk or some ice cream (hint hint Nora).
The service for us was below expectation. Trey was Inattentive to say the least. I could see him leaning against a wall by the bar instead of checking to see how the food was or if we needed anything. They had a band jazzing it up at 9PM, which certainly set the mood.
Overall I would return. The food was good and we paid under a bill for two.

I have been going to Nora's for over 10 years, I have eaten at most Italian restaurants in Vegas including Ferraro's was close by Nora's in the old days, and Piero's which has the best Osso bucco (I have not Nora's yet) The two are very good also, but Nora's is above them, it is a restaurant for locals, and they know it as it is always packed. I love the Crazy Alfred the best.  If you are in Vegas and want Italian you can not go wrong here.

Our first time here. Salad, soup, eggplant, wines, bread, and on and on.
Awesome atmosphere and food.
We'll. Be back.
Went to dinner there for my birthday last night.  The food was excellent and so was the staff.  Could be the best Italian food in Vegas

We love Nora's! The lemon drops are phenomenal. They light a lemon slice on fire before adding it to your drink. It's pretty cool. The Arancini are amazing! It's a fried risotto ball served with marinara. Arguably the best thing on the menu. Tonight I had the Alla Nora pasta and my husband had the ribeye with truffle fries. The pasta was great and was a huge serving. It had piece of eggplant baked on the top that wasn't mushy like eggplant tends to be. The ribeye was okay...my husband like it but fell in love with the truffle fries (again, a huge portion). Food isn't cheap but it's worth it. We will continue to return for date night.

Our team from work visited Nora's for our Christmas party for thr first time this year. It probably won't be the last. Our server Nina gave great service despite our continual sarcasm, loud talking as to not hear when she was taking our order, and unique requests. She had some great bussers also who were diligent in refilling our drinks. I personally had the rigatoni special and it lived up to the name, paired with the complimentary garlic bread which Nina made sure there was always plenty of, it was a great lunch location. I'll probably be back on a personal visit before next year's Christmas part.

Nora's atmosphere is amazing. You can either go casual or dress up. The food is beyond amazing and so affordable. Plus. They give you an overload amount of food. Seriously so good, my girlfriends and I go often to catch up and girls night.

Jasmine

I am back! My first experience at Nora's was great! Me, the hubbs, and his mother all went to grab lunch - and seeing how Moises loves pizza, and him seeing their yelp reviews we decided to try it out. The service at the time was very attentive and classy. Drinks never went dry, they let us know of the bread charges - when some places don't. 

The pasta dishes felt home made, pizza and the crust yummy. My boyfriend is from Brooklyn, so he is a bit of a pizza snob, and loved this. We loved the garlic bread, it was toasted good, fresh garlic on top.

Not only did I love the food, moderate prices, but I really loved the atmosphere. It gave the good old Las Vegas vibe, with Frank Sinatra playing in the background. It's a part of Las Vegas, not a lot of appreciate - but I felt it in here, that is love. 

I marked down a star because we came in the next day for dinner, and the service wasn't that attentive like it was for lunch the previous day. It was pretty packed, so I'm not going to knock on them for it.

This could have been a 4 star, even 5 star experience if it was based only on the food. Delicious, except for the bread (not so good....)!  But having a reservation really didn't help at all.  We were seated 20 minutes after our reservation.  The dining room next to the bar was noisy noisy noisy.  Took all the ambiance out of the experience.  We ordered a bottle of wine and waited over 15 minutes for it to be opened and poured.  Our server was very unconcerned about us and barely looked at us the few times she stopped by the table.  We had better service from the bus boys who really tried to help.  It was a special night for us, our 33rd wedding anniversary, and we felt shuttled in and out.

Went here last night for dinner, didn't know it even existed until then, a local took us here and wow the food and service were spot on. 

We had a big party so we were only able to get family style but it was great. 

Bruschetta was probably beat I've ever had, the pasta was great and the lamb chops and veal were delicious. 

Service was the best, the manager even came over to say hi and check on us.

We had to come twice to get it this super busy restaurant. The first time we couldn't wait the estimated 1 hour wait so we tried again the next night and arrived shortly after 6pm. We got seats at the bar but 20 minutes later a table opened up so we were able to move. We ordered the House salad which was more than enough for the two of us. It was quite tasty with tiny mozzarella cubes, firm tomatoes, lettuce, olives and peppers. Our entree was the Crazy Alfredo which was a great combination of sausage, shrimp, roasted red pepper, and chicken. We had pre-ordered the chocolate cake. If you love lava cakes then this is the dessert to order. We shared all the dishes and were overstuffed. Don't eat too much garlic bread if you want to make it to the end of the meal because you will want to eat everything. We will definitely visit again the next time we are in Vegas. I would give this 4.5 stars....it would have been 5 if the wait isn't always so long.

Nora's Italian cuisine is a find in Las Vegas. I  went with everybody. I went with Amy, Larry, Cindy, and Paul. I got the 4 staggioni. Amy got the angel hair pasta. Larry got the lasagna. Cindy got the chicken Alfredo. And Paul got the lasagna. We got good food and great service!

I've been coming to Nora's on and off for at least 8-10 years and it is always consistently good.  I love this place for lunch and is extremely reasonable for lunch ( ribeye steak with a salad for $12.95) is a steal!  The chicken marsala is great as well as the garlic bread.  I would highly recommend a reservation for dinner!

Wonderful food, service and atmosphere! If you love Italian food this is a must do. Very busy but they accept reservations. Great for a romantic dinner or an evening out with friends. We will visit again and again!

THIS PLACE IS AHHH-MAZINGGGGG!! We were referred by a local and we were quite impressed! The restaurant isn't too far from the strip, plenty of parking, exceptional service (our server was very attentive), and the food is delicious! This will be our go-to Italian restaurant when we are in town! Thank you soooo much Nora's Italian Cuisine!!!

Overall we had a great meal. The bus service was great and the food was very good.  I had tomato basil with penne and my husband had chicken parmigiano. My dish was excellent and was very fresh tasting. The chicken parmigiano was good but the chicken was a bit overcooked.  Everything else...bread, olives, and antipasto salad was great.  The only other issue was our waitress.  She had somewhat of an attitude and was not friendly. There were others in our party ...we ordered wine..it took a while to get that served.  And when we reordered..it was not timely.  The main course took a while to be served after the salad.
The atmosphere is great and we had a reservation and we're promptly seated. I discussed the issues we had with the manager and he apologized. We will come back again.
I get the lunch special spaghetti with a side salad. Their garlic bread is very good. I love the music they play and the service is very good as well.

I ate lunch in the bar about 3:30 on 9/30/14: house salad, garlic bread, and spaghetti and meatball. The salad and bread were delicious. The spaghetti arrived in a puddle of water and overall, was tasteless. 
I was not impressed; I can make better spaghetti.
The waiter came across as arrogant, and was not very interested in customer service.
Nora's has a good reputation in LV, but will lose it at this rate. Dinner staff is better.

Been here twice, second visit was yesterday. People raved on the crazy alfredo... Not a fan. Must be the pickled flavor for the pickled jalapeños? I got shrimp scampi which was amazing! The servings are enough for whole meal to have later. Calamari was perfect. Bruschetta was ehh. Not a fan of super thick large bread pieces. The tomatoes were wonderful. Cannolis were insanely yummy. Chocolate cake was too rich for my taste. They get slammed, so set reservations!

Sadly the last couple of time I have been here it the experience has been underwhelming. Slow or busy the service just wasn't what it used to be. 
The servers and the managers were too unprofessional and the servers were too sloppy and they looked miserable. Last two times I visited I asked simple questions about the menu and twice the server did not know, nor were they able to get an answer.
I celebrated my 30th birthday here and that was my last good experience over four years ago.
Sad to report this.

My husband and I are frequent Vegas visitors and were looking for some authentic Italian off the strip.  Look no further!  We had a fantastic experience, all the way from customer service to our delicious meals.  Our server was Don, who was so pleasant that we couldn't help but smile when he came to our table.  Also, the whole staff was very accommodating when we showed up early for our reservation and were more than willing to call us a cab when our dinner was through.  Definitely a go-to restaurant for us when we visit Las Vegas again.
No one ever answers the phone. I have tried several times. The food was awesome and I want to get it to take home and never can. Sucks, I wish they would fix that!

Didn't come here for a while! The experience is always delightful! Me and my wife came and forgot to make a reservation. It was BUSY!! We were told it will take 35-45 minutes in advance and decided to wait... We sat at the bar and had some drinks, the bar tender was very nice and served us well.
We then proceeded to our table where our service was great, only reason this is not a 5* is the ribeye steak I ordered medium can well well done, the quality of the meat was top of the line though that's for sure...

Absolutely one of the best meals I've had in a very long time. Simple but delicious dishes! The Gnocchi alla vodka was stupendous and the spaghetti and meatballs wonderfully good... Yummy! Service was great. Nothing bad to say about Nora's. I can't wait till my next Vegas trip so I could get some more!!!

Nora's is an off the strip delectable Italian eatery in Las Vegas.  Located in a strip mall near an Arby's, it's a completely unexpected treat!  Last weekend my entire family (and some friends too) descended upon Las Vegas to celebrate my Grandfather's 90th birthday.  The big birthday bash was held at Nora's (a place my dad saw on the food network).  They seated all 40 of us on the bar side of the restaurant where we mostly took over the place.  

Since our party was so large we had a preset menu all served family style.  Caprese salad, antipasti salad, garlic bread, calamari, pene with vodka sauce, eggplant parmigiana, chicken marsala, seasoned pork tenderloin with parmesan crusted potato wedges, tiramisu and canoli!  Oh my God I'm full just thinking about how much food I ate that night!  All that for $35 a person.  The food was excellent...especially the garlic bread, calamari, marsala, eggplant...ok all of it was awesome.  

The service was ok, but considering the number of people they had to contend with, I won't knock off a star.  They didn't even mind when we set up the gigantic poster board display of Grandpa's past 90 years on top of their beverage service table and they let us decorate with birthday banners and trinkets.  They also didn't mind when my dad and uncle got into a brotherly wresting match and broke one of the sparkling water bottles on the beverage service table....they just came over and cleaned it up.  

All and all it was a good time with good food and crazy company!  I would like to go back to Nora's to have the non huge group of people dining experience.  Plus I need to have more of that garlic bread, cause it was damn good.  Congratulations Grandpa on 90 years!

What a great find off the Strip! Excellent food reasonably priced. At 6:00 PM on a Wednesday night there was an understandable wait for a table. Being alone, I ate at the bar and was well attended to. Highly recommended !!

Nora's used to be one of my favorite restaurants in town and definitely my go-to for Italian. But since the change of location... it hasn't been the same.

First, the parking situation was horrible. On a Wednesday night, there's no parking... people were parking in the dirt or the plaza across the street. There is always a wait.

Most recently when I went, I made a reservation a week ahead of time for a party of 12. We arrive on the dot and ended up waiting 20 minutes for the table, only to find the table to be very cramped for the large party. The service was horribly slow. We had to ask multiple times for the [delicious] bread. We waited probably around 1 hour for our main courses... which came out dry. We ordered a good variety from pasta to fish to fillet mignon to osso buco. Nothing was prepared right. The meat was over cooked, the pasta was oily and you can tell it was sitting under the heater too long cause the sauce was dried onto the plate around the edges, and the flavors were just not there.

I understand this place is busy, but the server just never seems to be around. They never seem to have the beer selection from their menu. 

Only redeeming thing is the busser was always around to ensure we had water and drink refills.

Anyone got good recommendations for a new Italian restaurant? I'm open to suggestions at this point.

I guess I had high hopes when I finally had the time and reason to go to this restaurant,  I was thoroughly underwhelmed.  I have heard of Nora's Cuisine from tons of people.  They always say they are the best at Italian cuisine.  I for one as I said, was underwhelmed.  We had their garlic bread basket and all have to say is that it is definitely garlicky!  I am not sure if it's the an area that they're representing, but whatever it is, the food either was under seasoned or intentionaly just bland.  I ordered the Chicken Masala that came with a side of pasta with tomato sauce.  The Marsala was cooked very well and tasted awesome.  The side of pasta was another thing altogether.  The pasta was way too al dente!  The sauce lacked any seasoning.  It's like they opened a tomato sauce can and just put iton top of the undercooked pasta. My partner ordered the Chicken Parmigiana.  I don't know about you but I always associate parmigiana with a bread crusted, flattened chicken breast.  Apparently, that ain't so!  The chicken wasn't breaded at all.  He also has the same complaint about the tomato sauce: bland.  After a lackluster dinner, we opted to have the chocolate souffle which we ordered at the beginning of the meal.  I have to say, this concoction of chocolate souffle with vanilla sauce and pistachio was pure heaven.  But this dessert won't change my review of Nora's.  

One other point of contention that this place needs to revise: their waiters just plain suck!  The waiter in charge of our drinks was very attentive, but the main waiter who took our order barely showed his face.  We had questions and he wasn't around.  When he was around and we asked why the chicken wasn't breaded for my partners' Parmigiana, all he said was, "I don't know.  Weird right?". I was baffled to say the least.  We finally got our answer by looking it up on Wikipedia.

I have to say, Nora's really FAILED to impress me.  For our 4 year 11 month anniversary(we're leaving Las Vegas and wanted a nice celebration in the city before we left), Nora's just didn't deliver the ambiance we were looking for.  They need to fix their wait staff and warn their customers on which area of Italy they are representing.
Loved this place.  Ordered the Baked Rigatoni...Delicioso!  Went in on a Saturday night as a walk in for a first date...did not disappoint.  :)

If your looking for flavorful Italian food, Nora's is the spot! My cousins were visiting from California and happened to be craving delicious Italian food. I recommended Nora's and couldn't be more proud I took them here. They absolutely loved it. Customer service was great. There was a wait but it went by so fast! On Fridays and Saturdays they have a live band playing music which I find ideal! Oh and their red Sangria is REAL sangria. Tastes strong but delicious especially if your trying to feel good =)

I found this place after trying to go to some places that had terrible parking.  This place had a nice big parking lot and a heater outside to warm people as they entered the restaurant.  I didn't have a reservation but they still immediately seated me and service here was fantastic.  The waiter and busser was very attentive and nice.  I ordered the caprese salad, and Lasagna.  The caprese salad was different.  It had an actual salad with it instead of the normal, Mozzarella cheese, tomatoes, and basil with olive oil and basalmic vinegar.   They taste was very good and I would order this again the next time.  The garlic bread was wonderful.  Full of garlic and butter and very tasty.  First order is free with meal and second order they charge a small fee I think $2.  The meat lasagna was pretty tasty but little on the small side.  I guess it was ok because I was completely stuffed after the meal.  The bathroom was clean and interior décor was little old style.  Overall a good meal and would repeat visit here again.

I'm always looking for places where the locals eat - chain restaurants are the same everywhere (which I suppose is their appeal).  Nowhere is this more true than Las Vegas.  Everywhere a traveler goes is greeted by chains, cheap "bargain" places that scare me, or fancy culinary experiences that may be great, but not necessarily affordable by a family of four.  That's why it's worth finding what the locals like.  Nora's Cuisine is such a place.  

Our first mistake was not making a reservation - its very busy on a Saturday night with an active, upscale bar crowd and live music.  We sat in one of two other rooms which was also very nice and not too noisy.  

The food was quite good and very reasonable, especially considering that the portions were large and filling.  The menu was varied and interesting, so my two picky eaters were happy.  

Make no mistake; I've had much better Italian food, but this place was comfortable, friendly, not too fancy (Jeans OK, shorts no), and good service for a decent price.  The next time in Vegas, I'll probably return.

Phenomenal food, service and ambiance. 

My gf and I double dated with another couple here late on Friday night. I was a bit worried to sit down for dinner after 10:30, but my worries were quickly dismissed upon arrival. 

There was a band playing some jazz music in the room to the right and we were seated far enough away from the band to where we could talk but still hear the music faintly in the background. I was very happy about this because sometimes loud music blaring in my ears can be a turn off during dinner time. I like conversation, what can I say. 

I discovered that upon checking in on Yelp, I received a free glass of wine. AMAZING! Our friends ordered the sangria which they could not stop raving about! I highly suggest ordering this if you love sangria because it is some of the best I have ever had. 

We began our meal with an order of Arancini. I've never heard of or seen this on a menu before, but when my girlfriend saw them she went nuts. They looked like meatballs but were fried balls of risotto, cheese, peas, and meat sauce. Incredible! I could have eaten ten of them! Our waiter also brought out a basket of garlic bread and I thought it was excellent. 

We opted to share the special for the evening upon our server's recommendation, which was Chicken Mount Etna. This dish was really unique. I have never had anything like it. The chicken was cooked perfectly with some mozzarella cheese and peppers and was served on top of crispy, fried, angel hair pasta (think ramen noodle texture?) with a balsamic sauce/reduction and topped with onion strings. Strange combinations for an Italian restaurant, but REALLY REALLY GOOD. I cannot stress the deliciousness enough. It was a perfect portion for us to share, but I couldn't resist ordering a side of penne a la vodka (I'm a sucker). Their vodka sauce was delicious! 

For dessert, we pre-ordered the warm chocolate cake. I'm not a chocolate cake fan, but my gf loved it as did the rest of the table. 

Our server was amazing. My drink was never empty and he made some really great menu suggestions. Even though we were one of the last tables in the restaurant because we started late, I did not feel rushed or get the vibe that they were waiting to go home. Everything was perfect. 

I recommend this spot for a date night, dinner with friends, or any time you want some home cooked, reasonably priced, off the strip Italian food.
My Favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas, everything is great. Prices are awesome.
Very nice and clean. Food was great. Bathrooms were neat and tidy. Service was excellent. I'll definitely return when I'm in town.

i wrote one on my phone but i guess it was for the actual check in...

checked in and got a free glass of chianti!

i ordered the linguine with red clam sauce. awesome! the clams werent in the shell so that was awesome! but that could also mean it came from a can. tien n and anthony m order pastas as well. pesto and i forgot the other one... we got two desserts. one was a canoli with chocolate chips and pistachios. ZAM ZAM! and the other one was a tiramisu type of dessert with ladyfingers. ZAMMMMM! haha

the customer service was great. theyd check on us every few minutes asking if we wanted more water.

only complaint is that the floor smelled like mop bucket water....
Another great place to eat with great service and awesome customer service. Pricey but worth it. I recommend the anti-pasta salad. Call ahead for reservations so you won't have a long wait.

Really good Italian food. The antipasto was absolutely delicious and the garlic bread was good too. My husband had the pork tender loin and I had the veal scallopini, delicious. I used the Yelp coupon for a buy one glass of sangria and get one free, I wasn't wild about this though since I have had better. All in all it was a delicious diner and we will be back.

Amazing!! It was already crazy at 5:45 on a Tuesday, so make sure you have a reservation! We had a drink at the bar while we waited. My pour of wine was generous and Hub's mojito was delicious. 

We started with bruschetta pomodoro and arancini. Both were delicious! The arancini were crisp, but not greasy and came out to the table piping hot. For our mains, Hubs had gnocchi ala vodka which he enjoyed. I had pasta carbonara, which was prepared a bit differently than classic carbonara, but was delicious!! The pasta was nice and al dente, which is always appreciated. 

One of the things that impressed me on top of the delicious food was how well run this place was. They have quite a large staff. Hosts/hostesses/servers/bussers/food runners. Everyone was on top of their respected positions and everyone worked effortlessly together. A very well oiled machine, management should be very proud of how flawlessly the staff here executes. I will definitely recommend Nora's to anyone finding the self in Vegas.

The "Rigatoni Special" is so freaking good! The savory sauce is to die for...By far the best Italian spot in Vegas. "Crazy Alfredo",  and "The Chicken Parmagiana" were also very good. A must when here in Vegas if your craving a little piece of Italy! Enjoy!
OMG!! Amazing amazing. The salmon picatta is literally to die for!! I havent stopped thinking about it since it hit my taste buds! Our server was awesome and we had a really good anniversary dinner!!

I was recommended to go to this place for a long time and when I finally did I have to say I was fairly impressed. I ordered the veal Parmesan and my friend order the pork tenderloin with roasted red potatoes. The veal was really good but I have to admit the pork tenderloin that my friend let me try was even better . The roasted red potatoes were unbelievably tasty. Great Italian food and not pricey at all. Definitely going to go back

So me and my husband were staying at the Stratosphere hotel off the Strip and being 8.5 months pregnant - I got a craving for Italian food. 

Me and my husband looked into restaurants and the distance stated it was about 15 minutes and ultimately ended up deciding to go there. Yes it was further out but I couldn't make up my mind and figured "hey I'm starving. And indecisive so let's just go there before I start changing my mind". 

Best dinner I've ever had in all my Vegas trips! 
Which is about 10-15 times. 

The service AMAZING! The food also amazing! 
We enjoyed the whole time we were there! 

It's so nice outside also. 
It reminds me of a Olive Garden but nicer and food tasted more genuine/authentic.

This is the best spot we've found in Vegas. Find Rudy at the bar and rest assured you'll be treated to  a unique and memorable experience! Wonderful food and spirits that can be found off the beaten path. Highly recommend!

This is the second time I've been to their new location, and it was so nice inside. I really like the design and atmosphere of the new place, and I'm glad they decided to relocate to a new building. It really sets to mood for Italian cuisine. We arrived passed 10 PM on a Friday night and they had plenty of seating. The hostess was friendly and seated us promptly. I forgot what our waiter's name was, but he was really attentive and friendly as well. 

I ordered the lasagna and my friend got the ravioli with meatballs, and we shared a house salad. My friend said that her meatballs were cold, but the waiter put in another order and they were out right away. I usually order their specialty items which I really enjoy, but this time it was a little on the plain side. The lasagna was lacking a bit in flavor, however it was a big portion and I had leftovers for the next day. The house salad was good and fresh, although I prefer their Antipasto salad because it's huge and filling plus it comes with plenty of ingredients. Oh, and we also ordered the Sangria which was quite tasty! 

Overall, it was a great experience especially since we stayed till after 1AM! And they didn't even rush us out or anything! There were still two tables on the bar side of the restaurant, and they didn't seem to be in a hurry to leave even after we left. I felt so bad because I didn't even realize that it was so late! So when I realized, I was so embarrassed and I immediately began to apologize the the staff. The staff was really nice and laid back, and they reassured me that it was completely okay because there were still customers eating and it's often the case that they stay very late to clean up. It just seemed like a regular day at the office to them, except they had such great attitudes about it. I presume that they have good management, because it really shows in their attitudes! If I could rate it with a 4.5, I would...I would have usually given a 5, but this time I felt the food was lacking that punch. Either way I just really, really like the new location...beautiful atmosphere, exceptional service and great food!
Fabulous food. I always look forward to eating here when in town!! The garlic bread is the best I have had. Great service and very clean.
Great hospitality and amazing Italian cuisine. It's a piece of Italy located in Las Vegas.

This was my first visit to Nora's and it did not disappoint. We sat outside on the patio and started with drinks and appetizers. The antipasto was delicious and so were the risotto balls. I had the spinach cannelloni, my one friend had the crazy Alfredo and the other shrimp scampi. They were all incredible with very large portions. Service was great too.
Went here on valentine's day for the first time WoW this place is awesome I will be a regular here shrimp scampi is an A+
Finally found it. Unreal service and incredible pizza / pasta dishes. Will be a routine visit going forward.

I was happy with the prices here.  Italian restaurants can be pretty pricey but it wasn't that bad!  The service was crap.  The bf and I were at at this restaurant for a little under two hours and had food in front of us for about an hour of it.  The sangria was good and we gladly took advantage of the check-in offer of buy one, get one free.  :)  Bf said his food was cold and my food was subpar.  I honestly have found it hard to find good Italian food so in comparison to other Italian restaurants it was a little above average.  If you can cook good Italian food I would just stay home and cook for yourself. The chocolate lava cake was also very average.  In our young 20's and we were the youngest people there by far.

The new place is gorgeous , we had a big party and I tried several things . I really wasn't super excited about what I tasted , ambience is great , but food wasn't as good as I expected ?? I had cesar salad was ok , calamari was really good , antipasto salad was tasteless . Several other people ordered more main dishes and said they were ok , I would possibly go back again and order something different ....

I'm not from Vegas but a friend that used to live there took a group of us here for dinner and i thoroughly enjoyed it, esp getting off the Strip and going somewhere that is just your typical good family Southern Italian restaurant, much like i'd find in my town. 

i thought the service was great (waiting on nine young loud women for a pre-bachelorette dinner can't be easy, but the general boisterous atmosphere helped) - our waiters told us about the group menu option since we were a group of nine, and that made things so much easier. thus, we were able to eat family style and we tried a variety of reliably good dishes, including gnocchi, veal marsala and meatballs. for $22 per person, it was a great deal, esp given the amt of food we got. 

my only complaint about the food is the tiramisu - it was just way too mushy and watery.

My friend took me to this place since I was visiting town and what can I say, amazing! We had made reservations and the staff greeted us and immediately sat us down. The service was excellent and everybody was very attentive. My friend had lasagna and I had a shrimp pizza (I added alfredo sauce) and they were good. Lasanga was not all that, but the pizza was on point. Definitely try this place.

Cons: was a little too loud for my type of ambience.

Amazing food, amazing service. This is one of the few Italian restaurants I will take my friends to. It's a hidden gem. I do recommend making a reservation ahead of time, just in case it's busy since I've always seen the place packed whether it's a week night or weekend. Personal fave is the Tortellini Alfredo with chicken. My family loves the Crazy Alfredo and traditional dishes like the Marsala, too.

I recommend making dinner reservations b/c this place gets super crowded! Can't be mad about it though b/c the food here is delicious. ;) I like to try a different pizza and pasta every time I come here, especially for lunch to avoid a crowd.
This place never disappoints! I've been a frequent flyer since I was young. The new location is beautiful. FYI they literally have the best steak in town (steak at an Italian joint?! Try it!)

Saw the great reviews here, but was disappointed. Meat sauce for my pasta was greasy, salad was very plain, service was fair...bar was very very noisy for a weeknight and you can here it very easily in the dining area. Location is in a grimy strip mall

I came here with my girlfriend on a date and we ordered the veal scallopini, Alfredo with chicken, garlic bread, 2 sangria's, and the tirimisu. We decided to take advantage of their buy one get one free sangria offer, which their sangria was really generous in amount and pretty strong. Their Alfredo was not bad too, the veal had a pepper white wine sauce that was pretty good. Im not a fan of places that make wine reduction sauces that you cant taste any wine in, but theirs was distinctive and good. The veal was soft, and it came with an extra spaghetti plate. The first garlic bread you order is free, and nothing tastes better than free food! The bread was soft and they use real ground garlic on it, unlike some cheapie places. We also preordered the chocolate cake because it takes 25 min to prepare, but our waiter forgot to put it in, and gave us the tirimisu for free which was really nice. It was really moist and had a lot of rum it.

The ambiance is finer-ish dining and had live music very resemblant of smooth Frank Sinatra. Parking was a little packed but still not impossible. Overall it was pretty good, i wouldnt mind returning again.

This place is nothing special. It's on the same level as Macaroni Grill or Applebee's. :( Just costs twice as much; has super slow wait staff; not enough parking; and dirty dishes; and serves Italian dishes that don't satisfy my cravings.

It's date night with Hunnie Bunnie and she's stumped on where to go! I've been trying to go to NEW places so I Yelped Italian Restaurants and Nora's popped up. I checked the menu and they have Frutti Di Mare! Clams Shrimp Mussels Calamari with red sauce and fettuccine! I'm SOLD. 
I started with a glass of Red Sangria which wasn't bad - it was actually in a BIG ASS wine glass AND it was pretty strong. They also have a Yelp check in offer for a free second glass so I tried the White but I didn't like it - our server replaced it with another red one for me. Great! 
They serve complimentary garlic bread which is SUPER garlicky so OF COURSE I loved it. 
We started with a House Salad which wasn't bad. I ordered the Frutti Di Mare - Our server asked if I liked spicy at all and I said Yes! Make it EXTRA spicy. I ordered Spaghetti and Meatballs for Hunnie Bunnie and he asked if I would like to just do a Side of Spaghetti and Meatballs? Yes for sure! 
The side came out and was the perfect size for her with one giant meatball on top. 
Mine came out and the seafood was fantastic - LOTS of calamari and BIG mussels and shrimp! It wasn't spicy though so I dumped red pepper flakes on it. 
The server was great and Hunnie Bunnie also loved it because they have paper table covers so she colored all over it.
We also had dessert: Oreo Tartufu. Cookies n cream ice cream in a chocolate shell. HB LOVED it.
We love this place.  Has beautiful atmosphere and great food. Plan on staying awhile,  they ALWAYS have a wait, just plan accordingly.  Rigatoni was to die for. Parking is kinda disaster.

My first time here. I would describe the place as very airy and nice. The staff friendly. Started with Areci (?), which were cheese balls in red sauce, it was delicious. Had their linguini with clams, and I was impressed with the taste and amount of food. Also had their steak sandwich which was really good and cooked to order. I'm not too big on Italian cuisine at times but this place impressed me. Prices were also reasonable. Rest assured, I will be back.
Wow best Italian food ever!! Had the crazy fettuccine alfredo and carbonara! Get off the strip and try something so worth it!! So affordable too!! Will be a regular here!

When your diet allows for Italian and carbs, this is the best place. I love eating at the bar, when there's room of course. The bartenders are cool.

Pasta Nora is my favorite dish. Spag and meat sauce in bowl, covered by eggplants, and then baked to crisp-up the blanket of eggplants thats covering the pasta. Oh so good. 

Good selection of wine as well.

This place is amazing!
I have a friend who is not a pasta fan. Took him here and he loved everything about this place! 
The staff are very polite and very knowledgeable of their menu. 
The calamari is exceptional! 
Have never been disappointed in a single dish in this place! I recommend trying something new to you everytime you come! You won't be let down. 
Their veal Marsala and frutti de mar are amazing!!!!!!
Oh and that Branzino! Ughhhhhhhh, SO AMAZING! 
I can't wait to try something new next time!
Beautiful new location and the usual good food.  Service was the absolute worst...shame on Nora's.

Food was great however our service was horrible. I would have given them 5 stars because the food was so good, but we had to ask 4 times over 40 mins with two different servers before we got our appetizer bread. 

Then when it finally arrived it was barely enough for the four people at our table. Outside of this everything else was fine.

Wow. Twice in a week 
So me and my half decided to go eat over therefore time  after heard about their branzino fish and how great it is . 
Amazing place the vibe is great .  Bit loud but kinda flowing with it ...
We had to come back for that fish again but this time we finished with amazing desserts  (chocolate cake is crazy good )
Just earned a good customer

Excellent ambiance, live music selection from a college assemblage (jazz musicians), and not to mention the entrees. I just moved to Las Vegas and the same night my roommate took me here as a welcome to the Summerlin area. What a greeting! We didn't have a reservation, but he is somewhat of a regular, so upon speaking to Gaston (I childishly thought of the Little Mermaid-haha) he placed us at a table within 5 minutes even though people were waiting! Wow, I was impressed by the service! It's an intimate establishment that treats its loyal diners with reverence. 
We ordered a mini vegetarian pizza, a starter salad, vodka gnocchi and Alfredo ravioli. Excellent portions and flavors. I'll definitely return to sample another dish...maybe with him again!

This rating is based primarily on my food server. I have been to Nora's before. Even to the old location. Our waitress, whom according to the receipt, Nina, was very un-warm and  un-welcoming. She did not greet us cheerfully, she did not ask us about appetizers. I had to ask to start with one. Her demeanor was one of discontentment, almost like she "got stuck" with our table. Maybe she pre-judged us because we had a 9 month old with us, I don't know. My mom asked for lemon in her water, which she did not get. When she refilled my wife's tea, she only refilled mine about 3/4ths of the way. When the main entree came and she was removing the dishes, my mom said "oh my fork" and went to grab it, my wife witnessed her roll her eyes to the other staff member who was helping put the entrees down. Several times I saw her run her forearm across her nose to wipe it as she came from the kitchen. She never asked about desserts. She just had a subtle arrogance in her demeanor, almost as if she were somehow part of the family who owns the restaurant and she can do as she pleases, she kept going and chatting with the staff and sorta every now and then looking towards us. At the end, my mom asked her if she would take a picture of us and her reply was "can I clean the table first?" A few seconds later she did try to smooth it over by saying "oh I like a clean table." But her overall attitude was just rude. She wasn't busy running around with other tables to make this request a hassle. Overall food was good, and hostess was good, busser was good, atmosphere and new building and location were good. Just not her. However, my wife told me she did smile and wink at my wife at the end...

Dined here the evening of 3/9/10 (Tuesday).  My fiance and one of my best friend's had a reservation here at 8 PM.  The place was PACKED!!!   I could not believe how utterly busy this place was on a Tuesday night.  We arrived at 8PM and still had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated.  Upon sitting down at our table we were immediately served with fresh, hot and oh so yummy, garlic bread.  Our waiters were super friendly.  For appetizers, we started off with the mozzarella sticks and calamari.  Both were very delicious!  We split the small order of the antipasto salad which had: Romaine lettuce, mozzarella, pepperoncini, olives, onions, tomatoes, and rolled ham,  
provolone,and salame, served with our homemade Italian dressing.  It was soooooo good!!!  I ordered the Fettuccine Carbonara, my fiance ordered the linguine and clams and my friend ordered the spaghetti with meat sauce.  Every dish was outstanding!  The portions are huge,  you will definitely have left overs.  Service was also very fast and efficient.  We will definitely go back!

Some of the best Italian food in town! I don't care for pesto but friends wanted the pesto pizza, so that's what we ordered. It was sooooo good! I walked out of there so full, I was in pain but well worth it.

Had a great time! ! Food was sooo delicious! ..Party of 7 and everyone ordered something different, all dishes were excellent.  Service is great too, waiters are patient and attentive.  Highly recommended for something off the strip

Just tried the new location last night and the food is still my favorite Italian in LV but they really need to do something about the lighting, it felt as though there was a spotlight on us, very uncomfortable. The noise level is also an issue, we couldn't even talk to the person sitting next to us because the music was so loud. I do like that they now have outdoor seating so I'm hoping that if they adjust the issues with the lighting and noise I will be able to go back and give it a 5 star.

Recently my wife and I, along with some friends, stayed at the Gold Coast Hotel and Casino on Flamingo (See my detailed review). My buddy asked a local to recommend a good Italian restaurant. Without hesitation, Nora's was the choice. Since it was only a couple miles west on Flamingo we decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed. 

Our party of five arrived at 4:30 on a Friday and the place was already busy. However they were able to seat us in about five minutes. Great start. The server, whose name I wish I could remember, was wonderfully friendly. In fact, every one who worked there had a wonderful disposition while hustling to provide great service. We were very impressed. 

The dishes ordered by us included two dishes of spaghetti with marinara, one with sliced Italian sausage, Linguini and Clams (clams both in the shell and mixed in with the pasta), Spinach Cannelloni (my choice), and cheese tortellini with marinara. We also ordered a house salad served family style which was wonderful. There is also strips of garlic bread served with dinner. 

All the dishes were raved about. The servings were large without being ridiculous. My wife only was able to eat half of the Linguini and Clams, but since our hotel room had a mini-fridge she was able to take it back for a late-night snack. My Spinach Cannelloni has (of course) spinach, fresh pasta, ricotta cheese, mozzarella, covered in a tomato sauce. I was a little nervous about the tomato sauce but I needn't be. It has a wonderful flavor that complemented the stuffed cannelloni. Delicious!

Next trip to Vegas we will be back. Without a doubt one of the best meals we've had in the city in our many years of coming. Prices are also very reasonable for what you get. Great food, great service, great dining experience!

On our second go the service was once again top notch.  Our server (Don) was very friendly despite being rather busy with several large parties to attend to.  The wife had the baked rigatoni,  I had the Alfredo cabanara.  Before this, calamari with caper sauce (ecvellent). Her dish was tasty, mine was a bit too salty for my taste (thus the 4 star rating).  Other than that it was an enjoyable time.

I made reservations for dinner here on a Monday night.  The restaurant was pretty nice and crowded.  They had Booker's bourbon at a good price which is nice.  I ordered the rigatoni and my wife ordered pesto fettuccine with chicken.  They were both delicious.  The pesto was rich.  The rigatoni might have too many onions for some.  Both dishes were in the A to B+ range.  The cost was very reasonable.
Love it! The Original is the best! I enjoy this menu better than the summerlin location

So two lesbians walk in an Italian restaurant right? Lol...

The hostess looks at us and says "Yes, can I help you?" No smile, just attitude. 20-30 minute wait for a table so we opt for the bar. Bartender wasn't very attentive - asked us what we wanted to drink but didn't even give us a menu. We order a glass of wine which took ten minutes. Mind you we're at the bar and everyone else was already taken care of. The bartender comes finally and says she "spaced out." We finally order food and it takes half an hour, meanwhile the two other couples that say at the bar 15 mins after us already got their dishes. We only ordered a bowl of spaghetti - nothing too extravagant. The food finally arrives; there's hardly any sauce, the meat is burnt, and the noodles are stale. Long story short - the service was terrible and the simplest dish was horrible. We paid for the $8 glass of wine and went to Olive Garden.

Maybe it was because it's Friday night and very busy, but the service was less than adequate tonight.  My first martini was served in a very small glass and our waiter was not very attentive. Waiting to see how our food is.

I love the new place and it was my first time going with my girlfriend. Everyone is friendly and nice. Even talked to the manager that walks around and checks on the guest which is really nice. I order the ribeye steak and it was phenomenal! Had desert and their cannoli are amazing! Best in the town if you ask me. If you love Italian food come here it's great but it does get packed cause this place is really nice.

Best Italian restaurant in town...Ceasar Salad is to die for..garlic bread is delicious..house wine, I suggest red.  It's best make a reservation, the tables are usually all taken, the bars is full. This is local hot spot..everything I've had here is so good. I've been several times..

I've never eaten off strip before in Vegas so this was a first for me. I attended a wedding reception here and it was very well run. Service was superb. It always seemed like they were filling glasses and bringing out new food. I loved the baked rigatoni and the cannolis. I definitely would come back again!
Same as Usual, excellent service and wonderful tasty food. Stopped in after work to grab a quick beer and a bite at the bar. 5 StRS is just insufficient a rating.

If your looking for a classic old school Italian feel off the strip with a solid place that's been around a long time... Nora's meets that standard. Good for groups with affordable prices, big plates and staff that seem to look familiar time after time. I've been to Noras enough time I feel I can write a review based on consistency.  Things I continue to order are octopus (tender and a slight Mediterranean feel based on accompaniments), veal cannelloni, add sausage with anything, and vodka sauce.  Many of the dishes I've tried were good in their own right.
Good Karma! Great little place with a unique ceiling... Nothing like it in Vegas! The wine, pasta and the free sangria = zero complaints! Oh, and VERY cute male staff!!!! ;D not kidding...

The only reason this is a three-star review is because service was sooooooooo slow. We had a party of 8 and it took almost an hour from the time we ordered until we got our food. The food was very good and the Sangria (both red and white) was delicious, but it just took too long to get our food. I had a pizza and was very happy. The sauce was good, the veggies were all fresh tasting and well cooked and the crust was crispy on the outside and chewy inside. I would definitely recommend Nora's to friends if they don't mind a bit of a wait.
Nora's never disappoints! The food is consistently outstanding and the quaint atmosphere is comfortable and appealing. Chicken Carciofi was soooo good. And their cheesecake is to die for!

Was so looking forward to our dinner at Nora's. I was disappointed.  I emailed my complaint and never heard. So turned to Yelp. Food was not particularly good. As a meter of fact it made all three of us I'll. service was poor. Took forever to get waited on as well as seated even though we had reservations. We have eaten here in the past and the good was great. What happened? New chef? I am sad to say we will not be back.

I won't be visiting here again. As we sat down, it took 10 minutes before anybody even checked up on us. We waited far too long to receive our food and to be honest, you can find better Italian food else where. Our server never even checked on us to see how we were doing. A simple "how is everything?" goes a long way, apparently that's too much for them to do. I wouldn't recommend going here.
