This was fantastic!!! Best italian I've probably ever had. First, we had reservations at 7 and we were seated at about 710. We each had a glass of wine, we ordered the house salad regular size, and shared it(plenty big for 2 ppl) brushetta, and for our entree's I ordered the eggplant parm BEST I'VE EVER EVER EVER HAD!!! I always order eggplant parm anywhere we go that offers it..this one takes the cake! He ordered the gnocci(spelling?) In vodka sauce and requested it spicy.. he gave it a 10 and this is a man that gives everything a 8 that he likes.... we finished with the fresh out of the oven chocolate lava cake TO DIE FOR! The food came out with perfect timing one thing after another...cant wait to come back...see you next week Nora's!!!

The best Italian you'll ever have. Their food is incredible, their portions are huge and their staff is friendly. I wish they were in Los Angeles.

My favorite is their carbonara. They also have a delicious calimari with a pesto-red sauce. And their garlic bread is to die for.

When in Vegas we make it a point to dine at Nora's.  Yes, Chicago has many wonderful Italian restaurants, but Nora's is a treat while on vacation (usually around my birthday).  I suggest making reservations as they get quite busy especially on the weekends.
They start you off with a basket of garlic bread, so delicious!  When I was there last I had the Osso Bucco.  It was probably the best I have had in years.  It was tender and just plain phenomenal!  Had to pass on dessert, ate too much of the main course! 
Definitely a place be a regular!

When I refer people to Nora's they're a little taken aback, because of the location. But they're always impressed. The eggplant parm got me in the door. The tasty garlic bread & good service kept me going back. It's fairly easy to get in & out during lunchtime (a popular place for business lunches) & you can call orders in for pick up. The ambiance is kicked up a couple notches for dinnertime so you'll need reservations (quite nice for an intimate dinner).

Rushed to make kitchen close. Restaurant and bar are still full. Plenty of tickets working in the open kitchen. Sat at bar 9:56. Tried to get dinner menus from bartender. A languid tender finally hands us a cocktail menu. We ask for dinner. 3 minutes later after interrupting her digging through her purse behind POS we get an insincere "Ohhh, sorry the kitchen closes at 10." Last night they just left the phone off the hook b/c they were slammed. What's the point of locals' joints if you get treated like a meaningless outsider? The seating's great, but the lights are way too bright & cold. It's a reflection of the staffitude here. The new Nora'a could care less about hospitality; Therefore I can care less about it. Better off 10 mins. away eating proper Italian at a Batali joint or something...

I was visiting from California when I yelped for a good Italian Resturant .  Nora's came up and decided to try it.  I have to say it was the best decision !!  The food and service was excellent!  The restaurant  atmosphere is very welcoming .  Our server Sebastian was very professional and knowledgeable .  Loved the food especially the sausage, calamari and the  Ossobuco was absolutely amazing !  I can't wait to go back .  

The tap water was super tasty!

Satisfied my craving for Italian food. 

Must order: crazy Alfredo. Creamy and delicious. I could not stop eating it! 

Rigatoni special: pretty good. 

Calamari: sauce was ok.

I wish I could try more but the portions huge.

A great place in Las Vegas. A locals favorite. Off the strip. Great wines, a good menu and very good food. Get there no later than 5PM for a table seat- otherwise you'll have to sit at the bar and eat- not the best place to enjoy their ambiance and food. It is crowded and if you wish to get bumped in the back by bar patrons sit at the bar. 
You will really enjoy the food, it's a first rate Italian restaurant and harkens back to those in San Francisco or Boston.

Nora's is single handily the best Italian cuisine, and I mean authentic Italian cuisine! The dish I ordered was the linguine with clams  with the white sauce, I was not ready for the flavorful cauldron of deliciousness! It was loaded with clams and the sauce was majestic! Just tasteful! For appetizer we ordered the  fried calamari, it was fresh and delightful! I will sure be coming back for another delightful evening! Thanks Nora's staff and chefs!

We used to go to Nora's all the time and just tried the newer restaurant and was very disappointed. We ordered steak, pasta Nora which both came to us cold. The bread was soaked in butter and the fries were extremely salty. Very disappointed with the quality of food.

I have been going to Nora's when they only had one suite and Nora was serving the meals.  I love there food, especially Nora's salad.  The only downfall is that I wish they would grate their parmesan fresh.

Was in vegas (woohoo) and went here for dinner with my bffs fam. With a reservation it was about an hour wait... :/ but we were finally able to sit down and eat! I ordered the chicken fettuccine alfredo. It was good. no complaints I just enjoy the sauce to be a little thicker.

We recently visited Nora's with our friends. The experience and food was average. The hostess had a cold attitude. No smile,  didn't feel welcomed. They made us sit down and did not even lay the napkins and cutlery . We had to request for it once appetizers arrived. Main course was served all cold,  meat had no flavour . The worst part is that their service and food does not explain me why this restaurant menu items are priced on the higher side. To top it all they do not serve fresh grated parmesan once the meal is on the table.  Bummer! We were given stale geated parmesan cheese in a glass jar.

The garlic bread basket was nice and a promising start to our meal. We had Tortellini Alfredo and Chicken Marsala. The Alfredo sauce was ok, not the best...it lacked a depth of flavor but the tortellini were delicious. The Chicken Marsala was very flavorful but the spaghetti with tomato sauce that was served with it was mediocre and the sauce was a little tangy. The service was really slow, they were slow to refill our drinks, slow to get us the check, slow to pick up the check.

Nora's is my favorite restaurant.  I enjoy the ambiance, food, staff & service.  Every time I dine at Nora's I have a pleasing experience. My favorite dish is the lasagna- seriously the best lasagna I have ever had.  I also recommend the berry explosive cocktail- delicious.  The prices are reasonable and I find the location quirky and interesting.  I'd be lying if I said I wasn't nervous about them moving to a new location.  I'd also be lying however if I said I wasn't going to still patronize them.  They have a customer for life in me.  I highly recommend Nora's for all of your Italian favorites, date nights & special meals you want to share with special people.

what an awesome restaurant and the bartenders makes great drinks! very relaxed environment and good for dates or family outing! worth the price! the salmon is always perfects and moist!! i'll always go back to this place! haven't been unhappy once.

Great italian restaurant. The antipesto salad is amazing. I also order the chicken herba fini which is also great. The prices are also amazing for a fine dining restaurant.  2 people can eat for under $30.

This place... First time here... Omg. I had spaghetti with meat sauce. It was so amazing.  Complimentary garlic bread is solo good. There was 4 of us. We all had something different.  They agree with me.  Definitely coming back.

Great food fun atmosphere I hear that Nora's is more moving to a larger location I hope the move doesn't change the place much. I love there food I had chicken Marsala and it was so tender and flavorful. Nora's has a great wine selection and large variety of menu items at a fair price. Save room for the in house made Italian desserts it was so good.
Not a good night for these guys, usually much better experience.  Ordered for pick up.  Pasta fagioli had no pasta in it, wish I was kidding.  Pool of grease from the chicken wings.

I am eating now at the new Nora's location , place is way too cold and the light is son bright, makes you feel very uncomfortable !!!!!! For is the same , people are yelling at the bar !!!! I liked the old location so much better . 
very disappointing . I WOULDN't recommend it anymore !!!!

So delicious! I recently had dinner here for a friend's birthday, which consisted of a smorgasbord of different appetizers.  Usually, I am quite the picky eater and though I'm open to trying different dishes, it's rare I enjoy everything.

This was one of those rare occasions!

Shrimp scampi was my favorite, but the caprese salad (buffalo mozz - oh so delightful!!), focaccia bread, garlic bread, antipasto salad...it was all amazing.

The service was fantastic as well; so were the espresso martinis we had for dessert.  Next time, I'm trying a full meal.  Thank you, Nora's!
The service is GREAT!!! Very handsome staff! The food is very good and a nice atmosphere.
Amazing food and top notch service. I took the Rib eye and side potatos and it was delicous!! If you on a biz trip and want to impress your client, take him here

Far and away the best Italian food in Vegas. Amazing food and great prices. The way Italian food should be. They are a model that all Italian restaurants in Las Vegas should strive to be as good as.  The best garlic bread in the world. The most amazing Arrabiatta sauce on the planet. This is not only the best in Vegas it is the best I have ever had. You cant get better than Nora's Family run the way Italian establishments should be. Great service, amazing wine selection and full bar. I am always nostalgic when the sons were servers and Nora'was in the kitchen cooking long before they expanded twice.  I miss the 4 tables they used to have but happy they are doing so well now. A place you have to try. If you don't like Noras you don't like Italian food. WARNING: Garlic will seep from your pours for days. All worth it but be warned!

The food was really great, it just wasn't what I was craving so I left a little disappointed. I feel like it's my own fault because I ordered the wrong thing. 

I got the baked ziti, which was great. However, I was in the mood for a really yummy meat sauce and this dish was mostly ziti. My husband got the "crazy" Alfredo and thought it was good, but said he would get it without the sausage and jalapeños next time.

The wait was pretty long, they seem to seat you quickly with a reservation though. The service was not bad.

Order the chocolate cake with your meal, it takes 30 minutes to prepare. We didn't know that so we missed out.

It wasn't absolutely amazing, but good enough that we'll return someday.

I just had one of the greatest restaurant experiences here this past weekend and I had to update my review because of it. 

Nora's is a more upscale Italian restaurant and now they finally have the location that expresses how great they are. This family owned restaurant serves up great food with amazing customer service. 

Food:  For all the carb lovers, this place is a must go! You start off with some amazing garlic bread! This is made with fresh garlic and grilled to perfection. 
For starters, their salads here are AMAZING! They have the greatest antipasto salad I've ever had with a rolled up cheese/meat combination thrown into a great, fresh salad 
The crazy alfredo is the best item on the menu (and quite possibly the best item at any Italian restaurant). This is a must try!! 
For desserts we had the luxury to try the cannoli and Tiramisu. Both are five star and must at this restaurant. 

Service: we went on one of the busiest nights (Saturday on Valentine's Day weekend). And with that, the service was phenomenal. With a reservation, we were sitting down within 15 min and our appetizer was at our table within 5 min after ordering. 

I must acknowledge 2 people who went out of their way to make my Valentine's Day that much better! Jessika and Dayton both WENT ABOVE and BEYOND to make an amazing experience. 

Price: $15-$20 per entree. Our bill was $61 for 2 people (but we did get appetizers).

First thing that comes to mind is superb customer service. Two people assisted us. Will and ....darn. I forgot the other 1 but i remember their faces. Anyway, we ordered fried calamari and a salad as an appetizer. Fried calamari was good by itself. Not too salty. Just right and crunchy. No lemon or marinara sauce needed. Complimentary garlic bread came with it too which was really good. For my dinner entre I ordered the shrimp scampi which came with lingunie. The whole plate can fill you up without having an appetizer. We also ordered the cannoli for dessert. It's homemade with 100% riccotta cheese, bits of pistachio, and mini semi-sweet chocolate chips. I think the one at NOVE  is still the best I've ever tasted. Overall, a great Italian restaurant to dine in.

Great food, great service, outstanding live jazz, wonderful atmosphere.  The open kitchen and well appointed bar completes a place that feels so good for entertaining of just relaxing with a good bottle of wine and friends.

From the moment we walked in, the experience was fantastic. The delicious food was only matched by the incredible service. Large portions of homemade food at a reasonable price. If you want true Italian, you want Nora's.

I hate rating places based on service but here goes. So the bread was good. After 10-15(I'm giving her the benefit of the doubt)minutes of waiting for our server to come take our order we left. Literally watched her check 3 tables 4-5 times. Would've saved or something but we were seated outside.

A taste of growing up in vegas. I remember their expansions and now see they are planning a relocation. Came with my parents for a quick lunch. A shared salad, house red, and spinach pizza later. I realized Nora's has always been consistent with their food. Will likely come back each time I visit vegas.
Best food and service ever! Michelle was hysterical and took great care of us at the bar. Stop in and grab a seat at the bar and get entertained while eating amazing Italian food.
Food was amazing as always I have been a loyal To Nora's since they opened and would recommend hen to any one for a great dining Experence .

We visited Nora's recently and found the food good but not spectacular. The vodka pasta is worth trying but on our visit the pork tenderloin was overcooked and too salty. The salad that came with our meal was surprisingly pedestrian and contained thick chunks of iceberg lettuce some with dirty, brown edges. This slip-up in quality at such a well-regarded establishment was very disappointing.
Always great atmosphere, wonderful service and authentic food.  I make sure to go every time I am in Vegas.
This place is wonderful! The food and atmosphere are fantastic. I highly recommend it if you are in the mood for Italian!

This place is  really bad. A can of Chef Boyadee would be better than this crap. The linguini and clams were awful, they had the texture of sand and rubber. My mother in law had the nasty cold lasagna. The cheap tasteless bread  was the highlight of this dump. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!
Great Lunch Specials @ a good price. Great gourmet meals and special pasta dishes  special combinations .

My boyfriend and I went the day before Valentine's Day. This was our second time and we knew that it would be busy. Our reservation was at 7:30pm - they told us they were running behind so we did not sit until 7:50pm. Our waiter came by about 10 minutes later and took our drink order  I ordered the Red Sangria. Our waters and my boyfriends soda were constantly being refilled which was nice. After our conversations, our food came (lasagna and chicken parm), but I realized my cocktail never arrived. After awhile he brought it by and said it was comped which was nice. Overall it was an alright visit and the food was tasty! Just be prepared for a slower speed of service since this place is always packed and busy with hungry people!

I think 3 Stars might be generous. There are some other fairly good Italian places in Vegas. The only thing good about this place was that the prices aren't too high. 

The service was incredibly slow. 

We had Cabrese salad - Pretty good
Veal Parm and Egg Plant Parm along with Spaghetti with Marinara. 
The veal was pretty tough and the sauce tasted tinny as did the sauce on the pasta. The same was true for the eggplant. It tasted like they either over spiced with something or we were getting flavor from the cans they used.

This has become our go-to local spot for Italian.  It's always packed - so reservations are highly recommended, although we went the first time without, and they found us a table by the kitchen (which was really pretty interesting).
Food is great.  The Pasta Fagiole is a lovely starter, and their Signature Salad of Spinach, Farro and Gorgonzola is my new obsession.  Hubby had Veal Parmigiana - one of his new favorites.  The pasta is lovely and fresh, and the garlic bread is absolutely wonderful!  (Bring breath mints).  A reasonable wine list rounds out the evening, and the tiramisou haunts my dreams.

I'm shocked to know people like the food.  The service is better than the food.  I've given it a chance and I have gone three times not by my account but due to Birthday dinners invitations.  The presentation is nice but there is no flavor to the food whatsoever.  I have tried three different meals including desserts and I can't understand what people are talking about.  I think there is more hype and people have different taste buds and apparently it's boring.  Sorry, I won't be coming back I have had better.  I gave it two stars and not one because it's the food that counts and at least the people were nice.

Great food! Amazing service! I was here a month ago we sat in the dining room which was not the vibe we're feeling sitting at the bar... super casual yet elegant... Michelle (bartender) personable, engaging, funny and very attentive... 
Coming back for sure ..and definitely sitting at the bar!

Just absolutely stunning cuisine. Most authentic Italian Food in all of Las Vegas. Went in for the 1st time with a friend who recommended this place for our date night. Have to admit was a bit skeptical being from Bensonhurst Brooklyn. Was blown away by the food and was pleasantly surprised by the live jazz band they had performing (Saturday night). I will definitely be frequenting this establishment
Love the garlic bread and rigatoni special! The lasagna was decent but a little bland. Big portions.

We love this restaurant! Great atmosphere and the best mom and pop food in Las Vegas. Some food is better than most you really should ask your waiter. Great pricing and great music on Fri & Sat evenings. The staff is O-K, not much to brag about. They just aren't overly friendly like most fun restaurants. They basically seat you, take your order and bring your food. But the food is worth it!!! Their chicken cacciatore is to die for. I have them replace the tomatoes with the sun dried and it is even better!!!

Went to lunch at Nora's...first time being there. The place was packed and the parking lot was packed too. We had an assortment of appetizers and all were delish. Ordered the sausage it was delish. Casual atmosphere, service was good but the food was really good! Lunch prices in the mid range $12 on up depending on what your ordering. Will have to go back soooon!

We had our food to go so this review so I can't speak for the dining in experience. We came across this place on one of those nights were nobody feels like cooking and after attempting two other Italian places that were listed as open on Yelp but turned out to be closed, we found Nora's. 

Al Prosciutto Pizza - 4 Stars. Think a combination of regular run of the mill pizza with better ingredients. The crust wasn't super thick or super thin, def. not the artesianal-type but not chain-style either, rather just a nice middle ground. It had very little - basically no sauce or cheese as the first layer. The crust had been brushed nicely with olive oil and perhaps a light dusting of parmesan and large slices of sun dried tomatoes. The arugula and Prosciutto were added after baking but while the pizza was still hot, giving the greens a nice bit of wilt without being mushy, then more parmesan sprinkled on top. The only down side to this pizza was just too much garlic, and we actually like garlic, but this just had a bit too much. Deduct one star for that. I wouldn't want to have eaten it on a first date! If we ordered again we would just ask to hold the garlic. Other than that, great pizza. We had plenty of leftovers. 

Spinach, Gorgonzola and Farro Salad - 4 Stars. The farro was nice and tender and topped with a generous portion of fresh spinach. The salad was rimmed with large slices of fresh, firm tomatoes and topped with crumbled gorgonzola. The salad losses a star due to slightly too much dressing for our taste. I would ask for dressing on the side next time, but other than that, a really nice, fresh and simple salad. 

Rigatoni Special - 4 Stars. I wouldn't likely order this dish again, but that is because I don't happen to care for most of the meats in it, not that is wasn't good. The pasta was cooked to a nice texture and the sauce had a good flavor. A nice red sauce with just enough oil and spice to give it a little kick. The amount of meat in the dish was generous and the meatballs were flavorful and tender. The Italian sausage slices were what you'd expect, but if that's a flavor you like, then you'd be pleased. The sautéed green peppers were sliced very thick, making it so you could really taste their flavor as opposed to be little diced pieces you might miss in the dish. 

Pasta Fagioli Soup - 3 Stars. I didn't care for this dish so much. I felt it was lacking in a bit of taste - maybe some salt or something. It had a generous amount of beans and pasta, and the pasta wasn't mushy, so I'll just chalk this up the fact it just wasn't quite my thing, not that it is bad per-se. 

Bottom line, the place was pretty good and the prices were right. We'd definitely eat here again and check out some other menu items.

Nora's is a hard place to describe.  One thing I can say for sure - Nora's is very, very popular.  It recently moved from a strip mall location to a large, stand-alone building down the street, and even this larger space is packed every night.  Beyond that, I don't know if Nora's set out to be all things to all people, but it very nearly succeeds in reaching that goal.

Is Nora's a local hangout, family-friendly, with reasonable prices?  Yes, it can be.  My wife and I are locals, a couple of miles from Nora's, and we consider it to be a neighborhood joint.  You can get a lasagna or cannelloni for about 15 bucks, and leave full and satisfied.  (One thing about that family-friendly part - there are usually families with young kids in the dining room, and not all of them are, shall we say, well-behaved; so it can be kind of noisy in there.)

On the other hand, is Nora's a high-end, destination restaurant that draws tourists from the Strip?  Yep, it's that too.  And if you want Nora's to be a $$$ restaurant you can certainly start with the shrimp scampi appetizer at $17 and then have the veal chop at $40.  

My recommendation is to go with your favorite pasta dish.  Most recently, I had the Crazy Alfredo, which is sort of a paella made with fettuccine instead of rice, and was quite good.  I have also enjoyed the veal cannelloni a la vodka, and the fettuccine carbonara.  All of the pasta dishes I have tried have been rich, rich, rich, even for Italian food, so you definitely don't need multiple courses.  But if you do choose a starter, I would suggest that you stay away from the pasta faggioli - that was a dish I didn't care for.
Great restaurant for a large party. We had a group of sixteen and they didn't miss a beat. Great food, atmosphere and service. Fan for life.

Lets remember 3/5=average, 4/5=above average, 5/5=amazing.
I give this place a 4/5 came here friday April 28, 2017
Let break it down...

Overall experience 4/5
Reason being we had a 7:15pm dinner reservation, however did not get seated until after 8pm and waited another 20 minutes for bread and wine.  Our appetizers didn't get to us until almost 9pm.  Our server was Jessica...She was amazing.  The problem wasn't her it was the lack of policy the restaurant doesn't have in regards to large party payments.  Being a waitress prior I understand that a party of 10 w/separate checks will happen, but poor thing had two parties of 10 separate checks we witness as she served different receipt books.  So needless to say we understood how busy she was, but my gosh it's a friday night, couldn't the party arrange something else, or the restaurant have a rule.  Then the funny thing was, Jessica finally got to us and the other party interrupted in the middle of taking our order and pulled her back to the table.  Jessica was very kind and apologetic, but the restaurant owners should really put a stop to large party separate checks on friday/saturday nights.

Service 5/5
Jessica was very friendly and delightful, you would have never have known her chaos unless you witness it.  She never complained and never showed it on her face.

Food 4.5/5
In between above average and amazing.  Octopus was my favorite.  I love the jasper grilled items, great flavor.

Atmosphere 4/5
It is VERY loud inside if full.  Waiting area was very small and crowded with minimal sitting inside.  The decor is new and fresh, which looks great.  If in heels the floor is slick! BEWARE.  I will be excited to come back and enjoy the patio area under better weather.

We had a great evening and will return again!
A hidden gem in Las Vegas. I would give a 10.Food, service excellent.
I love this place! Their garlic bread is my fav! Very authentic! I always want something new each time! I have dined in, as well as take out! It's really a nice place for date!

Amazing Anniversary Dinner

They are open until 12am which was a plus for us.  Then the fact they had plenty of tables and a live band was really nice. The food was tasty and the beers were cold. They had a large wine selection too. We ended our meal with dessert and it was delicious. Thank you to the server and staff for making our Anniversary special.

Took my love here for din din on last night in Vegas. Would of went to Rao's in Caesars but had little Buster with us and wanted to be able to leave him in the car safely. Nora's is the kind of Italian restaurant that you would go to all the time if you lived in Vegas. Just looking around at the packed house you get the feeling that none of the diners are from the hotels. Had a decent veal parm plate. If I would change anything I would stop the use of the salamander.  The hot plate warning when the server delivers the plate has almost always been the first sign of a mediocre meal. This case was different as the veal was delicious and the melted cheese a velvet blanket of goodness. Can't wait to try it again next trip.

Aaaah what happened to you?? This was my favorite Italian restaurant of ALL time. I am sad to say that I will have to find a new spot:( 

I spoke so highly of Nora's, so when it was girl's night out, we had this place in mind. Parking can be a pain during the dinner rush because there are like 10 businesses sharing 50 spots. Make sure to give yourself some time for that. As for the restaurant itself, don't let the exterior fool you. The inside is nicer than the outside. To the right of the restaurant is the bar/lounge area and to the left is the more lit up family area. 

Service was pretty normal. Nothing special, she was nice and did her job. The average rating goes towards the food. Like I said, this WAS my favorite spot until now. Let me explain why. 

Garlic Bread: a few years ago it used to be thick slices of bread covered in butter with huge chunks of garlic right there staring at you. Bad breath for hours, but so good. Now, it's thin slices of bread with just garlic flavored butter. It's like something you could have bought in the frozen food section. 

Appetizers: Cesar salad was pretty boring. And $5 for a few pieces of lettuce was way overpriced. The truffle fries were pretty boring too. Just plain French fries sprinkled with Parmesan. Boring all around. The fries did have a good crisp though. 

Eggplant Parmesan: this is the ONLY thing I order off the menu. Pan fried eggplant covered with marinara sauce and mozzarella served with a side of spaghetti. Sounds good right? It was before. This visit I got a pile of mush. Maybe because they messed up my friend's pizza order so my dish was probably just chillin. Very disappointed. 

All in all, I probably won't come back to Nora's. It still beats Olive Garden, but maybe I'll just stick with Bootlegger's from now on.

My favorite item on the menu is the most simple...Penne with Tomato and Basil. We've been a customer since they only had 6 tables in the middle section (and did mostly take-out) 20 years! This is our go-to Italian restaurant in Las Vegas and where we take all our out of town company.

My husband and I had an early dinner at Nora's on Friday and we can't wait to visit again.  We are both bourbon drinkers and were very impressed with the extent of the bourbon menu.  Our favorite (Booker) was available and this bartender knew how to make a cocktail.  A very generous pour and $9 is practically a steal for this bourbon.  
We started with the spinach salad with farro which was a perfectly balanced combination with gorgonzola dressed in a delicious balsamic vinaigrette.
The mussels arrabiata had a nice zip to the broth and the mussels themselves were the largest I've yet to come across in Las Vegas.  We also had to try something from the Josper Grill and went with an order of the pork belly which was rich and grilled to perfection.  
We finished with the rigatoni gorgonzola with chicken and we fought this morning over who was going to take the leftovers for lunch.
In closing I must add that one of the hightlights of our dinner was our server Sebastiano.  What an delightful fellow and very attentive.

Amazing!

My best friends had their birthday dinner here. The parking is pretty limited. We went around 630 and the lot was pretty packed. Also it's in a strange location. I couldn't find it at first I was expecting it to be a bigger restaurant but I don't  judge. 

We decided to grab some drinks at the bar first. Lemon drop, bomb. Rose sangria, bomb. Moscow mule, bomb. That witchcraft drink, don't get! made me grow some chest hairs!

Finally seated, our waiter was amazing and very good looking I might add. We started with calamari. Very good, the sauce it came with was to die for. I ordered the Veal Cannelloni. Oh my gosh it was one of the best things I ever tasted. I honestly didn't know what veal was when I ordered it but it was amazing! My friend got the Frutti De Mare which was amazing also. It had a very seafood taste to it very different from my Veal dish but I loved both. 

They brought our tiramisu and a Canolli for my best friends birthday on the house. And that Canolli was heaven! It had pistachio crumbs and that just made it perfect. The tiramisu however, I've had better but doesn't mean it was good.

Must come back and I highly recommend!

Made reservations probably about 3-5 days in advance but when we arrived the hostesses could not find our reservation. It's pretty useless to make reservations. I also don't think they knew what they were doing, little did they even try to make an effort of communicating between hostess and guests. We ended up going to Casa Di Amor on East Tropicana. Which I highly recommend! Service was excellent! Staff was friendly and fast. Food was better! Plus, live music!

I think this is the hands down best italian place in Vegas. But you probably shouldn't take my word for it because I ALWAYS get the same thing here. The Frutti di Mare. Linguini topped with large portions of shrimp, calamari, mussels, clams... and a wonderful red sauce. I'm sure their other entrees are delectable if you don't like seafood. I would've given it 5 stars but the service is spotty since it's often so busy.

This is by far one of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to! The restaurant can get really busy but I can see why. The garlic bread, one word: Amazing. It really complimented the salad we ordered. I ordered the baked rigatoni and, just wow. I finished half of it because that rigatoni really fills you up! Sadly, I forgot the leftovers over there but hey, at least I had some of their delicious food. I made room for dessert and got the Oreo Tartufo and it was amazing! I devoured the whole thing! If you're looking for excellent Italian food, you should definitely take my word for it and come here!

My boyfriend had booked our dinner reservation on their website. He stated that it was our first time there and it was for my birthday. We arrived and were asked to wait while they got the table ready, not a big deal. We were seated and then proceeded to sit at the table for 10-15 before any one even acknowledged us. We eventually had our server come over who apologized for running late. She was going to take just our drink order but we had enough time to order our appetizer and dinner in addition to our drinks. We didn't want to risk not seeing her again. I got the Sicilian Mule (Moscow Mule) and my boyfriend got an Old Fashioned. My Mule was outstanding, could have used more Vodka but that's just me. My boyfriend thought the Old Fashioned was too sweet due to them adding an orange slice in addition to muddled brandies cherries. We got the garlic bread and the mozzarella sticks. Both were absolutely delicious. I got the seafood pasta which was great and my boyfriend ordered the primavera. We found ourselves unable to fully enjoy our meal for to it being unbelievable hot. Both of us were sweating like we were outside. We asked our server if there was a way to turn down the air, fully expecting them to say no. The server returned later and stated that it didn't go any lower, which I find hard to believe. We ordered the Oreo ice cream for dessert. The little kid in me expecting a small candle in it, since my boyfriend let them know it was my birthday, was crushed when it didn't come. Just the dessert by itself, no candle or cheesy little message saying "Happy Birthday". We were so disappointed by our experience of the environment and experience that it just didn't outweigh how good the food was. I have to say I was super disappointed, even more than I usually would be just because it was my birthday.

Been here several times and each time I didn't leave disappointed. The bar area is kind of tight to move around it but its tolerable. My favorite time to go is the weekends when they have this 3 man band play.  They play oldies from Sinatra to some modern music too. My goto dish is the linguine w/clams or the Fruti Di Mari.  Good stuff!  Plus their garlic bread is good too.  Aside from Olive Garden this is the only Authentic Italian place I've eaten at in Las Vegas.  I will try more... Check this place out... you might like it!!!

This has always been a must to on my list when visiting Vegas. That was at the old location.  The new location is pretty but we were told a 20 minute wait and it took 1.5 hours to finally get sat. 

The new place is so loud we couldn't hear ourselves or the waitress. It feels and sounds more like a sports bar than a decent restaurant. 

The food was still great. The manager walked around in circles and never offered to help his struggling staff or inquire about anyone's experience. 

I will probably return again when I'm craving a puttanesca, but sadly I am removing Nora's from my must do stops.

My all time favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas but don't be fooled by the outside. I've never had a meal there that wasn't awesome but my favorite of all is the Chicken Carciofi.  The service staff is very friendly, the bartenders are cool and the atmosphere is that of a comfortable local hangout that's your go-to place to relax and have a great meal at a reasonable price.

Great customer service! This is only our 2nd time here and our server, Brice, could remember our entire order, including drinks and dessert, from our 1st visit a few weeks back and even where we sat - seriously impressive! He was training someone during our 2nd visit, but he didn't miss a beat. I think that attention to detail and customer service is what keeps this place buzzing, even during weekdays. I really liked their spaghetti and meatballs/mushrooms since I've been craving a replacement for SF's Emmy's Spaghetti Shack, but what really leaves me craving this place is the pistachio cannolis! There's an option to get half-chocolate and half-pistachio, but I definitely prefer the pistachio. We've sat in the kitchen area and although a lot of workers come in and out of there, I actually enjoyed seeing everyone seamlessly go through the dinner service. I'll definitely be back to indulge on a cheat day!
Delicious every time. Great environment and service. Anytime someone visits from back home I make sure we make a spot by Nora's!

Consistently  good. We've  been  coming  here  for  12 years and  have  never  had a  bad  meal. In a town  replete  with  Italian  restaurants, Nora's is a standout. A local place  with  a  loyal  following, probably  due to  the  excellent  food  and  reasonable  prices.

First time at Nora's this past Saturday evening and have to say it was all I expected. Generous pours on the drinks, knowledgable servers and excellent food. Was surprised by the number of large groups including one of 20 in the main dining room. Not sure if that's the norm. A lot noisier than I expected, including multiple renditions of "Happy Birthday". If you're looking for an Italian experience that's a little more on the intimate side this place may not be for you. Otherwise, all was good except that our request for a table in the bar area which was made at the time of reservation two weeks prior was not honored. Hence, we were forced to dine among the groups.

I came here for my dad's birthday dinner on a Saturday evening. We had reservations so were seated within a few minutes. I wanted to sit on the patio but there wasn't any room because everyone else had the same idea. So, we got a nice seat by the window as a compromise. Our waiter was attentive and friendly. I got the Lemondrop Martini which was delicious. For my meal, I got the Chicken Parmesan which is one of my favorites. Everything tasted great and was made very well. I couldn't finish it sadly but it was delicious! The prices are high here but it is a more upscale restaurant so it's to be expected. It's a great place to come for special occasions!

I was excited to try this place because it's Liana's favorite Italian place when she lived in Las Vegas, so Dennis, Liana and I made a trip to Nora's before our flight out of Vegas. I usually review a place mostly for its food quality, but Nora lost a star due to its extraordinarily bad service. 

Let's start with the food first:
1) Pomodoro Bruchetta (3 stars) - but unless you're hankering for it, I say skip it... for tomatoes on toast, it's not worthy $7.
2) Truffle fries (4 stars) - very truffly, crunchy and delicious, but over the top salty.
3) Garlic bread (3 stars) - not bad, not great... it was made better by olive oil
4) Alla Nora (3 stars) - the eggplant was really dry, crunchy, bordering on hard to chew. The meat sauce had good flavors, but the spaghetti is also crunchy and dried out on the edges.  
5) Primavera (4 stars) - it's like a garden exploded on a plate. It's good, but after half of the plate the oils felt over powering.
6) Pappardelle with Wild Boar - not sure, since I didn't get to taste this dish, nor did we have a discussion about it... Dennis finished it, so it can't be bad. 

The pages of the menu were a bit sticky, that should have been our first warning, but one never really think of such things when your tired butt hits the seat. The bar service was actually reasonably good, other than the placemats being wet. We wanted to sit at a table, so as soon as one became available, we switched over. The first napkin was a bit dingy in one corner, but once reseated, there was a second set of napkin/silverwear combo, so I didn't say anything. My bread plate was coated with a thin layer of grease and a chunk of dried food on one side - had to ask for another one. Within 5 minutes of sitting down, we realize we were against the stage where the band (arriving in at this moment) will be playing. After being brushed behind the head with the cello, I got up to the hostess and asked to be reseated. She looked me straight in the eye and said "no - the table that's available is already taken." BY WHO? No one was there. 

No apology. 

I return to the table and me and my table mates sat stunned for about 5 minutes. At which point a man walks over and pulls a chair from our table and set up a tip jar right at our table. Liana about flipped out, and got up once again to request a table switch... this time asking a different hostess, and probably raising her tone slightly. 

We were reseated in the kitchen area with annoyance from the staff. 

Again, no apology. 

We had no water refills for 15 to 20 minutes and while the bus girl was responsive when we were able to flag her down, we were already rather displeased. The food was abysmally slow. 

Seriously, I am so irritated typing this review that I want to give them just one star, but I'm being judicious. 

I would not come back and I would recommend you don't go at all.

My best friend requested two things for her birthday: 1) To be surrounded by her friends & 2) To eat at Nora's. Luckily (for me) she got both! 

This was my first experience at Nora's, and WOW just isn't a big enough word to describe it. 

Employees? Fun, playful, attentive, offer their recommendations on menu items.
Atmosphere? Clean, dimly lit for great ambiance, colorful, busy (it was packeddd on a Thursday night, yet the room didn't feel crowded or chaotic.)
Food? Not just the best Italian food I've ever eaten, but some of the best FOOD I've ever eaten in general! Wine selection was great. Appetizers were hardy. All menu items were not outrageously priced (as you would expect them to be for a meal of this quantity AND quality.) 

Yes. Just, yes. Go now. I highly recommended it. 
If there is a line, wait. I promise it'll be worth it.

Noras has been my favorite Italian restaurant for  the past two years. My husband and I had not gone for dinner in probably 6 months. I was craving my favorite Fettuccine Carbonara all week so we decided to come for dinner last night (Friday, June 19) for our anniversary. Unfortunately the food gave me food poisoning. We had to cut our "date" short since I had the worst stomach pains. I know for a fact it was my food because I didn't eat most of it and brought it home. Today my husband had my left overs for dinner and now he has food poisoning. I'm not sure if I will be returning due to this recent experience. We also had calamari as an appetizer and that tasted great.

Sooo goood. At this time my sister, my brother and I went for my birthday dinner. We had the ossobucco, lamb and carbonara. Everything was delicious. We come to Nora's every time we come to Vegas. This place never disappoints. I highly recommend.
So good! Best vodka sauce and Italian dressing I've had.

I am completely satisfied with the crowd, music, ambiance and the special aromas that delight you when you enter this place. The staff was overall very kind and the dinner was excellent! The Shrimp Scampi dish was the best. The salad and bread was an excellent appetizer. The only gripe that I really have at Nora's was the wait staff. It seemed I never even seen the waiter the whole time we were eating and to tell you the truth if the waiter is not going to be on top of their game and they have the bus boy doing majority of the work they might as well stay at home. I believe our waiter will be fired in the near future if he keeps his ways up. Even after the bus person served us our desserts and toke great care of our family. I was surprised and irritated that the waiter took his time even taking care of our bill. Needless to say his tip fell shy of 10%. Times are tough in the economy. He should be so lucky to still have a job. Waiters in Vegas be aware people that work, meaning, the ones that still have jobs. They work hard for their money and when they go out they want excellent service. His butt was saved because of the great food and the Bus boy. Next time he may not be so lucky. 

Sean

Only had one dish for lunch today, so will reserve my five star review for when I have a proper meal at Nora's, but I was there long enough to know that the staff was friendly/professional, lots of space, the ambiance reminds me of old-school Vegas, which I like - and the dish I did order - the linguini with pesto and zucchini was delicious. Warning - the portion, even for the small, was pretty large imho.

Called around 3 and got reservations for 7:30.  Arrived a little early but we were sat within 5 minutes of our reservation time.  The place was very busy but worth it.  Service was pretty good and the food was excellent.

Started with the caprese  salad and then went with the chicken marsala.  Both dishes were very good.  The spaghetti with  the chicken was very good.  I really liked their red sauce.

Prices were pretty good for the quality food and service.

JFirst time visiting the new location. Busy and vibrant. As we walked in the the door the sweet aroma of garlic danced in the air. Calamari Fritti was perfectly cooked, golden and tender. We shared the Chicken Carciofi which was excellent! Bravo!

A noisy Italian joint with okay food. I was expecting much better. Daughter had sea bass, momma had eggplant parmigiana and  I had linguini with clams. It was just okay. Big disappointment.  Dessert was good. Tiramisu. Unfortunately, I wouldn't recommend this trendy restaurant.
Very cozy, friendly staff and affordable prices. Love the atmosphere and the food are awesome!
This was the first time visiting Nora's. The restaurant is very trendy and pretty!  It has great ambience !  We sat at the bar and really enjoyed our meals! The prices are excellent at lunch time!

It was my first time going tonight at 8pm and I am hooked. This place has really flavorful Italian food with such great prices! And they offer a free, huge glass of red sangria when checking in. Who doesn't like sangria! A+ just for that haha.
Soo let's start with the atmosphere. Seems pretty casual, some people were dressed nice but I'd say it's the same type of atmosphere as Cheesecake Factory. It's pretty packed and some people might consider it loud. Definitely make a reservation if you're going more than a two person party. My boyfriend and I were seated after a 5 minute wait on a Sunday @8pm and within that time we saw three larger parties come in with reservations. I've come to learn, busy=yummy :)
The first thing they brought out was a basket of garlic bread. This is how all other garlic breads should aspire to be. Real garlic and lotttts of it!! Off to a good start!
We ordered the Arancini as our appetizer. They were really flavorful breaded risotto balls with marinara sauce. Really good and I liked that the breading wasn't too thick. I was hoping it was a little more cheesy but it didn't need it. $8.95
For entree, I had the Rigatoni Gorgonzola with chicken. Again, super flavorful but not a bundle of flavors that you can't distinguish. You could really taste the Gorgonzola and the addition of mushrooms and sun dries tomatos made it heavenly. Large portion and extremely inexpensive at $14.95.
My boyfriend had the small (ahem* small is used very loosely here lol) Snow White pizza and added pepperoni to it. This thing was massive and a steal at $12.95. Wow. Sizing- Small:12", Medium:16", Large: 18". I stole a piece of course and I loved the crust!!  Soo good and not paper thin or focaccia bread thick. Very prominent garlic flavor and you could really taste all 4 cheeses they used, especially the ricotta.
Lastly, we had the Warm Chocolate Cake. My Oh My. Soo good. Make sure you order this with your entrees as it's a pre-order only. It had this creamy vanilla sauce and pistachios. I thought the pistachios would be a little over powering but they used it soo lightly that it was more like little hidden notes behind their masterpiece of a lava cake. It's actually very similar in texture and taste as Fleming's chocolate cake without the saltyness. $6.50
Our total bill for all four items before tip was $46. I'm not lying, I know, greaaat deal for the quality of food you get!
Our server was on point, very professional without being stuffy, as well as being fast and friendly. Our drinks were also never left even half empty. Great job! 
I really couldn't find anything wrong with place. I will definitely be back to try more items from their massive menu!!  :)

Were visiting the Las Vegas area for some fun.  We searched for an Italian restaurant and found Nora's. Wow, what a great meal and value. Our server Adam suggested a couple of dishes for my wife and I. They were both awesome! We will definitely be back.

Nora's in three adjectives: fulfilling, quaint, and poppin'. If you're on a diet, don't come here. Healthy portions and butter and oil go unspared here.

I love the service, all the waiters/waitresses are good looking,and the food is great.

This is theeee Best Italian Restaurant and Bar in Las Vegas... To start the mojitos were the best I ever had!!  the sangria a must !!!The Crazy Alfredo  and egg plant parm is always "solidly consistent like the service!!! I also always love the garlic house bread and the chopped antipasti salad is phenomenal!! You will never be disappointed eating or drinking at this perfect restaurant...make sure you make a reservation... I just had another 5 star dinner tonight... You need to try the outstanding Moscow Mule and they serve the best Mojito west of Havana!! Food is always so consistently delicious!! The service is also the best in town!!  The live music on Friday nights with Naomi Mauro singing jazz is always super talented and sophisticated.. She is a fantastic Vocalist!! I look forward to their brand new restaurant opening up in August!! Blessings and Congratulations to Nora's and the Mauro family!!

Nice place, great atmosphere however, I order my past al dente unfortunately, it was over cook. 
That's is only reason I give them 4 stars.
I love ordering their pizza for lunch, & I like that I can order by the slice & take it to go. I've been going here for years, absolutely love it!

This was the first time I have been to their new location.  I reserved the private room for my book club meeting and it was great.  It can seat 8-10 people but I must say that I would not go to Nora's if I were not in this room as the noise level was terrible.  I had the very parm with linguini and I know it said on the menu it was the leg but it was tough.  The others in my group enjoyed their meals.  Don't think I will be back there soon.

After many years, last night was the first time I've ever been disappointed with Nora's.  I ordered the rib eye as an appetizer, medium rare.  It came out well done and had a weird chemical taste.  The crazy alfredo was dry and the noodles were undercooked.

I really don't know where to start as I had heard this place is incredible! I read many Yelp reviews and some were great and a few not so great.  So, here goes.....I made a reservation for two at 5:45 on a Tuesday night.  We were welcomed by the hostesses and sat immediately. Our server asked for a drink order and I had read that the sangria was good but not enough fruit in it. The server asked if I would like to sample it before ordering a glass.  I thought that was top notch customer service.  It was a red sangria so I opted out and ordered a glass of Reisling. I normally don't order wine, but I thought I would treat myself.  The other member of my party (my 17 yr. old grandchild ordered a diet Coke).  Before I continue I would like to state that the server and waiter's assistants were incredible and my grandchild's drink was refilled at least 5 or 6 times.  We were brought complimentary garlic bread and it was delicious.  After we inhaled the first basket, our server asked if we'd like another and we couldn't resist.  We ordered the crazy alfredo that I had read so much about, and the server told me it was the most popular dish on the menu. That item was $22.95 which I consider pricey for pasta regardless if what is in it.  In addition I had always wanted to try bransino (a whole small sea bass) and decided to treat myself as it was pricey for my wallet at $28.95.  We also ordered a small white pizza that had beautiful mounds of ricotta for $13.95. Cutting to the chase.......The bransini was very dry and no flavor even though there was a spring of rosemary and a lemon wedge or two inside. The dish was served with a mound of dressed arugula salad which was the 2nd highlight of our experience.  The crazy alfredo was dry, the sauce was rather brown in color than your every day alfredo that is white.  The pizza was the highlight of the meal and the least expensive item. Our entire bill was $84.22.  We didn't finish the meal and brought home the pizza and pasta. I left a hefty tip for the pristine service.  I am going to make an authentic alfredo sauce to add to the pasta for tonight's dinner side dish.

Sat an hour after our reservation. Appetizers took another half hour to come out. Never had water refilled. First round of cocktails made at the bar were outstanding, second round at the table were awful. Food was pretty good, but the whole experience would not make me want to come back.

First time back since they moved to the new building. Very nice location, better seating, better parking, nice and new. Service was still top shelf, we were treated well. Food still awesome. I have no complaints with the new location but have to admit, I did dig the "cool factor" of the old hole in the wall. Agree that they needed to upgrade and they did it well. Congrats on the transition. We will keep visiting as long as the food and service remains like it always has been. Tip, make a reservation. Still a busy place.
Nora's is absolutely delicious!!!! Make sure you get Bryce & Kasey!!! They're amazing!!!!! I could eat 30 pounds of the Broccoli Pasta! Locals favorite!

Stopped by this place 3 weeks ago to check out the new location. There was over a hour wait so we left, made a reservation and came back the next week because I wanted to see what the big deal was about this place. The service was ok, nothing special, but being so busy it wasn't a big deal to me. The food was outstanding, and very affordable. My wife and I had different veal dinners, and were both excellent. Good wine menu, overall was a great experience and will def be going back.

went to nora s for diner and I'm italian from brooklyn. it was such a horrible experience.
starting from the moment we walked in the door. service was horrible and the food was even worse.pizza was horrible to start.our drinks tasted like crap and the salad and main course was so horrible we have no idea how this place has lasted as long as it did.the only thing we could think of is vegas locals don't know any thing about italian food and this place will take full advantage of that fact. pasta and sauce the worst. how can you screw up eggplant.we wasted 100 dollars.stay away from this place as it has horrible food and rude workers

Although it was a weeknight and Las Vegas itself was not crowded, a reservation was recommended -- and it was needed because this place was full or very close to it. All the customers were smiling and having a fine time. It was hard to choose from the extensive menu because everything sounded so good, and the plates of the other diners all looked wonderful. The more expensive dishes are gargantuan while the less expensive ones are merely huge.

I decided on pasta alla Nora since it is something I couldn't get elsewhere. It is spaghetti covered with meat sauce, cheeses, and pesto (which I didn't notice if it was present), then topped with bite-sized slices of eggplant and baked or more likely broiled. If you like eggplant, it's heavenly. It looked like a manageable portion to begin with; I actually breathed a sigh of relief that I wouldn't be overwhelmed. However, I ended up bringing half of it home with me; it was much bigger than it looked. My friend ordered the fettucine carbonara, and we both agreed it was the best we'd ever tasted. We both loved the garlic bread.

Before we ordered a bottle of wine, we asked whether it could be capped and taken home if we didn't drink it all. Our waiter had to go and check; yes, we could. The bottle we ordered was sold out, so he substituted another wine and reduced the price for us. Great service and a really sweet waiter.

I'd love to try the pizza as well as everything else on the menu. Delicious!

Fantastic local, authentic Italian restaurant. It gets really busy so wait staff can't be very attentive but the food and drinks are great. Free cannoli on my anniversary really made our evening. Try the wild boar pasta if it's available.
I love this place.  The food is amazing.  We go here at least once a week.  My favorite is the Halibut dinner and I always have the red sangria.  Rudy is great (bartender.)

I've waited a long time to try this spot out. A locals favorite for sure. I wasn't disappointed at all. I was beyond impressed by the atmosphere, quality customer service and especially the good. I highly recommend it. My family and I will be coming back frequently,
Way Too Loud!  Service was Slow. First bottle of wine was bad, but they graciously replaced.  Food was good.  But not worthy of a return visit... Why when you can't hear a thing ?

There are togo many other phenomenal reviews on Yelp to go over them all again. Great service, some of the best most imaginative yet  classy cocktails I have ever had, and food comparable to the best places I've eaten in any city. 

So, to summarize; excellent cocktails, great Italian food, classy, classy, classy.
This is a great restaurant. We had an anti pasta salad, calamari, and four different entrees. All expertly prepared. Great service.

While vacationing in LV, this was recommended to us by our Uber driver. Best meal I've had in Vegas in awhile. Fresh and authentic. Large portions. Incredibly reasonable -salad, 2 entrees, 4 amazing cocktails and 2 desserts only $104 (before tip!) Slightly off of the strip but well worth the trip!

I love this place, this is my staple delicious italian restaurant.  Try the melrose shrimp, gnocchi, or the baked ziti, INCREDIBLE.  Go here, you won't be disappointed.  Great atmosphere, prices, and food.  Like rosemarys don't judge a book by it's cover, it is in a strip mall and looks unremarkable from the outside but it is great inside.

AMAZING! Real, authentic, Italian dishes! Boyfriend was looking for a great place to spend Valentine's dinner and heard great reviews on Nora's. We shared calamari as an appetizer, which came with a tangy marinara sauce. Which was delicious. I had the Rigatoni Bolenese and Eric got the Crazy Alfredo. Both we DELICIOUS! I highly recommend Nora's that's looking for some amazing, REAL, Italian food!

Amazing. This place is legit. A hidden gem not too far off the strip. Garlic bread is great. 1st basket is free then $2.50 a basket.  The mozzarella sticks are a solid start. The bruschetta looked amazing. We had the shrimp scampi with linguini, the Chicken Parmigiana, and the 16oz ribeye. All 3 were the bomb. The steak may have been the best I have ever had period. The scampi was so buttery and garlicky it just melts in your mouth. The pasta was cooked perfect and the tomato sauce is excellent. The service was very attentive too.  Make a reservation if you are thinking ahead otherwise you will have a wait most likely.   I love the open kitchen too.

Seeing the great reviews and my grandma and uncle's praises about the restaurant before my arrival led to high hopes for my visit here. I had actually been to Nora's twice in the past and remembered really enjoying it the first time but felt ambivalent in the second. However, I arrived at the new location and was really impressed by the new exterior and interior decor as well as just the overall increase in space of the restaurant. 

Unfortunately, my experience as a whole did not mirror my expectations one bit. For starters, my grandma had informed me that she had made a reservation for 11 am on one of the days we were in town. Because we decided that we would rather have Italian food for dinner, I called and was told that there was no reservation for 11 ( and in fact, they do not take reservations for lunch! ). I'm not sure where the miscommunication took place, but not to worry since we were planning to go in later that night anyway.

We arrived right before our reservation time of 4 PM and were asked to wait while our table was getting set up. Not sure why it wasn't set up already, but no worries. Waiting for a minute or two is fine, of course. However, one minute turned into two turned into five turned into what seemed like at least ten minutes. No one seemed like they were in a rush to get us seated, which was a bit annoying. If that was the case, what was the point of making a reservation?

Finally, we were seated and all was fine. Nothing exciting took place between getting seated and getting our food ( except that the food seemed to come at a rather slow pace which was strange considering that the restaurant was mostly empty at this hour ). We ordered a Calamari Fritti, Truffle Fries, Shrimp Scampi, Frutti di Mare, Crazy Alfredo, and the Rib-Eye.

1) Calamari Fritti: This was actually really good. Perfectly crisped and flavored. Good sauce to go with the fried calamari. Would definitely recommend this. HOWEVER, when we were given the bill, they charged us $2 extra for this. The waitress told us that this was the price and when we showed her the menu, the prices did not match. It is fine if it is supposed to be $2 more; however, please update your menu to reflect the same. The staff did not seem to be pleased in helping us fix the error and, in fact, made us seem like we were a nuisance for asking for it to be changed. When there are pricing errors, it is not so much that the customer cares about the difference in price, but simply the principle that everyone is accurately charged for the food they are getting.

2) Truffle Fries: Overly salty and not very much truffle flavor. It's overall okay, but not the best that I've had. Wouldn't really recommend. The only reason I got it was because I had been craving it a few days back and was happy to see it for a decent price at a restaurant. Wish it would have satisfied that craving better.

3) Shrimp Scampi: I didn't have much of this but my grandma and uncle both ordered this and liked it. Too buttery for my taste and not salty enough ( which was surprising considering how salty the fries were ).

4) Frutti di Mare: Also not the best that I've had. Again the sauce was a little bland, and considering that this dish is usually very flavorful in other places, it was severely lacking that night. Not sure what could have been done to make it better. Definitely some more salt would have been a start.

5) Crazy Alfredo: This dish sounded amazing on paper ( and some of the reviews seemed to agree with that ), but I did not like it at all. The flavors didn't seem to marry well together, and it was too heavy ( which I suppose I should have expected with an alfredo dish ). 

6) Rib-Eye: This was definitely the highlight of the entire meal. The meat was very well cooked and flavorful. If I had to go back, this would be what I would get. It's a bit confusing because the menu has an option with fries and another with roasted potatoes. The fries option is $1 more than the roasted potatoes, and that was not the one that we wanted, especially since we had just ordered a side of fries as it was! Nonetheless, out came a bowl of fries. Now, this is just what I've experienced at other restaurants, but usually, if a party orders fries, the waitress asks if we still want it since one of the entrees comes with a side of fries that's the same size as the one we paid for. This was never brought up, though they were at least accommodating enough to bring out a side of roasted potatoes instead ( which took another fifteen minutes at least ).

Overall, didn't really enjoy my experience here. To get the bill took what felt like eternity and our waitress just disappeared on us for most of the meal that we had to flag down other waiters who were confused as to where she was. In additioit seems the online menu and the in-restaurant prices do not match. I am not certain if it is supposed to, but it doesn't seem to be a reliable source. I don't believe I will be going back again sadly.

This is my Favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. It's Great food and if you are able to get a seat it's well worth the wait. The only issue I've ever had is getting seated. Even with a reservation, you will have to wait. Clearly the food is that great

I wish I could star-rate a restaurants food, service, ambiance, etc, as individual parts of the whole experience. The ability to do this would drastically affect this review of Nora's. 
The food tonight was good. Not excellent, but it had some high points (gnocci w/ vodka sauce, veal scallopinni). However, other items lacked flavor, or in the case of the chicken parm, fell apart all together. 

The hostess and bar staff were great. They handled the dinner crowd very well. We had a drink while waiting for our table. Once it was ready we were promptly transferred to the dining room. This is where things went down hill fast. Our server was waiting on my wife and I, a party of 16, and 3-4 other tables. We noticed she had a busser (Justin) and 2 other food runners helping her with the party. All this assistance should have freed her up to provide atleast a bit of competent service to our table and those around us. In the hour and twenty minutes we were in the dining room we interacted with our waitress 4 times. 
1. Placed order for 1st cocktails, appetizers, entrees.
2. Delivered 1st cocktails, ordered waters
3. Ordered 2nd cocktail because we hadn't recieved food.
4. Recieved check. 

Notice it wasn't our server who delivered our second drink or our FOOD!!! She didn't approach our table until we requested our check through the busser. When she did approach the table she asked how everything was tasting. There were no plates on the table because we has finished our dinner 10 minutes before. 
My wife and I have no idea what she was doing the whole time we were there. Her large party seemed to be cared for mainly by support staff such as the food runners and the busser. 
Unfortunately I cannot rate the individual parts of this establishment separately, so they receive 2 stars based on the dismal performance of our server and lackluster food. 
However Justin the busboy is a 5 star employee. He never stopped moving. He turned tables with absolute efficiency and was incredibly professional in dealing with the customers. We observed him distributing  plates and flatware to the large party. Everyone was handed items individually, with an excuse me and thank you when he had to reach the opposite side of the table. We laughed when we observed another employee simply walk up and place a handful of forks and a stack of plates at the end of the table, and walk away just expecting the head of the table to pass them out. Fantastic job tonight Justin, we appreciated your effort.

Great food! Random location (in a strip mall) so it may not look appealing but it's awesome! I visit Vegas a lot and wanted a great place to eat with non-strip prices and this place was it! Highly recommend!

We had the best time!! 

Friday night, came in around 10:30 and there was a jazz singer with a band; they were great entertainment. The drinks we ordered were great Sicilian mule is definitely worth it! We ordered the prosciutto pizza and it was delicious. Also ordered Crazy Alfredo and it was great! Service was awesome! We could not have asked for a better experience. We ended our night with a cannoli which was also delicious.

My boyfriend found this place on Yelp - we were looking for places a little further from the strip and less touristy. (Even though we ourselves were tourists, go figure!)   Made reservations and got there early so we could check out the bar for a pre-dinner martini.  

The stoli lemon drop martini I got was in the top 5 lemon drops I have ever had (and this is coming from someone who has spent thirty minutes making a 'perfect' lemon drop martini for myself on more than one occasion).   The lemon slice they had in there was actually candied/seared  and I think that (along with the freshly hand-squeezed lemon juice) is what made it so delicious.   So they'd already won me over before we even got to our table.    The bartenders were courteous and prompt and humored us by taking our photo (twice because I looked fat in the first one haha).

For starters we ordered the calamari appetizer and caesar salad.  They also brought us a complimentary basket of garlic bread - which was delicious!  Lots of butter so it's gooey in the middle and crispy on the edges, just how i love it.   The salad was good solid standard caesar - nothing over the top or unique but very enjoyable.  It also came with more of the yummy garlic bread cut into crouton sized pieces on top - bonus!  The calamari was good - nice and crisp, not too greasy, and was a generous portion.  The dipping sauce they served with it (a caper infused marinara according to our server) is what makes this dish stand out.  It was NOM.  

The wine selection was also pretty nice and the server did a great job of recommending pairings. We ended up with the La Giaretta Cab Franc which paired very well as it was able to hold up to the bold italian flavors we were eating.

Entrees:  I got the crazy alfredo, and it was as delicious as the portion was huge.  If you're a shrimp lover you may want to ask for extra shrimp because my serving only came with two.  That didn't bother me though because I feel like the sausage and sun dried tomatoes were the true stars of that dish and I actually felt like the shrimp didn't need to be there. (Borderline sacrilege but true!)   The sauce seems like  an alfredo with some marsala sauce mixed in... lending it a beautiful golden color and sending the flavor through the roof.     I highly recommend this dish. 

The boyfriend wasn't as pleased with his, unfortunately.  The server told us the special was veal chop parmesan but we only heard 'veal chop' and envisioned something a little more pure and refined... so when we got a breaded cut of veal covered in red sauce and cheese we were a little disappointed.  Miscommunication aside, it was "good" and enjoyable but not great or anything to write home about.  I don't know about anyone else, but for me veal is such a rare, guilty pleasure that when I do eat it, I expect it to be damn good and also expect the chefs preparing it to treat it with due respect.  Unfortunately I don't feel this did justice to it.    Boyfriend says he was also shocked to see that the veal chop was $34 when we got the bill.  Completely out of line with the prices of the standard entrees printed in the menu which range from $9 to $22. 

Service during the dinner had its highs and lows.  Our server for the most part was friendly, nice, easy to talk to, and gave great wine and desert wine pairing recommendations.   There was a rather long delay between our salad course and entree course.  The server explained there was some confusion in the kitchen.... yada yada he apologized and told us he'd be happy to give us a free dessert.   We were fine with that, not a huge deal as we had eaten something already and were enjoying the wine and the music.   But then there was the awkward moment (as I'm browsing the dessert menu looking at wines) when he snatched the menu out of my hand and set a piece of cheesecake in front of me telling me he'll save me the trouble, this is the best dessert they have.  This made me feel a little awkward as though he thought I was trying to take advantage of the situation and order something super expensive or something, which I wasn't.   Well, neither of us usually eat dessert so we accepted the cheesecake with thanks but without much enthusiasm and proceeded to get the menu back so we could order some dessert wine.  The wine he recommended me (to pair with the cheesecake) did in fact pair so well with the cheesecake that I ended up eating almost the entire piece, of which I had initially planned to take a few polite bites and leave it at that.    

So all in all, despite the few hiccups, it was a very pleasant experience.  We had a great time and came away satisfied.  Our entrees were huge enough for us to share AND take home an abundance of left overs.   We'll be back next time we're in Vegas for sure and will definitely recommend to our friends.

The food is beyond excellent, and very decently priced.  If you come here get the cannoli!!! It's the best dessert you'll ever have.  Also ask for Nick, he's a great server and is very knowledgable about the menu!!

We ate dinner here after attending Penn & Teller on a Saturday night. The restaurant is about two miles from the Penn & Teller theater, in a strip mall. When we arrived, there was a live band playing, there was a dark ambience, and the restaurant was about half-full. 

The tables were covered with what appeared to be butcher paper, which I thought was a little odd. When I got my menu, I was surprised by the number of choices. I opted for the special, called the Mt. Etna Pasta, which consisted of pan fried angel hair, chicken breasts, potatoes, peppers, and a balsamic reduction, among other things. 

When my dish arrived, it looked like a volcano of some type. I didn't know where to begin. It looked odd to be certain, but I reserved judgment until I had a chance to taste it. I must say that it is one of the tastiest Italian dishes I've had in the last 10 years. I devoured the dish despite its large size, and left a happy camper.

The prices were reasonable. The band was just okay. The butcher paper table was a little bit tacky. The service was good. Overall, I recommend this place to anyone that is not desperately trying to impress a first date. Get to know the person a bit, THEN take him/her here and tell them to get the Mt. Etna.

Super, cuisine simple mais efficace, rapport qualité prix très bon, quantité prix aussi ! 
On se sent bien sûr la terrasse. 
Je recommande cet endroit

Nora's was recommended to me by several of my patients so I gave it a shot. We made a reservation for two at 7:30 but showed up at 7:00. They got us right in. The staff was awesome! We asked them for dish recommendations and we ordered exactly what they said. It was all delicious! I will bring the rest of my family back soon.

We like to go here for Italian food in Vegas so we can afford good food when we visit!  Even when a mistake in our order was made, the server was quick and responsive in the remedy of the problem.  Fun atmosphere.

Friendly staff, excellent atmosphere and delicious food!! The menu is varied and diverse, something for every palette. They even have gluten free penne, which is cooked to a perfect al dente every time. I recommend it with the crazy Alfredo, a delectable balance of creamy and hot. My boyfriend and I come back every time we're in Vegas.

Nora's Nora's let's see... I was thoroughly irritated with my first visit here because of a combination of things. For starters I was invited here on a date and reservations were for 7:15 PM. We weren't seated until about 7:45PM. I was on the verge of just saying you know what this isn't cool and walking out. Of course as soon as this almost happened we were called to our table. What is the point of a reservation if you can't be seated on time or at least within a reasonable grace period after that? The two hostesses working seemed overwhelmed and clueless. Oh but I wasn't alone in the not being seated for a reservation fiasco! There had to be about 3 other parties that were also waiting to be seated and inquiring frequently since we all couldn't pile up in the doorway.. Who would've known that this place would be jumping like this on a Thursday night? Anyways...

We were seated and immediately greeted. The server was cool nothing much to say about him he did his job. Usually when you ask somebody if it's there first time and they respond yes you start off with some possible suggestions..  Whatev...I guess that's not apart of the job description though. Moving on to the food. 

Appetizers:

House Salad (Romaine Lettuce, Mozzarella, Olives, Onions, Tomatoes, Pepperoncini,
Homemade Italian Dressing)

Mozzarella Caprese Salad (Tomatoes, Basil, Rosemary-Garlic EVOO)

Entree's:

Crazy Alfredo (Fettucini, Chicken, Sausage, Shrimp, Porcini Mushrooms, Mushrooms, Roasted Bell Peppers, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Jalapeños)

Chicken Carciofi (Tomato, Artichokes, Capers, Linguini, White Wine Sauce)

Conclusion: The food overall was pretty good no complaints on that. If you love pasta then definitely you can't go wrong with the "Crazy Alfredo"! My Mozzarella Caprese was good as well. My last complaint which cost them another star was the fact that when we asked for to go boxes the waiter brought them back and gave us the wrong damn to-go boxes. Nothing like getting home from dinner with somebody and finding out that you got the other persons food. And in my case this was a date..so imagine how awkward that was for me?.. Eh I may try again who knows....

The food I tasted here was low quality and did not taste freshly made. 

After sitting down, the garlic bread was brought out right away. I spit out the first bite because the bread tasted days old and was soggy. I asked the bus boy how the bread was made and he said Nora puts the spread on in the morning and then they bake it. If any type of spread is sitting on bread for hours it will still have that soggy consistency no matter what you do to it. He said he would bring us another batch and it would be crispier. It was crispier, however, it still tasted old and even though there was plenty of seasoning it had minimal flavor. I ordered the alla Nora and my friend ordered the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. My pasta was baked in an oven and came out piping hot. They need to cool this pasta before they bring it out to customers because it's impossible to eat for at least 10 minutes. The first bite I had was awful. The eggplant was soggy and the tomato sauce tasted like it had come from a can. The tomato sauce reminded me of the one time in my childhood when I tried a friends spaghettios. My friends pasta was better than mine and for an Alfredo the sauce was lighter than I had expected. The chicken was okay but it would have been better if it was grilled and the pasta was mostly clumped together. I called over the manager to tell him I could not eat my pasta and about the other issues I was having. He apologized and expressed his embarrassment for the situation at hand.
