He ended up comping our meal and sending us home with a free dessert which was a nice touch. 

Nora's just needs a complete face lift and some level of sophistication.

Great food. Seafood pizza was good, seafood diablo spaghetti was good, alfredo was good... I've had other items but can't remember.

I've been here maybe 3-4 times and one time the a/c seemed to be really kicking in. I'm not sure if a large crowd of people just finished, and the a/c was still working from the left over heat. But at the time I was sat in the dining around, there were only 3 other groups, with maybe 7 open tables. The waitress seemed to give us attitude for asking to switch tables due to the coldness. We asked to move before any of the food came out too. Oh well, maybe she was tired from the large crowd that might of been there before I arrived.

Out of 5 rating:
Food = 4
Service = 3.5
Ambiance/music/noise/decor = 4

Thank you for a great dinning experience on Valentines Day!!!! our reservations were for 4:15;
They had us seated with a smile and ready to go at 3:34.  The dinner, wine, coffee, desert  was of top quality. The pricing for 3 dinners was spot on, and it was a pleasure to leave a tip for our servers A well worth 5 star review.
It might be a landmark,  but it is way too noisy...my suggestion would be one of their private dinning rooms or outside.

Had my father and step mom in town for the holidays and asked what cuisine spoke to them for dinner.  They said Asian, Mexican, or Italian.  Told them take them to Nora's for old school Italian.  Dad said best chicken parmigian he has ever had!  He is 75 years old and has enjoyed many chicken parmigian in those years so to hit the best ever mark is quite an accomplishment.  Thanks Nora's for a great family dinner.  Great food to accompany some good family fellowship.

i LOVED the old Nora's - Garlic bread that will knock your socks off, family style food with flavor!! - crowded, noisy, AWESOME...  -- the New Nora's is fancy, really beautiful with plenty of parking, and the place was packed. -- there is where it ends, Food was salty, garlic bread was meh - Service was good, with attentive waitstaff, but food was very slow to show, Soup was salty as well, and pepper bombs (peppercorn) floating at the bottom.

I MISS THE OLD NORA's

Family style Italian done right is fun to enjoy with a large group.  I got a chance to dine here with 15 other colleagues.  The food was good and we were provided very attentive service.  

One of the others ordered appetizers for the table... and I think we went overboard on appetizers.  We tried the Arancini, calamari, antipasto salad, and mozz caprese.  Everything was executed nicely... but by the time dinner came I was already nearly full.

The table was also scatterd with wine selections... the wine list is pricey but everything I tried was wonderful... sorry, I didn't order the wine so I'm not sure what brands were chosen.  

I ordered the pork tenderloin for my meal.  It was packed with flavor and crunch.  I only ate a couple of bites, but I would completely recommend this dish for others.  And it paired nicely with the perfecly exucuted old fashions that I was enjoying.

Dinner was spot on... everyone left satisfied, stuffed with full bellies and flushed with wine and booze.

This was a great find through yelp! We were looking for Italian food and decided to give it a try. The food was flavorful but not too salty or sweet. My dad loved the spaghetti and meatballs while I got the rigatoni special. Seemed like a place where a lot of locals go when they're looking for authentic Italian food. The hostess and servers were courteous. Will definitely come back the next time we're in town!

GREAT GREAT pizza at a fair price! LOVE their version of baked ziti. Old school bar. Wonderful pleasant hostesses and terrific service staff. A small stage with live music on Fri and Sat nights. HIGHLY recommended.

we've been going here for years, probably over 10 years.  always loved the food, the prices, and especially the large portions.  not any more.  our usual salad we order for the "table" was now half the size.  my wife's favorite pasta dish was also half the size.  they also brought our pizza that was burned all around the crust.  our waiter, Marla, who was great, as usual, but had no "real" explanation for the changes.  prices seem the same, but the portions are much smaller.  we talked to Nora's night manager, who left us with the impression he could have cared less!!!!

Great experience, decadent menu and scrumptious food! We ordered the Calamari and we were not let down, it was perfection. I didn't see my Gnocchi on the meu, but when I had asked the waitress they were able to whip up some Gnocchi with creamy pesto sauce and I was more than thrilled with the taste! We will be coming back very soon!

This was a great place to stop in while I was in Vegas. The chilli was banging. The service I got was top notch because my cousin ordered something they didn't have and she went next door and ordered it for her.. now that's service. 

Even the two restaurants were connected, but still the hostess could have said, "no, we don't have that" but she extended her service far beyond the norm. That's great customer service. She certainly was worthy of a bigger tip!

A nice Italian restaurant off the strip that offers good and affordable food.

We ordered the classic Caesar salad, pasta puttanesca and carciolla pizza. Salad had a pretty good serving size for the price. It was good, but just had a tad too much dressing. The flavor was delicious though.

The puttanesca had lots of flavor in it. I liked the crunchy green olives that were incorporated in it. My bf liked the pizza a lot but it was just average for me. I've tasted something better. The pizza had ham, artichokes, black olives and mushrooms. I was not a fan of their pizza crust. 

The service was pretty slow for a Thursday night. The restaurant was probably 75% full. 

All in all we will probably be back since I wanted to try their antipasto salad and Alla Nora. Saw those from the other table and it looked pretty delicious.

AMAZING!! My boyfriend and I went here for our anniversary and our food and service was top notch. Highly suggest the crazy pasta, calamari and the cheesecake! Overall just a great spot for good food and awesome atmosphere! Will definitely be coming back!

GARLIC GALORE!!

I LOVE GARLIC in my food & this place is filled DERICIOUS garlic aroma!! I get a very mom & pop feel to this Italian joint... but like a back in the days mobster mom & pop shop feel where they would go to get a home style cooked meal. They 2.5 different dining area.... one in the right which seems more of a romantic mood setting while then left side is more of a bright lighting family feel & the center where the open kitchen is there are a few table but I dunno if they actually seat people there. The bar area is on the right side where it seems like they also have a stage for live performance music.

The staff look very professional & also carry themselves professionally in their vested uniforms. 

ANTIPASTO SALAD $15.25 - this is the large size which feeds 2-4 but I eat this as a meal usually when I do take-out. Romaine lettuce, kalamata olives, onions, mozerella cheese, Ham & salami wrapped w/provolone cheese, & Roma tomato w/ Italian dressing. I crave this salad whenever I want a salad. 

18" SHRIMP WHITE PIZZA $19.95 - white sauce pizza w/ diced pieces of shrimp, garlic, tomato, & mozzarella...  this pizza was PACKED w/flavors!! It was packed w/ little bits of garlic which was in every single bite.

GARLIC BREAD $2.50 - crispy outside but soft buttery garlicy on the other side. They give you a complimentary basket when you dine in & then additional order is $2.50 or when you do takeout. 

I have tried other things here in the past before but only these items have really stood out to me...
The service was impeccable! We will be back for sure. We enjoyed the photo booth. We did the tasting menu and it was delicious. The ambience, views, and openness of the venue was a plus.

Great Italian food and at a decent price.  Here is the major problems:

1) the food is good but they could drop the price 2 bucks an entree.
2) the appetizers are so overpriced it doesn't make sense.
3) the service is terrible! absolutely terrible.  Unfortunately the two times I went there the service almost made me walk out.
4) there are some good restaurants in the area and they need to step it up.
5) the place is too narrow.  hard to get around.
Good but busy and food a tad bit salty.  They are usually short staffed so food is slow to come out, but okay on drink refills and break.   Prices are fair.

The food was good.  However our wait time to get it at lunch was over 30 minutes.  We asked a couple of times to check on our order and nobody ever got back to us.  It was a Monday afternoon around one o'clock and not that busy.  I don't have that long to sit there and wait for our meal to be delivered and then eat it.  I had the Alla Nora and my husband had the Rigatoni Special.  If you are on a time line for lunch then really avoid this place.

Well... I waited 3 years to come here and tonight proved to me that it's definitely NOT worth the hype. I'm Italian and super disappointed in the service here. The food took over an hour to come out and when it did... Not so great. They don't make their own noodles or meatballs. All ordered out. I can't be okay with a place saying they're an authentic Italian restaurant when half the stuff they make is wholesale bought. Don't waste your time and definitely don't sit at the bar... The bartender is super rude. Ciao Bella!

The staff is wonderful... They all have personality which is something that just goes with genuine service. The food is amazing as well as the wine selections. My favorite thing they have is probably the arancini. Delicious!

This place was a great find off the strip. Great service and friendly staff, delicious food and even a nice jazz band to seal the deal. I highly recommend this place if your looking to get out of the crowd on the strip!

The best marinara sauce I have ever eaten.   The garlic bread is delicious.  The lemon vinaigrette is also delicious.  
What I don't expect from fine dining are tomatoes on the mozzarella caprese  unripe and cut thin making an otherwise beautiful dish just cheese ( ask for ripe tomatoes cut thicker to balance the mozzarella).  The house salad was uneventful 90% lettuce.

Recommended by a local. 
Amazing food, great service! It's nice to get a little bit off the strip and enjoy a great meal that isn't extraordinarily expensive like every restaurant inside all the casinos.

I'm giving 2 stars because the food was good but service was lacking and i had a 645 reservation but wasn't seated until 810! Asked the hostess multiple times what the hold up was and she said we were being sat in private room but a friend of the owner insisted on being sat in there so they pushed us back! This is completely unacceptable!  A manager never even came to talk to us and once we did get sat the server acted like she was irritated and was barely around. Definitely won't be having another special occasion here
Good authentic Italian at a reasonable price.  Will eat here again when we return to Vegas!

We were swinging by Las Vegas for a quick weekend getaway, so I reached out to Philip T. for some Italian recommendations in town. Nora's was one of the off-strip suggestions. 

I tried to reserve a table in the Yelp app, but they didn't have that service available. Tried OpenTable, which had the restaurant on the app, but it didn't take any reservations. WHAAT! So third time's the charm, right? Called the restaurant and they said that they are fully booked and wait time could be up to an hour and a half. But we had to be there to put our name down. We were determined to try this restaurant, so we drove out there and was met with a packed parking lot, and a bunch of people gathered outside the entrance. We put down our name and were told to wait nearby. Luckily, we noticed a couple leaving the bar area, so we snuck in and found two perfect spots smack dab in the bar. WIN!

I started with a Pilgrim's Passion to calm the nerves and ease the appetite... Gin, St. Germain, passionfruit puree, topped with a sprig of fresh mint. So smooth, so fresh. 

We ordered a plate of Mozzarella Caprese as the appetizer, which came with complimentary garlic bread. The fresh mozzarella with the EVOO drizzled on top was a perfect start to an Italian dinner. Paired with a glass of red and my cocktail, it opened up the appetite for a pasta dish.

We ordered the Melrose with shrimp... Linguini, creamy basil pesto sauce, zucchini, sun-dried tomatoes topped with roasted pine nuts. 
and...
Eggplant Parmigiana with mozzarella, tomato sauce and side of spaghetti with tomato sauce. The dishes were huge, and we quickly realized that one entree would easily please two people.. but hey, we're in Vegas so we smashed down as much as we could.. but boy, was the Melrose heavy. The creamy sauce made it rich, and really heavy. It was so tasty, but I threw in the towel after 5 minutes. The Eggplant Parm was really tasty, with soft breading and basil tomato sauce, it was definitely our favorite.

The service was very inviting and prompt, and everyone seemed to enjoy the food and ambiance. It's definitely a place we would return to on our next visit in Vegas. And thanks to Philip T. for his awesome recommendations!

Very nice Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. I think here have a lot Pasta on menu and that good If you love Pasta same like me. And they're have open kitchen here too you can see everything also nice full bar good drinks. Very nice service too. But they're not open table when I'm here. I have to wait 20-30 min but is ok.

Nora's has definitely carried over it's tradition of high quality food and excellent service to the new location. The dining room is a beautiful mix of brick and stone with a nice balance of wall art. Comfortable seating at large tables is available throughout. The background music combined instrumentals and vocals was at the perfect volume with the dining room people chatter.

We were seated immediately as our arrival was ten minutes prior to the reservation time. Service was spot on efficient from ordering cocktails , maintaining the water glasses and removing the finished items. On this evening the dining room was at full capacity and our server Kenia followed up on our satisfaction as she made the rounds.

The bread basket contained wonderful garlic bread so soft and warm. Hard to resist. My entree was a whole Branzino that was perfectly grilled. Crispy skin and moist inside. One of the best I have tasted. The fish was stuffed with sliced lemon and a sprig of rosemary. A few pieces of lemon  for squeezing made the fish outstanding. The dish included  tender and tasty  arugula which was the perfect complement. 
My wife ordered the chicken piccata which comes with a side of pasta. The chicken was tender and the lemon wine sauce provided the perfect balance. Also the capers did not over power the dish. The pasta was perfectly cooked and the tomato sauce was simply delicious. Both items were large enough to share or in this case to take home. 

It is extremely difficult to pass up Tiramisu in a great Italian restaurant. In this case we agreed to share. The size was perfect for two people. The dessert did not disappoint. A nice combination of flavors and light on the alcohol.

Congratulation to the Mauro family on the beautiful larger location with spacious parking. Look forward to returning in day light to play bocce ball.

Yelpers are right again!  Stopped in for lunch around 1:30pm on a Monday and couldn't believe all the cars in the parking lot already. Good sign! Sebastio was our server and he was so nice and checked on us at the right times even offering to refill our bread basket (loved that!) We ordered pasta fagioli soup, different than I am used to but everyone has there own version but good. We ordered lunch portion spaghetti and meatball (with one meatball $6.50 plus $1.50 for an extra meatball). Our lunch was very good. I loved the sauce and the perfectly cooked pasta. I want to go back ASAP to get a full size dinner entree because everything looked excellent! Check out the ribeye pictures on the reviews it looks better than some steakhouses! By the way, I was told to make a reservation if we come for dinner as the place is full and without a reservation the wait could be well over an hour.

Great atmosphere, delicious food, nice collection of wines and wonderful service. The music and service were great and for a Tuesday night the place had a lively feel. Most of the patrons looked like they knew their hang out and food place. I saw the stage for probably live music. Hopefully, on a weakened I'll try to go back.

We tried the new location last night, and we were very disappointed. Atmosphere was amazing and service was great. Food was a huge disappointment. Thinking we will give it another try in the future. Hoping it was just because everything is so new.

I went to Nora's for a special dinner for prom. Very disappointed...I heard nothing but great reviews and when we arrived we not only waited 20 minutes to be seated even though we had a reaervation, but we didn't get our food until 40 minutes after ordering. Reservation at 9 and food arrived around 10:35. We wasted so much time sitting and we were so hungry we filled up on bread and by the time we got our meal our appetite was gone. I was disappointed with my order, for it was not worth the ridiculous wait. I understand if it is busy, but the resteraunt was not packed by no means. I liked the inside but not the service at all. They offered us a free dessert. How about no dessert and you just discount our bill ? So much time wasted. We are not going back.

I have been coming here since it opened.  I love the food here well the pasta.  The pizza is not really my thing here because the crust gets soggy.  But the pasta is amazing.  The antipasta salad is amazing I cant eat certain types of meat that are in it but I still get it anyway and just pick them out.  This place does get busy so you should make a reservation.

Visited Nora's recently for my dad's birthday dinner. I really enjoyed Nora's. The service was outstanding the wait staff was very attentive. They also surprised my dad with a dessert for his birthday free of charge. I will only review the food I ate as everyone has different tastes. I had the brown butter shrimp for the appetizer. It was good but not quite as flavorful as I had hoped. The brown butter gravy dominated the dish. The shrimp however were cooked perfectly. For my main dish I had the Fettuccine Carbonara. I loved this dish! The pasta was cooked perfect. The sauce and ham were excellent together and was a very generous portion. Very comforting dish. The meal for 4 people including a few drinks was about $175 an incredible value in Vegas with out feeling cheap in any way. Well done!

Poor service and very average food. 
Red sauce and is basically red water. I had the veal parmigiana (typically one of my favorites). Bland!! No flavor to the veal or red sauce. Even the pasta was bland. Smothered it all in parmigiana and red peppers. 
Did I mention the device? Horrible. I've had better service at outback. 
Here's the topper! My wife gives them about 800-$1000 a month in lunch banquet business. And the manger that know her by name couldn't even say hello. Just stand there watching his staff struggle and stare!!

I went here for lunch and dinner within the same week. Food is delicious and service is impeccable. I really love the new location. I go to Carmine's usually but now I don't have to go the strip for clam linguine!!! Thank you!!

Great food and pretty reasonable considering Vegas.  Loved my pasta dinner and the service was great.  I would go back but probably ask to sit in the dining room instead of the bar.  Salads are  large so share.
By far one of the best Italian restaurants in Las Vegas! Love the new location and the service is still amazing! Thank you for a wonderful holiday celebration dinner!
Excellent Italian! Will not disappoint. Pasta cooked to perfection and sauce is very tasty. Will definitely return when back in Vegas.

This is an excellent restaurant. Great for family, friends, and date-night. The service is always very good. The food is delicious. The Pork Tenderloin is a family favorite, as is the antipasto salad. Make sure to get reservations and good directions so you can easily find this cozy restaurant.

My favorite Italian restaurant in town! This place has everything I expect from a restaurant: beautiful building with a nice view, indoor and outdoor seating for when the weather is nice, variety of foods that are delicious and reasonably priced, and good service. 
This time I booked a reservation. I arrived early and was still able to be seated right away. The waiters looked nice in their uniforms which added to the elegance of the restaurant. 
The garlic bread sticks are tasty. I appreciate that they brought them out right away. After we ordered, the food came to our table in about 15 mins. 
I had Veal Cannelloni alla Vodka that was delicious. I  enjoy everything I've eaten from here.

My favorite restaurant of all!! Celebrated our 22nd Anniversary tonight with our 2nd son's close friend & his wife (We lost him in March). They just purchased their 1st home as well....there was no better place to take them rather than Nora's.  The service is awesome, atmosphere is spectacular... their new location... WOW!! Most of all their food, anything you choose, is out of this world!!! Thank you once again for hitting it out of the park!! This was Matt & Lindsay's 1st visit, I could assure you they will be back

Reservation:  7:15 pm
Seated:  7:35 pm
Out of the Restaurant: 9:37 pm
Party Size:  3

This place is definitely a local spot. The food is decent but the service is so, so slow. My family and I ordered salads to start and then we got a  pizza and 2 pastas.

Salad:  I had the Caesar and my mom had the house. Way too much dressing and cheeses on both. 

Pizza and Pasta:  The pizza was ok and the pasta again was nice, cooked on point but again way too saucy. Almost overwhelming. 

Service:  We were a table of 3. We did not order anything complicated.  We did not leave until 9:37 pm. It took almost 50 minutes from the time that we finished our salad to get our entree. Absurd!  The waitress did come by and say it would be just a few more minutes however that's just nonsense. There was a large table of 12 that they needed to serve before us apparently and that is why the wait was so long. We were about 5 minutes from walking out.  Management seemed to be more focused on the locals at the bar as opposed to getting the food out. Disappointing. 

No one should have to wait that long for decent if not average food. Quite disappointing considering all of the '5 star' reviews. Not worth it.

Update: The meatballs are not like they used to be... just had them tonight, please go back to your original recipe.


Been coming here for years. You can take a New Yorker outta New York, but you can't take New York out of a New Yorker. This place is legit, true Italian good food like Nonna used to make. The meatballs are the best in the west. 

They're building a new location at the moment, can't wait to see the story go on with this place.

Salute!

Nora's is one of your not-so-secret neighborhood gems residing in a nondescript strip mall on the corner of Jones and Flamingo. it seems as if much as been written about this place and opinions vary. Mainly, it seems like an issue of expectations. So here is what to expect and you can decide for yourself if this is going to make your dining rotation. 

Nora's is really the combination of two suites in a strip mall. The room to your right will have a band at 9pm on a weekend night offering smooth jazz or whatever is Italian restaurant appropriate. The music is not too loud and you can either enjoy the music in the background or sit nearer to the band if that is what you are there for. There is also a semiprivate room for about 10 if you are having a little party. The other dining room is just a dining room. I didn't eat there, so I can't really say what the experience is like. 

Service. I will get this out of the way since this is where they lost a couple of points. The service was by no means terrible, as we were seated on time, food timely and drinks filled. It was just more of an intangible indifference I felt, as if I was not supposed to know about this place. Maybe everyone was in a bad mood because the night was cold and they were missing out on the Pacquiao vs Cotto fight. Or maybe you need to be a regular for a little warmer service. 

Anyway, I just desire warm, friendly service with Italian food. It just seems appropriate with pasta. Just like I expect bad service from the best Chinese restaurant. Not a big deal, but this prevents this place from being remarkable. 

The interior design is nice and they do good job of providing a good atmosphere. You will forget that you are in a strip mall. 

Food. Obviously, that is what we are here for. Firstly, by no fault of the restaurant, I ordered the wrong dish. Rare mistake. However, having said that, I believe that carbonara should be a wee less salty. Granted, this is from the perspective of a guy trying to limit his salt for health concerns. However, it is rare that something is so salty that I cannot finish it. The first few bites were delish, but got increasingly harsh as time wore on. Personally, I think that the prosciutto itself would lend enough sodium to flavor the dish nicely, but they went overboard by salting up the sauce. 

Shrimp scampi appetizer = good. Nice large shrimp, good sauce that goes well with the garlic bread. Speaking of which, the garlic bread was okay, with a home made kind of feel, if you like that sort of thing. 

Dessert. Somewhat limited choices, but the tiramisu was satisfactory with a nice wet cake to it. Ladies should have no problems here. 

Wine. An excellent selection of by the glass in case you are drinking solo or otherwise cannot take on a full bottle. Mostly Italians and California wines. You can go budget for $6. I got a couple of glasses of Regaleali for 8.25 each. 

What you must compare all this with is the fact that most of your pasta dishes range from $10-20, dessert is $5 and tea is $2.50. The scampi is mildly pricey at $13.95, but it was still worth it. 

I think it is unreasonable to expect some sort of mind blowing experience. Really, Nora's is a nice local restaurant for a casual meal with a lady friend or perhaps a decent group gathering. Good for conversation, a generous serving a pasta and perhaps a nice bottle of Italian red for a reasonable price. You can stroll in here with a sportscoat or dress more casually if you like (maybe leave the jorts behind, though). So don't expect the world and just have a good time.

In Vegas for a soccer tournament. My friend went there the night before and had nothing but good things to say. Due to the 45 min wait, we ordered to go. Had the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken, angel hair pasta with meat balls and Caesar salad. We kept it simple, I know but these simple dishes were outstanding with flavor and cooked to perfection. The taste was above average and I could tell the chefs put a lot of time and effort on these "simple" dishes. Home run for sure.
Great food! Ever since Savana got fired things have only gotten better

Tip: their pasta is huge so you can share it with someone else. 

I like the chocolate cake it's really yummy. I'm not sure how they make it but it's def a must try. 

I'm not super impressed with their pasta but the pizza is good. I always get the calamari for the appetizer and like it all the time.
Wow! What an amazing experience. The wait staff was amazing and the food outstanding. Highly recommend this restaurant!
I come to Noras about once a month. Every time my meal is perfect and the service is spot on. Simply put, Noras is THE place in Las Vegas for Italian food.

We walked in on a Saturday evening around 6:00.  We saw that the place was packed but we went in to see how long the wait was.  We were quoted a 2.5-3 hour wait or we could sit outside on the heated patio.  Granted it was windy and cold outside but I really wanted to try their Chicken Marsala.  We decided to sit on the patio, all by ourselves.  It was cold even with the heater and we did sit out there for maybe 10 minutes before we were acknowledged.  But once we were acknowledged, service was good.

I started with the Pasta Fagioli Soup.  It was good but not super memorable.  The Chicken Marsala was really good.  Chicken was tender and the sauce was flavorful and had enough mushrooms.  My husband ordered his usual Chicken Parmesan.  He liked the flavor but said his chicken was a little tough.  Their garlic bread is amazing.

Like I said, our service was good and it was quiet outside until a large party with kids came outside to wait for their table.  The kids were screaming but the most annoying part was the loud, pompous man with them demanding his table inside.  He marched around like he owned the place.  Unfortunately, they finally got their table when we were ready to leave.

LOVE the new building and the food is ALWAYS wonderful. A couple of suggestions: invest in black napkins (white rubs off on dark clothing). Get your electrician to put a dimmer on the overhead lighting in the room w/the bar. It's too bright for the amazing atmosphere you have created.
Really enjoy Nora's and wouldn't change a thing on their menu. It is always an enjoyable evening with friends. Will you bring back the live music?

Family owned and operated....and AWESOME!  Friends brought us several years ago, and we don't visit any other Italian places since. Pizza is great, and my favorite...the Baked Ziti is YUMMY! I crave it at times. We've tried several items, and not a bad one yet. Also be sure to get the Antipasto salad!

This is such a great place for locals and for visitors who are looking to eat off of the strip.  The staff is extremely friendly and entertaining.  They usually have live music on the weekends and the environment is romantic/inviting and not pretentious.

What more can you ask from an Italian restaurant.  Nora's is located off the strip in a shopping plaza, where you would never expect to find this little hidden gem.  I made a reservation but my party members were late.  The hostess had no problems with this and I was seated promptly when my party arrived a few minutes later.  You walk into Nora's and you see a part of the kitchen immediately.  To the left and right are dining areas that are reminders of what you would expect at an Italian dining establishment: lower lights, intimate areas, cozy, etc.  

We were seated and given bread.  We then ordered some wine and beer which was reasonably priced considering it is Las Vegas.  I had the house specialty seafood pasta with a caesar salad; all perfect and as tasty as expected.  The other members of my party had Chicken Parmigiana and an Eggplant Parmigiana.  Both were also great when I tried them.

The restaurant is very good in most ways, and I recommend it to anyone looking for quality Italian cuisine.  It just did not blow me away in any category to earn that fifth star.

This place is so cute inside and out.. There is a live band playing, indoor/outdoor eating and they have little private rooms for private parties. 

It was my first time eating here and I really liked. We had a party of 10 so they placed in us a private room with a tv, music and lights we could control.

When we sat down they gave us baskets of garlic bread to hold us over until we got our actual food. I ordered the gnocchi in vodka sauce and it was delicious. The price of food was fairly cheap  $12-$25 a plate depending if you got meat or not.

I really like it and it is for sure one of my favorite Las Vegas italian spots!

The food here is great. We started with a house salad which was a nice portion. For entrees we ordered the popular Crazy Alfredo and Rigatoni Gorganzola with chicken. Both dishes had great cream sauces and were delicious. Finally for dessert the chocolate lava cake. I normally dont care about dessert but this was bomb. We ate at the bar and the service was on point. We will definitely be back.

This is a great neighborhood gem. Everything here is good. The Crazy Alfredo is my favorite. They tend to be really busy and sometimes the hostess' can get into the weeds when it comes to seating people. But don't worry they'll get to you. It's worth the wait. 

April 2017 Update
This is based on the rude customer service the "hostess"
gave my wife over the phone when she was confirming a dinner reservation. Here's a tip, if you're not nice to loyal customers you lose customers. We went to Capo's instead. Everyone there was lovely.

I've been to Nora's multiple times and I am a lifelong fan of pappardelle noodles, but ... 

My most recent dining experience tonight left me both angry and disappointed. 

1. No one likes a cutter. Our reservation was at 7:45pm and we checked in 30min earlier,  but apparently that was not enough for the hostesses who chose to seat a couple that not only checked in AFTER us, but WITHOUT RESERVATION. Not cool. 

2. Third times a charm to cook a steak? NO. Medium rare does NOT EQUAL well done, but the server quickly offered to re-cook a new steak. Again, medium rare does NOT EQUAL rare- the second steak was not only unappetizing to look at, but also extremely red on the inside. At this point, the MANAGER came to CONVINCE us that it was the right cut and the right level of doneness. Third steak...AGAIN- it comes back medium well, but everyone has finished eating and it has been over an hour since we sat. For better or worse, we seemed committed to this third steak. 
Not cool, I know what medium rare looks like and shouldn't have to be convinced/almost bullied into accepting it. 

3. Check up on us. If you and other members of your party have ACTIVELY VOCALIZED CONCERNS/COMPLAINTS about the restaurant YOU ARE MANAGING, I would recommend checking on them to assure no other problems or even to offer solutions to fix problems. No manager in sight after initial conversation. Not cool. 

Overall- expect good food, but know there is a long wait and apparently inept staff from my experience tonight.

The food is absolutely amazing. No reason to go to an italian place on the strip when Nora's quality of food, preperation, and price are perfect. The calamari is just right, the free basket of garlice bread is a perfect addition as well. The main courses offer such quality and variety, and the servers are spot on. DO NOT MISS THIS PLACE.

Nice late dinner with friends, food was good, service very kind, drinks awesome good sugestión from nicola my server, my busser the small asian guy was very attentive, ambient was ok. One big dissatisfaction is the manager a dark skin guy with a suit , welll my friend i try to get your attention for a question about the drinks but you IGNORED US!! That is what i hate from managers they think their job is just looking around like a clown!!! My friend you are supposed to be friendly and kind with the guests but instead you walking around like a big AHOLE!!!!! I was about to make you a nasty review but the crew in the floor and kitchen don't deserve that because of you!! Mr manager.
This is by far the best Italian food in Vegas. They have the best selection and a great atmosphere. You can't go wrong when you eat here.

Always excellent...! The service and the food is great. The atmosphere smells great. I didn't need a reservation and i waited 12 minutes... Not bad... Great date place. San Genero event was in town and Nora's was still busy..! That is awesome!
Delicious italian food!! And you would think that it is more pricy because of the quality of the food and the atmosphere, but it is really cheap for what you get!! I am in love with the white pizza!!

Love this place and try to come whenever I am in town.  The service is excellent and very attentive.  Had the antipasto salad and it was delicious. It is big enough for 3 people.  Had the veal Marsala and the veal was cooked perfectly.  My son had the lasagna and it was good as well.  My husband had the veal chop Parmesan and he thought it was adequate.  Will continue to visit when in town

The garlic bread!!! I could end this right here right now and tell you just to go there for that, but I wouldn't be doing my due diligence. The second most important thing I can tell you is MAKE A RESERVATION! I was very lucky that I have a friend that lives in Las Vegas and was able to recommend Nora's as well as warn me to make a reservation. When we walked in we were sat immediately thought there were a bunch of other families standing there waiting for tables I assume were just walk-ins. We had the mozzarella sticks as a app and they were pretty good. For dinner I had the chicken Parmesan (very good) and my husband had a chicken dish with pesto that he said was absolutely phenomenal! Unfortunately, we were not able to eat it all because the portions were substantial and we were also unable to doggy bag it because we were from out of town. I wish we had Nora's here! If I find myself in Vegas again I will most certainly come back here!
Great go-to spot for reliable, well-priced food. The garlic knots are my favorite. They have good happy hour deals.
Anthony @ the bar is amazing!!!  Gotta try his Milagro peno martini! Well that and everything else we tried.  Good vibes, good food food, great drinks, great service!!!  I'll be back.

Really 2.5 stars

Very disappointed. It's been a while since we ate at Nora's. Used to be regulars. Food is not the same as it used to be. Sauce was bland. Marsala was salty. The anti pasta salad is still very good. Ravioli could have been better.  

The service was mediocre. Never came to refill water. Very slow.  We had to ask to get dessert.

Local gem, similar to Ferraro's .
Terrific ambience, bread delicious and desserts of tiramisu and spumoni ice cream fantastic.
Spinach faro salad w/chicken was very good and lasagna was some of the blandest I have experienced.
Noodles tasted doughy, meat sauce had NO meat and when I told my server Sebastian, he simply shrugged his shoulders. No credit given , no replacement offered.

This place is really good the food is really Italian style feeling, the white pizza is just really so good it's so fresh and the staff is just incredible. The new location is so pretty and spacious as well. They do a fantastic job

This place is amazing! I had the Crazy Alfredo and it was out of this world. My daughter also has the same dish and said it was the best Alfredo sauce she has ever tasted. My wife had linguine and sausage. The sausage was really great! Both tasty and spicy. My son-in-law had the shrimp and he loved it.
This was first time and we got our food as a take out order. We will definitely be going back and eat at the restaurant next time.

This has become my favorite Italian restaurant! It's a pretty classy restaurant, which you won't be able to tell from the outside! Our party was however the youngest and least dressed up because it was a last minute decision as our first choice place was closed for the day. We really didn't know what to expect as it was our first time. If they didn't have a dress code, they should, because everyone else was dressed really nice and seemed like they were there for some kind of special occasion! 

We came here around 6:30pm and beat the dinner rush! Didn't take us long to be seated. I really didn't know what to expect, because outside it didn't look like much, but on the inside, it was like WOW. It was really nice, there are three parts to the restaurant, the middle is where you enter, you can see some people working on the pizza boxes and such and a hostess, the right is the bar area with a lot of seating and the restrooms are located there. The left was the main dinning area where we were seated. 

The restaurant is family owned which opened in 1991 (the menu had a bit of history on it when you first open it). With the yelp check-in you get a complimentary glass of wine, with any order. Which it came in a decanter (see picture) and they pour some of it into your glass after they place it on the table. 

It took us quite a while to order, well myself really, the guys already knew what they wanted. When we finally ordered, it took a while for the food to come out, but when it came out it was HOT, fresh hot out of the oven / stove. Out of our group we had the Rigatoni special, Crazy Alfredo, and al la Nora. Oh we also got a small basket of garlic bread, which the first one is free, and if you wanted more it was about $2.50 (I'll confirm again next time I go). 

The Rigatoni special contained sausage, meatballs, onions, pepper, in a tomato sauce, it was very good. Everything was cooked very well and contained a lot of flavor in the meats. I really enjoyed it and it filled me up fast. Though I felt there was more meat than there was pasta, for some this is a good thing, but for myself it isn't. I would still recommend it! 

The crazy alfredo contained both meat and seafood, which looked good, but I didn't get to try it. And the al la Nora was a baked dish containing spaghetti, eggplant, beef, tomato sauce, and some others ingredients (I don't remember all of them) which my other friend enjoyed. 

I can't wait to go back and try one of their pizzas!!

I have to say the food here was very mediocre. Decent house salad, great calamari, but the rest is just ok. Salmon was overcooked, we had to return our dessert because of how old it was, and the pasta was decent.

We ate at Nora's last night.  Customer service was excellent.  Food was really good, but their cheesecake was the bomb!  Best we've ever had!  Great dining experience.  Never felt rushed and had the sense they really enjoyed us being there.
Sorry I waited so long to try this place.  Worthy of the Best Of Vegas Awards.

This little Italian place tucked away in West Las Vegas is absolutely awesome.  It's a decent drive away from Las Vegas, located close to Spring Valley.  As the others have said, the Garlic Bread is absolutely spectacular, just the perfect touch to any meal.

The food is quite authentic and will not disappoint.  The meatballs were extremely tender and the pasta was very fresh.  For any coffee lover, the expresso here is very good as well.  There isn't a single thing on the menu that I would shy away from.

As for the environment, the interior is quite cozy and good for a time out with friends or maybe even a casual date.  The noise isn't too loud nor is it awkwardly quiet, which makes it easy to catch up and maintain a conversation.

The service was good; however, at peak times it seems like they are understaffed.  The wait can sometimes be long if you don't call in advance for reservations.  Nonetheless, it is worth the wait.  Also, the parking lot is quite small, so you have to plan some time in advance to get a space or to park in the surrounding neighborhood.
We were in the private room and everything was AMAZING!  There was enough food to feed an army and everything was delicious!  Service was top notch!

Came here for my birthday dinner and the service is fantastic as well as the food they are so attentive to you and they also allowed my friend to bring in a birthday cake to surprise me. I really recommend this place if your looming for a nice place to have dinner or even a special event

This has to be one of the best Italian restaurant's in all of vegas... nice little hidden gem... food is exceptionally tasteful... service was excellent... definitely coming back and making this a regular stop... I was with 4 others who also shared the same... Nora's Rocks!!!

A friend took me here a couple of months ago, and I loved it! It kind of reminded me of something that would be in New York or San Francisco.  The crowd was very hip, young and fun.  I loved the live Jazz music, it set just the right mood.

I ordered the Caprese Salad, and my friend ordered this dish that had angel hair pasta, shrimp, pine nuts and zucchini.  It was to die for.  I would definitely recommend taking your date to Nora's...something about the food, wine and music could set anyone under a love spell!

Wow!!! The food was amazing! We came here our our daughters bday. A Thursday night and it was packed . The parking lot was full and you had to park on the street on a weekday! Thank goodness we made a reservation. The service was excellent from the waiter to his partner who kept the water coming, and cleaned the plates each time. I ordered the eggplant and it was delicious. My daughter ordered the shrimp scampi. I tried and it is the best I ever had, I will def be ordering that next time . My wife ordered the baked rigatoni , excellent . We were served tiramisu for her bday! Class act all the way around.. we will def be back. The garlic bread for the table was awesome! Big chunks of garlic on the bread, toasted to perfection. The place was packed the entire time we were there and did not let up.. wow!!!! Thank you!!!!
Nice to eat where the locals eat. Try the Crazy Alfredo... now thatz-a-spicey-a-meatball!
One of the bestItalian restaurant in Las Vegas. And a lot less expensive than the strip. Great service too. The place is always busy, so make reservations

I went for the 1st time today. All I have to say is WOW! Our food was delicious some of the best pasta I have ever eaten. Better than most of the Vegas Strip pasta places. I will be definitely making this my goto place.

I haven't visited Nora's since they used to be in the strip mall just west of their new location, but man, have I been missing out! 

Their new (I say new, but it's probably been there for years) location is very spacious! A bit echoey due to the high ceilings and tile floors, but if you manage to get a room to yourself, then you'll definitely appreciate the privacy! Try asking for one when you book a reservation.

As for the food, Nora's has also been exceptional, and they continue to defy expectations! The Garlic bread was dangerously addicting, the calamari was perfectly fried, and not overly battered. And the Veal Marsala was sublime! The veal was tender, the sauce was just the right thickness, the flavors were spot on. 

Overall, if you're looking for a nice place to take a loved one, reconnect with friends, or even explore on a first date, Nora's will not disappoint! Be sure to make a reservation, because they WILL get very crowded!

I have been to Nora's twice now and both times have been great. The food is always delicious! This time around, we asked the waitress for some crayons and she totally got them for us. My friends and I colored the entire table top. Yes, we are full grown adults, but why should the kids get all of the fun? Plus, a good coloring session is always a good time.

I have had their gnocchi and their pizza, now. They've done one thing wrong though... they've kept the restaurant in Vegas. There should definitely be a Nora's by my house!!
Love this place. I go to Las Vegas quarterly for business and eat here every time.

Every time my family and I go to Vegas, we would hit up this hole in the wall spot that has built upon its success by delivering authentic Italian dishes using the freshest ingredients. The prices are reasonable and portions are fulfilling. I've gotten the Chicken Mt. Etna which is two chicken breasts stacked with oven roasted tomatoes and deep fried vermicelli. Though quite heavy, the taste was marvelous. You can't go wrong with their Crazy Chicken Alfredo, as well as their Four Staggioni Pizza. Great ambiance, and a nice and fully stocked bar. Nora's is certainly a spot to take a date out without leaving a dent in the wallet.

This restaurant is outstanding!   We were visiting Las Vegas from Florida and were staying on The Strip.  Fortunately we had a rental car, allowing us to drive the 3 or 4 miles to Nora's.

Located in a strip shopping center with limited parking, we never would have guessed that this place would be so good.

The food and service were top-notch and Sinatra was playing in the background.  The garlic bread was delicious, as was the Arancini appetizer, a risotto and cheese starter.  Some of the entrees were so inexpensive that it made us think twice for a moment - $10.50 for a large portion of eggplant parmigiana.  Others in our party ordered chicken, veal, and pasta dishes.  All were very reasonably priced and a nice break from the touristy places in or near the big hotels.

We loved Nora's and will absolutely return the next time we're in Las Vegas.  Thanks to Yelp for the favorable reviews!

Have been recommended this place by friends and not far from my place. Went w my kid. The table where we were seated was very small and cramped. in the bar area. Was around 5.30pm. The lemon clams were over steamed. had the lasagne and eggplant parm which were average and a bit on the oily side. Wine however compensated. Not the most friendly or responsive staff. Apparently smiling not allowed.

I may try again.
Came here based on a friend's recommendation. Glad I did. Very good food and service. Doing a brisk business on a Wednesday night is a testament to their quality. I'll return.

We just celebrated my friend's birthday there, and the food was delicious! Garlic bread was real good with chunks of garlic on the bread. I had the Chicken Carciofi, and it was real good. My daughter had the chicken parm, she said it was ok. It had way too much pasta, and not enough chicken. It didn't really look that good to me. We were a party of 11, and we had a semi-private room in the back, with a big round table. The staff was very attentive, and friendly. Coffee is Lavazza (my favorite). We will definitely be back.

Solid 3.5 stars and if and when I come back, I could see myself bumping up to 4. But I just dont think it's quite 4 stars yet.
Service was good. Nick was our waiter and he was pretty good. 
The food was good, but not amazing. I shared a house salad and the seafood pasta. They were good, OK, but not great. I guess I expected more. The place gets crazy busy, and I suppose they are better than some of the italian places here in Vegas, but truth is, if I want good italian, I cook it myself. But, I will most likely come back, and maybe, just maybe, it will be a much better experience. 
Prices are good and service was good so that will garner a second trip!
Maybe It's what I ordered.....???

I first tried this restaurant nearly 5 years ago when I only lived around the corner from it. I haven't lived in Las Vegas for years now, but every time I am back in town I make sure to at least get take out from here. Really solid Italian food at reasonable prices. The pasta is always cooked perfectly, the sauces are delicious, and the garlic bread is delicious (and I don't normally eat much garlic bread). It gets really busy, I suggest making a reservation whenever you go.

As a frequent customer, I don't know why it took me so long to write this review! The food is unparalleled. Definitely try the red sangria! The new location is absolutely gorgeous and mostly the same friendly staff from the old location! Service is always exceptional. I'm always recommending this place to family and friends.  If you haven't tried this place, it is a MUST!

Barely contained chaos would describe the atmosphere at this very loud restaurant which we recently visited on a Saturday night.  Understaffed, crowded and noisy would be another description. The saving grace would be the food which is pretty good.....for Las Vegas....but would be mediocre at best when compared to what you you might find in NY or San Francisco.

We started our meal with complimentary garlic bread -- way too much garlic -- and kind of soggy.  We then tried the Caprese Salad which had very good mozzarella but very pedestrian grocery store tomatoes. We also tried the lemon clams which were in a tasty lemon butter sauce, but about a quarter of the clam shells were broken and to be safe, I did not eat the contents of these particular clams. The kitchen should remove such broken shell clams before serving. 

For entrees we tried the Chicken Carciofi, a pretty good dish full of chicken, artichokes and capers on linguine. We also had the Puttanesca which was tasty although full of green olives instead of black olives which I have found to be milder and better suited for this dish. The portions were enormous, a negative in my book. 

Service was spotty as it seemed our waiter was a bit overwhelmed covering two tables plus a birthday party table with 14 guests.  The appetizers came out very quickly though, but we were put off when the entrees arrived when we were only halfway through our appetizers and when we were finished with our appetizers, the appetizer plates were not removed from the table. 

The wine list is pretty good. 

Zagats rates this as the third best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas which may be correct but only serves to prove that Las Vegas is indeed in a barren Italian culinary landscape.

Unimpressive location and storefront, but definitely one of the best Italian restaurants I've been to. No wonder they are rated the Best Unknown Restaurant in Vegas.

Crazy Alfredo - flavor bomb: so creamy, seafood flavors mixed with mushroom flavors and a good spice. 

Lasagna - perfect moisture and balance of sauces. You can really taste that ingredients are great quality

Olives for an appetizer: LOVED those. Soft and flavorful.

Spinach farro salad: a good light salad.

None of our food was disappointing, so good!
The food was gorgeous.  The restaurant was gorgeous. The waitstaff was gorgeous. It really is a five star restaurant.

Most sad to write this review. This is my second time at the new location and will not return. 
I have been a frequent diner for over 10 years, loved the old space and the controlled chaos and of course the food.
My first experience was better than my latest. Food seemed to be the same quality my first go around. This time, not so much ... salty, 3 small average meatballs and not the 2 delicious meatballs that were standard.
Our waiter was awesome upon arrival, but was over worked and distracted by the end.  He told us he had to pull our appetizers and plates because our entrees were ready and continued to be rushed throughout the remainder of the night. 
My husband had puttanesca and said for the record it was really good. 
However, even the house salad was different. 
Super sad day for me! I loved this place.

Spaghetti Lunch Special. Yum ! Can't beat it !

Everything is good on the menu. 

Great wine bar. Full bar also.

At night they have live music in their parlor.

Definitely, a local favorite for me.
Good atmosphere, friendly staff, short wait, food was outstanding...!!!

Espresso Martinis!?! Yes, ask for Norman. He makes the best drinks I've ever had. And talk about service, Nina is amazing!  She's pleasant and beautiful inside and out. The Snow White pizza and truffle fries were delicious!  Nora's has had a facelift with the new and improved location but her beauty within has not changed. Love it here always.

Fantastic authentic Italian food. If you are anywhere near Las Vegas and want a real meal, go to Nora's.

They had a salmon special when I was there and it was easily the best salmon dish I've ever had. All of the pasta dishes looked great and even the chicken noodle soup was home made and delicious.

The staff was very nice and attentive. 

Don't be fooled by the location or the outside (it's in a strip mall) - this place is top notch and prices aren't bad either.

(Try the iced tea)

This place was super good. The atmosphere was very live. Not too noisy but busy. The staff was super friendly and made jokes. The food was really good even though I don't eat much Italian food. The sangria was amazing. Some of the best sangria I've had. The complimentary bread was good too.

I've been wanting to try Nora's for quite some time. Made reservations for two. Had only a five minute wait for the table. The complimentary garlic was delicious. Ordered the steak bruschetta for appetizer. It was basically overcooked Philly meat....disappointing. Had the rigatoni Gorgonzola with chicken. It lacked any sort of flavor and the chicken was rubbery. Maybe I needed to try something else. It was quite busy. Also they had bread pudding on the menu which is my personal favorite, again I was underwhelmed. Service was lovely though.
Nora's is the best authentic Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. Their new location is beautiful and the place is always packed. The service is outstanding!
I have been here several times and it never fails to disappoint. We took a few guests and everyone raved about the food. The service was impeccable.

Every time I visit this restaurant, we have a good time.  Last night I went with my clients and cousin and it was a good night. Started with a round while we sat at the bar waiting for others to arrive.  Bartender, excellent service.  Ordered apps but got sat early so they transferred our apps to the table and we started eating.  Ordered a bottle of Pinot Noir from Sonoma, didn't really taste how we expected, that's why the 4 stars.  Other than that, our entree's came out cooked to perfection, a little too much jalapeno in the fettuccine though.  Over all good experience.

Notes:  Bartender and waiter, excellent service and prefessionalism.

The food was absolutely fantastic. The service left a lot to be desired. We called a few weeks in advance to reserve for a party of 12 and we were told they had to split us up into two tables. This did not seem like a problem until we arrived and they seated us in separate rooms. We also tried to change our reservation as soon as they opened that day to add one more person and we were told we could not. So in order to have everyone fed, we had a table of 8 in one room, a table of four in the second room, and one person at the bar. At the table of 4, it took 20 minutes just to receive our salad but dinner went pretty easily after that. We took out time and enjoyed all the delicious flavors. When we were done and getting ready to pay the check for the entire party we found out that the table in the other room hadn't even received their entrees yet. At this point we had all been seated over an hour so I'm not sure what the hold up was. Thankfully we had scheduled two hours for dinner because we barely made it out at the two hour mark to get to a show after. I would come here again but I would never bring a party here.

We are fairly new to Vegas and have heard people here and there mention this place called "Nora's". Everyone raved how great the food was and how the atmosphere was so relaxing. One night we had family in from out of town and had done the strip places and the local place we frequent and Nora's came to mind. We called and the recording strongly suggested reservations. Seeing that we were in the car with family heading that way we were concerned. When we got to the restaurant we were quoted an hour and a half wait. It was full. We put our name down and asked the hostess if she would mind calling us when we were closing in on our table. She said they normally didn't do that but she assisted us as a favor. We went to Sams and then she called shortly after. We got back and we're seated promptly. 
The food ... is ... AMAZING DELICIOUS FRESH GENUINE UNIQUE ... I could go on. 
It was moderately priced and worth the pricing. Service was top notch. Servers tag team all tables to ensure a smooth dining experience. 
We will be back. Treat yourself and make time to visit Nora's.

One of the first restaurants I tried since moving to Vegas and was not disappointed! The food is really good & not overpriced. They had live jazz (I forget which nights they do this) I believe it was a Friday night. The drinks & service were also great, can't wait to go back!

My experiences at Nora's have been nothing short of excellent. The food was absolutely some of the best I've tasted for Italian food, and the service was spot on. The biggest downfall of this place is that it's too busy!

My favorite dish so far is the fettuccine carbonara. It's not really a fancy or special dish, but it's one that I like to try at a lot of different places. The waiter even asked me if I wanted to add peas (which add a lot to the dish and is usually in it anyways).

I've also had the chance to try the steak and arugula bruschetta, the chicken mount etna, and the rigatoni gorgonzola. All of them were very good, though the chicken mount etna might have been better with normal pasta rather than fried pasta.

Love Nora's! Been coming here for over 5 years, even after becoming vegetarian, is still a good place to hangout!
Love the fact that they can accommodate my 'needs' Crazy Alfredo is just as good without meet :) the only problem I have is their garlic bread, totally addictive! :)  
Must try the Lemon Drop Martini!

ALRIGHT NOW, this was just super good food.  

We got sat towards the back where the server station was, but wasnt going to let that annoy me.

Bernadat was our server (thats how it was spelled on the receipt, so sorry if it was spelled wrong), and she was super amazing and a doll.  She was super attentive.

We started with the Noras salad (nothing special), but it was good.  He got the baked chicken parmigiana and I got the chicken alfredo.  He really enjoyed his chickem parmigiana, and the best part it was fried.  It was pan seared in a pan and the sauce and cheese got put on after.  Just different and super delicious.  The alfredo was delicious, but I didnt care for the chicken so much in it.  I did order a side of meatballs, (this was just ok, I wouldnt order it again)

We also ordered some drinks that the servers had made up, its in the cocktail menu on the first page.  He ordered the toasted coconut which was AMAZING and I ordered the pilgrims passion, it was super good as well.  

We ended the meal with a tiramisu, which was ok.

Other then that, service was great.  Everyone knew where to be and when to be. 

The 2 hostess seemed a little lost, but that didnt ruin anything.  

I would like to sit on the east side of the restaurant next time we come.  It seemed a little more quiet and intimate.

I give Nora's 5 stars! Been going to Nora's since their old location down the street and I can honestly say I haven't been disappointed! The food is amazing, price is even better! Not very expensive at all! Service is always great so no complaints there! I'm not sure how long they've had live music but they have that going on now too! One of my favorites restaurants in town for sure!

Primer vez  en este restaurant y noooo me gusto la comida .. el espagueti Alfredo no tenía sabor y el pollo que tenía parecía que lo metieron al agua lo sacaron y pusieron en mi plato .. sin sabor ..me habían recomendado mucho el lugar pero no fue de mi agrado .. el servicio muy lento .... no volveré gracias

Went to Noras for the first time, and it was DELICIOUS! The lasagna was my favorite and the chicken marcela was out of this world and man those breadsticks are addicting so be easy with them. I cant wait to go back and try more things, especially dessert! It does get really busy though so if you don't call ahead or have a reservation it could be a while waiting.
Ordered a seafood pasta and pizza. Waited half hour, turned out they made wrong pizza. I came here because of the high rating but I was very disappointed. Pasta tasted okay. Will not come back again

There is an awful problem in Las Vegas finding decent neighborhood restaurants.  The restaurants on the strip are expensive and the neighborhoods tend to have strip mall national chain foods.  I thought Nora's might work out but it didn't.  The prices are high for the quality of the food.  Any place that uses pepper as the main seasoning may have a problem with the quality of the meat.  The service is dreadful.  We waited over an hour and ten minutes for our food.  I have never waited that long in my life for dinner.  The waiter disappeared so we couldn't find him to inquire as to the delay.  We were not offered even a drink or bread for our inconvenience.  And it is loud, crowded and cold.  We will not be returning.

We went there with no reservation on my moms birthday, which I found out its reservation only. But they set a table for us and  accommodated our party. Staff was excellent but the food was even better. We have been here 3 times since.

Went in for lunch this past Monday y
to celebrate a friends birthday. The food was pretty bad. The pasta in linguini with clams was way under cooked and I just about broke a tooth with a clam shell. My friend sent back her veal, it was so sugary sweet. The replaced her dish with a tasteless eggplant. My friends husband asked her to bring him octopus do she orders it to go. When she got home all she saw in her to go box with 4 little pieces of octopus with an old looking wilted salad. She paid $20.00 for that to go dish. I called the restaurant to speak to the manger he was unavailable so I left a message. He hasn't returned my call. We were very disappointed.
This restaurant needs to be on an episode of bar rescue!!! Someone please help them! I've been waiting for my food since 7:13pm it is now 8:10pm...

Went to Nora's for the first time May 4 2017 for my birthday . 

Service : our server was good . Our reservation was at 9:30 pm on a Thursday so service was a tad rushed so they could get out of there . 

Food :
-the antipasto salad was average something you could get a basic deli . 
- the osso bucco was great and the best part of the experience 
- we had a side of rigatoni with the spicier sauce which was also average. 

Overall : 
The experience was  what can be expected from a Italian off strip restaurant not great but definitely not bad .

It's  a very good, non-touristy Italian food. I've been a number of times with different business folks and everyone agrees that it's the best Itailain in Las Vegas. I love the Gorgonzola chicken! Every food item I have been at the table for, has been a hit, so the menu is solid. This is a must go, whenever m in Las Vegas!

Great Italian food!!!

This might be our Italian Go To from now on!

Nora's looks like an Italian restaurant out of the movies... looks a lil Godfather-ish on the 'right hand' side complete with a bar and live music...

We were seated on the 'left hand' side - still very good - Appears that this side is suitable for large groups...

Onto the food... Wow!

We were on family night... this is how it went down:

First we noshed on the (free - 1st round is free) Garlic Bread... I loved that they sliced the bread very thinly - it did not fill me up... it is all in the slicing of the bread that made all the difference to me & my guys... We also had the Calamari as our appetizer (Yummy - full squid and all!)

Mom (Me): Gnocchi w Vodka Sauce w a glass of Annabella Cab Sav ;-)
Geo: Pasta Alla Nora
Lu: Baked Rigatoni

Everything was very tasty & true to Italian Cuisine.

I rarely every give 5 stars... this would apply especially because of the area that the restaurant is in... not the nicest... However, Nora's makes up for it!

Since, I love to review I am sharing this - even though I do not want All of Vegas there taking up my space... lol

It was quite busy, however, there was still room for more... It was a Tuesday... I would say that if you are going any other day, like say the weekend, call and make a reservation & give them at least an hour or more notice...

Salute! Cin Cin!

your constant companion,

~deirdra

Food was delicious. Service was not good. Wait staff was not friendly nor attentive. Never came back to ask how everything was. Never came to see if we needed refills on our drinks. Never asked if we wanted anything else.  I could see if they were extremely busy. But it wasn't. Again, food was amazing, which is why I gave 3 stars.  Will I go back? No thanks.

My favorite Italian restaurant ever!!! I have been going here every week for over 3 years now. Everything I order always taste as good as the first time. Family owned and intimate. They are moving to be bigger location this year because the place is so great. I recommend this restaurant to everyone who loves Italian or just great food. Prices are unbeatable. You can go to an Italian restaurant on the strip pay triple and still be hungry and the food not have any flavor. I can go on and on. Just try it out!

Tonight me and my boyfriend celebrated his birthday dinner here it was so amazing from drinks to the food! everything was great enjoyed it all! Definitely will be back soon!!!!


Server was Marla :) she's great

Big disappointment... Was a big fan of the old Nora's and finally checked out the new one.  I had the El Diablo and Clover Club at the bar which were both exceptional.  Bartender service was very quick and friendly also.  Had been told that we could be seated early, but the reservation time came and went before we were called.  We ordered the a bottle of wine, veal cannolini a la vodka and the chicken marsala.  The old Nora's had the best chicken Marsala in the valley in my opinion and I am from a small town in upstate NY where they have some of the best Italian food in the US.  The wine was awful.  We didn't even finish it, but I blame myself because I chose it.  The veal was mediocre, but the chicken marsala was very dry.  I sent it back and was very quickly brought a new plate.  This was also very dry.  I choked down what I could because I was hungry.  The side of pasta was a saving grace.  Anyway I will never be going back to Nora's.

Go where the locals dine! And Nora's is where the locals dine...and in droves!!!

Nora's is a legit restaurant that has been serving huge plates of tasty pasta since 1991 ( that's a long time in Vegas land). 

They have moved from their original strip mall location to a much larger free standing building. The new location is gorgeous with lovely wood floors , modern light fixtures, outside dinning ( at 105 degrees we opted out of that!), a very lovely large bar.

We did not have reservations and had to wait an hour...but it was worth it. My tip to you on this is to come in after the first rush around 7 and it should be less hectic.

Great appetizers: free garlic bread, wonderful done calamari, mozzarella sticks, a very solid Cesar salad ( somewhat pedestrian but okay).

The menu has something for everyone: great gnocchi, fantastic lasagna ( layered with light al dente  pasta, bechamel cream,  tomato sauce and rich cheese), hearty wild boar  pappardelle, lovely linguini with either shrimp scampi or salmon.....even their classic cheese pizza is pretty darn good.

The meat and fish dishes also looked fantastic although we did not partake.

Nice and extensive wine list ( nothing crazy but good solid pics). Two of us had a Chianti Classico and it was okay not great!

Service was impeccable: polite, efficient, and consistent. All used utensils were replaced with new. Water was filled consistently fast. Waiters checked back frequently to see how things were....and these guys are working lots of busy tables!!!!

Desserts looked great but we were too full.

I highly recommend Nora's for 2-10 people and feel you will have  a wonderful experience away from the strip.

Expect to pay $30 for an appetizer, a pasta dish and maybe a glass of wine....and for me from San Francisco that's a deal!

Great food, reservations are a must, bar gets over packed and it is near impossible to get a seat.  Also make sure you sit in one of the side rooms and not near the kitchen.  Food is grea and alone would be worth four stars,but the service is suspect at best, and being beyond packed is what bugs me about this place.

A little disappointig, with all the good reviews and as busy as they were I was just expecting more. My daughter and I arrived for an early dinner at 4:00 and the place was kinda busy, by the time we left at 5:00 it was packed, and it was midweek!!! That's usually a very good sign. We ordered mozzarella sticks for an app and they were soggy like I assume frozen ones from the store are and it came with an extremely small side of marinara sauce. The meals were ok, chicken parm and ravioli, nothing to exciting but ok. The service was excellent...

I honestly cannot see how this placed is reviewed so well. So, we came here after reviewing the reviews of my fellow yelpers and saw a good amount of people in the restaurant. We were served the complimentary one basket of garlic bread. If you want some more garlic bread, it's $1.50 per basket. It was ok. I ordered the lasagna and my bf ordered the "works" which is a mixture of sausage, jalepenos, shrimp, sun-dried tomatoes, and pasta. My lasagna was gross. It had pounds of cheese to mask the nasty flavor of the dish. I couldn't figure out what the flavor was sort of like nutmeg. The works dish was somewhat better. The shrimp was good and the sausage but seperate. All together it was rather nasty. Yes, its not expensive, but save your money its not worth it. We left very dissappointed.

The new location is beautiful! The hostesses were very helpful despite the place being extremely busy. The food is wonderful as always and Adam the bartender is better. He is attentive and very sweet.

Check-in via Yelp, and scored 1 FREE house wine! Nora's garlic bread is AHhhmazing! The "Crazy Alfredo" caught my attention! This best-seller features the classic fettucine alfredo piled with chicken, sausage, jumbo shrimp, porcini mushrooms, domestic mushrooms, roasted bell peppers, sun-dried tomatoes and jalapeños! Yum! Nora's Cuisine entrees are mighty huge, one entree can serve up to 2 people!

I work at the tattoo shop across the way, and although I've never actually dined within the restaurant, I order pick-up every now & then.The woman on the other end of the line is always so sweet & helpful when I call, and because my "usual" (angel hair w/ creamy pesto) is attached to my name + phone number, placing an order is a breeze.

It's usually a 25-35 minute wait, which is totally cool with me, I know how busy it gets around dinner time... For real though, this place is always hoppin' with hungry folks! And it's no mystery why. Nora's is delicious!

I consider myself a Nora's expert.  I have a hard time paying a lot of money for Italian food, but Nora's is the right price point with quality food and interesting drinks to boot.

Food: Get yourself some of the fried risotto balls for an appetizer to go along with the complimentary garlic bread.  My favorite entrees are the Alla Nora and any pasta with the vodka sauce.  My husband likes the linguine with clams.  I know that one of their "famous" dishes is the Crazy Alfredo, but I'm here to tell you that you can pass on that dish.  Too much stuff in there and the flavors don't stand out because they're all competing against each other.

Drinks: Original and handcrafted cocktails at the full bar.  Of course they have a substantial wine list also, but I'm a cocktail girl.  Those bartenders know their drinks, and can make a wicked Sazerac.

Service: There are two dining areas and a private room that you can reserve.  The private room does have a fee to reserve it, but you get this amazing appetizer platter that is enough to serve around 12 people.  I've never had a problem with service at this restaurant; they are wonderful (my favorite waiter is Will, a tall and handsome drink of water!).

No other Italian place compares.
Wonderful food. Wine list extensive.  4 star only because we had to ask for a server. Once he came over everything was impeccable.

This restaurant  is always busy. Make reservation or you will be waiting  for minimum of 30 minutes before you get seated.  Price is very reasonable servers are friendly and nice. Good place to take your date out on a budget. Pizza is very good but other Italian foods on the menu is OK in my opinion. But it's locals favorites.

This was my first time at this larger location. A Tuesday night and it was crowded! Make reservations when you go. We got there around 8:20pm and their first availability was 9pm. The location is easier to see since it's close to the street. They have a nice outdoor seating area with misters. And there are benches inside and outside to accommodate guests waiting for their tables. 

When we were seated, the first thing I noticed was the noise level. It was quite loud. Hard floors, high ceilings and open layout made it a little playground for all the sound waves! But it got quieter as people trickled out. The service was nice and attentive. Food came out in a timely manner.

We had the grilled octopus and calamari as appetizers. Both prepared well, but the octopus had more flavor. I had the Crazy Alfredo which I enjoyed because it was a touch spicy. I guess I was in the mood for a little kick! It had shrimp, sausage, chicken, mushrooms, sun dried tomatoes and jalapeños. Overall, a pleasant experience, but nothing that really stood out. 

They also have a private room which would be nice for groups.

The food here is spectacular. Can get a little crowded like crowded but we were seated quickly after first being told there was a wait. Judy had the rack of lamb, cooked medium rare, huge portion, presented on top of cooked spinach. Complimentary garlic bresd as good as you will find. We also had friends led bronzini- grilled while so watch for bones.less expensive pasta dishes are filling and totally satisfying for spaghetti lovers. This is a fine restaurant. Service was terrific, parking lot a little small and puck a time to avid the wait. But once you get seated, you will be happy.

The food was very good, the service was bad. I would come back though.

Our group of three came on a Monday night with a 7:45pm reservation. We arrived around 7:30 and were seated around 8:15. The place was packed!

As others have commented, the garlic bread is a nice touch. The waitress took our drink orders, two glasses of wine, and two diet cokes. The wine came in little carafes to pour in your glass. My friend had about 1/4 of her Sauvignon Blanc left when the waitress came and took it away without even asking. Only one of us was given a glass of water. About halfway through the entrée, a waiter came and took our diet cokes (which were half full), ostensibly to refill them. He only brought one back.

Two of us ordered the Wild Boar Pappardelle and one ordered the eggplant parm. The egglplant parm portion was huge. Both dishes were really tasty and reasonably priced. 

I also noticed the staff walking around the restaurant were acting as if patrons were in their way and would push past you if you were walking between tables.

Our waitress did ask if we wanted separate checks at the end and said it would be "very easy", which I thought was nice as most restaurants discourage this.

Friendly.  Decent food. Reasonable prices.  I went there for a late night meal and just had a small plate so can't give it a fair review but no complaints

My friend that went with is a regular and really loves it.

I love Nora's.  The food is always excellent.  I work very close to this restaurant, and I would recommend going for Lunch, as the Dinner prices are a little expensive for my taste.  
The restaurant is very very loud.  The service is OK, but the food is always excellent.
