The Chicken Marsala is Awesome, The Chicken Carciofe is Amazing, The Baked Ziti is very rich and decadent, if you order it split it with someone, as you can't finish it due to it being so rich, but it is delicious!
For a lighter fare, order the Orange Roughy lunch, it is pan seared with Oil & Garlic, and has a light crispy crust and is served with a small house salad. 
If you are looking for a romantic quiet italian restaurant, Nora's is not the place.  If you are looking for a small local italian restaurant with excellent food, You will love it!

The new building is beautiful but attitudes have completely changed.  I always loved Nora's when it was in the strip mall.  It was cramped but the food and service always left you with a good feeling despite the close quarters.  I think we are giving up on the new location though.  It started with a takeout order.
      I had ordered a good amount of food including a chocolate cake.  "That cake takes like half an hour", said the person on the phone.  They told me to pick it all up in half an hour.  I arrived and the hostess seemed irritated by my presence.  She came back with my food sans cake.  "You know that takes like half an hour to cook", she told me about the cake.  Her tone suggested I was a dumbass for ordering cake.  My food sat on the host's stand getting cold while I sat and waited for cake at the bar.  The bar tender asked what I wanted and I told him I was waiting for cake.  "That takes like half an hour", he said.  Thanks bud.  I asked to speak to the manager and told him my beefs.  He was very professional and gave me a voucher for $30 off my next meal.  Cool. 
      Several weeks later my wife and I pop in late in the afternoon with the plan of getting some apps and cocktails.  We used to do this frequently at the old location.  We loved the arancini and calamari.  We sat at the bar and were unacknowledged for ten minutes despite multiple people behind the bar.  It appeared the person who's section were in had tables outside the bar that needed his attention and the other bartender was not going to bother with us because we were not in his section.  This just made me sad because, as someone who worked in restaurants for years, I really admired the teamwork and camaraderie at the old location. It just gave you a good feeling while you were there.  We were never ignored there.  We got up and left, if anyone noticed they didn't care.
      The last time, still holding the $30 voucher, was around 5:00 last Saturday.  I approached the host stand, met with a rather curt, "yes?" from the hostess.  "Table for two please" I said.  She looked left, and then looked right at the half-empty dining room.  "It's going to be about half an hour unless you want to sit on the patio" she said.  It was about 110 degrees that day.  She cared more about keeping the sections even than getting people served.  As we left disappointed I told my wife, "I'm tired of holding on to this stupid voucher, I've had it in my wallet for almost six months."  "Just give it to someone" she said.  So I handed it to a dad in the waiting area and finally severed my maddening tie with this indifferent restaurant.

AMAZING!!! The Seafood Misto is a major tongue-gasim, simply scrumptious and a super satisfying split, SERIOUSLY!

It may be that I have a very fond memory, that is now associated with dinning at Nora's with my Mom.  The first time we went here over a month ago, was after we went for a consultation for a tattoo, then today, we went to get them, WoooooHooooo! They came out fabulous by the way.  

Anyway back to the Misto!  Which is all we've tried, besides the salad and bread,and it is out-of-this-WORLD!   Make sure you save most of the garlic bread, to dip in the sauce of the dish, ooooooh, awwwwww, mmmmmm, I tingle all over just thinking about it, yum yum yum yummy!  

OK, sorry I'm back, :-) So, we split a salad and the Misto, and that's the PERFECT lunch! It's one of those meals that you get to remember hours later, and wonder when you'll get again. Something so delicious that you don't want to eat to often, for fear of it losing it's appeal.

  Oh yeah, if you don't  like garlic, this isn't the dish for you ;~D

Great service, good food, live music, lots of parking and excellent decor.  Nora's Cuisine made a great first impression on me.  Good wine selection and full bar was another plus.  I definitely want to go back.

One of the singular worst meals I've ever had! Flavors ranged from bland to completely tasteless. There is more flavor in a can of Chef Boy R D or Spaghetti-o s, and I wouldn't feed that stuff to my dog.

came here for dinner with a large group expecting nothing, but i left feeling very full and very happy with everything. 

what i ate:
- mozzarella caprese (app): delicious caprese. fresh ingredients. very tasty. 
- pomodoro bruschetta (app): very fresh and garlicy on top of tasty bread. while very good, i was nervous about eating more than one and getting too full
- garlic bread: soooo garlicy and buttery and delicious. i was starving when i got to the restaurant so i think i inhaled about 1/3 of the basket. left my mouth super yummy and garlicy. but beware this bread basket! the more you eat the less room you'll have for other delectable treats
- antipasto salad: i know this is a salad, but dang, it's a filler. plenty of cheese, ham, salami, olives. very tasty italian dressing
- penne w/vodka sauce: suprise dish of the night! that vodka sauce is UH MAY ZZING! so addicting. the leftovers were pretty good the next day too
- chicken parmigianai: very well cooked. not too heavily breaded. the chicken was still moist and juicy
- pork tenderloin alla siciliana w/arugula salad, garlic red potatoes: the pork was good, but it got kicked up two notches when paired with the spicy, citrusy arugula salad. the garlic potatoes were so perfectly roasted, though i wonder, did they flash fry these suckers cause they were so crispy and addicted. probably due to being drowned in oil? shh, it's okay, just keep eating them.
- tiramisu: dessert to get! so tasty and perfect. not too soggy, not too cream. this was soooo good. i wish i had more room in my stomach to keep eating
- cannoli: tasty, but id rather have more of the tiramisu
- house sangria red and white: omg, BOTH were so tasty. not too heavy on the wine, not too sweet. just a perfect pairing. (yelp check in FREEBIE: buy one sangria or house wine, get one FREE!) the bartenders were pretty annoyed that we all used the app to get the freebie, but no shame. the sangria is great! the white one was much more refreshing, but i preferred the slightly richer red wine

pros:
- service: we had a very large party, but the server was great. he tried to keep on top of things as much as possible, despite having to juggle so many of us
- FOOD: everything!!!! i ate was so tasty and delicious
- live music: when we went on a friday night there was live music in the bar dining area. i cant really remember what kind of music they played, but it was relaxing and nice... but, due to the loud music, it may be difficult to have a conversation with your date if youre sitting in the bar dining area
- prices: very very reasonable for all the food offered

cons:
- only 1 bathroom for each sex. i was there for a few hours, and every time i went to the restroom there seemed to be a wait. 

would i come again? sure!

I have to say it was a good one
Good customer service 
Grate taste of there food
Love it 
Very recommended this place to anyone

Reservations? No reservations? Call-in's, no call-in's? Hmmmm... So do we call before we come or should we just come? Who the hell would know with this confusing establishment.  Been here twice now and this Saturday night was my finale. Teenage hostess attitude is totally unacceptable, unbearable and downright snippy and rude. I called to make a reservation and the teenage 'Flo' like girl says Im sorry we don't take reservations. So I come to restaurant and find that I am asked if I have a reservation. WTF! I tell her no because when I called in they said they don't take them. She tells me that'll be 40 mins. My party of 4 waits 15 mins at which time we are seated in the raised cafe bar tables. Super uncomfortable and should be removed from this establishment. I know the diner hostess put us there on purpose lol. Food was mediocre at best, meat sauce was bitter and left me night time memoirs. Sausage links were stone cold and entrees were all luke warm. To top that off, the service was absent and it took an hour to receive our meals. Seriously folks....your food and your tude just isn't deserving of my gracing your establishment's presence. This is not New York, nor is this a real Italian joint, so do your patrons a favor and drop the attitude about which customers you care for and which one's you don't. We as customers could give a care less about who you want in your restaurant, so treat them all with top notch service, food and respect. Oh and PLEASE get rid of the 3 Applebees Girls you have tending to the hostess station. They are losing you business and loyal customers with their condescending tone, attitude and demeanor.
Great place! We got the prosciutto pizza, which was absolutely delicious! I dragged my grandmother despite the fact that she said she wasn't hungry and she had 4 slices!

The food was A-OK, but the fact that I'm struggling to remember it shows that the experience to me was very middle of the road. I had the Veal Marsala, and it tasted like Veal Marsala. The sides we ordered for the table were tasty, but it was pretty much the same story - the calamari, truffle fries, and garlic bread tasted like calamari, truffle fries, and garlic bread. Though I appreciated the service and family business feel, it was difficult for me to understand the accolades, and as others have mentioned, the Strip has many excellent (though pricey) Italian restaurants.
Food was okay. My cousins chicken was really bland. I had the lasagna and I feel like I could of bought a frozen lasagna and it probably would have tasted better. I won't be returning.

Good old style Vegas atmostphere. Bustling with people, the bar was packed and everyone was extremely friendly. Bartenders were understandably busy and they make a mean lemondrop martini.

We were sat right on time (I would highly recommend making reservations). The waiter was friendly, again,  busy so he was in and out and doing what he does, not a lot of personal interaction as with the bartenders.
I orderd the Chicken Erbe fini - spaghetti with herbed chicken breast. Spaghetti was good, good red sauce, not watery and full of flavor. The chicken was a little dry and not as much flavor as I would have liked.
My date ordered the lasagna and after sampling some of that, I should have ordered the same. Hearty, full of flavor, strong cheese flavors, the meat sauce was excellent. Baked of course, and very rich.
The garlic bread was good as was the mozzarella sticks, both served piping hot and a great way to start the meal

Celebrated Valentine's Day with my love and this was the perfect place  we enjoyed the garlic bread, a house salad and an appetizer first. For dinner, I had the Chicken Marsala & penne lunch portion & it was delicious! My Guy really enjoyed the Chicken Parmesan with rigatoni! To top off our night we had to have the Cheese cake & the gelato! 
Our waiter was fast & friendly. We'll definitely go back soon.

I am writing this review as I enjoy leftovers from dinner earlier tonight. 

The Nora experience ...ahh where to start...
From the moment you step into Nora's you feel right at home. 
The restaurant has this indescribable homey feel to it that just puts a person at ease. There are two rooms to the restaurant, without having made a reservation, we were lucky enough to be seated immediately in the room by the kitchen.
Their ceiling is very unique and is decorated with Trinacria ornaments which is the symbol of Sicily. Our server was nice enough to give us a short history lesson...pretty interesting. 

The garlic bread...ahhh the garlic bread...I could probably eat three baskets myself. So thin, crispy, and buttery....ahh AND GARLICKY...so delicious. The first basket is free and every additional basket is 2.50...which is smart of them because it is just that addicting. I can see people going off on the garlic bread and call it a day. 

I ordered the Chicken Carciofi in attempts to be "healthy"....I figured that chicken breast can't be that bad for you...eh. 
The order is served with pasta, fresh tomatoes, artichokes, and capers. The chicken was so moist and the flavors were just MMmmmMm...perfect...not to salty and just right. Pretty much blown away at first bite. Very generous portions, which explains why I'm stuffing my face with pasta at 1:30am...
Such a bad idea blaghhh...Body will hate me for eating all these carbs before bed.

Friends got the rigatoni special and cheese raviolis which were great as well but I was pretty overwhelmed with my Carciofi to really enjoy theirs.

We also got the calamari and mozzarella sticks as appetizers, but I wasn't really impressed with either.

Really great Italian food at very reasonable prices without sacrificing service. Our server was very attentive and informative. I will definitely be back to try the crazy alfredo. It is probably a good idea to make a reservation next time to be seated in the main room.

Guaranteed to put you in a food coma.

The new Nora's is great ambiance. 
Kenia is an awesome server 
Food is good but not great. Took a long time to get food. 
Better than some. 
Not as good as others.

All that and more....
Ask for: Kara!  Outstanding waitress.  Seriously.  She killed it. 

We've been waiting for months to go to the new location on W. Flamingo.   My suggestion: Get there early...and ask for "Kara".  

They have an extensive wine & spirits (great Whiskey selection) menu.  They also feature Tenaya Creek Micro brews on tap. 

We had:
Appetizers:
Caesar Salad
Calamari

Main Course:
Ditalinni Pasta 
Shrimp Scampi
Chicken Marcella

Everything came out in good time..food was authentic and great quality.  

Stop reading my review and just go already!   

Forget Abou-it!

Food was excellent! I had the Melrose, which is linguini in creamy basil pesto with sun-dried  tomatoes and zucchini. Delicious. Service was great. The waitress was very attentive. Made our bread sticks seemed bottomless.

Years later even after moving to a bigger location, their service is still the absolute worst in Vegas that I have ever encountered. I've lived here my whole life and I will never patronise this place on my own accord. Their food is loaded with so much salt that my blood pressure skyrockets and I'm thirsty beyond normal. And why on EARTH are the negative reviews on here "not recommended?"  They are absolutely truthful in their rightful scorn.

Pretty good and consistent . They use good tomatoes which I appreciate . Floor was slippery but looked clean . I liked the pizza I ordered . My wife got the veal , it could of used a few more whacks with the tenderizer but flavor was on point .

The Restaurant was one of my favs ,. I was disappointed the eggplant parm was sliced so thin all you tasted was sauce & cheese . The sauce was too tomato tasting w/little flavor . Service was adequate at Best . The rice ball appetizer were the size of golf balls instead of the larger than meatball size they should be to at least savor the taste . We will give this place another chance as the chef might of been off & make allowances for an off night

Not overly impressed. The entrees we ordered were all pasta and had a good flavor but that's about where the good stops. The complimentary garlic bread was nothing special and pretty dry, but this isn't what makes my review only 2 stars. The service was terrible. We were seated in the crammed kitchen area and 20 minutes of no one taking our order I nearly checked in to be like 'oh hi, we're your customers on the table by the door and we're hungry!' It got to the point where other servers that we tried to wave down would just put their heads down when they walked passed our table. Plain rude and frankly it was not that busy. There are definitely better Italian places in town for the same price or less.

My brother introduced me to this place...very good food.  Southern Italian from what I understand.  I ordered the Linguine with Clams...very good!  My bro loves the Pasta ala Nora and the Orange Roughy dish.  My dad ordered the Chicken Marsala and he enjoyed it.  We also ordered the Antipasto salad which was yummy, with lots of fresh meat on it.   The service was very good...they were very attentive. From what I understand they used to be smaller and then when they were featured on some show and got more popular they had to add on an extra room to accomodate all their new customers.   I seriously felt like there was a little old Italian lady that cooked our meals for us...so yummy:)  Make sure to make reservations...we went on a Tuesday, made reservations, and we still had to wait a bit!  Oh, and it's located in a shopping center, behind an Arby's!

Busy busy Saturday night! Well worth it! The service was phenomenal, food was fantastic! Everyone enjoyed they appetizers & entrees. My chicken parm was delicious! Huge portion! Waiter recommended  the peanut cup cocktail. OMG! A must have. I can't wait to come back!

My buddy and I misjudged the walking distance from The Palms to Nora's on a 100+ degree evening. The entire walk over we were hoping for the best and that the food would be worth the trek. Nora's delivered just what we were craving. Garlic bread starter went down quickly and we ordered another basket (the first is on the house and any subsequent basket is on you). We had two amazing and large-portioned entrees: fettuccine carbonara and chicken parmesan (you can add any sauce over the pasta you want - I ordered the meat sauce).

The service was excellent. Friendly, attentive and quick servers supported by bus boys, drink boys and cute hostesses. After gorging ourselves, we decided to Uber back to the casino. Once Nora's moves to their brand new stand-alone location, we hope to be back on our next visit to Vegas!

(Also, eating off the strip is so much nicer. Supporting local restaurants has always been more rewarding and delicious!)

New location much too noisy. Sat at table for 4, and couldn't hear each other talk. Server didn't know who ordered which dish, so had to ask. That really is annoying. Pasta dish cold and lacking flavor. Old location was much better. Think twice before coming here.

Worst meal and service I have ever experienced here! I've been coming for years including the original location and this is for the first time it took for ever to get water - we got a drink order after our appetizers, and the calamari was cold,  the pizza crust was hardly warm, the branzino was cold and I had to ask for olive oil and sea salt 3 different times from 3 different people before I finally got it!! When the manager Joemar came over to try to help he was rude and asked what I wanted even though I just told the waiter that I wanted the pizza warmed up - terrible all around!  The manager does not belong in the service industry.

Had a reservation here for 8:30 pm but didn't get seated until 9. 

The service was pretty good, especially since it was a Friday night. Our waitress took down our orders fairly quickly and other servers were constantly making rounds to fill water, which was nice. They have a live band playing on the weekends but we were seated on the other side so we couldn't really hear them. 

The complimentary garlic bread was delicious! It had real minced garlic on it, not just garlic powder. It was my favorite part of the meal. I ordered the chicken marsala which comes with a side of spaghetti. The chicken was juicy and tender but the portion was actually pretty small. The side of spaghetti, which was was just OK, was bigger than the chicken.

It's not my favorite Italian restaurant but I wouldn't mind coming back again to try other dishes!

This was the first restaurant I ever patronized in Vegas back at their old location.

Lets start off with the positives: the food. 

The food is great! I haven't had a bad meal here yet. Their prices match up to the quality and the portions quite well. It isn't a cheap dinner, but it isn't outrageously expensive. 

The drinks: great wine list, and great cocktails! The bartenders know what's going on here.

The negatives: THE WAIT!

I'm tired of the wait here. We've been here 3 times at the new location, and only once did we get our food within 45 minutes of ordering it. We waiting and hour and 10 minutes the last time we were there. That is unacceptable. 

It's hard to talk negatively about a restaurant whose food you love, but I really just don't think it's worth the wait at this point. The service is WAY. TOO. SLOW.



Would I come back here again? Only if they can guarantee me I get my food inside 40 minutes from ordering.

Would I recommend this place to others? Yes, with the warning that they will wait.

Reluctantly gave Nora's another try after a not-so-amazing first visit, and glad I did. Danny and Marcelo pulled out all the stops to make sure everything was on point this time around.

My friend and I were seated promptly at our reservation time and both opted for a Strawberry Daze each since they were so good before. A beautiful batch of arancini came out on the house, and was quite delicious as well. While I was tempted to give the alfredo another go, I chose our server's recommendation of the Chicken Carciofi. Super delicious if you like the flavors of lemony capers and artichoke. I must add that the dinner portions here are huge, but I was happy to have leftovers to enjoy later.

Housemade tiramisu hit the spot to close out a great dinner. Staff was attentive, attractive, and kind. Atmosphere was upscale chill without a touristy Vegas strip feel, which I really liked. Cool environment for a nice date or just to catch up on the latest goss with a girlfriend without feeling rushed.

Went in for a biz lunch today. New building Is nice. Need more parking 

It was 130 when we ordered and it took 45 minutes for 1 sand which, simple salmon and veggies and a chicken Marsala

The salmon was way over cooked! Crispy on both sides, tasted like they dumped a whole shaker of salt and the veggies were just dropping in oil. Entire plate was disgusting. 

I did mention it to the server but, didn't want to make a scene in biz. I had only a few bites. It was clear when the server picked up my plate that I didn't eat it. 

After leaving I called to inform a manger so they could do better next time. After being out on hold and then hung up on (by accident,I assume). I called back and asked for a manager. I was told there wasn't one there, he had stepped out. So, I left a message and told them what I wanted to discuss

It's now 930pm and no call back. 

The Decision to never return or hold another biz meeting there has been made

Too bad :-(

Nora's... mmm mmm mm. Very cozy/ classy environment. My husband and I did date night here. I had been once for a company lunch and I couldn't stop talking about it.. well they relocated and the place is GREAT! It is super packed so make sure you make reservations.. they give you a delicious garlic bread to start off.. and the customer service is good. I had this shrimp scampi and my mouth just waters just thinking about it!

Yup!
Well worth it 
Great food - maybe really great 
Nice wine list 
Service is good but not great 
Atmosphere is fair, but how about the food!!!!

Well worth the 3 mile trip from the strip.  Great experience and great value.  Fun stop.

I am VERY picky when it comes to Italian restaurants, but this place is the best!!! I always get something with an alfredo sauce, and it drives me nuts when it has been sitting even for  a short time, as it starts to dry up fast. I have been here twice, and it was 100% fresh, and the flavor was great!!! Price was good, since it was off the strip, yet the quality and flavor still beats the higher priced places. Service was amazing, just be sure to get a reservation. All the locals know and it fills up fast!

I'm not an Italian food aficionado but this is hands down the best Italian food I've ever had. Great atmosphere and service. Perfect to impress a date or to impress clients for a business meeting. Huge bar with a lot of good wine. Michelle makes the best drinks. Only ask her to make your drinks. You won't be disappointed. Plus she's super cute ;)

I used to go to this place years ago when they were a quaint restaurant and now they have expanded into a bigger more upscale place similar to their other location in Summerlin which closed. Their food is not as good as it used to be but still good. Great Ambience and service is good too! I do recommend this place to everyone!
Amazing pasta!!! Live music on Friday night. Tastes very authentic wouldnt even notice this place was here, its kinda hidden in a plaza.

It official! Garlic bread is addictingly scrumbdillyicious!!!!
Had the rigatoni special, good enuff
But I like dishes that go POW ZAM ZING!
So I'm gonna see whats next on the menu 
Atmosphere is nice n casual, service nice and attentive, would u like more garlic bread? Why yes thanks!
Overall a pleasant experience and will be back for more!

Mangia!!!!!

Tuesday night around 8pm, had a 15min wait (not bad for how busy they are). Got the house salad with balsamic vinaigrette and it was excellent. They forgot our garlic bread but once the waitress brought it, it was excellent too. I ordered the gnocchi with Alfredo sauce, and it wasn't good because their gnocchi is too sweet and chewy/doughy for house made gnocchi and I am a big gnocchi person--not worthy of comparison with Sage's gnocchi. My husband ordered the pasta primavera with Alfredo sauce and it was very tasty, highly recommend this dish for vegetarians. Taking off 1 star for gnocchi and one for the waitress being forgetful with aspergered behavior unless strictly business is her understanding of "service", as well as, rushing us a bit for no reason what so ever. She even grabbed the check book before we had a chance to go over it and pay. Will definitely come back to curb our pasta cravings and make sure she isn't our waitress--5'4 lady with her dark blond hair pinned up, in her 40s-50s, with black squared teacher glasses (she never gave us her name) who needs to get off her adderall!

I've always enjoyed my visits to Nora's when they were in their old location, and was excited to check out their newer one as I had heard some good things after the move. 

We made a reservation for 7:15pm and were seated promptly. The server immediately came over and asked us for our order, I thought that was a bit bit strange as we had just sat down. I ordered Wild Boar Pappardelle. I've had this dish here once before and it was just as good if not better than the first time. We also ordered Pasta a la Nora and spaghetti with clam sauce. They were busy (as always) and I felt they weren't as mindful as they usually are, but the only thing that seemed to suffer was a delayed drink refill. 

The one thing that rang out to me was that this new location was much louder than the previous one was. From what I recall the decor seemed a bit softer in the old one, and this one is more bare and the sounds seem to overtake the location and I could barely hear my dinner mates sitting right next to me. Overall it was still a enjoyable meal and night out.

Anniversary Dinner November 7 Great Authentic Italian Cuisine

Great Service very friendly and attentive staff and waiter, conveniently made online reservations we were seated right away upon arrival.
Tip-register online receive 15 dollars off birthday.
Portions are big enough to share.
Value- big portions, quality food, low prices
Free Anniversary dessert so goood!
Ambiance -1star located in strip mall away from vegas strip, Ceiling tiles needed attention, No music Friday night scheduled for Saturday, Sat in small table in the corner. Locals come in shorts casual atmosphere, felt overdressed.

MUST BRING A JACKET, the place is SO cold! 4 of us attended. We ordered the Wild Boar, Chicken Parmigiano (which is hard to mess up), Chicken Marsala, Chicken Alfredo. The boar & Parmigiano were too salty. Our service experience was horrible. Had to flag down our waitress multiple times to simply get drink refills. We came in at 8:45 & didn't leave until 10 mostly due to the 30+ min wait. Also had to flag down a server to get our waitress for our checks. She put the wrong items on the checks & put the wrong items in the bags. We pretty much serviced ourselves for the entire dinner, the only thing that was actually done for us without having to ask was to get our food brought out to our table.

I've been to Nora's twice and had somewhat different experiences. 

Both times that I went the food was very good. I've tried their gnocchi, and their fettuccini Alfredo. The gnocchi was very good, not the best that I've had in Las Vegas, but it was delicious. Everyone that I've dined with at Nora's has enjoyed their meal.

The first time I visited Nora's was with a large group, so I can understand that service was a little slow. The next time we visited with a small party the service was excellent. 

The dining room is crowded but has great ambiance - exactly what you would expect from a nice Italian restaurant. Unfortunately, you may not be seated in the dining room. The second time I visited this restaurant was when my mother was in town, and we took her to Nora's because she wanted a nice Italian dinner for her last night in Vegas. We did not have a reservation, and we were happy to wait for a table. After waiting for a few minutes we weren't taken into the dining room but instead sat next to the bussing station and kitchen. There's a tiny row of tables behind the hostess station - it's noisy,  busy with servers running food from the kitchen, and warm. I realize that this restaurant is small and busy, but I don't think it's an acceptable place to seat diners at a restaurant with prices this high. It was made even worse by the fact that the only people sitting in this area were people who were more casually dressed. So, I guess if you would like a nice seat at this restaurant either make a reservation specifying a table in the dining room or make sure you aren't dressed casually. Either way, I don't think I'll be back. There are many places in this city to get good Italian food at a lower price point with just as much ambiance as you would get sitting next to the kitchen at Nora's.

This was my first time at Nora's. I don't frequent Italian food as it is a little too heavy for me sometimes and when I do I usually just go to Maggiano's or Brio, but upon a recommendation I came here. It was definitely a great choice.

The ambiance was very nice, upon entry it seemed very classy and upscale, but don't be fooled--the prices are very affordable. We were greeted by very sweet hostesses and seated immediately. 

The menu is not too overwhelming. There were a lot of options, but not too menu that you don't know where to look first. It's also nicely sectioned off hy what kind of dish you are looking for--meat, seafood, pasta, etc. As an OCD list maker, I appreciated that. 

The food was absolutely amazing. I ordered the crazy alfredo and was blown away! I love my food spicy and the one thing about pasta is that other than red pepper flakes added after the dish is served, it is not usually spicy. This dish had jalapenos in it and while I am not a fan of jalapeños, I thoroughly enjoyed the spiciness it added to the dish. 

The only reason why I am giving it 4 stars is because we waited quite awhile for the garlic bread to come out. I had previously looked up Nora's on Yelp and had read that their garlic bread is the best in town so I was anxiously waiting for it. Which by the way is completely TRUE. BEST GARLIC BREAD OF MY LIFE!
Best pasta joint ever. I been to their older location before they've moved to their new hot spot. Hands down my top 3 places for Italian place to go.
Great italian food! The antipasto is a perfect starter and the linguine with clams is delicious! Favorite local spot.

Great food and excellent customer service! Every time I come in, The waitresses have excellent customer service and food is on point. Honestly the best Italian food I've had in Las Vegas!! I've had dinner here about 10 times and never once do I have anything to complain about. DON was our waiter and such a great guy , so friendly !!! Took really good care of my family and I !

All I can really say is Wow!!! The food is great, the best Italian food I've ever had, pizza is wonderful.
Anytime I'm in Las Vegas I will be stopping here!!!!
Better food here than anywhere I've been on the strip. A local friend told me about this place and I'm so glad he did. With so many places to eat in Las Vegas you can get lost but this one is worth checking out.
The place is always crowded so you got to expect to wait some but great food is worth it.

Have been to Nora's 2x now an both times have been very good. The service an the food both outstanding. As soon as you walk in you notice the nice wine room with a huge variety of wine. The decode is nice an modern an it's very open. They have a lot of seating but beware on the weekends this place is packed. So if you can make a reservation. Th kitchen is open which I live as you can see everything being cooked an the smells coming from there make you even more hungry. They have great lunch specials an offer a wide variety of choices. The regular menu had amazing choices as well. I live how they bring you it garlic bread an take your drink order right away. For lunch on this day I had a regular house salad an added chicken to it needed some protein. An a cup of chicken soup. The salad was amazing an was very filling. An the soup just as good. Both just the right amount to fill you up. My husband had the sub which was great as well. The homemade chips are great as well as the fries an sauce. I will definitely go back again for lunch an even dinner. Can't wait to try more of the menu.

This place is sooooooo good!! Had the mussels for an appetizer. We dipped the complimentary garlic bread in the delicious broth the mussels were sitting in and boy was it a party in my mouth!! Entrees we had the linguini with clams and the alla Nora and both were phenomenal!!!  Dessert we had the Oreo tartufo. Chocolate heaven! Ambience was very authentic Italian and so was the food. Bernadette was our server and she was such a sweetheart!! Will request her when we come back. My only thing to say negatively is that it was freezing in there!! Literally like an ice box. I even had 2 glasses of red wine and was still cold!! We did ask Bernadette if there was something they could do about the temp and a few minutes later we saw a gentleman mess around with the thermostat. It did help but not much. No biggie though. Next time I'll just bring a jacket. Problem solved! Thanks again Bernadette and to all who helped make this a great dining experience!!

I love this place for all types of Italian food. The pasta servings are very generous and incredibly tasty. The sauce and spices they use, along with the fire brick oven make for amazing food. My entire family loves this place. They have an excellent wine selection as well.

My coworker recommended this restaurant for my sister who was hosting a pre-wedding dinner for her son.  She wanted a dinner which was reasonable and comfortable for 35 people.  WALLA!  Who would have thought the food was FANTASTIC the drinks were SUPERB and the Ambiance was wonderful.  I want to go back to Las Vegas just to eat at Nora's again.    I can truly say I have never had such wonderful Italian food.  Apple Martini's were a big hit also. Thank you to the wonderful family who owns Nora's.

This is one of my favorite places for Italian food! The calamari is the best that I have had in Vegas so far. Two things make a great calamari, the way it is cooked and the sauce for dipping.The crazy Alfredo is the BOMB! Only down side is that the crazy Alfredo is a very greasy dish. Usually I add in a salad to help balance out the guilt of this dish. The bar is always hopping as well as the rest of the restaurant. Also one of the best BBQ chicken pizzas in Vegas. Perfectly balanced with BBQ sauce. Lots of great dishes to choose from, only problem is that it is hard to choose. Great service with a smile.  Can't say that I have ever had a bad meal here. This place does tend to get busy, so I usually do orders to go. Definitely makes life that much easier.

For some reason locals love this place.  I am not one of those people.  I've eaten many a meals here and always wondered why it was so busy.  The one thing I do like is the live music.  If you long for old-school vegas stop by the bar and listen to the band.  Eat dinner somewhere else first.
Best Italian in Vegas, hands down! And the sangria is to die for! Ask for Bryce!

Wow. Came for the branzino, but even the house garlic bread was impressive. Hot, buttery and toasted to perfection. I've driven by this place for years and we finally decided to give it a try after we had heard they had great branzino at a decent price. Anthony was our server and he was on point. He even offered to help filet my wife's sea bass if she was uncomfortable with all the hidden bones. The cocktails were amazing and the wine list was pretty impressive. The ambiance is nice and casual. We will definitely be stopping back by. I gotta try the chocolate cake!!!

Food was good, but the old Nora's was much more cozy!  The acoustics are bad and the noise level is like a cafeteria... No barriers to elope.  Very loud.  To many good Italian Restaurants... I will try elsewhere.  Good service!

I was excited to try out this place reading all the great reviews but we left kinda feeling like we overpaid for what we got. We came with the 3 kids 2 in highchairs and they seemed pretty family friendly. But I felt they seated us right in the middle of the bar area and with kids there just wasn't much wiggle room and felt out of place with singles and older couples drinking at the bar and trying to enjoy their night out. They did have an entire other side of the restaurant which would've been a better option to seat a party with kids. 

As for the food it's was meh. My hubby loves Alfredo so he got the crazy Alfredo which he did eat it all but said there was too much going on with mostly sausage and peppers. I got the lasagna and we didn't finish it, and a white pizza which definitely lacked flavor, it was just crust, spinach, cheese, no fresh herbs or drizzle of olive oil which is common at other pizzerias on their white pizzas. The garlic bread had a ton of garlic, kids didn't like it but hey I like garlic so it was ok. Service was ok nothing worth noting just kinda blah. I also saw 2 other tables that sent food back, not sure if it was the flavor or just the wrong order. So yea I could say it's worth a try on date night but I would stick with OG which might have even been cheaper too.

We've been dinning with Nora's for over 17 years and we have never been disappointed. Whether for lunch or dinner, the food and service are wonderful.  It's always a pleasure to see staff that have been with them for years.  The only thing we would change is more live serenades - we miss it when one of the owners sons would give us Italian serenades (these were frequent at the prior location just a little a little West of the current NEW location).   

Inevitably, returning family and friends from out-of-town always request a meal at Nora's.  Tonight, we had a party of 10 and we received the most attentive and perfect service from Daniel and Jacob.   A huge thank you to the staff at Nora's for excellent service and even more amazing food!  

As for the food - excellent!  The baked ziti or chicken Marsala are my personal favorites!   My husband and children could not survive a meal at a Nora's without their garlic baskets.  You can never go wrong with a meal at Nora's!!!

I met friends from out of town for lunch earlier this week.  As always, Nora's did not disappoint!  There were 5 of us and we ordered a large salad that was enough to serve everyone at the table with seconds.  Ands, it was very good!

I ordered one of their menu's "Lunch Favorites."  It was the penne chicken broccoli pasta with garlic and oil.  It was excellent.  One minus--there wasn't enough garlic taste for me.  One of the others at the table ordered a large pizza with pineapple and mushrooms--the pineapple being a first for me.  It was such a pity when there were three pieces of pizza left over and she couldn't take it home with her.  She was winging back to Canada the next morning.  I made the sacrifice and took one for the team.  I brought the three pieces home, had one for dinner, and have the other two frozen for a lunch treat!  Tip to Yelpers---go out to eat with out of town friends the day before they're flying home and you might get some take out for the rest of the week.

I have been a fan of Nora's for several years and I highly recommend the place to anyone looking for good Italian food with a really good atmosphere and great service!

Great place to eat. Warning to people that enjoys Italian at chain restaurants. This peace will ruin all those places for you. The food is amazing here. It's always my first choice. I tried a few other well known Italian spots in town that has a reputation and Nora's still beats them out by a long shot. I have been to Nora's at least 40+ times already. Not once have I thought their food was inconsistent. Same great taste every time.  They are very busy so make sure you get reservations. For you guys out there looking to take a girl that likes Italian food, this is the spot. You are welcome.

I came here on the recommendations of friends. The place is modern and not old school vegas, which I prefer. Really? if you go to an Italian restaurant in Vegas don't you expect to run into a few former members of Capone's gang?  So I appreciated the live music on a Sunday night and was hopeful. But the lasagna was run of the mill and a frozen lasagna at Trader Joe's would have been just as good. My suggestion is to pass up this place because there are better alternatives.
Nice atmosphere off the strip. Great food and service .. loved the calamari and pregame alcoholic drinks .. entree was delicious also
In the top 5 Italian restaurants in Las Vegas.  We have been going here for years and never are we disappointed.  Good wine selection, great food. We only wish they had a Henderson location.

Italian food is tough to get wrong, but also tough to get right. Nora's gets it almost right, but I don't find it to be the local legend people make it out to be.

The complimentary (well, uh, the first basket at least, which is pretty miserly!) bread is pretty good - flavorful and crisp, and buttery on top. Just a little burned on the edges too, which helps. The appetizers and entrees, while tasty, just aren't rich and robust enough to be legendary. The pasta has never seemed particularly fresh to me, and the portions are pretty tiny. Still, it's good, hearty Italian food - just a bit generic.

Last time, I was daring and tried the Chicken Mount Etna.
Don't repeat my mistake. Its flavor is more Chinese than Italian.

Lastly, a couple of non-food-related critiques:

1. Service can be inattentive at times, but they get pretty insanely busy so it's excusable.

2. Try and avoid the obnoxious band. If I want live music, I'll go to a concert.
2a. It's loud as hell in there, even when there isn't a band.

3. They partake in possibly my most-hated restaurant ritual - having empty wine glasses on the table upon arrival. Prepare for an awkward moment and a subtly disappointed waiter when you don't order wine.

When you're in the mood for no-nonsense Italian, Nora's can certainly hit the spot. I just didn't find that it lives up to its reputation.

Everything was delicious! The cocktails to start were great-I had the something Mist? Bombay sapphire, strawberry, lemon, honey, and rosemary made for a unique and refreshing cocktail. My mother had a peach bellini which was AWESOME as well! 

Everything we had for dinner was great-the steak and arugula bruschetta was great, thinly sliced steak on top of toasted garlic bread. For our entrees we had Frutti Di Mare in a spicy red sauce, veal parm, and a chicken dish similar to piccata with artichokes and capers. Everything was fantastic! 

The service was great, especially the server assistant who helped me decide on a dish (the chicken carciofi-sp?) and it was delicious without being too overwhelming or heavy, thank you!!!

Nora's is AMAZING! It reminds me of a restaurant you'd find on Arthur Avenue. The food is out of this world and the service is great! I love the ambience, it's very old school Italian. The fettuccine carbonara is my fave and their sangria is so yummy!

I love this location, the Osteria in Summerlin is a little different, still good, but it doesn't have that hole-in-the-wall family style feeling. I'm Italian and I hardly like Italian food in restaurants but this place is my only exception. Try everything! And visit the bar too, they have some amazing mixologist's.

Just try this crazy alfredo pasta, you not going to be dissapointed. They also have full bar and great collection of wine. Stuff making atmospere very frendly and life music make it romantic, i dated my gf in this restaurant and we're very impressed. Very good restaurant, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!!

I've been to Nora's quite a few times. I like Nora's most because you can go there on a date or a casual meal. It's my go to place for Italian food on the west side of town. The menu is good and the price is fair.

If this place were closer to where I live in Las Vegas, this would be on my list of places to go every week.  Very good food, energetic atmosphere, nice alcohol selection.

The best Italian place I have found in Las Vegas thus far; I am not into eating Italian food out too much as my wife and I do a decent job cooking it at home, but Nora's is worth the doe.
If you want Great food and impeccable service, you need to check out Nora's.  We will definitely come on our next visit to Las Vegas.  Looking forward to seeing the new location when it opens.

The best dining experience we have had by far! Friends referred us here and we are so happy we gave it a shot. Kara, our server, was the best!!! Thank you Kara. From the sangria to dinner to dessert , it was all amazing. The service was fantastic and fast. I can't brag enough about this place. It was amazing!!
Really nice atmosphere in both dining rooms, you can bring your own wine for a corkage fee and the food is very good

When in Vegas, I expect over-priced meals that are trying a little too hard to be memorable. Until this last trip, when the hubs and I needed to get away from the madness of the strip and stumbled across Nora's. Best. Decision. Ever. Loved the food--- but only for lovers of garlic and if EVERYONE participates! The meat sauce was literally the best I've ever had. And the fact that it's family owned and run? Bellisima!!! Brava!!!

Nora's is the whole package!  It's a quaint, neighborhood, family restaurant.  There's butcher paper on the tables, the whole place is bustling and there is a 20 minute wait out the door.  

Nora's serves up hot, chewy, buttery, garlicky bread to diners.  They offer an extensive wine list and tons of specialty cocktails.  Last night, my husband sampled the pilgrim's passion.  An alluring blend of gin, passion fruit, elderflower, mint and egg whites.  I had a HUGE glass of red sangria ($7.50).  

We started with the gemberroni fritti.  Lightly dusted, fried plump shrimp with mixed greens, lemon wedges, and a zesty tomato caper sauce.  ($9.95).  A great way to start.

Next, we shared the alla nora ($9.50) and the fettucini carbonara ($12.50).  The alla nora is ground beef, eggplant and spaghetti baked with a crispy crust on top.  It's really good, and a heaping portion. The carbonara was as heart stopping as you'd imagine.  Creamy, dreamy, and delectable.  

We finished our hearty meal with a tiramisu.  Light and creamy and perfect coffee flavor.  The tiramisu vanished but lots of leftovers to take home otherwise.  

Nora's is simply unbeatable for the value, ambience, and flavor of Italian homestyle cuisine.  If you haven't been, you must.  Make a reservation!! They are always packed....the secret is out!

Excellent service and amazing food. While on business 3rd night in Vegas, we decided to have dinner at Nora's. Coworkers choice, she's been here before. New location, warm feeling and great ambiance. Ordered ice tea for drinks and they kept refilling our teas and all without asking. The bread was a bit overwhelming with the garlic but still fresh and good. Ordered a house salad before the main dish and it was just the right portion and delicious. Main course was whole wheat penne pasta with pesto sauce. What I loved about this place was that our waitress was friendly and knowledgeable. She even offered to go light on the oil in the pesto sauce which I'm thankful for because it was perfect. The cannoli dessert was so good that I finished it all. The only reason  for the 4 stars was that our waitress was a bit MIA. We only saw her once during our dinner and when she brought dessert she acknowledge that and told us the dessert was on the house. Everyone was friendly from beginning to end  and it's easy to see why the locals come here. The restaurant does get packed. My recommendation is you make a reservation before hand and leave room for dessert. Thank you to our server's for the great service. My recommendation, make a reservation before you go to the restaurant and leave room for dessert. You will thank me later.  Location isn't to far from the Rio and worth visiting. Bon Apetito!

My food was good although I am no food expert and the prices were very reasonable. The place was full and I talked to two people at the bar who were locals and both were educated professionals who made a special effort to dine their regularly.

Googled good Italian food off strip and we stumbled on Nora's and OMG, so glad we did!!!! Food, wine and service were all excellent for our entire party of ten. Alfredo sauce was to die for and those red sauce lovers were also impressed! House Moscato was excellent!
Our server, Nina took good care of us! Highly recommend.

An amazing Italian place!! I was extremely happy with the food and service. A great place for a date night or a meal with family and friends. They have patio seating available. The garlic bread is bomb!!! The plates are generous, and can feed up to 2

This place is a hidden gem!!  Great little Italian restaurant away from the strip.  You've gotta try the crazy Alfredo if you like hot and spicy !  This is a must try place and prices are extremely reasonable.  Portions are a lot as well

Have been really excited to try the new location. Used to be regulars at the old spot. To be honest it was such a letdown. Made reservations for 3 and a newborn. Got there 5 minutes before our reservation. Ended up waiting 20 minutes beyond our time. 

They seated us in this back room with dreadful lighting. It was clearly a party room that they use for overflow on busy nights. No thanks. Terrible atmosphere and horrible lighting. The main dining and bar areas were so lively but this area was a total buzzkill. 

The server we had was fairly nice when she approached us. We had a pregnant guest with us so decided not to have wine. As soon as we told her that she was MIA the entire meal. The busser essentially took care of us the entire meal. Food was mediocre at best. 

Ordered the Gnocchi with Vodka Sauce and Chicken Carciofi, with some appetizers. The vodka sauce was ok. Have had just as good out of the jar. The Carciofi was supposed to be a garlic wine sauce. Tasted like chicken stock and flour. There's too many Italian options around to go and have an experience like this.

Excellent meal.  Excellent service from waiter nick and Anthony the busser. Very accommodating and personal.  Outside dining was great with the heaters.   Pizza was delicious.  Sauce was yummy.   Chunks of sweet tomatoes. Definitely will be back!

My absolute favorite restaurant! I am Italian so we have s hard time finding good Italian. This place is absolutely delicious! The new building an atmosphere is gorgeous! The prices are very reasonable and they even have live entertainment. A huge selection of wine the place is always very romantic. Be sure to call and make reservations because you may not get in it's always packed in the evening.

Great local hangout for Italian food.
shrimp scampi - so good.  Will come back for more!

Nora's Salad ain't no joke.  Roasted bell peppers, fresh lettuce and homemade dressing.  Great flavors.  Really good.    

Although I am not a fan of alfredo or gnocchi, if you're into that, my friend swears by the alfredo gnocchi.  I tried a bite but it was too rich for me.  In the defense of Nora's alfredo, I have never liked alfredo sauce anywhere.  I had the lasagna and thought it was better than Chef Boyardee.  I wouldn't say this is the best Italian food in town, but it is worth a visit.

Nora's is a great place for any dining occasion (e.g., birthday, anniversary, date night, dinner for one, etc). The hostess in the front was not pleasant. Understandably it was very busy, but that should not warrant an unpleasant greeting. Hence the 4 star rating I am giving.

However, the food here is excellent. It is worth the money you pay. The bartenders were professional, and very attentive. Our waiter was great and very knowledgeable of the menu. We were low on water, and had to ask for a refill which again is understandable at a very busy restaurant. Nonetheless, our party had a great dining experience. I would definitely return to try other items on the menu!
Great food!  Had the Arancini to start, Alla Nora (pictured), the wild boar pappardelle, and finished with the tiramisu and Oreo tartufo. The garlic bread alone is worth the trip!

I found out about this place way back in 2003. I'm a huge fan of Italian food so when my husband and I got married in Las Vegas I asked the locals where the best Italian Restaurant was and they named Nora's. Our first dining experience there was in 11/03, we live in California and every chance we get to go to Las Vegas, we always make it a point to have lunch or dinner at Nora's. One year we took a trip to Texas to buy a car, so when we planned our route back to California, we stopped in town for dinner, since it was during the holiday season, Nora's wasn't open on the day we went so we stayed the night in Las Vegas just so that we could dine at Nora's the next day, that's how big a fan we are!
 I have become adventurous and have tried many items on their menu, it never disappoints. This past August we took our 6-year-old super picky eater to dine at Nora's. She still talks about it today, her cheese pizza with pesto sauce was the best she's ever had. My only wish is that I either lived in Las Vegas or that Nora's would move to California
Went with a party of five and the food and service was top notch.  All the food was tasty and the cheesecake for desert was different and good.

Absolutely worth visiting if you haven't already done so. The new restaurant has a great deal more room and the food is still amazing. Can't get enough of the antipasto salad. Yes, I'm from Chicago and I said salad. The baked rigatoni is excellent as well. About to steal the girlfriends leftover pork tenderloin. It is 5 stars all around. Call early for reservations. Always busy

Was looking for some reasonably priced alternatives off the strip and remembered to bookmark Nora's as a must try while in Vegas for 4 days. Probably the best meal of the entire trip. Everything that was said here about the food is all accurate and true. The portions are huge, enough to be shared family style, a small salad for 1-3 can still feed 4-5. 

Service was very friendly and generous. I made reservations ahead of time based on the reviews that it can get quite crowded, even on a week night, we were seated in the dining room where the room was full of families, women on a girls night out, couples, etc, the room was alive and buzzing. 

Had a lovely glass of Dr L reisling which comes in an adorable little carafe. WIth an unfortunate helping of parmesean cheese garnished on the dish of one of my lactose intolerant dining companions, they were quick to replace the dish with a fresh bash of non dairy product . 

We shared the antipasto salad and bruschetta and indivdually ordered the linguine with clams, baked ziti and chicken erbe fini. 
I had the linguine with clams with the white wine, olive oil and garlic sauce, excellent dish, plenty of clams, pasta served el dente, was too much of a serving, that I couldnt finish. 

We had also earlier ordered the chcocolate cake based on the numerous suggestions here and it was a great way to end a very hearty meal. The chocolate cake has pistachio bits and has a brownie like crunch to it, but very ooey and moist on the inside. 

The only sad part of the evening is that we were so stuffed and knowing we were going to be heading out to a party later on and that we're staying in a hotel with no fridge, had no way to savor any of the leftovers the next day. 

I've had many of good meals in Vegas during my trips there, however this is a kind of place you want to go to when you're wanting to go where the locals go and stay away from the pretentiousness and drama with some of the high end restaurants on the strip. 

Molto Bene!

The food is very bland in most cases, unless you get their old Steak and cheese sandwich (not on the menu anymore), and then all you can taste is the cheese. The chicken Parmesan is not breaded and is sitting in a tasteless soup. I have eaten here many times (not by my choice), and have never had a good meal. It is clean and has a nice atmosphere, but I would skip this place in the future

Amazing spot! Great atmosphere, reasonable prices. My boyfriend and I had the Sicilian olives and truffle fries as an app- delicious! I had the fettuccine carbonara for dinner, but substituted gluten free pasta. It didnt even taste gluten free! It was amazing. My boyfriend really enjoyed his veal parmesan as well. We'll definitely be back.

I'm so glad we finally got to try this place. Great customer service from the hostess to our waiter and servers. Food was just as good as I imagined it to be. From the salad to the main course to the dessert. I ordered the Salmon Carciofi. So delicious! I highly recommend if you like capers and artichoke because there's a lot of it. Everyone in my party ordered something that they all loved as well. You can tell the pasta and all ingredients are fresh because none of us had that gross bloated feeling that most pasta do! 

Will definitely be back and recommend this place to everyone!

This place looked very promising, came in with the family hoping to get a great Italian meal. Service was very very slow, took a long time to get a server to the table. Once the server came and we ordered it was all on our own from there, didn't get checked up on too much. Main issue was the food, the pastas were mediocre and didnt really have much flavor or anything worth raving about. Wouldn't recommend for lunch, if you're okay with going to the strip for some Italian food go to Grand lux cafe or somewhere else, this place just set the expectations high and exciting but didn't provide the flavors or the quality of service we were looking for.  Disappointing, server wasn't too nice either or helpful when it came to me not liking my food, sassy

I know the food is great at Nora's. Been going here since they had their old location. So we decided to go to their new location on a Sunday night. We get there and it's a packed house. The hostess at the front desk told us it'll be maybe 40 to 1 hr wait. So we're like okay, we'll wait. As we were waiting, we noticed that people who had reservations were waiting for almost 30 min for their table. Even the manager and the hostess were so frazzled that night they were giving each other attitude. We also noticed many of the tables were still waiting for their food. We even waited more than an hr. and the manager came to us and bribed us that their "$10,000" heating system outside was legit if want to sit outside in the cold. I don't care if it was $10,000 or 1 million. We specifically said we wanted to sit inside. So more than an hr passed. We left. 
They have poor customer service and bad management.

Their new location is beautiful. We were a big group and service was still great and food arrived quickly and together. 
Starters weren't the best I've had... They were just ok. I love Italian food but that was more American Italian... 
We had Bruschetta, caprese and grilled veggies. All nice but nothing special. 
For an entree I got Alfredo ravioli which was really good. All my friends food looked great as well. 

I recommend the gnocchi

Love his place for years! 
Crazy Alfredo still my favorite.
Prices went up a little bit. But all in all still the best on this side of the strip. Parking is very hard to find, even on a Thursday.

Wow. All my years I've been eating on the strip...and here was this gem!

Everything we had was good! We had the crazy fettucini, aracini and oreo tartufo. All destroyed!

Portions are big so share! Make sure you have reservations because this place gets packed!
Love this place!!  Great food ,friendly staff and pleasant atmosphere.  The Osso Bucco is so.e of the best I have had, and the pasta dishes are always perfectly prepared!!

As a birthday dinner I came with my wife 
The food came fast even on Friday night 
We are very happy overall with everything we have Order and definitely planning on going back there again sometime soon. 
Highly recommended

This place is amazing and delicious.  You do have to make reservations ahead of time because this place is busy.  Parking not so great and you make be parking in the street.  Beside those two things, service and food are great.

Had dinner here last Friday with my dad, his gf and his friend. I was so excited to try this place as I had heard so many good things. The food was really good - I had the chicken Marsala - probably the best I have ever had! 
However! We all were surprised how rude the waitress was! I don't want to give her name, but let's just say she's older one with no smile- to start things off she ask my father first what he was having - my dad said you mean you want to start with her ? ( meaning me ) she didn't say a word and waiting for my dad to order. We all were like wow! Never had anyone do that before - usually ladies first.. She was ok with refilling the drinks but,  a chip was on her shoulder the whole meal. I will definitely come back and still recommend to friends ... But I will ask to stay out of her section!! all the other wait staff had big smiles on thier face ... Seemed to be just her.  What a grump!

We went in for lunch and I had the rib eye steak  sandwich and let me tell it was so freakin amazing. They are not shy with portion size at all. It came with a side of onion strings which were delish and some potato chips which unfortunately were not that great, saying that they were made on site, they tasted a little stale. Everything else even the diet coke was very good. We definitely will be back, my hubby had the rib eye steak it came with a salad it was the same price as the sandwich and my hubby says it was also very delicious. He could have went for an appetizer too, he loves to eat. Oh yes can't forget the amazing breadsticks very good as well.  Overall 5 stars. Apparently there is a line out the door we didn't experience that for lunch but we did notice they are building a Nora's restaurant on the corner that should be able to handle the larger crowds.

I love Nora's! Several of my friends used to work at Nora's when I was a teenager so I was always there eating the food and eating what they brought back to the house. I basically lived off Nora's for a significant amount of my 19th year of life. Thanks for that Nora's! Gio used to sit me down and feed me pasta with meatballs and a sausage shaped like a penis - thanks for that Gio :D hahaaaaa

Good times. Their food is honestly delicious. They just opened a new location next to the old location and I'm so happy they did because they made the restaurant bigger which was needed, and they did a beautiful job with the new place. It's a wonderful environment to dine in.

I hear Gio is turning the old location into a pizza place, which I could not be happier about because I love their pizza. The Snow White pizza has been a favorite of mine in town for 14 years. And I'm a huge pizza lover with very good taste in pizza, when I say pizza is good it's very good. The service is always great as well. All in all a truly wonderful restaurant that has served this city for a very long time. 

The Melrose pasta is my one of my favorite things on the menu. Love you Nora's! I need to go back so I can take photos of their food to add to my review! I have none! Sorry!

Every time I come to Vegas, I MUST have dinner here at least one night.

It helps if you call ahead of time and make a reservation
Really delicious home-made tasting Italian food. The garlic bread is amazing. Wine is pretty good too.
Excellent food and presentation!  I had always heard great reviews about this place but never actually made it out there until this past weekend.  I'm definitely coming back and bringing clients!

A bit overrated. We waited for 35 minutes to get a seat and another 30 minutes to get the food. I understand it gets crowded during the weekends. But a half an hour wait was a little ridiculous. Im talking simple to make pasta dishes. Appetizer we ordered was ok. Pasta was a bit on the salty side. Prices are reasonable though. The not so great part was the service. Would have been great if they followed up our order.

We went to the new location for dinner. The atmosphere was great. Service was great. Unfortunately the food was not good. Chicken Parm was tough and my eggplant parm was mush, either over cooked or over ripe, either way it was bad. We will give it another try in a month. If it's not better I hate to say we won't go back, which would be such a shame because the place is beautiful.

Such an amazing iconic vegas off the strip spot!!! Had the calamari and anti pasta salad... had truffle fries but no sauce served with them... staff said out of ketchup.. but overall new Nora's is great!!! Can't wait for patio next time!!

Went to Noras last night at their new location.  I have to say I was extremely disappointed. Way too loud inside as the music was blaring!   The service was beyond horrible.  We were seated at our table for about ten minutes before anyone ever came over to greet us.  No busser came to the table to provide water or take a drink order.  Once we did order our server came back only  once to ask how things were.  The food was not nearly on point as it used to be.  The marinara sauce that came out was luke warm at best.  Very very disappointing since we have loved Noras in the past.  Will not be returning.
Go to Nora's.  You won't be disappointed.  You'll love the garlic bread and anything you order off the menu!

Last night, Saturday, My boyfriend, friend, and I went to eat at Nora's. I was excited to eat here and expected a lot. We walk into the restaurant and the new set-up is beautiful. I pass by the restaurant every day on Flamingo on my way to work, and the new location is much nicer, aesthetically, than the old one. So, I decide to take my friend here as a special occasion since she is visiting from out of town. 

Anyway, this was our first time eating here. We had reservations at 8:30pm. We arrive at that time, and get seated shortly after. The hostess gives us our menus, and we wait for our server. We were right by the entrance to the kitchen, so there were many workers who passed us. No one came to greet us. At about 8:55pm, still with no service, we literally had to track down our server, who seemed reluctant to help us when we approached her. She didn't even acknowledge that we've been waiting. There was actually no greeting or introduction at all. Just, "Can I get you something to drink?". We ordered our drinks and food from her at the same time. 

I ordered a Hitachino white ale, water, and angel hair pasta with arrabiata sauce and sausage. My boyfriend ordered a diet, water, crazy alfredo pasta, and a calamari appetizer. My friend ordered water and fettuccine alfredo. 

After waiting for a bit longer, and still nothing on our table, the server came back to tell me they are out of the beer. So, I ordered a sangria. Meanwhile, my boyfriend goes to speak with the manager. He said the server is newer and he would expedite the order. After this, the food arrived in the following order: 1) my sangria, 2) only two waters, 3) the calamari, 4) the diet (after re-requesting), 5) the third water, 6) the complimentary bread, 7) the main dishes. 

The food, itself, was tasty but nothing spectacular. I enjoyed it, but for the price - not worth it. The portions were decent. The food presentation was good. However, taste-wise, it was like any other Italian restaurant. I would say, the food rates a 3.5 out of 5 stars. Honestly, it wasn't something I would come back for, even if the service was good. 

The service made this experience a poor one. When service is this poor, the manager usually does something about it. I was a server for years, and a comp of some type is usually offered to the guests. Nothing. After almost a half-hour, we had to sequester our server to come help us, and when we previously waved or tried to flag down anyone else, they ignored us. Most likely, because it wasn't their section. I mean, c'mon, at least attempt to rectify the situation by offering us a second round of already-free bread or something. 

The restaurant was busy, and it was a Saturday night. However, there were a good handful of people, bus boys and servers, who were quick to clear a table once the party was finished. Like, I'm talking, immediately after guests left. So, busyness or lack of help was not an excuse for not assisting us. 

Our bill came out to $81 for the three of us. I rarely ever leave less than 18-20% of the taxed bill. Last night, I made an exception. The food was okay. Service was terrible. I do not recommend this restaurant and will not be returning.

Food delicious but it is already 45 min after our reservation & still sitting in waiting area.  Don't know if worth the wait.   Seems like if you know the staff you will get seated earlier.....finally seated @ 8:45 & when we complained all we received were excuses.  People were coming in & getting quoted an hour without reservations...... 3 minutes after we were seated, couple seated who just walked in.  ............waitress & manager helped to correct situation, were very nice unlike the hostess' which thought their lame excuses would fool the customer.  If they would have just been upfront & honest, we wouldn't have had a problem.

We sat at the bar at 7pm on saturday and it was getting busy. Bartender was our server and he was just not interested in paying any attention at all. We could barely get him to take our order. After that he basically stopped serving us. Bright spot was that the food was outstanding. Both pasta dishes came out very hot, fresh and full over flavor. Loved the food but the bartender killed the experience

I've only been to their new location once, but have been to their old one a couple times. I went for lunch with my boyfriend & after hearing such great reviews on the place we were excited to try it. Our waiter was very friendly & made some recommendations. We started off with the pork belly appetizer & he ordered the crazy alfredo & i the chicken piccata. We waited what seemed like a long time for the pork belly, then our server let us know the kitchen had messed up on it & was remaking it. When it came out, it was good though. Then we the food runner gave us our plates, my boyfriend had visual mushrooms in his dish, after he had specifically asked for no mushrooms to be on there. My dish was not even the one I ordered. The woman apologized & took them both back. When she returned everything was right. Our server asked what went wrong, but didn't seem to apologetic. Both dishes were delicious. I'll definitely be back to try more. My boyfriend agreed. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because 3 out of 3 dishes needed to be remade & nothing was taken off the bill. If even just a glass of wine or our appetizer was taken off it would have made it obvious that they valued our time and our satisfaction & wanted to ensure we came back. A place like Nora's seems like they would care about guests return

The service was ok. I came in with my family of 8 and unfortunately,  everyone is our party had an upset stomach from the tomato sauce in the dishes. Luckily,  I had the chicken which came with salad. That was delicious.  I recommend them if and only if you don't have anything with their tomato sauce.

My boyfriend ate here last night.  It was still very crowded for a Thursday night at 7:30 so we sat at the bar.  Anthony was on top of it and greeted us right away.  My bf got the veal (wah I tell him veal is not pc but he won't listen) and I ordered us calamari to start and Anthony recommended the alla nora to me over lasagna.  We were started with garlic bread which was good though it was covered in butter... straight to my ass. j Straight to my ass!  Second and third pieces... no control whatsoever.  The calamari was also amazing!  Perfect amount of crispy texture and the sauce they serve it with I had to ask for a second ramekin- I wanted to drink it.  I debated taking the ramekin into the bathroom so I could lick all the marinara out of it but thought if anyone saw me take a ramekin into the bathroom they'd think I was a weirdo.  Ok trying to maintain some class I stopped eating the calarmari.  I'm a little person so I was already full at this point.  I took a few bites of my dinner when it came but was still full.  There was a piece of crisp basil on top of the alla nora that I was in love with.  Next time I go to Nora's I'll ask for extra basil leaves like this!!!  Obsessed.  Alla Nora had a parmesean-basil type of grantinee over eggplant, meatball and spaghetti.  I loved it.  I tried some of my bf's side of plain spaghetti which was also very good.  I mean it's weird bc something so basic as spaghetti I don't generally find good but this was.  I did not try my bf's veal but he was very very happy with it.  He is straight-up Italian so he just loves Italian food.  We eat at Mezze near our home a lot and we decided it's a close call which is better but Nora's wins.  I ordered a cannoli to go but wished the chocolate cake had been offered at the start because it takes 20 minutes to make and I didn't read that on the menu.  It was the only chocolate dessert.  The cannoli has chocolate chips on half of it so I guess there is that.  The other half has pistachio bits on the cannoli btw.  I saw a lot of coffee drinks going out and I was dying for one but knew I wouldn't sleep if I got one at that time of night.  We both can't wait to take his parents there!

Wow! This place is darn good!  New building and location .... much better!  Great food and value!  Nice break from the Strip. Check this place out ... great service (family), great food, great prices for the quality, good atmosphere!  4 Star!

The Yelp reviews enticed me to visit this place. Summary: Food was good. Service was absolutely terrible.  Very rude waitress.  

My first experience, I came here with a date.  I ordered what appears to be everyone's favorite - the Crazy Alfredo.  I love Alfredo sauce. The portion served could feed two people. We ordered the Bruschetta Promodoro.  Recommended.  We moved on to the entries and finally desert.  Overall, the food was pretty good. 

Unfortunately,  the waitress was very rude and provided exceptionally poor service.  If someone doesn't like their job - they really shouldn't put themselves in such situations.  From the time we arrived, the waitress appeared unfriendly.  Her demeanor left me with an impression that she was not happy 1. doing her job. 2. providing us service (personal problem of hers maybe?).  Both relatively polite individuals who didn't make any odd/uncommon requests for service.  

I ignored her rudeness, since I was there to enjoy dinner with my date.  Naturally, I avoided any additional order or asking any questions about the menu options.  She made me feel so uncomfortable, I just didn't want her near our table.  

On my second visit, we got the same person.  The waitress remembered me and appeared to make an effort to be friendly, initially.  Unfortunately, that was short lived.  Her presence was just negative.  You can just sense the negativity in a person - whether it is their dismissive facial gestures, or overall rude tone of voice.  

Again, I have no tolerance for such people and pay no mind.  What bothered me more on this second visit is her crude remark.  Apparently, a term I used to describe what I wanted to order - rubbed her the wrong way?  She made a very rude remark that made me give her a quick look - but I smiled and moved on.  I don't come here to engage such petty people - I come here to enjoy good food with good company.  Unfortunately, this same waitress chipped away at my attempt to enjoy dinner with my date. 

On my third visit (Italian is a favorite for many, and the food is good).  This time, my date insisted on visiting this place as she never had the pleasure of experiencing it herself.  So, I took a chance.  Long and behold - the SAME waitress for the third time.  No difference.  This waitress provides such poor service, I had to walk over to the bartender, order a drink and tipped him well.  He noticed the poor service being offered by the Waitress.  In fact, he even gave me a look as if he acknowledged what was going on.

Omg what a great restaurant this is the type you know the food is going to be great! I was not disappointed at all wow the service by Sebastian was authentic and caring . The mussels were spiced perfect the pasta was great I will be back

We have been coming to Nora's for years, but for the last two the service and feeling when dining has gone down hill.  We made reservations three weeks ahead and still were told it would be a few minutes.  30 minutes later standing in a sea of backed up guests we were now told the people at our table decided to have dessert.  What does this even mean?  We were then offered the bar or the patio.  Being our anniversary this is not acceptable.  Nora's used to be a fun place, but it seems they have gotten too big for themselves, they have stopped caring about the customers.  I guess they have enough so why be bothered.  They need some kind of actual system for reservations that works.  On New Year's this also happened but it was worse because 5 tables that had reservations after us were sat first, looked like they forgot us at the bar.  The food is definitely not worth the aggravation and other reviewers are right if something is writing they just shrug and don't care.
