Bye Nora's, there are too many restaurants in Vegas to worry about this mediocre mess of a business.

My family & I really enjoyed this place. We had the shrimp scampi which was amazing. My hubby really loved the sauce used for the shrimp scampi. His exact words were "this sauce is so good I want to drink it" lol. And he honestly is not someone that compliments often. My daughter had the cheese pizza which was also really good. She's 7 and also made a compliment about how delicious it was. I had the linguini and clams it was pretty tasty except my hubby got the angel hair pasta with the arrabiata sauce and after I took a taste of that we ended up switching. He liked the linguini and clams better and I liked the angel hair and arrabiata better so it worked out very well. I just wanted to try something different. My husband had a cup of coffee and he said it was pretty good which is also rare for him to compliment restaurant coffee because he uses a French press at home and he swears they make the best coffee. We ended our meal with tiramisu. I have to admit as a tiramisu fan I didn't like the way it was prepared. The lady fingers were very soggy which ruined the entire flavor of the dessert. I am still giving Nora's 5 stars though due to the fact everything else was great. We will for sure go back whenever we're on that side of town.
If you like to eat where the locals eat and have an amazing meal too, come here! Nora's is authentic Italian with a rustic vibe, great wine selection and the service was excellent.

What a delightful surprise.  Don't miss out on this gem.  Easy to miss in a strip mall, but worth the trip.  Great food and wine.  Make a reservation.  A lot of people know about this wonderful restaurant.

Food is really very very average here.  I feel bad writing a poor review as the prices and service are very good.

We were seated promptly and with a smile.  Everyone, the host, waiter, even the water guy were very cheerful.  Possibly the best service i've had in vegas.

But the food :(

Garlic bread - cold, really no flavor
Side salad - ridiculous amount of olives
Gnocci - really bland...basic red sauce

My friend had recommended this place and claims to really like it.  She had the Chicken Marsala and upon sharing a bite with her i'll be making her dinner next time because I think I can do better ;)

I would/will give this place another shot at some point because the service was very good.  I really wanted to like Nora's.

My family and I came here for the first time because the reviews were really good. We didn't have reservations and that wasn't a problem got seated within 15 minutes. The hostess was friendly when seating us. We waited about 5 minutes before being greeted by our server and asked if we were ready to order. We then told him it was our first time here and would like some recommendations, he wasn't very friendly and seemed to be rushed. We got the ceaser salad that was way over dressed and tasted like an overkill of anchovies, we couldn't eat it. My husband had the chicken Milanese and was very bland and lacked flavor. I had the lasagna it was just ok but the pasta was very mushy definitely wouldn't recommend. My kids had chicken parmesan it was the best one out of the three dishes, but the marinara sauce could definitely have a little more flavor and seasoning. Never really saw the server around until he dropped the check without offering dessert or asking if we wanted or needed anything else which I wanted dessert, but when someone drops the check it must be because you don't want us to spend anymore money or appreciate our business. This is a huge pet peeve of mine. I was watching the server next to us and he was amazing at interacting with his tables and recommending dishes with wine and constantly being visible to where if his tables needed anything he was on it. My husband and I had to ask his name it was Donald he was amazing keep up the good job. So if you do decide to go there ask for him he will give you better service and a better dining experience. I probably wouldn't go back for the food wasn't great and the lack of service that was provided and with so many other restaurants in Vegas I would rather spend my money at a restaurant with delicious food and can receive an unforgettable dining experience.

I was really looking forward to eating at Nora's based on reviews from various media and on Yelp.  Expectations led to disappointment.  Had lunch there today, ordered calamari, pizza, and angel hair with meatballs and marinara sauce.  The calamari was the best part of the meal, actually very good.  However, the pasta and meatballs were bland, sauce did not taste like any marinara sauce I have had, and the meatballs did not seem to have any type of seasonings.  On the opposite side, the pizza was so salty, could only eat a slice, and there was something missing that I just couldn't put my finger on until I got the bill.  That's when I discovered that the Capricciosa pizza we ordered was not what we received, instead our waiter, Travis, brought us a All 4 Stagioni; considering all the stuff on the pizza, no way could we tell what they were serving anyway and seeing our bill it all made sense about why the pizza tasted so different than what we were expecting.  Then to top it all off, the coffee we asked for never arrived, but the bill sure did!  Look, the place is nice and airy, very clean, and maybe there are other things on the menu that may be good.  But first impressions are important, and my impression is that in Vegas you better be good all the time, not just some of the time, or first time customers like myself will not return, and I won't.
This is one of the best Italian places in town! They always have amazing food and great service!!!

Came here after a coworker recommended this place, saying it was her favorite Italian spot in Vegas. It's a nice little mom and pop type place.

When you walk in,  you come directly to the pizza order counter,  but we were seated to the left, which was a more private area, nice for dates, possibly. Frank Sinatra, Michael Buble, etc. was playing in the background.

On to the food. You start out with a complimentary order of the garlic bread,  which was amazing! Sooo garlicky, with fresh minced garlic. We had the fried calamari, which came out quicker than expected. Microwaved? Or maybe it was just because it was slow at the time. Either way, it wasn't as crispy as I'd like, but still enjoyable.  It was served with this sauce that kinda tasted like a roasted chile salsa you'd find at a taco shop, and paired really well with the dish.

For the main dish, I had the pappardelle pasta with the wild boar and red wine ragu. Oh. My. Poop. I loved it! The meat was tender and the sauce full of flavor. I had some leftovers and was actually excited to get hungry again so I could eat the rest of it. 

I'm definitely coming back to try some other dishes.
One of my favorites, staff is always pleasant and the wine selection is nice and cappuccinos are yum.

Great restaurant -- glad I stopped in.  Really good food, great service, and a nice restaurant with plenty of parking.

I woke up in my room at the Flamingo with a completely out of character hunger for Italian food.  I briefly considered a chain at a nearby hotel, then gave up and was headed over to Chinatown instead (where I eat most of my meals when in Las Vegas, and have never been disappointed.).  Browsing Yelp for what is open in mid afternoon, I found Nora's, and decided to try -- thanks to Yelp I've found a great new choice.

I had the arancini appetizer -- quite good -- and then the baked ziti (recommended by the server).  My iced tea was never empty, and finished off the meal with a great cannoli.  I'll definitely be back!

I'm from New England.... which means I am an Italian cuisine SNOB. Fearing mediocre quality in the heart of Vegas we searched and searched for good Italian food. By referral, we found Nora's. Thank God (we visit often). Needless to say we have visited Nora's many (did I say MANY?) times. It is fabulous. Get a reservation and go hungry. Everything from the bread basket to the Crazy Alfredo is delish. Went with my husband and 2 friends, they all dream of, ordered and LOVED the Crazy Alfredo. We all started with Caesar's salad (great!) and I had the Cannelloni. Holy, cheesy delicious yumminess. I am a picky eater, more of a "many small meals throughout the day vs. 3 large(r) meals", I cleaned my plate, licked it clean. Prices are as crazy (good) as the alfredo! Go. Don't tell the tourists though, this is a GEM of a locals spot!!!!
Really good food! I had chicken parmesan and it was the best! Service and food were both great.

Came here while visiting from out of town.

Best meal in Vegas trip.

Group of four had tale in kitchen area which was awesome.

Could hear live music, awesome.

Food, was great great great.

Heavy on garlic in some dishes but in a good way.

Nothing was to complain about.

Price wasn't expensive.  We had appetizers, four entries and some dessert and three bottles of wine and it wasn't too expensive for what we had.

I hope they keep the tables in the kitchen at the new location.

Not to miss.

This is a solid, neighborhood restaurant to visit if you are in the mood for some Italian food and great cokctails. I dare say that of all the local restaurants in town, this received the highest amount of locals. Othe rplaces in town are starting to attract tourists, but here it is guaranteed that 99% of the clientele is local. I like that. You can sit at the bar and have an amazing cocktail and chat up some of the regulars. When I go I usually order the clover club. They really have an amazing cocktail program, I highly suggesthaving a pre-dinner cocktail at the bar. The only thing I dislike is tha they have tv's at the bar, but othe rthan that a good time is guaranteed. Plus  in the evenings they have live music, which is nice.

I recommend coming here for a leisurely dinner. You start off the meal with a basket of garlic bread, super garlicky and super good. The calamari and arancini are both excellent appetizers. All os the pastas here are great. I have tried most of them, the pesto, primavera, lasagna, etc. My favorite is the pasta alla nora, which is pasta baked with an eggplant, pesto and meat sauce. OMG it is delish! I he tried their pizza once and I wasn't convinced. Stick to pastas and you will be happy.

No dinner here is complete without cannoli. I recommed you order it with pistachios only, rather than the chocolate chips which are not very good. 

Oh, bonus if you check in on Yelp. You get a free glass of the house wine. Score!

This is the BEST Italian food in town, although I seem to order the same thing when I go.  The Crazy Alfredo!  What a dish!  Their garlic bread is amazing; always hot and crispy with the perfect amount of garlic and seasoning.  If you're a fan of Caesar salad, their dressing is great also.
The atmosphere is very authentic.  My wife and I sat in the bar area on a weekend evening.  They had live entertainment.  I felt like we had stepped into a scene of "The Godfather"
Made reservations and glad we did, this little gem fills up fast!!! Great service and great food! The pizza was one of the best we ever had in Vegas!! Definitely a place to keep visiting!

Nice Neighborly Vibe and Good Food.....

Pros:   Good portions and value.  Friendly atmosphere.  Not far from the Strip.
Cons:  Perhaps too popular?  If you want fancy, look elsewhere.

Ratings:
-   Overall:    4
-   Food Quality:  3-4
-   Food Quantity:  4
-   Menu:   4
-   Wine List:   3
-   Service:   5
-   Fancy Factor:   2
-   Neighborly Feel:    5
-   Smell:    5
-   Cost:     4
-   Value:     5

My wife and I, along with 3 other couples from San Jose, traveled to Las Vegas to meet another couple for the husband's 65th birthday.  Friends had a strong recommendation for Nora's from people they trust, so the group agreed to have one of our 3 dinners at this restaurant.

Although we stayed in a hotel along the infamous Strip, Nora's was only a 10 minute cab ride to the west.  As many Yelpers have noted, it's not a fancy place from the outside...and not exactly on the inside either... but some of the best Italian food we've found was in similar surroundings ( like the late lamented Gaetano's in the LA suburb of La Habra and some in our hometown of San Jose ).

We had reservations for 10 people at 915 PM on a Thursday evening, but when we arrived at 9 PM, it was packed.  No surprise according to plenty of reviewers.  But the guy handling reception duties, servers  and even other customers waiting for tables were in a good mood.  Is everyone in Las Vegas a comedian ( or trying to be )?

By the way, there was one promising sign of a happy meal to come.  We all know how big promises can lead to big disappointment, but I've noticed...at least with Italian restaurants...if it smells good in the parking lot, it usually tastes good later on.  Nora's passed the smell test.

Patrons were slow to leave, but one table left at 915 PM so some of the staff rearranged things and our group got into their chairs by 925 PM.  A bit late for me ( I typically start dinner about 7 ), though we were on Vegas time. Although we shared the room with a party of 20 celebrating a birthday, there was no cramping of space for us or several other tables for 2 and 4.

Age has its benefits, but short-term memory is not one of them.  Details on the food have faded into a haze ( maybe from the casino in the Mirage.  What a hell hole! ), but longer lasting impressions are important, too.

The menu was quite large and varied with many favorites recognized from the lists of Italian restaurants in neighborhoods around the country.  Question was...how well did Nora's handle the job?

First thing on the table were loaves of garlic bread.  I usually can't resist that stuff, especially is it's half decent, and it was really good that night.  Or maybe I was just starved.  Either way, after a basket of bread and part of my draft beer, I began to breathe as if the waiter brought a dose of smelling salts.  I'll always remember my mother saying "don't load up on bread", but it's a hard habit to break.

Friends passed around several salads, though since I'm not a sharer, I kept my plate behind a moat of utensils.  That's just as well.  I need my own salad every day...and it was quite good.  Nobody at the table voiced any disagreement.

My entree was eggplant parmagiana, which as a "chicken-fish" vegetarian, I seem to order a lot of the time.  I'd give it an 8 on a scale of 10.  Not bad!  Good size, texture and tomato taste.  The side order of spaghetti was also respectable.  My wife's chicken marsala was good, but she thought the sauce was too sweet.  I can't remember what our friends had, but nobody raised their hand to complain, at least publicly. By the time we finished at 11 PM, our group of greying baby boomers was a tad tuckered, so we bypassed dessert and called cabs for the short ride back to the Mirage.

We split the bill evenly among the 5 couples and each paid an astoundingly small $44 plus tip.  That's a lotta food in a high priced town.  Service was friendly in a good-natured, smart-alecky way.  The oldest member of the staff I spotted was in his 30's, so it seemed like a bunch of neighborhood kids...the family?...running the restaurant and having fun doing it.  You almost felt like a regular after one visit.

There must be tons of Italian restaurants around Las Vegas, but if you need to get away from crowds in the big hotels, Nora's is a solid choice for eating within a decent distance of your room.
The cheesecake was one of the best I have ever had if not the best xD.  Their prices aren't too high and the service is spot on.

This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas.  My family and I were at their new location (beautiful) last week.  We had Don as our waiter on the patio.   He is superb, polite, professional and personable.  Thank you so much to Nora's for staying true to yourself and offering fantastic food!

Simply amazing, this was my one and only time dining at Nora's and it was fantastic to say the least. We met some close friends for dinner who happen to be locals of Las Vegas. They recommended this off the strip restaurant for a great Italian experience. I will definitely return in the future.
Love Noras, outstanding food, cute little place and a great value.  Try the antipasta and crazy alfredo.

great!!
have only been here once....you instantly sense the history and tight-knit family that runs the joint...this place is quaint and warm...i saw it on the food network the other day too!
i had the shrimp scampi which were HUUUUGE and really really tasty with tons of garlic and linguine!

vegas is the only place (besides tahoe) that i feel has great, fresh seafood for being so far away from the ocean!!

good prices, good service, good vino, good atmosphere
definitely worth a visit!!

Great food and service was spot on. Started the meal with a bourbon bunny. Had the Antipasto Salad with my friend who started with the house Cabernet. I had the wine with my ribeye for dinner. Great ribeye. My friend had the veal cannelloni. Great dish. We finished with the cheesecake. Awesome. A very good meal. The wine was perfect.

It was my first time trying this place and I was kind of surprised by its location/interior. I thought this place was pretty good but not as amazing as my friends made it out to be. It was very crowded, so they must be doing something right... The food was good, but not unbelievably out-of-this-world. The breadsticks were so good (honestly my favorite part of the meal). I had clam linguine which was pretty good but slightly too salty. For dessert we had tiramisu and cannoli and I preferred the tiramisu. My friend really liked how many toppings were on the cannoli. 
The issue I had was that the waiter seemed kind of excited for us to hurry and leave. Maybe because the place was so packed. I didn't think he was rude but I did get the sense that we were slightly being rushed.  
Anyways, the food was pretty good! All in all I had a good experience.

We waited FOREVER! Not only did we wait for a long time to receive our food (other tables seated after us got their food first) but we also waited for our check for a long time. We were temped to leave because there was no one around. The food was decent but definitely not worth the wait. I can honestly say I will never return here or recommend to anyone.
One of the best Italian restaurants anywhere. Don't miss Noras when in Vegas!  Awesome food, wines and service!  Try the "Crazy Alfredo"

It was my first time here and it was packed! Man do they need to expand that parking during lunch hour. It made me feel like their food would be good. When I walked up to the hostess she informed me that my company didn't have a reservation. I was a bit confused because my DM had made one on 3 days ago. I had to wait for my DM to get there and come to find out that our private room had been booked at the wrong time. It was a little difficult to conduct our meeting since we didn't get the private room but they did a good job clearing people around us. The food was pretty good and they comp us free dessert. My overall experience was good except for the part where we had to convince them that they forgot our reservation. It would have been nice for them to apologize for the mix up and possibly had a manager looked in to it. I would recommend this place on a personal day but would we hesitant if you need to make a reservation.

Our date night started a bit questionably here but was quickly turned around into a fantastic dining experience. No need to get into details but we noticed a few small things that were a bit "off" when we first got seated. However from the second our server showed up until we left we had an excellent experience. The food was phenomenal and the server gave a few excellent suggestions for a beer and app. Overall we were very happy with the experience and will be returning.

Very good food and excellent service. The staff was very nice and very attentive. Pappardelle with wild boar bolognese sauce was perfect. I will be back.
Ps: food was reasonably Priced.

Oh how I am going to miss Nora's!!! Just moved to New Mexico and we made sure we went to Nora's a few times before we moved! This place is the BEST Italian in Las Vegas! My boyfriend and I love this place! We no longer need to look at the menu because our favorites are so amazing! My usual is the Baked Ziti and he loves the Crazy Alfredo! I know I will never find another Italian restaurant like Nora's!

We tried Nora's last night for the first time. The ambiance is really great with bricks, white lights and white linen. We had a great waiter Sebastian that was very knowledgeable and courteous to our needs. I'm not sure I can say I was in love with the food though, but I will say maybe I need to try again. My husband wanted risotto but they only have risotto balls. He ordered a margarita pizza large which was $18. Where he may have gone wrong is he ordered extra sauce and we both agreed it was too much. His bad, I think normal sauce would have been how he liked it. I ordered the baked rigatoni do it arrived way too baked. The inside was very dry and it was a ricotta overload. The dish was not deep at all so the ricotta being dry from heat soaked up any sauce. The meat sauce wasn't very meaty. In fact I didn't taste too much meat. So may be I ordered wrong and again the place is affordable and nice enough for second chances!
Absolutely the best Italian restaurant in Vegas. Everything on the menu is amazing and service is terrific!!!!

Storefront location hides a very good place for Italian. I waited short time for a table and was asked to be patient, my server had to catch up. 
I thought, here we go, crap service, but he dropped 4 checks in quick order. 
At his suggestion I ordered the calamari ap and rigatoni special for entree. 
Calamari was crispy and good, the sauce better than average. This sauce is what keeps this from being a five star review. 
The rigatoni was fantastic! Pasta was perfect, sauce great, and meat perfect. 
Add excellent service and Nora's will be seeing me often when I get to Vegas.

BLAH. I wish I could give this a no star review. NOT Italian. Nothing fresh, dirty floors. Blahhhh this should be called American with pasta restaurant- ugh hate when a place says its Italian and it's not. I travel to Italy 4x a year .... I think it's safe to say I can understand Italian cooking far past penne with red sauce. Plus any Italian restaurant that's has "Alfredo" is clearly not Italian considering it's an American pasta dish. Booo

YAAAAAAAASS!! I've been coming here for years. Probably since 2010? or prior. I love the atmosphere in this place, very cozy and romantic. My only compliant is the wait time is kind of LONG. And occasionally the chef is off. It's absolutely affordable and authentic in my opinion. The drinks are great too. Just typing this makes me want to go have dinner tonight. YUM!

PS MAKE SURE YOU MAKE A RESERVATION!

easily the greatest bruschetta ever.  The warm crisp bread with a soft dense center is topped with the perfect blend of sweet tomatos and olive oil and herbes and all around magic that makes it undeniable.  Already craving to go back and I just ate there last night.  The yelp offer of one free glass of wine also tops off a perfect round of plates.  I got the tri blend tortellini with the vodka sauce that was definetly solid and nice.  (i might have added a few veggies like peas or carrotts to it, but the dish was still great)  and then got a tiramisu which was a great blend of flavors as well!
Many find this the finest Italian restaurant in town.  I think it is a little above average. Had the Penne with Arabiata sauce. Very bland. Nice atmosphere is why I'm giving it 4 instead of 3 stars

I was craving spaghetti  for lunch and decided to order pick up from here. I got the spaghetti lunch special with meat sauce which is a little extra for price and added one meatball to it. It was affordable and the spaghetti was packed with flavor! The meat sauce was delicious ! It came with garlic bread and of course that was good. I would definitely come back here to try other dishes for my Italian fix.
If your looking for quality you can taste then Noras is the place for you. It's like a gem in a old strip mall.  Great food and pizza.

Noras is like my second home, here in Vegas its hard to find a place with good food.My friends and I will come here about 4-7 times a month, the staff is amazing and welcomes you like your there sister, drinks are heaven, and for being a vegetarian the eggplant is the best, i mean the best! out of this world.

I have dined at the old Nora's location several times before, but this was the first time I went to the new location. The place is very nice, sad to learn that the patio on the upper floor was for banquets only, I felt it would be a perfect place for a happy hour (which Nora's does not offer). 
As usual the place was packed, but we were seated right away, Anthony, our server was great, he answered all our questions and when we tried to order too much food, he directed us to cut a few items out (which was a good thing since we couldn't finish what we ordered anyway.)  The only complaint, we weren't  finished with our starters when they brought out the entrees. It did not ruin our meal, just a little "rookie mistake". Thanks we will return perhaps for a bit of afternoon vino and some bocci ball.
I've been going to this place since I was a kid and the food is amazing! It has a nice atmosphere as well.

My family and I are not from Las Vegas, so our whole trip we relied on Yelp to help us find some great places too eat, and we came across Nora's... The great reviews got us here, there was only three of us. 

We ordered 
Italian wings, without parsley 
Fettuccini Alfredo w/ chicken 
The fries with Parmesan (forgot the name)
And angel pasta with oils and Garlic

The portion sizes are great, and big!
The only thing we did not really enjoy where the Italian wings, maybe it was the oil they were fried in, or just didn't hit our tastebuds right.

The pastas, and fries were absolutely amazing! We couldn't stop talking about them. Everything other then the wings were very enjoyable. However we only seen our waitress 4 times, to take our drink order, our food order, bring the food & bring the check. When we asked for stuff she would say oh she forgot.

I would recommend this for the great quality of food, but mild service.
I had the Eggplant parmigiana. Not so good. It had a weird taste and unevenly cooked.
Great food at reasonable prices. Finally they moved down the street to a much needed bigger location.

This spot came highly recommended by my coworkers. I could tell that most of the diners here are regulars. It took me awhile to get here since it's a bit of a drive from home for me.

We arrived at the start of dinner service and found that they were already getting busy. The hostess was quick in getting everyone seated. Our waiter was quick to greet us and get drinks started. He was friendly and professional. There was never a long period of time without him checking in on us. 

The garlic bread was really good. It's definitely meant for true garlic lovers, but this is why I liked it. We passed on a second basket because we didn't want to get too full, but I regretted it later. 

I started with a House Salad and my husband started with the Caesar Salad. Both salads were very good. I really liked the house Italian dressing and the large portion of cheese on top. 

For my main entrée I had the Crazy Alfredo because this was the dish recommended to me by all Nora's fans. The dish lived up to the hype for me even though I think this was my first alfredo dish in at least 10 years. The sauce was delicious and I loved the combination of chicken, sausage, shrimp, jalapeno, cheese, and mushrooms. Definitely a yummy combination. The portion was enough for two people and could definitely be shared. I'd also recommend sharing since it is such a rich dish.

My husband ordered the Veal Parmesan. He thought it was good, but not the best he has ever had. I tasted the red sauce on the spaghetti and didn't care for it. 

The food overall was pretty good and I'm excited to give them a try when they build their new restaurant. We'll be back to give them another try.

Great fresh and well prepared food. I had a chicken dish lightly grilled with artichokes and light sauce. My daughter had fettuccini. Nice. We will come back
Service was super friendly fast and attentive

This place is a bit of a surprise for me.  The location is horrendous for what the interior has to offer. I took in this surprise in sheer delight because of how much Nora's Cuisine reminded me of San Francisco. Don't judge a book by its cover. The ambiance is pure magical. Nothing beats the pace of a well ran restaurant. It's like watching a well orchestrated opera. I haven't even touch upon the food yet....Let's just say for my pallet this is rated in the Best of the Best category.

Score for Las Vegas

Still the best after all these years.

Moved out of town for a few years and just got back, so we had to go to Nora's for dinner.

It was outstanding, Anthony has been there for 7 years now and continues to provide unparalleled service.

Mussel's were large, plump and delicious, and the pizza, wow, I am still enjoying it today for lunch.

I can't wait to go back.

First time at Nora`s, 3/12/18,,,our party of 4...I read the reviews first, & was a little apprehensive, seeing some of the bad ones....But none of them were true for us..For a Monday night, (6pm), the parking lot was full, so was expecting to wait for a few days, even with reservations, was seated in 5 minutes...:) The young waiters were very attentive, took the time to answer questions about the menu..The food came out within 20 minutes, & very hot.. :) Joe got the sea bass, & the whole fish was on the plate..he asked waiter if they could filet it, & it was done perfect within a few minutes..My cousin got the eggplant parm..,enough for two people, so 1/2 to go.. :) ...Dad got linguine/clams,,he loved it, clams perfect..I got lasagna, which was hot, enormous , & perfect...A little loud, but everything else made up for it..Just wish it was closer to our home here in Sun City, Summerlin...We can use a great Italian restaurant, with reasonable prices..I say that, cause we have one here, in Sun City, but while Nora`s lasagna is $14, "their" lasagna, is $23, & smaller..... NORA, how about a second location up here?, you would do quite well..

Great Italian food! 

The 2-for-1 sangria was great just for checking in on Yelp, but the tortellinis in vodka sauce were the highlight of my experience. Delicious!

I'll definitely be back next time I'm near the Strip.

I set up reservations for our party of 6 this past Wednesday. The place was packed, they seated us and we had to wait forever to get our wine order in. We were never asked if we wanted another bottle. 
Also we needed to flag down someone to get more sparkling water too. We did get an apology from the waitress for the delay, but then we waited again for our main course. The food was ok, nothing special, tons of Garlic, but they never offered fresh parmigiana??  I have had the same experience twice now, so unfortunately I will not be returning.

Pretty disappointing experience. Came here last summer and the food was above average but service was awful (they forgot to give us water the entire meal, upon reminding them). We thought we'd give it another try this summer for lunch, but again had awful service. We waited for a pizza for half an hour, and upon its arrival it was cold and undercooked. They must've forgotten to bring it out? We also noticed it wasn't the same quality as the previous year, almost as if it were from a cafeteria. They have certainly compromised quality in the past year. Waiter wasn't apologetic at all for the cold, late food. Either way we won't be back.

Best Italian food in Vegas. Not quite up to NYC standards, but not bad. Nicely decorated bar, cool open kitchen & comfortable restaurant with good service. 

Food:  great clams app, free Garlic bread with meal, Veal chop (VG) , Veal Parm (just OK), pork belly app (Excellent) , Octopus app (VG), wines by the glass (fair price and decent pour). 

Can take a group with reservations. Good pace of service, didn't rush you. I'd go again.
Not for the chicken marsala 'though it was good too but definitely for the garlic bread to the caesar salad, the sauce and meatballs....yummy!

Best Authentic Italian in Vegas!

Heard about it from friends and on Food Network.

Great atmosphere & super attentive and friendly wait staff.

Their lasagna & scampi are out of this world & on occasion they have different chefs specials from time to time. 

Have been 10 plus times now & looking forward to many more.

Came here for the first time. Was unable to make a reservation at the time we wanted due to it being so busy. We were able to get a table for 4 at 8.30 pm. The place was PACKED. Hardly any parking and every single table was full. Very little waiting area near the hostess booth. 
However, we were seated right at 8.30 pm, so that wasn't a problem.

I ordered the Frutti di Mare, which is mussels, calamari, clams, and fish over linguini (red sauce). Big disappointment on the mussels. There were only 4 and they were very very briny and fishy tasting, leading me to believe they were not fresh. I'm from Southern Italy. I pretty much started eating mussels out of the womb, they shouldn't taste like that. 

The calms were un-shelled and mixed in with the pasta. I would much rather have them in the shell. In the sauce, you lose the flavor of the clams. Overall, pasta was cooked well and sauce was good. But for $22, not worth it. Calamari tubes are really cheap and the plate was loaded with it. They need to knock down the price of this dish. 

Our waitress did not bring us water, even though we asked multiple times. We all left parched.

I'd like to come back and give this place another try.

I called to make a Mother's Day reservation around 11AM the Tuesday. They need to get on Open table or something because whoever this girl is that took my reservation, repeated it wrongly about 5 times before "confirming" --- "4 people for 2PM on Mother's Day Sunday".. only for me to call for confirmation as I'm driving to their restaurant that they don't actually open until 4 PM. I tried initially to make an online reservation and their system said if no availability then call which I did.

Now I'm scrambling for Mother's day reservations as we are trying to drive somewhere to eat. Sucks.

As soon as you walk into noras you get wonderful aromas of garlic and beautiful ingredients coming from the kitchen. I had the linguini with clams as well as chicken marsala, the pasta was perfectly cooked and the flavors were well balanced. The garlic bread is to die for! Now for the sangria, it's the best I've had in awhile and for 8$ it's a perfect size. I can't wait to return but, for my first time, I'm impressed! I wish I had pictures to post so you can eat with your eyes First!

Talk about bust...we have driven past this place a thousand times and thought how it stands out in an otherwise run-down neighborhood.  So tonight, we stopped by, which may not have been the best idea, given that it was Father's Day and they appeared to be slammed.  

We were seated at the one remaining table outside.  Our waiter came right over and got our drinks quickly.  Appetizers (calamari and salad) took about 20 minutes to come out.  Our bread, which was promised about four times, arrived in about 25 minutes.  Our table was cleared and then, we  waited for our dinners.  Thirty minutes later, another waiter came to our table, as I guess we were just sitting there with blank stares on our faces, and asked if anyone was helping us.  At that moment, our food came out.  We were fried after sitting outside for an hour in the heat, even with their misters, and were tired and annoyed it took an hour for our meals to arrive.  We had them box it up, cancel our dessert, and we left, about 70 mins after arrival.  I couldn't stomach the idea of sitting there for another hour.  Or whatever it was going to be. 

My husband order a chicken pasta dish, which he tasted and said was good.  I had the gnocchi and vodka sauce ($17.50) which tasted like...well, tasteless mush.  It literally had no flavor and the gnocchi waswater logged or something.  That meal was tossed in the trash, as it was completely inedible.  I wouldn't give that slop to my pets.

I don't think I'll give them a second chance.  

Two stars for our waiter. who was at least friendly (although who would also disappear for long amounts of time) and the ambiance, which is really nice.  Minus three stars for the mediocre food and the ridiculous wait times.

Nora's was an unexpectes surprise. When I choose to eat out I almost never choose Italian. I'm glad we did. 

 When I arrived I saw how packed the parking lot was and but we had a reservation and we're seated very quickly. So be sure to reserve a table. The seating is quaint but comfortable and the decor has a nice mix of old trattoria and fusion bar. The staff was friendly and attentive.  We started with the caprese, calamari, and bruschetta. All were delicious and the complimentary garlic bread was a warm and we'll flavored.  My entree was the wild boar pappardelle and it was by far the most amazing thing I've eaten in a long time. The flavors perfectly melded together with a tiny bit of acidity which complimented the boar beautifully. I have only good things to say, definitely will go again.
My favorite Italian Place in town. Cheaper then the strip by far. Make a reservation as this place is always busy. My favorite is the Frutti Di Mare. The Crazy Alfredo is also very good.

It was suggested we eat at this Italian restaurant. The staff was friendly, but by no means is this good Italian food. I had the eggplant parmegan and it was like mush. We had a family dinner of 12 and no one was raving about the food when we left. We are all Italians and know good food.  But..like I said...the service was good and I will give it 2 stars for this reason.

Their lasagna is good. The bread sticks they give you are the best in Vegas. The house salad is  tangy and in a nice vinaigrette with mozzarella cheese. Nice cozy atmosphere and nice waiters. I'll be back. This place is always packed so you should make a reservation.

Bait AND Switch......

Reserved for a Wednesday night dinner at the newly relocated Nora's.  

Reservation process was a complete hassle and I should have taken notice early on.  No Open Table and Nora's on-line website booking system unavailable.  Telephone call resulted in a "we're not open message" without any option to leave a message.  Repeat call resulted in a long hold for a live attendant to accept a reservation.  Reservation offered was 15-45 minutes adjacent to requested time, which I gladly accepted.

Arrived just a few minutes before our 6:45 reservation to a jam packed waiting area filled with mostly angry patrons.  Second sign I should have abandoned the reservation.

Checked in with the hostess and proceeded to wait 45 minutes beyond my reservation while witnessing two things exclusively:  #1, patrons simply abandoning their reservations and departing; or #2, patrons waiting 30-60 minutes beyond their reserved / promised time, while complaining amongst themselves and / or to the hostess stand -- all to no avail.

I've dined at Nora's many times in the past while visiting Las Vegas.  Things have changed for the worst and I won't be back.

I understand issues and circumstances arise.  Communication goes a long way towards mitigating unforeseen matters.  Issues / circumstances were not the issue, its simply they way Nora's chooses to do business.  Oversubscribe, overpromise, and under deliver are the new norm and this customer votes with his wallet.

Hostess sat us, 45 minutes after our reservation, without so much as an apology.

Loads of outstanding restaurants in Las Vegas.  Many of which appreciate your business and honor the very basics, such as a reservation time.  Nora's has run its course and we won't give them another opportunity to showcase poor, poor execution.
Best have a reservation as this place is always packed. Tasty Italian fare & good service... we will return some day.

Just tried this restaurant in the new building,seated behind the host station as you enter don't ever sit there.had the rigatoni gorganzola with  chicken it was ok service was ok panna cotta with fruit was ok the food wasnt like wow I'd like to try there lunch there pizza .

I love this restaurant! Definitely a nice escape from the chains like Maggiano's and Bucca di Beppo. It has a great casual, local feel to it without the strip's overpriced menu.  I loved my baked ziti and the garlic bread. The serving was so big I had to take some home. They were also kind enough not to charge me a cake cutting fee when I celebrated my birthday there. Cons for being in a seedy strip mall with bad parking.

Life changing, this is literally the best Italian I have ever had in my life. Garlic bread is addicting, spinach cannoli was fantastic and the breaded eggplant was to die for. There's live music, service was great, I would recommend this over anything at the strip for sure.

My CEO's wife recommend Nora's as a great place to get Italian food and boy did she hit the mark. We stayed at Palms so it was a quick and easy ride over to Nora's. It was $10 in a cab and the Uber ride was $8.

We ordered the Calamari was not good. It was really chewy and most likely frozen. Would not recommend it. 

For dinner My boyfriend and I both ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo and it was amazing. The garlic bread was also delicious. I mentioned in passing that we were in town for my boyfriends 30th birthday and the gave us tiramisu on the house. If you are looking for a reasonably priced Italian meal in Vegas, go to Nora's.

Very disappointed in the new Nora's. Waiter staff is not trained, because when we were there, waiters and waitresses were in a group talking where the customer can see.  We had a problem with a pizza which was cold and tasteless, and the manager never acknowledged our party.  Professional he was not!  Our salads had no taste, and the waiter was not very proficient.  Sorry to complain, but we never had these issues at the old Nora's, and this was our third time at the new Nora's all of which were not a very good dining experience. We won't be coming back and like the old saying, if it's not broke don't fix it,the old normal Nora's wasn't broke.The waiter presented our order to the manager and he never acknowledged our complaint,if he doesn't show concern to customer service how is the staff.

I have to start backwards, with the leftovers:  Rigatoni with Chicken in Gorgonzola Sauce.   Not my dish, but my husband's.  It became mine the next night, after he went to a dinner-included activity and I delayed my own dinner until I returned hungry from my own evening out.

He sat at the table, hyperventilating from the aroma and the seductive memory of the the night before ;)  But I didn't let him have one bite! It was even better the second time; some of the fat from the cheese melted away, and the flavors melded together even better.  When I finished, I tried to figure out how soon in this holiday-heavy season we'll be able to go back.  Two days later, and I'm still jonesin' for that dish.

It was a while in coming: two previous attempts to make a reservation got shot down, but on a Tuesday night we were "allowed" to dine at 9:00 p.m., and found the place mobbed.  Incredible.

So why not five stars?  After all, the house salad that we shared was pretty damned nice, too, even though I don't eat olives or pepperoncini.  But Herb does, and when it was served we thought they had mistakenly brought us the large size.  And tasty, complimentary garlic bread was a delicious touch.

The service was terrific, too, with our waiter available when we needed him, but not overly obtrusive.

We were, sadly, disappointed in the Chicken Marsala.  Perfectly pretty spaghetti accompanied it, and the chicken was very tender and juicy.  But the sauce was overwhelming sweet, overwhelmingly drowning the chicken, and frankly, the portion - compared to everything else we had, and saw on other tables - seemed very skimpy.  I can't remember the last time I disliked this dish, except maybe in a New Jersey diner.

I also found the prices to be all over the place.   There's something for everyone, but if you're on a budget, many items seemed priced too high.  And that goes for the award-winning wine list, too - wine prices are steep.  Our total bill was reasonable, but we're not big eaters and usually don't eat red meat or seafood.

I can see why Nora's has such great ratings.  I recommend it highly, and will go back as soon as possible.  But for me, that fifth star is elusive.

Took my parents here while they were in town based on friends reviews of the place.  Service is always a main concern for me and I definitely felt Nora's exceeded in this area.  I believe our servers name was Bryce and he was helpful the whole time.  Calamari appetizer was great.  I ordered the crazy Alfredo and wasn't overly impressed, but it wasn't bad by any means.  I'd order something else next time probably.  My parents ordered the carbonara and a penne dish and both loved them.  I personally didn't like the sangria...something tasted really off to me but again my parents both enjoyed it.  I had the Oreo dessert and they got the pistachio cannoli...both tasted  excellent but my parents found a piece of plastic in the last few bites of their cannoli.  The server ended up taking it off the menu for us.  Kind of a subpar experience overall in my opinion.  I want to like this place and would probably give it one more shot.  Everything would need to go right from the service to the food the next time though for me to make Nora's a repeat place for me.

Dined there for Valentine's Day . I understand Valentine's Day is a big dining out holiday but we had a show and they were already a half hour late for our reservation so we dined at the bar , which we would have clearly rather sat down and had a nice dinner but we were time crunched , and they were late . The manager thanked us but that was it . Our experience was not exceptional in any way and the manager was giving out free champagne to a lot of other people who they were also clearly running late on there reservations but we got nothing . We didn't even have time to have dessert because the food took so long . We had to ask them to bring us bread even though it seemed like everyone else just got some . It was just frustrating when you decide to spend a special day at a restaurant and receive just a bad experience all together .

I'm giving my review based on our service today. I have heard amazing reviews about Nora's and gave it a try. 
The service doesn't deserve a star!!!  We were originally seated at wobbly table and the Hostess kindly changed our seating with no hesitation. After waiting for water for 10 minutes our server came over ready to take our order and we still didn't have water at that time. After placing our wine order, I had to stop the waiter immediately to place an appetizer order. As we sat and talked we realized it's taking our order longer than anticipated. It finally came. Same thing with our food.  The waiter didn't ask if we would like anything or advised us of our food being up shortly(time frame) The waiter dropped our food off and didn't look back. Didn't ask if we needed anything. We had to ask for red pepper flakes for our pizza. We asked for water twice and received it once. Now, if someone buys a bottle of wine, isn't it just business sense to ask if they would like another bottle? (Increasing Nora's revenue/sales) Would you like dessert? I mean sell us!  We are there to dine and enjoy!!!  We wanted another bottle, we wanted to converse with our waiter, we wanted to eat until we were stuffed to the gills. Instead, we received a hurry up and eat. The food is great the service is HORRIBLE!!! I even asked the family behind me. The father wasn't happy as well.

Nora's Cuisine has been seen as Las Vegas's best kept secret since opening in 1991. I recently was let in on that secret when I was on West Flamingo with a strong craving for Italian Food. When I walked in I noticed the decor of dark cherry and textured paint on the walls. My first condo was decorated  similar so it felt very inviting. The limited seating also made for a cozy dining experience.

We were brought some complimentary garlic bread almost immediately after being seated. The aroma from the bread was intoxicating but when I bit into the bread the grease was too heavy that I felt it on the roof of my mouth. I've had better garlic bread so I just moved on to the Caesar Salad. The Romaine lettuce was crisp and lightly coated with homemade dressing.  Honestly the croutons that topped the salad were much better than the bread and the Caesar dressing was perfect. 

I was torn between the Chicken and Veal Parmigiana so I asked the waiter his favorite out of the two. He said he preferred the Veal. When I can't decide sometimes I ask for the waiter's advice as a tie breaker but it doesn't always go so well . I'm happy to say this time the waiter knew what he was talking about! The veal was tender inside with crispy outer breading. It was served  over a tasty marinara sauce and topped with a healthy dose of mozzarella cheese. I also tested my husband's Baked Rigatoni which was made with a meat sauce, rigatoni, ricotta and mozzarella cheeses. My impression at first bite was it was too salty. It tasted better the next day. 

On a sweeter note we had the Oreo Tartufo for dessert. It was a ball of cookies and cream ice cream covered with a hard chocolate shell. It was big enough to share and small enough where you wouldn't  feel sorry you ate it. It was sinfully delicious! 

Nora's is great place for date night or a family dinner. The portions are generous and the service is excellent!

I heard great things about Nora's so we decided to give it a try.

It's literally in a strip mall on Flamingo/Jones. And, decor is nothing spectacular. I was, also, a little disappointed with paper tableclothes, but if the food was good I was willing to overlook it.

We sat in the dining room to the left of the entrance which had tables right on top of each other, so definately not a place togo if you want any sort of quiet or private setting. It was kinda loud actually, and we were very aware of the birthday party happening to our right and the party of 12 to our left.

They give you a basket of garlic bread to start (1st basket is free) and it wasn't very good...it seemed just like anything frozen you can buy at the grocery store.

We were never offered a wine list, which I thought was odd. Aside from this, I thought the service was really good.

We ordered 2 entrees...chicken parmesan & sausage rigatoni.

The chicken parm was an unbreaded breast with tons of cheese, and pretty tasteless. It was served with about a pound of pasta (literally). I make better chicken parm at home. The sausage dish was actually my husband's, but I did get to sample the left overs. He thought it was excellent. 

For desert he had some sort of oreo ice cream dipped in chocolate. I had a traditional canoli. We respectively, gave these a B.

They had quite a list of dessert martinis, as well, and I couldn't resist trying the banana coconut cream pie martini. It was pretty small, but really strong, and didn't taste much like any thing except alcohol.

The entire check came to around $50 for 2 people.

Overall, Nora's was just OK. I probably won't go again simply because I think there are much better places to get an Italian food fix. But, atleast I can say I've gone.

So we called because we were going to be late to our reservation. Instead of showing up at 10:30 we were going to show up closer to 11. Knowing they closed at 11 I said we were cancelling. The hostess said, " we would still love to have you" I DOUBLE CHECKED that it would be ok that we arrived so close to their closing and she said yes. We showed up at 11:01 and the hostess said "sorry our kitchen is closed" !!! We spent $40 in Uber to go there. The person who answered the phone should have just accepted my cancellation. SO UPSET and they were just like "sorry". Terrible. Don't go there.

This is my go to for Italian never had a bad meal and the garlic bread when u sit down is to die for great atmosphere and very cool place to eat especially when the weather is good you can eat out side and great bartenders

Best of Las Vegas in 1996, 2001 and 2009.

On my menu....

Trying to keep track of what someone else is consuming is a pain. I'll just recite what I had yesterday...

Garlic Bread (*** Complimentary) Unlike other patrons of Nora's... was not overly impressed with this Garlic Bread. We had two to three re-fills, and each refill was not consistent with any previous refill. Bread not up to par with the rest of the meal...

Alla Nora (**** 1/2 $10.50) Spaghetti, Eggplant, Ground Beef, Tomato Sauce, Pesto, and a variety of Cheeses with a light layer of Breading on top thrown together into a Bowl and baked until the surface is lightly crusty. I told you I was going to have this entree on my next visit! Did not disappoint!

Carafe of Sangria (****) Sangria is supposed to be the Wine Punch of Spain... what is it doing on the menu of an Italian restaurant? The Red Wine was light and dry... but in Nora's version the Fruit, either sliced or chopped was missing or in small supply. Would have been more refreshing with more Fruitiness.

Service was business-like and efficient... and distant. My favorite Italian, where I live, the owner is quite a bit friendlier and attentive... and hand-kissing towards the fairer sex. Maybe I didn't notice it on my first visit, but I was sitting on one of the outside seats of the table.... and caught my attention very quickly. Waiters a little too brusque for me... maybe they weren't Italian!

We got to Nora's around 5pm to 6pm, and there was no problem getting in and, most importantly, no waiting! But... after we got seated, the rush of diners started.

After all the hype I expected the food to be really good. Maybe it was an off day but my eggplant parmesan looked good but it was very bland with no garlic, Italian flavor at all. The side of pasta had about two tablespoons of sauce, also not flavorful. My husband's sausage did not taste like sausage, also not flavorful. 

It was very noisy and you could hardly hear each other. But the waiter was very nice and accommodating. May give it one more chance on the patio.

Very nice quality Italian food, I have been here a couple of times. First time I had Penne w/ vodka sauce. Good.. not great. Second visit I had the Spaghetti Marinara, better much better. I am a fan of their marinara. I am not a fan of how close you are to the other tables. I need just a little elbow room for my spaghetti dinner.

This place is the kinda place u wanna come to every time you're in vegas. Inside is super nice good for dates or group parties. Waiters here are super friendly and very attentive. Can't go wrong the pasta ala nora or my favorite the crazy pasta. Truffle fries and calamari is a must too and save room for their canolis. You'll thank me later

A great place for family and a quite night away from the strip ..  you forget you are in vegas once you are in there ! Not a bad thing when you want to enjoy great Italian food in great company with a glass of wine ..  !!

This is my favorite Italian place! Doesn't look as fancy until u get in. It's nice, quiet (sometimes they have a live band), food is DELICIOUS!!! Good sized portions, very flavorful, great atmosphere.

Found this when searching on Google/Yelp for best Italian Restaurant in Las Vegas and preferably wanted something off the strip.   Saw pictures of the Crazy Alfredo dish and knew we had to go there.  This play did not disappoint.  My husband had the steak special that was so buttery and tender.  My son chose the homemade chicken tenders-he really enjoyed it.  I had a Caesar salad to start that I have to say wasn't very tasty:/.  Very mild flavor.  My crazy Alfredo pasta dish was TDF!  Probably one of the best Alfredo dishes I've ever had!!!!!  Overall we give Nora's a 4 out of 5 because of the Caesar salad missing the mark for an Italian Restaurant.  Our family is already planning our next visit to Nora's when in town!

Great restaurant!

We came about 5:30 on a Friday and was asked if we had a reservation, but we didn't.  They still sat us down, but asked if we could finish our meal by 6:30 for the next reservation. We agreed as long as they could have the food done fast too. They said no problem.  And they did. 

I ordered the Caprese Salad for an appetizer and of course filled up, so I didn't have much room for my main meal. I got the Crazy Alfredo following the advise of my fellow Yelpers.  It was Yum!!!  

No room for dessert, but still finished my beer. I would come back again.

When we to Las Vegas we always look for off the Strip restaurants. We found a gem in Nora's Italian Cuisine. The food, service and cost of the meals were great. I would recommend reservations and you will not be disappointed.

This was my second visit to Nora's in the past week.  We stopped in for lunch one day because we have heard from two people how good this place is.  Lunch prices are very reasonable and the food is amazing.  

The lunch service was a little slow but I'll tell you what, the FOOD was worth the wait.  We got the Steak and Arugula Bruschetta as an appetizer and it was out of this world!!!   AMAZING!!!  They do bring you a small basket of Garlic Bread, the first one is on them the menu says and then $2.50 after that.  The bread is amazing but when you get a basket with just 4 small pieces for two people and then want to charge me $2.50 for another 4 pieces, that I may question.

I had the Rigatoni Special and the sauce, the sausage, the meatballs, OMG... we also a Nora special which is not on the togo menu so I cannot tell you the exact name but I was told it was the BEST they have ever had.

So since our experience with the food was SO AMAZING, we decided to go back last night and bring my daughter and her husband.  Of course we had the Steak and Arugula Bruschetta and they ordered the regular Bruschetta and both were again very good.  We also ordered the regular Antipasto Salad which we have had in a lot of Italian places and this was by far the BEST.

This time I decided to try the Chicken Parmigiana which you can get breaded or not and it was AMAZING..  The portion size was give me a to go box size which I did take home.  We also had the Veal Chop Parm, a $42 plate but I tell you what, the size of this Bone in Veal was so big, it came home and provided two more meals.  My daughter had the baked Rigatoni and her husband had the Snow White Pizza.  I guess he was having a Disney moment.  

Both dishes were amazing and to go boxes were in order for those as well.  he ordered the medium pizza and it was big enough for 2 to 3 people.  

They all wanted deserts and OMG, the cheesecake is to DIE for, no you won't die if you eat it but after all the food you might explode, the Cookies and Cream Tartufo was amazing, the Panna Cotta was WOW and then a Toasted coconut drink with drambui, and brandy was the topping on the meal.

My friend Frank from AZ comes here all the time and this place was packed non stop last night until about 8:30 then it started to slow down, but I truly understand why Frank says there is NO PLACE like this in Vegas for food of this quality.  Everyone from the hostess to the Manager last night were some of the warmest and friendliest people who ensured the place was running like a well oiled machine and they did an AMAZING JOB!!!  Many kudos to the kitchen and the entire staff, this is one of the BEST Italian places we have ever found her in Las Vegas and HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place and we will be back often, it is just that good.

They do not give military discounts but that is ok, this place is so good I will support them and so should you.  The prices are very reasonable and it is worth every penny.  I don't want to see corners cut to provide a discount and GOOD FOOD is worth paying for and this place is for REAL!!!!

Ordered a "To-Go" order for a business luncheon today.  VERY disappointed!  We ordered two Italian Subs and they did not include the dressing.  The sandwich was too dry to eat.  The Veal Milanese was to be served with tomato and a house salad.  They forgot to include the salad and tomato, so all we received was a fried piece of veal without anything else.  They completely forgot the Mozzarella Caprese, so one employee was without a lunch.  Only ONE order out of the FIVE was correct!!  They didn't include cutlery, napkins, etc.  Their lunch was just embarrassing.

I have been here several times (always for take-out) and have never been disappointed.  Their pizzas are delicious and so are the pasta dishes.  I love the ambiance: it's very casual and friendly.  The kitchen is right in the middle of the action and it's something you see as soon as you walk in the door.  The smells are outrageous and enough to kick the salivary glands into high gear!  On my most recent visit (4/19/14), I ordered the snow white pizza with prosciutto on top.  The pizza was delicious and the crust was perfectly crispy and very tasty.  I also ordered the Rigatoni Nora and the Baked Rigatoni.  Everything was delicious...I'm still dreaming about the leftovers from the next day and how good they were!  Next time, I intend to take some friends with me and eat in to truly enjoy this excellent restaurant.
Service pretty bad couldn't get a waiter to come to the table place was almost empty finally after 15 min had to waive one down then waited again . Food ok nothing great .

Love getting away from the strip and Nora's is a solid option!  All the traditional dishes and some of their own unique dishes. At least 1 large and 1 smaller private dining room.  Authentic Italian at reasonable prices without the tourist crowds.

I hate to write such a bad review but I have to. It was my friends birthday and we had a party of 10. Our reservation was on time which was good but they sat us at this round table. The chairs were touching each other and the silverware was touching the next person. Not only were we touching legs but we couldn't even open our menu without getting in the space of the next person. When we asked the host staff to move us and that fitting that many people at a table was really uncomfortable, she said to us: We always sit large parties here and there is never any problem.
She basically made it seem like we were crazy. The server agreed that they were crazy for sitting us all at that table and went and spoke with the manager. They basically said we would have to wait until another large table opened up to move. We ordered a few bottles of wine and waited for a table. It took them 1 HOUR. tables were opening up next to us, they could have put two tables together to accommodate us. It was clear they were irritated that we wouldn't try to eat squished together. 

Once we got the new table, we got a new server who never came to the table. We had to flag down other staff to ask for water or whatever we needed. 
My food was burnt. The list goes on.....

Terrible experience for a birthday. The old location was amazing but now its like all service has gone out the window. very sad to say.

I have dined to Nora's on numerous occasions, from the old location off of Rampart to the new location on Flamingo. Excellent food, wine and service. I will say though, I do miss the intimate setting and ambiance that the former Nora's on Rampart gave.

I am from the Washington DC area and I came to Las Vegas with my family
for two weeks. Before this restaurant, I wasn't turned onto the idea of Italian
food..but this place did it for me! The Pasta Fagioli was amazing and so was the Gnocchi with Vodka Sauce. I had absolutely no complaints.  The cannolis and the chocolate cake were great too. If you are in Vegas, its def a must.
Wander off the strip it is well worth the ride. Food was great, service was incredible. Would go back anytime and probably will.

My wife and I went here on NYE 2017. Sebastian was our waiter and did such an amazing job it prompted this review. If you have the privilege to go here and be served by Sebastian you will have a phenomenal experience. Food was awesome. Cannolis are the best in town. Whiskey Sour was the best I've ever had. I will be returning over and over again!

First time there was for lunch. The smells were fantastic, reminded me of places in NY and Boston. Great service, menu included many segments, pasta, seafood, meats etc. Moscato and Cianti was exceptional. Appetizers and entrees were delicious, gnocci alfredo and veal marsala. Will be back.

I DON"T UNDERSTAND WHAT EVERYONE IS REVIEWING.

This is the equivalent to average pizza place food.

Maybe the garlic bread was decent and someone else wrote favorably about the crazy alfredo -- But if you're in the mood for chicken parmigiana or eggplant parmigiana -- You will be wildly disappointed.

Chicken Parm - BLAND, FLAVORLESS CHICKEN, FLAVORLESS SAUCE/GRAVY, FAKE CHEESE (Not real mozzarella)

Eggplant Parm - TOTAL MUSH and hardly any flavor in sauce either, FAKE CHEESE

Do I really have to spend $$$$ to get decent Italian in Vegas??!!

:(

Simply put, the best Italian food in Vegas and perhaps the west coast.... I only review the really good or really bad.  This is really good and a fair price.... Drive off the strip a couple of miles and head west on Flamingo past The Palms.  Make reservation in the weekend. They have the traditional faire plus great specialities.

We came to Vegas to celebrate my daughters 21st birthday and chose to eat here. It could not have been better, the service was attentive and helpful, the food was so good we mentioned it even days later. When the server found out it was my daughters birthday she insisted on bringing out a beautifully plated dessert. All in all great experience, not one negative thing about it. Thanks to everyone there!!

This place was referred to us by a freind, who is a local, and boy where they spot on, especially when he recommened the Anti-Pasto Salad. Yummy garlic bread.  We had the Spaghetti and Meatballs, and the meatballs are excellent!  Full of flavor, moist.  The Antipasto Salad is super fresh, crisp romaine lettuce, great deli meats.  Sadly The Chocolate Cake was a bit disappointing for us.  I think it had like nutts and and lemony sauce, it just wasnt quite our cup of tea.  But their Canoli's, OMG those where some of the best i've ever had, very very good!  We visit Vegas often and so far we've been back twice( in 2 months) .  You just cant beat their prices and great food.  We'd rather eat at a great local place like this then pay the over-rated and over-priced fees of a lot of the restaurants in Casinos or on the strip.

I wanted to see what all the hype was about with Nora's. We went around 5:30/6:00 on a Thursday night and it was pretty calm but right as we were seated tons of people started coming in. The service was great and our waiter Kenia was fabulous! She always checked on us and the bussers were constantly walking by checking on us too! The only downside was the wait time to actually get your food but it was well worth. The portions were pretty big and the quality is excellent! We ordered salad to share, Crazy Alfredo, & Rigatoni Gorgonzola with Chicken. All of it was great! I can't wait to go back and check out more!

Great service, quality Italian, awesome live band (Nat King Cole/ Frank Sinatra jams), off the Strip and close to home--what can be better than this?  I came here twice within a month.  It's intimate, yet fun to bring a small group of friends.  Reservations are recommended, because they are quite popular with the locals.  

The calamari is a great starter (light in batter, crispy, yet not oily).

The Frutti di Mare with the spicy marinara is yummy if you like a whole lotta seafood.  All portions are big, so you can share between two people. 

But if you like something light in taste and creamy and not too meaty... I recommend the Melrose Shrimp.  Creamy basil pesto, zucchini & sun-dried tomatoes, and linguini-- garnished with 3-4 giant succulent seasoned shrimps.  There are pine nuts added which gives it a nice crunch, but you can ask them to hold off on that if you're allergic or it's not your thing.

I really enjoyed their live band which played a lot of vocal jazz (New Orleans kinda tunes).  It was great vibe.  My friends and I had so much fun--we'll definitely be back!

Heard Nora's was the place to eat, but got their & soon realize they should've just changed their restaurant to "Reservations Only". & btw 2/12 Hrs is not 45Mins. I seen people been waiting patiently for hours but of course "Reservations" will be seated first. That's not really an issue. But the real issue is "Reservations" that had missed their time & show up late can still be seated ahead of Walk-Ins which makes 0 sense.

Chose this place because its my daughters name...Nora who? The food is phenomenal, atmosphere relaxing, my server Donald was top notch, absolutely loved the music playing. I will def be coming back here hopefully bring others so they can have a great meal and experience

Noras is one the locals favorite Italian restaurant. Their food is very authentic and delicious. The atmosphere is cosy and pleasant. This is one of those places where the servers would recognize you and make you feel welcomed. There are a lot of locals who frequent this restaurant and are treated like family.
We ordered one of their most popular dishes, the Crazy Alfredo. The portion size is definitely crazy. You can easily share this dish with someone else. The pasta is super creamy and it comes with chicken, sausage and shrimp. I was very satisfied with this dish. However, the best part was the chocolate lava. It takes about 20 minutes to get it, but it's worth every minute. The dessert was soft, super tasty and thankfully it was not overwhelming sweet. The pistachio on top was a very nice addition to the dessert. Overall, this is a nice place if you want great food while feeling like your home.

We'd been looking for a mom n pop italian restaurant and this one hits the spot! Yet another classy, yet casual place.  The service was great and the waiters very friendly. The food was delicious as well - for an appetizer, we ordered the bruschetta, which was light and very well done. For the entree, I ordered the Alla Nora and my boyfriend ordered, what I'm assuming was the special for the night as I do not see it on the menu.  The Alla Nora was a wonderful combination of eggplant, cheese, and pasta, baked and topped with herbs. I remember his dish as an amazing pasta dish that had a good amount of vegetables, but what stuck out was the gargonzola that was mixed into the dish and was blended into the sauce.  I had expected this to be too cheesy and creamy, but it was just right.  And how can we not top of an Italian meal with a dessert of Cannoli?  Not only was the presentation beautifully done, but it was delicious.  

Price-wise, the restaurant was very reasonably priced and I'm sure I'll be going again in the near future.

Went to new location for our annual big dinner party. Unfortunately new is not good. No longer same charming place. We were there for 7:30 reservation and didn't sit until 8:45. No apologies just attitude. Service was not the same. I am no longer a fan
The food was good, nice atmosphere and a very popular place.  I would tell friends about and I would return to try something else on the menu.

While visting Vegas, my boyfriend and I wanted to try a nice local Italian place off the strip and found Nora's.  The atmosphere was very nice.  Our waiter was very courteous and attentive. The items on their menu had traditional fare and some other authentic plates as well which offered a good variety! I had the Veal Cannelloni al Bosco  which was nothing I've had before.  I thought the sauce was quite delicious, but the filling was a little dry.  My boyfriend got the Chicken Parmigiana.  The sauce was full of flavor and not watery.  However, the chicken did was not crispy, but instead a little soggy, so that was disappointing.  The portions were pretty good compared to your typical huge vegas portions.  If we come through Vegas again, we will probably stop here again! :)

Nora's has been my favorite italian restaurants for years! You really can't go wrong here, it is italian comfort food for me. The sauces are all so delicious, I never even liked Alfredo sauce until i tried it here. The calamari is some of the best i have ever had, and all the specialty pasta dishes and pizzas are great. The service is always great and the staff is so friendly. They have a great drink menu with many wine and craft cocktail choices. The deserts are to die for! my favorite are the cheese cake and the cannoli. Also the lunch menu is awesome and everything here is really affordable and amazing.

Great food and fairly priced.  Really busy, even during middle of the week so don't come starving.

My only squawk is that the bartender that served us while we waited for a table was less than friendly.

Things got better once we go to the table and after we sat it was on.

Good Italian restaurant where it seems like locals actually eat. I had a veal chop parmigiana and it was great, a large chop nicely presented so the bone did not interfere. Also had good spinach sautéed with garlic. Service was professional yet friendly. A really nice break from The Strip.

Went tonight based on a recommendation and we were pleasantly surprised! Delicious. Everything we ordered was very tasty and you get significant portions. Garlic bread is awesome. The antipasti salad was great. The crazy fettuccini and chicken marsala were on point. Great service and family owned. This will be our go-to Italian spot from now on!

Crazy Alfredo was very tasty, although a bit smaller than i would expect for 25 bucks.  You get 1 basket of bread for free - only got 4 small pieces of bread that was more or less burned.  Waiter spent 20 minutes straight talking to the table next to me and ignored me more or less.  I think he liked the daughter.  Thank God for the bus boy who kept bringing me drinks.  Overall well worth the hour long walk from the strip.

One of the best resturaunts here in Las Vegas. Not only was our service phenomenonal...the food way delicious! Our servers name was Don. He was very kind and attentive. You could see the servers focusing on the customers with genuine smiles and care! I ordered the Crazy Alfredo and it was very good!  Loved the kick of jalpeno in the pasta. My hubby ordered Chicken parm and a pie to go, he was happy! It was our first time there and we were thoroughly impressed! We will be back!
Been here twice with a party of 10 or more each time. Everyone loved their food (especially the crazy alfredo) and Bryce knows what he's doing...great waiter.

The food was good, the servers kept wanting to clear our table when we were not done yet. The patio overlooks the parking lot and could use a lattice barrier with pretty lighs to give it a better ambiance. Candle lights would be nice on the tables since they act like they are fine dining. I would go back.

First time coming here the other day. Was craving some Italian food and after finding it on yelp I thought Me and My boyfriend would give it a try. We came around 4pm, good thing because 30 minutes later it started getting packed! Hostess wasn't really a hostess, didn't really greet us or talk much as she was sitting us at our table but anyways, the server made up for that, she was great. We ordered the arancini & the house salad for apps and my boyfriend got a cup of the pasta fagioli also some complimentary garlic bread. The arancini was delicious I could've eaten all 4 myself lol the salad was yummy. The soup was kinda flavorless, needed more salt, and the garlic bread was great. For dinner I had the Alla Nora (Eggplant with Meat sauce & pesto) and my boyfriend had Rigatoni special (rigatoni, sauce, sausage, meatballs, peppers & onions). Only complaint I had about the Alla Nora is wayyyyyyyy too much parm cheese on it, like literally the whole thing covered and made it way too cheesy and salty. Next time I will ask without the cheese so I can put it on myself. My boyfriend liked the rigatoni, the meatballs were delicious. As for dessert we had a cannoli which was yummy and some Oreo ball icecream thing which was great. Will def be coming back again!
Marla was a wonderful server. On top of everything even when the restaurant was packed! Amazing food and great atmosphere!
Thanks to Yelp, found this wonderful restaurant. A must try when in Vegas! Freshly made pasta. So so good

This place is a hidden gem.  We came early so i can only give a review for the lunch time.  The food was fabulous.  The server was extremely professional and polite.  He gave great recommendations on food and wines that would go along with it.  At night he was saying that they have a singer and piano player.  I would have loved to see that.  I will be back for a dinner in the future.

I came here for a rehearsal dinner for my sister's wedding last May. I have thought about going back to this restaruant ever since. I absolutely loved everything. I was able to try a lot of different menu items since it was a large party and they served us pre selected random dishes. 

The antipasta salad, so delicous!!! I would say the best I've had anywhere. All the yummy meats and cheese with a great dressing.  Next we had Eggplant parmesan, so good and the best dish was the Baked Ziti. I never ever order this at a restaraunt but I've been in search of one as amazing as Nora's ever since. I thought I had been missing out on this dish for years but nope just the one at Nora's. Last but not least, dessert was served tiramisu and canolis. The canoli was amazing! I definitely recommend this restaraunt and will probably be back every trip I make to Vegas.

The reviews convinced me to try it.  I went with my husband and 2 kids, and arrived at 5:30 on a Saturday night.  They said it would be a 20 minute wait, but then 2 minutes later said a table was ready.  Not sure what that was about.  

Anyway, we loved the Nora salad, and I got spaghetti with meatballs.  The sauce was delicious, a little on the salty side which I love, and also had a little spice which didn't bother my 6 year old at all.  My son got a 12" pepperoni pizza and ate 4 slices.  My husband got the clam sauce spaghetti which he liked.  It was an excellent deal and I will definitely be going back.

I have read all the reviews on Nora's since they have re-opened at a new location and so I decided to try it.  Used to go to the old location and most of the time it was OK....  
Went there last night and I'm sorry to say the food wasn't as good as it should have been.  The Chicken Marsala was OK, nothing special, tasted the same as all the Marsala dishes I order at other Italian restaurants, nothing special to set Nora's version apart.
