 Also ordered the Eggplant Pizza which was terrible, the egg plant was burnt and the pizza crust was un-chewable, sent it back and ordered the Eggplant ala Nora without the Pesto on it.  Again the eggplant was overcooked so it tasted burnt which isn't exactly a treat, and it was just an average dish of spaghetti with sauce and then topped with burnt pieces of eggplant.  
The food isn't fantastic, it is just regular Italian food you could eat anywhere and pay less for.  I don't go to a restaurant because the building is new, that is not what I am paying for, I am paying for a fantastic dinner and I didn't get that.  It was below average but priced above average.  More detail should be given to the quality and preparation of the food.   It wasn't worth my going there because I didn't enjoy myself nor did my companion and we had terrible indigestion for the better part of the evening after dining there.  
There are many Italian restaurants around town that can compete with Nora's and the food is more enjoyable, prepared correctly, and not as costly. 
 I don't understand all these great reviews because I looked at the food coming out of the kitchen (not just what I ordered) and it didn't look like it was anything special.  I just think people are so used to going to Nora's that it becomes a habit and they go not for the food but because they are used to going there.  Sorry Nora's, your new building is pretty, but I think the quality of your food need improvement!!!!

Went here for Valentines dinner. Great experience! Staff are nice.. 

Started off with comp garlic bread which was a little hard, and wine. Food came out about 30-35mins after which I thought was a long wait, but it was Valentines and busy, so didn't really mind. 

We weren't really impressed with the food though. I had the lobster pasta, i thought it was bland. Not worth the money. I'd choose olive garden next time I crave for some italian.

Great authentic Italian cuisine! Started off with the calamari that had a side of tangy sauce on it. Great choice. Also got the house salad, which is definitely shareable, and the shrimp scampi. Again, all great choices. For dessert, ordered the tiramisu and the limoncello shot. The tiramisu was amazing! Best I've ever had! This will definitely be a go to place every time I visit Las Vegas!
I've been coming here since high school....never a disappointment. Best hidden lil gem.

The girl who greeted & seated us looked quite confused as she was talking to me. I made reservations the morning of & didn't have problems. We were seated right away. 

I ordered a sangria and the bf ordered an IPA. He said his tasted good & had no complaints. My sangria was pretty strong. I wish they had more fresh fruit inside but it wasn't bad. They give you a complimentary basket of garlic bread. Those were pretty tasty. I ordered the crazy Alfredo and he ordered some pasta with eggplant stuff on it. The meals itself were very good. However, it was almost an hour wait for the food. They were pretty packed so I guess it wasn't a surprise that it took a while but still... If I wasn't a little tipsy & I wasn't enjoying my bf's company, I would've been annoyed LOL. But the server was very nice!

I was introduced to this place by my manager (who's previous boss came here all the time). At first I was a little startled when she said Italian food - as I'm not much of pasta person. I had came here for a special dinner and I must say - the italian food here is one of the best! The crazy pasta and the spaghetti were cooked to perfection! The crazy pasta had a little jalapeño kick to it with chicken, shrimp, tomatoes and bell peppers. The spaghetti with red sauce was cooked perfectly. It looks plain at first but the taste wasn't strong and had the right amount of basil and cheese. In the beginning, the appetizers were filling and left our party having to stop ourselves for more. Although I had to take a lot of food home I had to make room for dessert - the cannolis were the best part. This little tube of sweetness was the perfect ending for an amazing dinner! If you are looking for authentic Italian food stop by at Nora's! Make sure you call and reserve a spot for a slice of Italian heaven!

The 2007 recipient of the LVRJ's Reader's Choice award as the Best Undiscovered Restaurant and has a Zagat rating of 24, 18, 21. http://www.norascuisine.com/  This southern Italian restaurant is very popular and we encountered a long waiting line as we entered at 7PM, but we had secured advance reservations and were promptly seated.  We shared a Caesar salad that was on the small side though the menu indicated it would serve 2-3.  The salad itself was decent, but the croutons were soft and flavorless.  The menu was the same as you would find in any Italian/American restaurant so my wife ordered the eggplant parmesan while I chose meatballs and spaghetti.  Both dishes were satisfactory though typically over sauced and below expectations.

Nora's is legendary for Las Vegas. Every local tells their friends that this is the spot. I think it is for a few specific reasons. Food quality is always good and the dishes are consistent. Sequence and consistency of service is always on point. it is always busy. Everytime I have went, there is a small wait (not bad) because they are busy turning tables. Their operation is very efficient with scheduling. The price point is very afforadble and of course they are the home team favorite. They are the underdog off the strip. All that contributes to the fierce loyalty they receive from their customers. I would even dare to say they are like the Rao's of Las Vegas. No, they don't have a 3 month wait and their tables aren't owned by certain families and you have to get approval from them to sit there or anything silly like that, but you might want to be prepared for fisticuffs if you say anything negative about this place in certain circles. 

I joke. . .

I checked in and they gave me a comp glass of wine. I made the entire table check in and they gave a comp carafe! Score! Winner! Winner! I think it was also because it was my girls birthday.

I only gave it 4 stars because of the atmosphere. I know they tried a second restaurant and it didn't do as good. I think that was probably because it lost some of its mom and pop charm that the original stores oozes. I too would have some hesitation on doing too many upgrades in order to not disturb an already successful business, but there has to be a happy medium that can be achieved where the design of the space can be more indicative of their food quality. 

The lighting does not have enough highlights or shadows in the room. It is all diffused mid-tones so nothing stands out. There is no contrast on the walls. The ceiling has some ornate feature that I couldn't really make out. I like the pizza/app guy at the front as you walk in and a long bar inviting you to start there, but other than that the chairs and tables and lighting threw me off making me want a cooler atmosphere but it would not deter me from going there time and time again. The vibe was a little ho-hum. What about a little music in the background? Doesn't have to be themed to italian, adult contemporary could work too. I understand music is a big commitment as well. In addition it will also increase the overall ambience of the room and I noticed quite a few people that have most likely been going there for years (perhaps decades). They won't like the higher noise level, but it will most likely increase the length and purchase of the customer visit.

Ok I am rambling. The place is good. Eat there and love it.

I was super excited to try out Nora's on a friend's recommendation and had a booked marked for awhile too. Came for dinner and it was packed. Was greeted right away and informed us of a 15 minute wait. However, they were able to get seated in 5 minutes, so that was a plus.

The ambiance and decor is classy and charming. The wine room with the ceiling to floor window is their highlight. Wine barrels repurposed for the chandelier lighting over the bar area was clever and unique. The wine menu was made of cork. How appropriate! With all this attention to detail, I was a thrown off by the butcher paper on top of the dining table. I know some Italian restaurants have them and give you crayons ( if you have kids? ) to doodle on, but we didn't and they were kinda in the way. The paper was folded into half and it made the table uneven in parts so I had to move my drink to the more level part of the table. There is a white table cloth underneath it, so it would have been nice to do without the paper overlay. 

Server was very prompt and friendly. Complementary garlic bread came out first. It was soft, had real chopped bits of garlic on it, and buttery. Yum! Was hoping the rest of the meal will just be as good. Ordered the fettuccini alfredo, spaghetti and meatballs, and mozzarella sticks. Mozzarella sticks were safe. The garlic marinara dipping sauce was above average. The fettuccini alfredo was very basic. It needed salt and was swimming in butter. Felt that it should of been creamier. It could of been better. Spaghetti and meatballs was underwhelming. Meatballs were moist, but needed more seasoning. The sauce didn't have a robust flavor that comes from a low and slow cooking methof at all. The red sauce actually looked very plain. No flecks of Italian seasonings or pepper in sight. These 2 dishes are simple, but when done right it can be amazing and these were not. It was simply just ok. 

The atmosphere is upscale casual. Details in decor are thoughtful and chic. Pricing is very reasonable. Would be good for a first date without breaking the bank or to watch a game at the bar without the rowdy crowd of a typical bar. May give this place another try in the future.

We tried this place a couple of week ago & were delighted.  It was a busy Friday night, but were seated within minutes of our reservation time.  Waitress came right to the table, and took our orders quickly.  Food was very good, and pricing reasonable.  Will be back soon.
The service was excellent, the food was amazing and the atmosphere was very pleasant. We will return next time we are in town.

Another great meal and our 1st lunch, usually here for dinner. Got to try the Italian rope sausage and the absolutely outstanding Seafood Misto. 
Let's not forget to thank Joemar for the nice greeting. Our waiter, Rudy also knows his mixology, makes a perfect, Perfect Manattan.

Maybe with some of these people like Darcy ripping the restaurant up, there won't be such a huge line of people waiting to take their reservation.  I get it, you weren't treated like a superstar as you may have been before they moved, but you even acknowledged how great the food was, that the bartender was fantastic and even comped a round for you, but still give them 2 stars - napkins in the rest room weren't folded as they used to be, seriously, stop being such a snob you're at a busy restaurant with absolutely delicious food for very reasonable prices, best restaurant this side of the strip and finding stupid reasons to mark it down.  Sorry, I don't usually react this way, but this restaurant is my new favorite - moved here in January and have looked around for good food at reasonable prices and this is the one.  They get large parties all of the time and are swamped, all of the time.  So some of the waiters stand at the front, any good restaurant does that so they can overlook all of their tables to see if anyone is looking for help.  Apparently, you got a table that was busier than most, your waiter may have been waiting on one of the large tables and hadn't made their way out to you yet.  If you really think this is a two star restaurant then you definitely won't want to go back their again.  But...if you find yourself back there soon then you should update your review because you know their restaurant is so much better than any others in this area.  I know they're busy, I've waited for my food and service as well, but I'm out to dinner so I realize that's always a possibility.  Rather than having a restaurant that treats its customers like cattle and moves them in and out quickly, here you just sit back and enjoy yourself and the atmosphere and stop all of the phony pretentious attitude - missing a certain je ne sais quoi, come on, you're not at an upscale restaurant that charges a hundred + bill for a spaghetti dinner, if you were they'd have waiters tripping over each other!  Cheesecake Factory, seriously, I've eaten there twice and both times the food wasn't great and the service was ten times crazier then Nora's.  I dare you not to eat here anymore, we'll see how long you last before you try them again!

Great variety and quality Italian food 
Gets you off the Strip and serves you great quality food

The free garlic bread is garlicky and yummy. We've never had a bad thing on the menu and we've tried a lot of them. It's a must try Italian restaurant and we always bring our friends and family from out of town. They also have great private rooms.

We always visit Nora's when we come to Las Vegas. It is a nice alternative to something in the hotel and the food and service are always great. 

I opted for the "Crazy Alfredo" on my last visit and it was decent. I still prefer their Vodka Penne over most of the pasta dishes there. The place has a decent selection of wines by the glass as well. 

The antipasto salad is pretty good and plenty for two people to share as a starter.

We went a couple weeks ago for a friend's birthday.  At first I was leery of how good this place could really be because of it's location.  It's in a crappy little strip mall kind of tucked away where you wouldn't see it unless you were actively looking for it.  I was so pleasantly surprised.  The place was packed, the hostesses/waiters were nice, there was a small jazz band playing, we were seated promptly (we had a reservation - HIGHLY recommend booking one) & the food/drinks...oh god it was all SO great.  Here's a rundown of the food we ordered:

Appetizers:
 - Garlic Bread (1st basket on the house - it's so good, you'll want to pay for another basket but don't be tempted to fill up on bread!) 
 - Arancini (so good!)

Dinner:
 - Alla Nora (This was my order & it was SO good)
 - Pork Tenderloin alla Siciliana  (My friend's dish - it was excellent)
 - Chicken Parmigiana (The birthday girl's dish - also very good)

Desserts: 
 - Oreo Cookie Tartufo (This was good but VERY sweet)
 - Salted Caramel Panna Cotta (**THIS WAS MY FAVORITE***)
 - Tiramisu (Good! I like a little more cookie to cream ratio but very good)

I was so impressed by everything about this place that I'm taking my honey there tomorrow night for an early valentine's day dinner.  It was the first place I thought of when I was asked if I wanted to go eat somewhere...make sure to check it out if you're in the area & want some delicious Italian food!

I've been taking my fiancée to her favorite restaurant Nora's every year for her birthday since 2013.  It is simply marvelous!  The most delicious Italian cuisine I have ever tasted!  The portions are quite generous and not enormous so you'll more than likely be able to clean your entire plate from the appetizers to the main course to dessert!

The staff is kind and attentive and they really make you feel welcome.  The last two years we've gone, we've ordered their famous Oreo Tartuffo dessert which is a cookies and cream scoop of ice cream covered In chocolate shell with Oreo cookie crumbles and I think there's even some mousse with it too!

It's absolutely one of the tastiest desserts I have ever had!

Highly recommended!

Ok 
I'm Italian
From NJ
I know how to eat
I'm insanely critical of Italian restaurants

This is easiest the best hole in all of vegas. 
This is better than a lot of places in Little Italy NYC

Didn't care for the shrimp scampi
And chicken Francese isnt offered
Hard to get a reservation and parking blows
But the food is great
You can tel why they are crowded

I won't let anyone serve me but this kid Nick who wears glasses
The way he serves me and my clients when I bring them here, it's like we are being hosted in his own home. 
He had us ordering all sorts of things even alcohol! 
This place is a gem

Great neighborhood restaurant!
They moved in to the new building last month in September. Their new location is just a block away from the old one, conveniently on W Flamingo Rd & Duneville. The two level restaurant is surrounded with lots of parking spaces! Luckily we don't need to leave because of not being able to park our cars. It happened before at their other location!

The new building has plenty of tables and seats. On the ground level, immediately on the right side, you can find the full liqueur bar with seats, and tables in the same area. From this room there is an entrance to the upstairs dining room (still waiting to be finished, as of last week), and also there is an entrance to the outdoor patio dining area. On the left side they have another dining room. 
They've kept the open kitchen concept, so the restaurant stays very casual.

The menu also stayed the same! 
I'm very pleased to find their lunch specials unchanged, with same prices as before.
I think the complementary garlic bread taste even better, knowing that at the end of your meal you'll be getting the bill, and no surprises!

Our lunch experience was very pleasant.
Our waiter ( sorry, I can't remember his name) from Italy, took his time to talk to us, served our drinks and meals, and made us feel very welcome in the brand new location.
I specifically asked for my sandwich to be prepared, and I got it perfectly right. 
Due to food allergy, my BF also had a special request to skip certain items from the salad. He got his meal absolutely perfect.
Our drinks were refilled by the busboy. Both waiter and busboys were very attentive.

We tried other menu items many times before (of course at the other location), but we are looking forward to coming back to dine here again.

Perhaps to enjoy some live music someday!

Whenever I'm headed out to lunch with coworkers/vendors, and people are in the mood for Italian, two places come up as suggestions: Pasta Mia and Nora's.  I've been to Pasta Mia quite a few times and well...whenever these decisions come up I'm always rooting for Nora's.

Now maybe it's because I grew up going to places like Olive Garden and Macaroni Grill, but for the most part I've never "craved" Italian food for the better part of my life.  Nothing against those two restaurant chains, I've had good family celebrations there, but the food never hooked me.  Well, my opinion of Italian is slowly changing after visiting Nora's repeatedly.

I started out with fettuccine, spaghetti, etc. and all those other dishes that most places serve.  What really won me over was their Melrose Pesto.  I've had pesto before at other places, and there were times were I was gagging it down.  I'd given up on the green sauce, until a coworker brought back leftovers of their Melrose Pesto at Nora's.  I ate it the next day for lunch, and immediately knew that I had to try that on my next visit.  I was able to do just that this week, and here I am anxiously waiting for my next meal there.

Also of note is the skill of the bartenders.  They make some well crafted cocktails, and outside of Downtown Cocktail Room, this is the only other place that I trust to make me an Old Fashioned.  Nora's makes it to my list of repeat eats.

Thank you Nora's Italian Cuisine!  Everyone in our large party said the food and service was terrific.  The staff was quick and efficient.  One of our guests quipped "outside of NY, this is the best pizza!"  We may just have to make this our annual dinner place.

This place is amazing!  It will be a dining destination anytime I visit Las Vegas.  It is off the strip, it is full of locals and it is perfectly priced!  The food is as good as it gets with unique Italian dishes and phenomenal pizza! 

Highly recommend this restaurant.

My wife and I were doing a brief get away in Vegas. We can only handle one or two nights of all the Strip has to offer, and were really wanting something more mom & pop'ish. We found this place on Yelp and saw several great reviews. We decided to give it a try. 

We made same day reservations and they seated us within 5 minutes even though we were running a little late. When you walk in you're hit by a great smell and the place feels like a happening local food spot. 

We had over-eaten all weekend a weren't terribly hungry, so we ordered a little lite. We split the Veal Marsala. Incredible sauce and great meat. It was the best Marsala sauce we've ever tried. It came with a side of spaghetti that was good as well. We also had a bowl of pasta soup (Farmagiano?) that was huge, hearty (filled with beans and pasta shells) an was great. I had a gratis glass of house red via our friends at yelp and we were out the door for $30. 

If you're looking for a friendly, home style change of pace from the big-ness of Vegas, and are craving great and affordable Italian food, do yourself a favor and check this place out. Highly recommended.
Yummy!! Phenomenal Italian food.  I can honestly say it rivals Buddy V's at the Venitian.

This place has great food!  the pizza is the best in Las Vegas.  I took the family here last night after hearing multiple times how good the food is.  All I can say is if you have not tried this place you are missing out.

Gorgonzola rigatoni with chicken was pretty good a little bit strong on the Gorgonzola that's what my wife had I had the crazy chicken Alfredo stuff it was really good I definitely go back there everything is all a cart

One of my biggest complaints about Vegas is that all the restaurants are chain restaurants.  I go out of my way to find "normal" family owned restaurants.  We found Nora's and always impressed with the service and price at this Italian eatery that started many years ago as a pizza joint.  Even on a week night, reservations are recommended.  A typical evening will show you 5-6 different servers all focused on your needs...  One does beverages, one does bread, one takes your order, one does water, another serves your order...  And they communicate very well so you dont even notice that it is someone different each time.  The food there can be good to great.  The portions, generally speaking, are not huge but filling, but they are priced right.  For dinner for two, we plan about $40.  I have taken clients here for lunch, and have not been disappointed.  Saturday nights can get noisy as they have a singer who comes in.  This is a favorite date night spot for us, and I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for some good, "real" Italian food!

Don't wanna be ANYWHERE near the strip and want Italian food?  Come here! Great atmosphere, private and romantic.  Their Fried Calamari is amazing.  Traditional Italian courses galore and the service is good.  I would totally return.

Great Food! Great Service!
I Love  the rice balls... The veal parmigiana with spaghetti is great as well!!

One of the best italian restaurants in Vegas! I've tried their white wine linguini clam pasta, wild boar and rigatoni pasta... All of them were amazing! Their bread and service were remarkable as well!

Finally made it here with the boyfriend. He ordered the Crazy Alfredo and i had the Melrose with chicken.  They give a basket of really good garlic bread..i loved it because i like garlic but for those of you who dont..beware it has a lot of garlic chunks.  The pastas were good. Not bad...but pricey considering pasta cost nothing to make at home...which i did this week.  I was able recreate the Melrose add chicken and shrimp and made it better.  Overall...it was good. The Oreo Tartufa was ridiculous.  Id go back just for that!!!

Second time to this restaurant; I think this is a nice little local hold-in-the-wall place that offers quality food that's in the Spring Valley area.  I don't think this is the best Italian restaurant, but if you are in the neighborhood, give it a try!

Had dinner at this place last night. Sat in the smaller room. We had 9 pm reservation ( place closes at 10 ). Room had 6 other tables with guests dining. Waitress took our order. Asked for bottled still water, they brought ice water. We order cheese sticks, spinach salad and 2 entrees. They coursed everything out, cheese came first, a while later, the salad. They were ok, nothing special. As we were finishing our salad, we noticed the room got empty.  Then immediately the entrees came out. From this moment on, the waitress started to rush us. She never checked on us on the cheese or salad courses, then she appears abruptly as we were eating our entrees and asked 'how was everything. Should I wrap these up?' Well, we were eating still, so we said no. Barely five minutes after, she came back and asked ' all set? Should I wrap these up'? My friend let her wrap his entree, as I was still eating. When she returned with his food to go, she picked my plate and asked if  she could wrap it up. I let her do it. I was upset by this time already. My friend asked about the chocolate cake, she said takes '25 to 30 minutes.. I have a cheesecake..' We said no , just the check. They probably would have thrown us out if we had ordered the chocolate cake.. Mind you that we left 9:55, so technically, they were still open. I ate there before and loved it. This time, the garlic bread was the only great item. My pasta was flavorless, my friend entree has so much cheese, it was all we tasted. Cocktails were ok, nothing special. Won't come back.

Nora's never disappoints, food is always amazing! But they should train their young hostess ladies. 
   My party of 5 was told that our wait was going to be around an hour, but we had to wait 1 hour and 45minutes. (We would've gone to another restaurant if we were told that the wait was going to be nearly 2 hours.) 
   While waiting in line, we saw several of parties of 2 who came in after us getting sat before us, but we waited thinking they were taking a long time to make a larger table for us. But NO, we were cramped into a 4ppl table; the same-sized table as those parties of 2. We spoke to the manager and he kindly comped our appetizer and salad. 
   Anthony, our server was attentive and professional, and he made sure we had a great dinner after all. 
      (I do not know the name of the manager, but if he is reading this, i would like to say that I'm sorry if we ranted too much and gave you one of the hardest nights. We were very hungry and upset. A five-star review is for my apologies.)
Went for an informal business dinner. Everything was so good. The staff was good and the overall ambiance was good. A nice diamond in the rough

One of my new favorite go to restaurants!!

First, the ambiance and decor is super classy. It's very loud and packed, but everything is aesthetically pleasing. 

Now the food is really good. My boyfriend and I ordered a medium (16') white spinach pizza with shrimp on top and the crazy alfredo pasta. I've never had such an amazing white pizza! 

Everything was delicious and it was big portions. We shared our food and didn't even get to finish. I'm so excited to come back and try the other things on the menu!!
Wife and I stopped in for lunch on Wednesday. The food here is delicious and the service was excellent. We will definitely come back again. If you haven't tried Nora's before I highly recommend it.

We ate here last night.  If you get there before 5 your seated right away, after 5 reservations are a must or you will wait a while. The prices are extremely reasonable and the food is excellent.  The service I felt was rushed but there were a lot of people waiting to get seated.  We will definitely be back.

Great authentic Italian food. We started out with some bread, doused with garlic and butter. We got mussels arrabrita in spicy sauce and the promodoro bruschetta which was a bit too salty but both very delicious. I got linguini with clams which was spectacular and the red sauce was perfect. My boyfriend got the frutti de mare with angel hair and that the best dish there. Plenty of seafood and perfect sauce. I look forward to returning.
One of my fav italian restaurants in town. This place always feels like home. Great bartenders as well especially Gaston. For special occassions we always get the back private room.

This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. I love that it is local and not on the strip. I have been here many times and will be back for many more.

The service this time was good. Nothing out of the ordinary but nothing bad either. 

They start the meal off with garlic bread. It's so good it can be hard to stop eating it. 

This time I started off the meal with a resiling. It was good but very sweet. I was kind of surprised because it was sweeter than I though it would be.

I then decided on angel hair pasta with vodka sauce. I like getting thin pasta because it makes it less filling and rich. I really enjoyed it. The portion was good so I was able to take it home for dinner the next day which I always consider a plus.

For dessert we decided to get the tiramisu. I had never had it here before and was so happy we finally decided to try it! It was amazing and I will need to continue ordering this in the future. 

In the past we have also tried the peanut butter martini. If you like to drink your dessert then omg you have to try this! So yummy and satisfying. 

This is a must try in Las Vegas!

Every time I come here, I leave saying "why don't I come here more often?!" The menu is extensive and the prices are incredibly reasonable. 

Most recently, dined in a group of four - we ordered a large salad (Antipasto) and the arancini to share. The large salad easily had two servings per person. Both were super tasty... And we easily could have had just that for dinner - we ended up boxing up all but three bites of our entrees (equally delicious) to eat for lunch the next day. I can vouch for the Crazy Alfredo, gnocci (and vodka sauce), Pasta Puttanesca and Rigatoni Special. Yuuuum. 

Our waitress was super friendly and attentive (wish I could remember her name - sorry!) and recommended a great bottle of wine - and made no judgement about the fact that we told her we wanted to stay on the cheap side of the list.

Go, go, go!
Sit at the bar and take in the old Las Vegas vibe. Order the Arancini and the Castiglion Del Bosco Brunello. Enter heaven.

My Family and I have been visiting Nora's for a few years now and we loved the place. The way it was an old mom and pop type of place had a very appealing draw to it. Old school pizzeria with an added sit down Italian restaurant attached. Not over fancy not over bright a nice welcome relaxing place.

 It was my sons 18th Birthday and he decided to return to Nora's. But at this point they had moved to the new location. I'm not sure what I was expecting but this wasn't it.  Its way to Modern for my taste. high ceiling fancy this fancy that, It lost its down home appeal. Was not warm and inviting at all. the staff even seemed to be stuffy. 

  We ordered our apps and they came out on a timely manner, and where ok.. I think part of them sat on the pass for a it as they where warm at best.  Items you would think would come out with certain dishes we had to ask for exp. ( ordered sauce for the bread but no spoon to dish it out with.) Large salad to share yet no extra plates for the salad i guess we where suppose to use the app plates which had sauce all over them.

  After Looking over the menu we noticed there was nothing listed for kids. So we asked or sever if there was a child menu. She told us they did not have one but we could order small pasta or pizza..  Who doesn't have a kids menu?

   Our main dishes seemed to take for ever to come out. When they did again half seemed to have been held at the pass under warming lights. They where on the drying side and not as hot as they should have been. I had the Chicken parm, it was very tough and on the edge of drying out. The Breading was soft and tasted like rye bread.. The noodles that came with it
where way to al dente like the where rushing to get food out..  The food was also very lacking in flavor.. I use to love the old school tastes here, its almost as if they went to cans and boxes.
other pastas in out group where the same not cooked enough and lacking a good portion of sauce. so barley covered the noodles. 

   The staff was friendly but not warm. They where moving tables much like any other fancy place in town it become numbers not family. They have definitely lost the good old home feeling which we so liked.. 

   I doubt I will return, have had better food at Olive Garden to be honest compared to this visit..

Congratulations Nora's for stepping into the uppity fancy bland like everyone else's restaurant.

We went here for our holiday party for work and WOW! Every single dish was absolutely full of flavor.  The Caesar salad was the best I have ever had and I eat a lot of salad!  The service was impeccable, and the place itself is stunning.  I will definitely be going back!

Dollar for dollar, the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. Sometimes crowded and sometimes noisy, but mostly weekend nights. Lunch is most suitable for business. Even the bar is a fun place to sidle up to for a glass of Tuscan red. Make reservations.

I had VERY high hopes for this place when my husband and I made a reservation for Valentine's Day weekend...

I had heard great things about this restaurant and was hoping that I would finally be able to find an awesome Italian restaurant in Las Vegas... I was wrong.

Our garlic bread was pretty good as was are fried calamari, which was out to our table about 1 minute after we ordered it... which made me wonder why it was ready so fast.. Hmm...

I ordered eggplant parm and my husband had chicken parm... both were edible, but not all that amazing.  The sauce lacked any flavor whatsoever.  

I'm an Italian from New York, so I guess you could say I'm bias.  So far, the best Italian food I've had in Las Vegas has been out of my own kitchen.

This place is actually a good even for the modern man. Not your tyical on the strip vegas spot which is good beause i really dont want to meet another couple from florida named dan and cheryl. It is definatley a local spot with your once and a while pop ins from vegas show people. i was in there couple months ago and saw holly madison, thats right the bunny. I get so distracted, focus.. best place to dine is the bar side for sure. There is a old school 3 piece band which plays everything from frank to nat king cole with a rare spotting of kareoke if you get lucky. 

the food is pretty good, italian is tough from me because of my broken english family from the old country. i enjoyed there chicken plate that looks like a volcano or my aunts hair.. Goodfellas style! The appetizers are nice and everything is seasoned good. i think sometimes they get so crowded that they lose some of that love that goes into cooking. great atmosphere and great music. have fun!
Buon Appetit

We've been going to Nora's since 1994 and have never been disappointed.  Their new restaurant on Flamingo just two blocks away from the original is awesome!!  They have the same great menu and the same wonderful staff in a gorgeous new building and have added some outside patio dining as well.  If you liked the old Nora's you'll love the new one and if you've never been you really have to try it.
This is one great Italian restaurant.  Food was excellent.  Service was excellent.  I wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant for a great dining experience. It is advisable to make a reservation.

A had a few friends that recommended this place, so I decided to have my birthday lunch here. I was not impressed at all with the food. I ordered the pesto pasta with shrimp very bland and pizza with prosciutto (smelled bad). Expensive and not impressed with the food. Only thing that was delicious was the cocktail I ordered

We had a horrible experience here tonight. Our server was awful. I asked for lemon for our water twice and she never brought it. It took forever for her to take our order, and the three tables seated after us received their entrees before we did.  (We ordered two Spaghetti and one house salad- there were 3 of us.) When we mentioned that this did not seem right she told us she tried to get our food out as soon as possible. Tried? How does that make sense that all the tables seated around us after we were seated first received their entrees well before ours? Plus she brought out the salad first- which was supposed to be the entree for one of us so the other two were left waiting while one person ate their salad. Then of course the person with the salad was already finished by the time the other two even received their spaghetti. We were so irritated- it ruined the whole evening. Service was slow the entire time. We were ready and wanting to go- waiting for our check- when she brought out complimentary gelato. (We did not want dessert.) I'm sorry but free gelato and good food does not make up for terrible service. We will not be back.

I'm probably the millionth person to say that this is my favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas. I've been coming here for years and it never disappoints. The ONLY problem about this place is the wait time. So call ahead, make a reservation and have some courtesy to show up on time to enjoy one of the best meals you're going to have in your life. If there is a wait, hang out at the bar (a friend of mine, Angela, works there and is super awesome) until your table is ready. 

Once you get your bite into ANY of their food, you'll realize that the wait was worth it. Definitely try the Veal Parmigiana with Meat Sauce! The portion was huge! So it's probably better to hit up this place with a lot of your friends and family style it so you can have a dose of everyone's plate. Second, Alla Nora. Third, try a pizza (you'll be surprised). 

I'm not going to go in depth about this place because everything on the menu is honestly amazing, it just depends on what you might be craving that day. Service, impeccable. Ambiance, comfortable. Overall experience, WOW. Stop by and get a meal of a lifetime. You won't be disappointed.

We have been going to Nora's for over 10 years and never disappointed at their original place.  However, since going to the new place it is a different story.  Have been there about 6 times and only once were we completely satisfied.  The service is slow and more than once they have either not put the order in or let it sit under the lights until there was a film on my chicken marsala. No apologies, just served it and walked away.

Sad, but I doubt we will go there any more.  Wish it were different.

Have been there 3 times for business dinner and consistently good food and service.   Usually get the salmon n pasta.  Always great.   Atmosphere good and always packed.  Great place to get a great dinner or lunch.

Nora's is one of those places where I step inside and forget I'm in Vegas.  The house combinations are flavorful.  Comfort foods with portions that are oversized.  The tiramisu which is too often a let down at Italian restaurants; hits a high note and resonates here.  My only complaint is that there is no proscuttio e melone on the menu.
Great service and food!  Love it for date night!

We were in the area and Nora's was the only nice bar in the area.

When we walked in, there was a hostess and server in the front.  The hostess was working on the computer and the server was counting out her tips.  They both completely ignored us even though we were right in front of them.  It was kind of awkward how long the ignored us for.

We were asked to be seated outside because the weather was perfect.  We really liked the patio area - it's really nicely built.  The chairs were comfy for outdoor seating too.

I had a draft beer and wife had a cocktail from the menu.  It ended up being $20 for the two drinks.  I thought it was a bit over priced for a neighborhood restaurant for two drinks.

Being from the east coast, I expect my pasta to be homemade and the mozzarella to be fresh...Not at Nora's! Food is average at best! On par with Maggianos or Brios. The only reason I gave it three stars was for the bar.

Our experience at Nora's is always different. Consistency is the issue. My husband and I normally go to the bar and have a beverage and dinner. Michele is a great bartender. Always on top of things. The 2 male bartenders can't keep up and will walk past an empty glass or empty bread basket until you ask. I specifically asked if I could get a dish with marinara sauce instead of meat sauce and he assured me I could. Came out with meat sauce. He offered to change it but meanwhile my husbands dinner gets cold. The food is normally very good no complaints about food!
This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in Las Vegas.  So far everything we've tried was good and would recommend this to anyone.

So far this is one of our favorite Italian restaurants that we have found in Vegas.  My husband loves the Scampi: huge prawns in a lemony garlic butter sauce.  Establishment appears to be a locals hangout....excellent service...I would definitely recommend reaervations.....solid memorable dinner!

Nora's is probably my favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas. It caters to an older crowd but the decor is very modern and sophisticated. There's always a wait so either snag a set at the bar or make reservations. 

I've come here multiple times and get pasta every time. Their penne with vodka sauce is delicious and creamy. The pesto is very rich but a whole bowl of it can be too much. Their wild boar perpedelle is also wonderful but sometimes can be on the saltier side. 

My favorites are the pasta all Nora ( basically spaghetti bolognese with eggplant) and their rigatoni special but I sub the tomato sauce with vodka sauce for a creamier richer taste.   

They also offer complimentary garlic bread to go with your meal and the garlic bread is delicious. Sometimes I'm guilty of filling up on that too quickly but thats ok because I'll have leftover pasta for the next day!

This place is pricey, classy, and so dang delicious! Probably my favorite Italian place I've been to put in Vegas so far. It's filled with business men and brunching women so me and my tattooed friend felt a little out of place but that didn't stop us. We had a glass of moscato each, the steak bruschetta (SO AMAZING) and we split a pasta. Our bill came to around $60. 

Our server was a little strange. We asked to change the sauce on our pasta to a vodka sauce and he kind of just said "well I like it the way it is but I guess whatever you want". We thought that was weird because we're both servers and we would never say something like that it comes off judgmental and what's it to you?! Then we asked him to split the pasta in two plates if possible and he made us feel we were asking too much. We said if it's too late no worries but if not it would be easier. He comes back and says "well the kitchen yelled at me but here you go". Again as servers WE WOULD NEVER SAY THAT. Why would you try to make the guest feel bad especially at a higher end spot like this where you're going to have pickier eaters. Maybe he was having an off day. Me and my friend ended up laughing about it but it was uncomfortable. 

Overall the food is worth the shitty (hopefully one time) service. Maybe it was because he didn't think we would tip since we didn't appear like his usual clientele. Never judge!

Food is good. Ordered the steak and arugula bruschetta to start and the taste was pretty bland, so skip that. For main course I got the linguine with red clam sauce, which was ok. Not enough clam taste, nor was it spicy enough. Friend got the chicken marsala, which was good. Maybe a little to sweet, but that's just my personal preference. Good service from Travis. He looked tired, but was very polite and always checked to make sure we were ok. Will definitely come back to try other dishes.
Excellent Italian restaurant!  I highly recommend, but be prepared to wait or make reservations.  All items ordered were outstanding.

Um so this is by far some of the best Italian food in Vegas. After the first bite of lasagna I almost cried about the amazing flavor. This is becoming a go to place for lunch for our team at work. We will definitely be back. Between myself and my coworkers we have tried a lot of what is offered on the menu. Another key feature is the bread, trust me you won't be able to get enough. The service is always friendly and fantastic.

What are people talking about with this place? We were looking for a yummy alternative to the overpriced and/or overrated restaurants on the Strip and thought yelp would steer us in the right direction...not this time. The menu looked appealing and the wait staff were very nice. Unfortunately, the food left something to be desired. I had the tortellini with vodka sauce, My Darling had the chicken marsala, and our friend had the capellini arabbiata. The pasta was not al dente nor was it properly drained which caused the sauce to be watery. My pasta verged on the soggy...the wine choices and prices were pretty good though. While the food was supposed to be "home-style" and not haute cuisine, it was still lacking because the flavors and quality were not there. Generally, the only thing that was noteworthy about the food was that the prices were reasonable. 

This place takes cards. There is plenty of parking in the lot.

Tried multiple pastas and pizzas.
Every single pizza that they make, it tastes great, flavorful, nothing to complain.
Their complimentary garlic bread is amazing, do request for cheese on the top for extra, it will make it even better.
But I am not really a big fan of pasta that they give us. Seafood pasta - I am not a big fan of seafood, happened to try that because my girlfriend loves seafood, she said that it was good. 
Gorgonzola & Mushroom pasta (forgot the name sorry) was really unique in flavor, it was really flavorful with interesting tastes. 
Chicken parmagiana - Chicken was really tasty, I don't know if it was not supposed to be crispy for the chicken part, but what threw me off for this pasta is, it is not really flavorful, no tastes into the pasta by itself, it was very plain in my opinion. Tomato sauce was not very special at all, I felt that it tastes like a spaghetti sauce that you maybe able to get at Walmart. I guess I just chose the wrong menu. 

If I include everything to rate this place based upon my experience, I would still give 5 stars, great atmosphere with amazing staffs. Just needed to choose the right menu. Price is reasonable too, so I would definitely come back to this place every time I am into Italian Food.

I didn't see my MIL and GIL on my birthday so they wanted to take me out to a belated birthday dinner. I have had this bookmarked for quite a while. 

We were given a basket of garlic bread while we wait for our order. MM! I am a garlic freak so I was taking the garlic off everyone else's slices since they like it light on garlic. You can also request plain toasted if you don't do garlic. 

The BF had cheese ravioli w/ alfredo- the raviolis are fresh made in house and were very good (I took a bite of course, tee hee) and the sauce was thick and had good flavor. 

Mom had the lasagna- she's been wanted lasagna for weeks and she was very happy with it here. It had little sausage bites in it instead of just meat sauce and cheese. She's a light eater normally, but she tore into that! 

Grandma had spaghetti and meatballs- she liked the meatballs here a lot and they did look quite good. 

I had the chicken mt etna- it wasn't bad, but I think I ordered the wrong thing. The individual components were good- chicken with peppers and cheese and balsamic together was nice and chicken was juicy, the onion strings were crisp and the seasoning was great, roasted potatoes good. There was angel hair that was crisp to like a uncooked top ramen consistency which is a bit odd and between all these layers was a bit much. I ate the onion strings and some of the chicken. I can see some people really liking this type of stuff (I ordered it based on the Yelp summary on top of it being mentioned in reviews), but to me it's the classics here that are standouts and can't steer wrong with a solid plate of pasta.

I ended up asking for a side of linguini with vodka sauce. I'm so glad I did because it really changed my dinner. The sauce was superb and close to the vodka sauce at my favorite Italian place in LA I've been going to since I was a kid. I got my bread and wiped that bowl clean! The BF tried some and he is now saying we are going back for some of that! 

The quality, taste,portion to price ratio is fantastic here. Most pasta dishes were around $9-11 with specialties in the $14-20 range with a few meat specialties from $22-30. That's like Olive Garden prices and leaps better. Very reasonable compared to a lot of other Italian places in town. $60 +tip for 5 dishes and drinks is not bad at all! 

Our server was very attentive, personable and polite throughout. He kept checking in without being obtrusive to dinner conversation, filled drinks half full, had good pacing for boxes and check that we didn't wait for any need. We ended up chatting with him and he's actually a busser who they sometimes let serve. Casey should be a server as that's some seriously great service!  Way better than some of these seasoned jokes around town. He gave me a tiramisu even to top off the  birthday dinner (for those curious- pretty good, heavy on the coffee notes so a dessert for those who love their coffee). 

Despite what I ordered originally, this place is great for the classics and service is great. Definitely coming back and sad I haven't tried it sooner.

Best Italian cuisine I've ever experienced. Very elegant and very fancy. Thanks a lot to the General Managers daughter Ele for telling me about Nora's. Amazing and divine wine, and one of the most jazziest music I've ever heard. Also thanks for the food that was not even on the menu.

First timer here and a non-local. Location is in a small stip mall, fairly large restaurant. Greeted and seated very quickly as I was eating alone. (I think they may prefer reservations because they do seem to have a lot of clientele). Obviously I chose this restaurant due to a yelp search, yet it was the garlic bread pictures that won me over was looking for something traditional versus garlic knots. Only ordered a glass of malbec wine $10 and a house salad $8 and Arancini $8. Food came out quickly, literally 5 minutes. Yet I didn't receive my complimentary garlic bread for a bit, asked a waiter about it and then got it. Salad was very good and fresh tasting, not even a huge fan of tomatoes yet they were very ripe. The House Italian dressing was very tasty. The garlic bread was definitely just what I wanted, very buttery and tons of garlic on it. Can never have too much garlic in my opinion. The Arancini was flavorful but I do think maybe it could have  been a little warmer/hotter, and possibly deep fried just a touch more so that when they are laid over the tomato sauce they wont get soggy as quickly. They were slightly breaking open due to them absorbing the tomato sauce liquid. The server suggested a Malbec wine, it was indeed a very good choice. They staff was always around to take care of your needs. Would definitely come back if I'm near in the future.

We will absolutely be coming here every time we visit Vegas now. 
The bread and olives provided were amazing. (I ate all of the olives myself. Once I started I couldn't stop). We had a caprese salad as a starter which wasn't exactly to my taste but that's fine. It was something new that I was trying. Then I had the spinach white pizza for my main course. It was incredible. The waiter was so helpful and guided me to the correct wine choice for myself. Then at the end of the meal he surprised me with a desert that I loved as well(: I left fat and happy. I can't wait to go back.

Mix of about average food.  Pasta isn't fresh, they buy it from somewhere.  The tiramisu was very good.  Friendly servers though slow. Not worth going out of your way for, and good luck finding a cab to get out of there.

Awesome food, VERY difficult to get in to. Generally when I get home on Friday night at 6:00pm, we still have to wait until 8:30 to get a table. However, definitely worth it. Last time I had baked rigatoni something or other- ah-mazing. And the canolis...mmm.

We went here with a large party on New Year's eve and it was awesome.  I appreciated that they had their regular menu for New Years too. They even had some party favors.  The steak florentine was to die for.  Not a lot of restaurants know how to make it and they really hit the mark.  The service was exceptional!

Granted everyone loves Nora's. I wasn't impressed. We were seated immediately and received some menus. Our drinks were brought right away and our sever was very informative and helpful about answering questions had we needed to ask any about the menu. I decided on lasagna and I convinced my boyfriend to try the crazy Alfredo because everyone raves it was crazy good. Also because it has three different type of meat in it. We were brought some garlic bread but it had a weird taste to it. The garlic part tastes good but the bread had a off putting inedible taste I did not stand to eat. Our food took a while in my opinion but they were making it to order (I believe?) so I didn't really mind. We were brought our pastas and after being so excited I was quickly let down yet again. My lasagna had an overwhelming taste of basil. The crazy Alfredo was not to my liking. I thought I would like it but prefer a classic Alfredo instead. My boyfriend finished the entire plate of Alfredo which means he loves it and doesn't even like Italian food unless it's seafood. The meatballs I ordered in addition to my lasagna because I was unsure if it came with meat because the menu didn't state of it did or not, we're tender and flavorful and I did enjoy the one that I ate. I would give this place another chance and order something else. I just wasn't impressed with what we ordered but the service was great and the fact he ate the entire bowl says a lot. I'll be back with an updated review.

So we made last minute reservations for 7 p.m.  When we arrived the place is just the right size for a small family owned type restaurant.  We were sat right on time and our server from the get go was FANTASTIC!  The selection on the menu was great and so were the prices.  We started with calamari and it was so good.  Their sauce that they make to go with it was perfect as well (not just your typical marinara sauce that most restaurants use).  Their small basket of garlic bread was to die for.  My dad ordered a veal chop that was butterflied with the bone on.  THIS THING WAS HUGE!!!!!!!!!!! I ordered a linguinni in pesto cream sauce with shrimp and pine nuts. It was a little rich for me but was incredibly delicious.  We did try a tiramisu for dessert and I'm very picky about that particular dessert but it was home made and I think most people would really like it, I didn't care for it though.  

My overall experience is DEFINITELY 5 stars and I'd go back any time.  It's a GREAT place for some good upscale home made italian food.  Just don't forget your reservations cause they are very busy.

I'm not sure if I had really good Italian food before but this restaurant was just okay to me. I felt like their garlic bread could have been frozen before because I could probably find bread like that in the grocery store. From all the great reviews, I was expecting freshly made bread with a rustic outer layer that you see all the top Italian restaurants have. I ordered the crazy fettucini that had everything in it. A little too much going on there. The pizza was good. Nothing will beat the East Coast. It was super dead and I was expecting the restaurant to be super busy! If you sign up for their e-club you get a free appetizer and dessert which is awesome! Our server looked like she was having a bad day on top of this. Maybe it was just bad timing. I'll definitely give it another try but not anytime soon.

Quick update... Nora's is still amazing. Just got some dinner tonight and had to update you all on how amazing Nora's is. Have had Nora's almost every week since I first tried it on my birthday in August. No, I'm not exaggerating... literally almost every week.
If you haven't stopped in Nora's yet or if you live in the area and haven't had takeout yet... make sure you do.

Overall, my experience at Nora's was solid, and I plan on returning. A little detail, and I'll start with weaknesses because they were (in my opinion) not deal breakers: 
-The hostess who sat us was kind of a brat. I don't want to say she was rude, because she wasn't necessarily rude.. They were super busy, so maybe she was just in the midst of something frustrating. Anyway, her attitude just came off as bratty. 
-I thought our waiter was going to be the same because of how he answered a question I asked regarding a menu item, but he ended up warming up to us (once the rush died down).
-The layout is NOT ideal. It is crowded and busy. We ended up getting completely blocked in because they had to put a couple tables together to seat a large group, so that was a little frustrating for us and for our waiter. (They are moving soon, so I am assuming this won't be an issue once they move.)
-It took a while for our food (~40 minutes for baked rigatoni and chicken parm). As with all of the above, I figure this was because of how busy they were (we were there at 8 pm on a Sunday, btw--we were glad we made a reservation!)
Like I mentioned, none of those are deal breakers for me, but they are the reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 this time around. 
Now for the good.... THE FOOD OMG. The garlic bread was awesome. The chicken parm was good my husband loved it, I'm just not a big fan, as the chicken doesn't typically have a lot of flavor and I'm weird like that). The baked rigatoni was fantastic. The meat sauce was just like I remember growing up with Italian family--you could tell that it was cooked right, because it had that brownish color that a good meat sauce gets. The ricotta on top of the rigatoni was AMAZING. Just good, good food. 
We are excited to return once they move locations (honestly, maybe even before that).

Will absolutely be back. Highly recommend!

Called midweek for a same day reservation. They said 9pm was the earliest. We showed up 30 minutes early and they sat us promptly. 5 star 

Didn't care for my table that much. It was a small 2 person table against the wall crammed next to a stage. But we had a table, and the place was packed.. walk ins were being told long wait times, so I cant complain. In the future I might request not having that table again.  4 star

Wine list was solid and sure to have something for most people though I wish it had a few more options in the 100-200 range. 4 star

After I ordered a bottle of amarone it arrived with a decanter and the waiter proceeded to open it. What shocked me was the battery powered aerator that was used during the pour from the bottle to the decanter. Our first course was tomato bruschetta. The nice thing about mid age armarone for me is the way it opens up over the meal. The acidity would have paired perfect with the ripe tomatoes, and later on, after it sat for 30 minutes in the decanter, it would have opened up perfectly for the main courses. I didn't get to enjoy that experience. What I got was a wine that tasted like it had just been through a blender. 2 star

Tomato Bruschetta was decent, but I wasn't a huge fan. The baguette was fresh but had been soaked in way to much olive oil. The tomatoes were cut too large to eat on a baguette without falling off and I never got the flavor of garlic, basil and pepper. Not to say there wasn't any but for me it was bland. On the positive side my girlfriend highly enjoyed the generous portion of tomatoes, almost twice as much as you would normally see on this type of dish. 3 star

For the main I ordered the crazy alfredo and it was amazing. Packed with mushrooms and peppers.. pasta just right... topped with awesome shrimp... the sauce was perfect! This dish is divine. 5 star

She had the spaghetti and meat balls. The meatballs were enormous and very good but the noodles were served soft. In an Italian restaurant, we were expecting al dente. It wasn't spaghetti either, it was more like spaghettini. Overall a decent dish but I had higher hopes. 4 star

We pre ordered the souffle for dessert. NOM NOM 5 star

It was so good it has inspired me to create my own yelp award. I will call it the Nom Nom award and reserve it for dishes that are so good they make you slow down when eating... enjoying the moment while making cavman like noises with your partner in between the omg this is so freaking good stares you share. Yea, its that good.This dessert is 5 star plus and wins my first nom nom award.

Service was excellent. Staff was busy but not stressed out, everyone was happy. With a full house and a line almost out the door this is a rare combination. Our waiter was prompt, friendly and serviced the table properly. Our wine and water stayed full and the table was kept neat by the busser. 5 star


Over all a solid 4 with potential for more when I go back and sample their pizzas and other offerings.
Bleu Cheese Stuffed Olive Dirty Martini.  Arancini.  Crazy Alfredo.  This place is one of my all time favorites.  I always make time to visit when I'm in Vegas.  Great service.

I've been seeing this place come up over and over again on Yelp. We finally decided to give it a little taste.

First of all, make reservations. This place is a madhouse on a weekend night. 
Secondly, prepare to wait awhile if you don't. 

We were starving after driving and waiting for an hour. So you'd think everything would be amazing. Eh, it wasn't. 

The service was bad. Not horrible, just way under good. We could barely get her to stay at the table without her wanting to walk away when we'd tell her one thing. So that was sad. 

We had --

The risotto balls. I don't know the actual name. They were...meh. Really cheesy. But the marinara was delightful. 
Spaghetti with meatballs and marinara. Meh. The marinara was delightful...hahahahaha. 
The crazy Alfredo. Meh. I don't know. Nothing about it stood out. 

I will say this -- the pasta itself is super good. Like, excellent good. 

We also had some really good Malbec. For the full bodied, non sweet wine lovers, try Amancaya. 

This is the highest rated Italian joint in town. I don't agree.

I love the new location. They did an amazing job with the decor and the floor plan. The bar area is beautiful. I can't wait for the upstairs to open in a few weeks which will consist of a lounge and private dining. The food is the same incredible food as the old location. Congrats to Marcelo and his family. You did a great job

My friend and I came here after numerous people told us how great it was. They were packed so we decided to sit at the bar. The bartenders were super nice and welcoming. Rudy described to us a couple of his signature cocktails and we decided on the lemon thyme cocktail and a mango lemon gin cocktail. Next Rudy helped us pick our entree's and told us about a chicken piccata that wasn't even on the menu! So I got the chicken piccata and my friend got the chicken carciofi. Both dishes were amazing. We asked Ryan about the desserts they hand and he informed us that the cheesecake is made locally and was amazing, so we ordered that and he did not lie! I asked for some extra strawberry sauce and instead Rudy hand cut fresh strawberries for us! Over all Rudy and Ryan made the visit amazing! The food, the cocktails and dessert was beyond exceptional. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone!

Parking is not ample at all! Had to park down the street. Made reservations for 6:00pm and told to wait for a table! This place needs to get there act together! I know the food is good but for my sweethearts birthday I should have picked another place. She and I came ready to eat! Not ready to wait!

Underwhelming Italian restaurant. When I looked at the menu and the mid-range prices, I expected a cozy little gem. It is neither cozy nor gemmy. The atmosphere is as lackluster as the servers and food.

Rigatoni was highly recommended (over the lasagna) by the server. Pasta was chewy and dry due to the scant amount of sauce. As much as I love garlic, it's way over used...to the point of drowning out the flavors of any other spices or the meat. The ricotta survived the garlic tsunami only because it was in volcanic-sized dollops.

At $21 a person, for pasta and a beverage (no cocktails), I fail to understand the rave reviews. There are numerous and far better options in Vegas, several in that vicinity.

LOCAL HOT SPOT IN CRAZY VEGAS...... We're not touristy eaters. We always look for a place where locals go and thankfully we found Nora's. It's a short drive from the strip and worth it. We knew we were in the right place as soon as we walked in. The aromas and the live jazz music put a huge smile on my face. We shared Mussels Arrabiata (fantastic and spicy), my hubby had eggplant Parm and I had the Frutti di Mare. Now, as a native New Yorker and having been raised eating italian food I must tell you that this is the best Italian cooking west of NY and my Pops cooking that I have had. For me, our dinner at Nora's was a trip back home. The jazz music was awesome. It really did make a wonderful dinner - perfect. The wait staff was friendly, informative and attentive. They have a full bar with specialty cocktails - and a great Mixologist. I  wish we had a place like Noras in Sacramento. It's like having dinner with family.

First of all, they do take reservations online which I highly encourage to do. The restaurant was very busy even though it was a Wednesday night.
Jessika was our server and she gave great service. She didn't make us feel rushed when we took forever and a day to look at the menu. She was very informative when explaining the menu and was very friendly despite how busy it was and how busy she clearly was. 
As a starter we ordered the pork belly. It was tender and melted in our mouths, however the edges were a bit burnt so it would have been perfect without the burnt parts.
As the entree I ordered the crazy alfredo but I asked to substituted the pasta for angel hair pasta. My dish was delicious, the only thing I wished was that I rememebered to ask to have it without the jalapenos. The shrimp portion was generous and I enjoyed the creamy sauce.
My husband ordered the rib eye. The first parts of the steak was cooked medium well rather than the medium rare he had asked for, but as he continued down the rib eye it was cooked more toward his liking. His rib eye came with truffle fries, which were mostly eaten by me, haha.
We had to get our food taken to go. Jessika did mention that the portions were fairly large, but when she said that I didn't know she meant it was enough for 3 meals. No complaints though. It means no cooking the day after which is always a plus for me.
For dessert we had the chocolate lava cake with some kind of pistachio sauce. The center was perfectly gooey and went deliciously with the sauce.
The reason why I put 4 stars for this experience however is because the section we were put in was with large parties and they were really loud. I felt like I was yelling so my husband can hear me talking. When we come again, I will remember to make a note on my reservation if we can be in a quieter spot in the restaurant.

Easy 5 stars...why?

Not only is it the best Italian I have had, it's also one of the best priced meals that I have enjoyed.

Atmosphere is nice enough for date night, but not too formal, where you have to get dressy or feel like you are going to break the bank.  Service was very friendly, and attentive...couldn't have asked for a better server.  Went with a good bottle of wine that the waitress recommended as well...win!

On to the food!

Garlic bread is good...very garlicy garlic bread lol.  It was good, but not mind blowing like some have said.  But good garlic bread nonetheless.

Started with the shrimp scampi...very good...wish the shrimp was seared a little more, but very tender and  the sauce was yum.  This was more expensive than both of the entress lol.

We went with the lasagna and the ziti...not only were they the best I have had, but they were both about $10 a plate!  Not even Olive Garden is that cheap...and OG is like Mcdonalds compared to the taste explosion that is Noras.  I don't know what they put in this food at Noras, but I am still thinking about it days later.  Portions were generous as well.  

And lastly, tiramisu for dessert....very good.  Seems like you can't go wrong here.

I am actually looking forward to visiting again...I'd like to try some more of their seafood options!

If you are craving Italian, don't burn 3 times the amount of money anywhere near the strip...it is worth the drive or cab fare...believe it.

Food was good (Baked rigatoni, cheesy yum. Soggy garlic bread, eh). Our server was on top of things and very attentive. The only thing that rubbed me the wrong way was was the hostess. When I told her we didn't have a reservation she kind of got an attitude. Granted we arrived at 6 pm on a Friday night, but still... The place was EMPTY when we walked in. She told us since we had no reservation we could sit at a tiny table next to the pizza oven area or a hightop table next to a stage. We opted for the stage table and luckily, no band played while we were there. Even though they got busier while we were there, there were still plenty of tables, and no need to be treated like we couldn't be served due to no reservation. After my husband talked me into not walking out, we enjoyed a nice meal and a really nice server. While nothing completely blew me away, (Let's face it, Vegas is not known for its Italian food) the food, price, and our server were good enough that I might go back again. AND, I'll even be sure to make a reservation.

GREAT Italian place in Vegas!! Food is good and pricing is alright too. A little above average price BUT it's worth it. Ambience is your normal Italian place which is somewhat a formal look BUT a nice place to just hangout and chill with good food.
Amazing italian food! I keep coming back to this place, because I can't get enough. The service is great, and never waited long to get a seat. I am a very pleased customer.

Want to have a wonderful dinner in Las Vegas and not spend hundreds of dollars?? Well this is the prefect spot for this!! I came here to meet some friends (they have five years coming to this restaurant) We made reservations earlier that day and the place was so busy that we had to wait 20 minutes. We waited in the bar and had some mojitos. 
The staff at this place is good and professional. When we got to our table I scan the menu and get really surprised because of the prices. We ordered an "Anabella" wine bottle (I really recommend  it of you are looking for a wine suggestion). We ordered the small  antipasto salad to share. It worked perfect for 4 people; the portions are generous. 
We also got a medium pizza to share. It was delicious!! Crispy and with a lot of meat! For main dish I had the chicken parmesean. It was super yummy. The chicken came with a side order of pasta and marinara sauce. Everything was really good. I couldn't eat all the pasta because I had to safe some room for a Tiramisú .  Tiramisú is my favorite dessert and I loved it in this place.
Nora's is a great establishment that provides great Italian food if you happen to be in Vegas, I had Chicken Alfredo which was great! The have a huge menu with many choices to please everyone.

Awesome.  My new favorite Italian place, with Chicago Joe's and Casa di Amore tied for a close second.  This place has the atmospere that many of the larger chains try so hard to achieve.  The in-house jazz band cranks out standards on specific nights of the week, but I'm not sure which nights they play.  Live music, great food and a friendly staff = A++

By far the best Italian restaurant I've been to in a long time.  This place is great.  The service was perfect the food was amazing.  We loved the set up of the restaurant, ambiance and location.  It's conveniently located right off of Flamingo and Lindell with ample parking even for the busy Friday night that we went.   We were a little discouraged when we saw a lot of open seats and they said it may be 45-60 mins to be seated.  It only took 15 tho so no worries there.  They offer barside seating, huge dining rooms and a few private rooms.  Very cool.  As soon as your seated you'll receive some breadsticks (amazing).  Then we got our drinks (Stella, iced tea, water and wine with dinner).  We proceeded to get Pork loin, Salmon and some pasta.  Everything was great.  Everyone in our group enjoyed it thoroughly and we will definitely be back.

I think dinner was pretty good - we got the Crazy Alfredo and the Spaghetti with meat sauce. The spaghetti with meat sauce wasn't good at all, probably the least special out of all of the restaurants I've been in.

The crazy Alfredo was delicious and I highly recommend it. But I won't be back as service was terrible and it took us about 40 minutes to get our meal, and a good 15 just to get our bread. 

Then it took another 10 to pay for our meal so overall... what would have been a solid 4.5 turned into a 3.

This place is a little gem in a strip mall! Don't be fooled by the outside, go inside and you'll be impressed. The food is awesome! Best pizza in town! I love the house salad, as well as the antipasto salad.
Try the Gorgonzola ribeye sandwich, it's great!

This is hands down my favorite locals spot for Italian!..everything is delicious and very reasonably priced!..I def recommend the Snow White pizza and the chocolate lava cake but you have to order it in advance as it take awhile to come out cuz it's made to order

Ambiance is awesome. Service is phenomenal. The food was above average for me but I feel like I may have ordered wrong. I got the rib eye steak with truffle fries. I sent back the fries for being too salty... which for me is nuts because I love salt. The steak was perfect but a little heavy on the char in places. The crazy alfredo is one of their specialities but it is not great. The pasta was perfectly cooked but the combinations in this dish are not complimentary. Again, I will give it another chance because I feel like I have to try the other things on the menu.
Snow White pizza with Alfredo sauce so good. You have to add the Alfredo it doesn't come that way ..

Worth the wait! Wonderful vibe. Great staff. It was crowed but like I said worth the wait...Had the chicken Alferdo and my cousin had angel hair with pesto.  I definitely recommend this spot if you're in sin city!

Me and a few family members went here for lunch based on a friend's recommendation. The service was ungodly slow. They were good about serving drinks and bussing, but it took about 15-20 minutes before we finally got waited on. We didn't receive our meals until about 35-45 minutes later. UNACCEPTABLE! 
The Rigatoni was undercooked, the Lasagna seemed to be overcooked and tasted like canned Ravioli, and the Chicken Milanese was rubbery and lacked flavor. I had the Veal Scaloppini which was good, however the Spaghetti noodles were not Al Dente. That long of a wait and the food wasn't even cooked right?!?!?!? I'm sorry Noras but you really dropped the ball today. Hopefully you can learn from this and improve your food and service.

I swear, people have the most disgusting palates in Vegas.

I ordered the "Crazy" Alfredo (advertised as a "favorite").  Crazy is right.  Expired chicken, overcooked rubbery shrimp, and it all tasted like it was cooked the previous week, stored, and microwaved for service.
My wife ordered spaghetti with meat sauce.  How can you screw that up?  I don't know how you can, but Nora's did.  The sauce was watery and the meat chunks so small it can literally be drunk and not chewed.

Seriously, my wife almost went across the street to Smiths to pick up a bottle of Progresso to put on hers.

I tried this place once about a year ago and figured I'd give it one more chance.  Never again.

This place seriously needs Gordon Ramsay to do his Kitchen Nightmares show.  It screams outdated, lack of standards, and absolutely disgusting food.

There was one semi-redeeming quality - the store bought bread they served was loaded with roasted garlic.  That was pretty decent.

Food is great! Portions got a lot smaller pasta is not that expensive!!! And service is soo slow and almost painful!!! Customer service is very below par!!! New place would be great if you changed these things.
Great food and service! Had a date night and the menu is very reasonably priced and our waiter Dayton was very friendly and professional. Will be coming back for many more date nights.
Best Mom & Pops Italian Place in Town.  I've been going here from about 7 yrs or so...The Best Garlic Bread...Rib Eye Steak for great price.

Excellent food. The pizza was great with a nice crust and the cheese was amazing. We got the salami with a antipasto salad. The dressing on the salad was one of the best vinaigrette's I have had. Would definitely go back especially to try their pasta dishes which I saw being served to other tables and looked amazing.

Nora's is one of those restaurants that you never forget.  I went with a friend while visiting Vegas from a recommendation from a valet at our hotel.  We wanted a locals place with good Italian food and Nora's blew us out beyond our expectations.

For starters we had an antipasto and minestrone soup.  Both were delicious.

For my entre I had veal scallopini, which was tender and delicious.  I love garlic and Nora's knows how to use it properly, not overwhelming, but definitely there to enhance the true flavors of the veal.

The ambiance and friendliness of the servers made the experience totally enjoyable.  I highly recommend this restaurant to any visitors who want to get off the strip with it's exhorbitantly pricey restaruants and experience the way Vegas really is.  Down home and offering quality restaurants at reasonable prices.

What a find! We really enjoyed dining at Nora's. We had a few appetizers and a few entrees. We had the Calamari Fritti and Arancini for appetizers. Both were delicious. Eating the Arancini with the basil leaf was yummy. As for the entree, we had the Frutti di Mare, Fettuccine Carbonara, Chicken Parmigiana, and Grilled Branzino. All of the entrees were great. Suprised that the grilled branzino comes in as the whole fish; which is an added bonus. There Frutti di Mare was one of best I had. After chatting with our waiter, Sebastian, who by the way was pretty awesome; made the dining more lively. He was very attentive and accommodating. I would definitely and highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a wonderful Italian dining experience outside the Las Vegas Strip.

Made reservations here for Sunday,
Early dinner which I highly highly recommend ... 5:30pm. Every time I have dined here later than 6:30pm,  it is always extremely packed and there's usually a line out the door (people literally waiting in the parking lot). The parking lot is difficult to park at peak hours.
