The food is always delicious. There were four of us and we split the large house salad ("serves 4-6 people"). I had an appetizer "Bruschetta Al Pomodoro
with tomatoes, fresh herbs, olive oil ADD steak for my entree!!!! Yummy. 

The bill for four of us came to (with four glasses of wine) $125. Not bad, I shall return.

They moved to the new building close by. we were trying to order to go but PHONE doesn't work! PHONE doesn't work! PHONE doesn't work!! when we spent 30 mins to drive there the hostess told us the wait time for to go is 45 mins, if your phone was working our wait time could be 0 min. I would think the first thing you do when you change location is to be sure customer can reach you by phone and the new address? NOPE. Neither on their website or Yelp.
Excellent food great service will definitely recommend it to friends I will bring my guest from out of town here

My girlfriend and I visited Nora's for my birthday dinner and I found the food to be "wanting". We began our night with the Arancini and in all fairness they were outstanding! The main courses were only mediocre at best. I had the veal marsala, which the meat was over cooked and the wine mushroom glaze while providing excellent initial taste had a horrible bitter finish. My girlfriend had the Frutti De Mare which the pasta and sauce were very well done but the seafood was cooked too long which resulted in rubberized morsels. Overall it must have been an off night, I will go back again, but was not impressed with my first time going. On a side note the wait staff was top notch and very attentive.

Took my wife here for a nice date and couldn't have been more pleased! The atmosphere was great, food was great, and the price wasn't bad. If you like italian food and a cozy landscape, this is the place :)

A step up from your normal Italian restaurants like OG with home town Italian flavors and pastas.  The ambiance makes you feel like you're back at grandma's house with the rest of the family on a Tuscany countryside.  We had several different dishes and all were very tasty considering I'm not a pasta guy.  Def a step up from commercialize Italian restaurants, but not as pricey as Maggiano's.  Why only 4 stars... The cocktails were good but small in size and the desserts were ok to good at best.  Would recommend making reservations like we did unless you like waiting for 30 mins to an hour at least.

Must try...was craving Italian food and wanted to find a place outside the strip before flying out... what a great find... amazing decor... great staff and even better great food for the price... everything we had there was cooked to perfection... the kids loved it as well... when we are back in Vegas will definitely going back to this place

I can't believe that it finally took me till last week to try this place. This might be the best hidden gem in the valley.

Listen.....just get the Spaghetti Alla Nora and thank me later.

I'm out...back to enjoy that pasta.

I've been wanting to try this place for years.  In fact I went with a friend who has been several times and highly recommend Nora's.

I finally went and to say the service was 'meh' would be an understatement at best.  I'm not one for negative reviews unless the experience was really impacted, but in this case it was.  It was birthday dinner and the server brought me a piece of tiramisu after the lackluster pizza with no cheese that she didn't mention.  I thought well at least this is nice, a birthday desert.  She literally tosses the plate on the table, my mouth opens to say thanks, and she abruptly turns and meanders away.  The entire night was the same, ok food, unattentive service, not really pleased I wasted a birthday dinner with family and friends here.  Better places in Vegas where the servers actually look you in the eye and spend more than 10 secons at your table.

My friend who has been several times even commented on how off the service was.  Shame.

Soon as i walked in... i was excited to start grubbin! Just by looking at the place you can tell its a REAL italian restaurant plus they had a check-in offer for free sangria!

First came the garlic bread. The garlic bread was just how garlic bread should be... crispy, buttery, and full of garlic! it was soo good we ordered another (the 1st garlic bread is free then $1.50 for each additional). 

For appetizers, we ordered the Steak & Arugula Bruschetta which was a good change from the usual tomato version. It had thin cuts of steak with arugula & vinaigrette on top of french bread.
 
But the reason for the 3 stars is because of the entrees.
K.L. had ordered the Linguini & Clams which were so bland! Surprising since the bread was so flavorful.
I had ordered the Gnocchi with Vodka Sauce, which was so much better than the linguini, but i probably would not order again.

The service was great and the place did get slammed right after we walked in so i would like to give Nora's another try... and another free sangria.

I'm the type of person that when I go somewhere and they have something good, I stick to that item. My girlfriend has taken me here for my birthday for the third consecutive year and for the first two I've always gotten the shrimp scampi with linguini. Which in my opinion, may be the best in town. For my last birthday I decided to switch it up(not entirely sure why) so I got the wild boar pappardelle and I must say it was probably the best meal of my entire life. Hands down!! It was so well balanced I couldn't understand it. Noodles were perfectly cooked, boar was so tender and not dry. Honestly I haven't stopped thinking about it for the past 9 days! Well done!

The atmosphere is cozy, got here around 5:45pm and were seated immediately. Christmas theme but not over the top, very classy. Food was amazing, starting with the garlic bread. Yum! I had the "Crazy Alfredo" and it was delicious. She got the vegetarian white sauce pizza and really liked it. Coffee was good, they gave us cups to go. The server was really busy but they had back up people so we were rarely waiting for more than a minute or two. The only reason I don't give 5 stars is because the parking is horrible. They share a lot with several places and we had to drives round the lot a few times to find a spot.

This is now my new favorite Italian restaurant. Every dish we had here was amazing!!!! The bruschetta appetizer was great (even better if you put balsamic vinegar on it). We got 1 free basket of delicious garlic bread. My main course was the Alla Nora and it was incredibly flavorful. It was spaghetti meets eggplant parmigiana. The meatballs were perfect! The gnocchi with Alfredo sauce and chicken was on point. The bathrooms were super clean too which is a big deal for me!

Las Vegas Review Part II of the "Losing Money, Spending Money and General Hubby Eating Freebies Back At Home Tour".

Friday night in Vegas, it was my mom's choice for dinner and she is a Vegas local, so of course she didn't want to hit the strip, or have a buffet, or deal with the traffic and valet at the hotels.  

Nora's Cuisine is a mid-size local Italian restaurant, that appears to be popular.  They had live entertainment, which I found to be ok, but definitely geared towards an older crowd (and hell I'm older now, and it was still too old for me!)  The portions are large but I found the prices to actually be on the high side.  Let me explain:  Italian food usually is larger portions and usually is on the cheaper side, excluding Northern  Region Italian and some pricier ingredients, think Marscapone Cheese, Veal and Fresh Seafood.  I ordered a fairly basic salad and spaghetti & meatballs, both really standard with basic and cheaper ingredients.  

While both dishes were large, the salad was again, basic, could have used more mozzarella and other than a few olives, tomatoes and onion, was overpriced at $7.95.  Highlight of salad was the homemade ranch dressing which was delicious.  The spaghetti & meatballs was again large, but the 2 meatballs were more on the smaller to medium size and you were really left with quite a bit of pasta.  I did not detect any veal in the meatballs, and the seasoning/ingredients was not quite there, as they were not soft and tender and appeared to be missing the requisite amount of cheese.

I found service to be lacking, I had to ask twice for a simple refill of iced tea and I also had to ask for parmesan cheese as a topping for my spaghetti & meatballs.  The waiter seemed stressed (too busy perhaps) but that's not exactly my problem, is it?  

Side note:  My mother had made reservations, we were on time, but we still had to wait about 15 minutes.

Overall I would recommend Nora's, but I don't know that I would make it a for sure Italian destination when I'm back in Vegas.

This eatery is always consistent, genuine service and always a delight when having lunch or dinner here. This Italian restaurant crafts their dishes with fine ingredients and simplicity.  Each appetizer, entree and dessert is admirable and all the dishes are perfection.  One of my staples is the Arancini, on occasion I've had two orders and made that my entree:)

My friend recommended Nora's for dinner this past Sunday night and I was impressed.

Highlights:
- Large portion sizes. I got the rigatoni special with sausage, peppers, onions in a spicy tomato sauce. It was delicious and probably enough for a lunch portion the next day.
- Complimentary Garlic Bread. Not only is it complimentary, this garlic bread is delicious. Could not stop eating this.
- Prices were very reasonable in the $15-20 range. Definitely a Vegas Italian restaurant locals can go to on a weekly basis.
- Pasta was cooked perfectly al dente and had a great bite to it. 
- Calamari was really good. Portion size was larger than I expected for a seafood appetizer.
- Plenty of parking out front. However, this place gets packed quickly.
- Make a Reservation. Expect to wait 15 minutes after your reservation on busy nights. 
- Good Music. They had a few string musicians on Sunday night and it was a great complement to the food. Appreciated that. 

Overall, would definitely head back to this next time I'm in Las Vegas.

The best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas.

Environment: The inside is beautiful. After moving into their new location roughly a year ago, the interior finally lives up to the standard of the food which they serve. The restaurant is bright and open with an abundance of seating ranging from indoors, to a patio, to private rooms, and to a full-service bar. Each section of the restaurant has its own drawing points so I am never disappointed where I am sat. Interestingly, my favorite place to dine is up at the bar. It is clean and spacious and allows for easier conversation if you are on a date, however when I come with groups I opt for a table. Additionally, the open kitchen is nice and adds some ambience. Finally, there have been a couple times where I have come in during the evening sand there has been a live band which adds yet another classy touch to the restaurant.

Food: If the restaurant itself wasn't so nice, it's the food which has me coming back every time. Everything I have tried here has been excellent. I have tried various appetizers such as the grilled octopus, fried calamari, arancini, and the clams and each one has been delicious. For the main dish, I never miss ordering the rib-eye steak and the fettuccini carbonara. The steak is always cooked beautifully with tons of flavor, and it pairs perfectly with the creamy pasta. Additionally, their garlic bread Is phenomenal. They serve it complimentary and are very good about grabbing you more once you finish yours. We usually go through about 5 baskets during and before dinner and always take some home too because it is just that good! Their cocktails are nice too, and I have tried several them but I always end coming back to their house sangria which is the best I have ever had. It tastes so fresh and fruity without sacrificing being too sweet.

Service: Service is up to par with a classy restaurant as I mentioned before the waiters are always eager to get you anything you need without being invasive. Additionally, when I have sat at the bar the bartenders are very personable and helpful with recommending drinks and dishes and making conversation throughout the meal.

I would recommend this restaurant to anyone and everyone I have recommended has loved it just as much as I had, so I will be back again and again and again!
I got the "crazy alfredo" and let me tell you, it's the best chkn alfredo, with shrimp, and sausage, cmon now!!!! And the garlic toast with. Make you wanna slap yo mama.

Its a Tuesday night and my friend are I are sitting in the living room watching reruns on TV waiting for our gal pal to come home from her errands. Did I mention we are starving? The lady friend left about two hours ago for some errands. What that really means is a full manicure and pedicure.

So the gal pal finally gets home and we head out for some good eats. We waste about a gallon of gas before be finally decide on Nora's Cuisine. I've never eaten here before but I've heard good things about it.

We roll up around 8:15 and the place is pretty full. The hostess nicely asks if we have reservations. We decline. We were then told the wait would be about 10 minutes or so. After a brief glance around the room, I noticed a lot of empty tables, Hmmmm...? 10 minute wait?

We finally get seated and the hostess apologizes for the wait. She explains that the dish washer is not working at full steam (insert joke here) and the wait was more for the clean dishes than an available server. I am always willing to wait for clean dishes!

The menu looked decent for an Italian place. It has all the usual Italian fare one could ask for. You can pull up the full menu on their website. We finally decided to start with the Calamari Fritti and a simple Caprese Salad. My two friends both ordered the Shrimp Scampi and I decided to go for their best seller, the "Crazy" Alfredo.

The Caprese Salad came out first. We just wanted some greens, tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese drizzled with a light olive oil. We got exactly that. It was simple yet very tasty. Next out was the complimentary garlic bread. We started gnawing on the bread when the Calamari came out. I'm so glad we squeezed the lemon wedges over the golden crispy fried calamari because, at least now it had some taste! Ouch! The side sauce that came with it was pretty bland as well.

Out came the main dishes. The Shrimp Scampi looked pretty good. My dish looked awesome as well. How can you go wrong with the best seller? Well... To be honest I didnt read the whole description of the dish. 

"Crazy" Alfredo - This best-seller features the classic fettucine Alfredo piled with chicken, sausage, jumbo shrimp... (Honestly. I stopped reading here. I should of read on.) ...porcini mushrooms, domestic mushrooms, roasted bell peppers, sun-dried tomatoes and jalapenos.

JALAPENOS? Yes. You read that right. Now dont get me wrong. I love japapenos on my nachos or mexican food... But in my Alfredo? To be honest, it was too much. I picked them all out and it really did look like someone took a huge handful and tossed it in. Maybe I'm missing the 'gourmet taste' of it or whatever, but I can definitely do without it.

The dessert selection didnt look too exciting so we decided to pass on it. Our final bill came out to around $70 before tip. Overall just an "A-OK" meal. Maybe I just ordered the wrong dish. Would I eat here again? Sure. I'd give it another shot. Next time I'd try the pizza or another large salad.
Cucina italiana and great customer service! Food was amazing! Bartender was really nice! Highly recommend this restaurant! Will be back again!

I have been eating here frequently for over 10 years.  I had my high school graduation party, wedding rehearsal dinner, and countless anniversaries/birthdays/family dinners here.  Sometimes this place can be packed for dinner so I definitely recommend making a reservation ahead of time.  They give amazing garlic bread before your meal comes and they have the BEST antipasta salad and cannolis ever!  My mouth is watering while typing this...

Man oh man the pasta here is so delicious.  Reservations make it so much better so make sure you do that.  

It's a great place for a casual dinner, birthday celebrations and banquets.  The parking lot is too small for the size of the restaurant, but there's plenty of street parking.  

They offer garlic bread which was really good.  I had calamari and it was the usual at any Italian restaurant.  I tried the melrose shrimp with half chicken and half shrimp.  My dish was really good and really creamy.  Every thing that went into my mouth was fat girl heaven.  

Downfall, with a really cool place like this they didn't offer freshly grated Parmesan.  I don't understand this.  

The service was good and I really want to come back if I'm in the area.

What can I say besides how disappointed I am that my favorite Italian place in town, has gone down hill.  They turned an intimate hole in the wall restaurant, to a place that is now lacking in every area.

The food that was amazing, is now mediocre at best. To be honest, the food doesn't even taste the same. The attentive service that once was, is now gone, it took 20 minutes to get drinks (and I got water).  Mind you, when they finally brought out my water the glass wasn't clean and had lipstick stains on the rim. Cool. The seating is too close together, which makes it hard to move around the restaurant. 

I might give it one more try, but all I kept saying when I was there was how sad I was that Nora's is ruined. They should of stayed at the old location.

I have been coming here for the past 15 years and it has always been a good experience. Great food, great service, good value, and always consistent.  We dined there last Sunday and was very disappointed. There were four of us and we ordered the anti pasta salad, our usual. It was delicious and had been delivered to our table very quickly. Then it seemed to take forever for our entrees to come out and when they finally did, my entree (Alla Nora) was cold. Not even lukewarm. Everyone else's was fine. The manager was great, they re-made my order and when it was served it was piping hot.  I asked for the leftovers to be boxed and they came back with a bag which I thought had my food. However, when I was home and went to reheat it, it wasn't there. It was my boyfriends pasta that he didn't even want to take home. How disappointing the whole experience was.

Linguine and clams for me. The pasta was a little bit past al dente and on it's way to overcooked, and the clams too, I don't know, noticeable? Does that even make sense? "Noticeable" as in a little too much of a flavor, which makes you wonder how fresh it is... Also, I'm not used to parmesan cheese on my L&C. 

Pasta with arrabbiata sauce for him. "Very bland," he says. He also kept reaching for the crushed red pepper, which should be unnecessary with an arrabbiata sauce.

It had been years since I've been to Nora's. I used to have such fond memories, but so far, nothing can top Parma as #1.

Make reservations ! This place is packed ! 

Garlic bread was delish but don't fill up the portions are huge ! 

The 4 staggioni pizza was uh-mazing! 
The crazy Alfredo not so much . Super cheesy with minimal flavor . I had to add lemon to zest it up .

Service was excellent . Grazie Sebastian!

Upon moving to Vegas 2 years ago, this was one of the first places I heard about when I asked around, and I have had it bookmarked on yelp for a long time. My bf and I tried coming here on Valentine's Day, but it was too packed and we agreed we would come back another time. 
We went last night and let me tell you it was not worth the hype. We were very disappointed. The waitress was non existent. Never asked us if we wanted anything to drink, and when we did we couldn't find her or anyone to flag down to ask. So we never got drinks other than water. The time from the appetizers to the food was so long, at least 30 minutes.  "That's okay, it'll be worth the wait", or so I thought.. but the sauce tasted like it came out of a can.  It was not good at all. Not one of us (party of 4) ate our meals and no one even asked why. Then we were just sitting around waiting for someone to clear our table, ask if we want dessert, give us the check, etc. no one ever came. My boyfriend had to get up and go to the kitchen where the waiter/waitress stand with the cash register is and ask for our check!!! Yes he had to get up and get his own check because no one ever came! I can't believe I was excited about this place. We left extreme minimal tip, and even that was being generous. I don't like to pay for service I don't receive. I will never recommend noras Italian cuisine to anyone, in fact, I will tell people to stay away from it.

Very disappointed with the quality of the food for the price. I got super watery spaghetti and I just was not thrilled with not only that but the service had to ask the waiter for five different times for extra napkins and just not great anymore such a shame.

We were greeted and seated by host right away but in general Service was okay. I would say nothing special about their pizza and a actually it was very salty for my taste.  We also ordered calamari which was delicious but I wont able to say same for their chicken wings.

After eating real Italian food when I went to Italy a few years ago, I became an Italian food snob.  Good Italian restaurants in Vegas? No such thing!  Until I came to Nora's.

I got there before they even opened for the day and I'm glad I did as it got real busy around 11:30!  That's always a good sign.

We got calamari which was tender and crisp.  I got gnocchi in Alfredo sauce which was creamy and absolutely fabulous.  We also got the rib eye sandwich with gorgonzola topped with onion strings and homemade potato chips on the side plus a basket of fries.  It had huge chunks of meat and the rich and tangy flavor of the gorgonzola complements the meat.  For everything we got, I only paid less than $40!

The service was good.  Remember to check-in so you can get a free glass of wine.  The free garlic bread is great.  You can definitely taste the garlic which I love.
great food reasonably priced. if you don't want to pay $100 for a plate of spaghetti on the strip then this is the place for you!
Great 1st experience. I had the pesto gnocchi and some pretty amazing cocktails. Sat at the bar...  Michelle was the best, so sad she's not there anymore!!! :(

Been coming here two to three times a month for a long while now.

Great Italian food and drinks, with very generous portions. The lady and I always tend to order appetizers along with our entrees and we've never been able to leave without a takeout box. Nice classic drinks too, especially their Negronis and Old Fashioned(s). 

I've liked most items I've had here food wise, namely: the rib eye, salmon, branzino and the wild boar ragu pappardelle. 

I highly recommended calling for reservations/waits for parties greater than two during dinner time. They are pretty busy on the regular and even with the lady and myself we've had waits and had to go to the bar (not like that's a bad thing though).

We have been eating at Nora's since we moved to Las Vegas in 2005.  The old location was very cozy feeling.  The new location (just a few blocks away) is a more modern, trendy type place.  Our first visit to the new location was disappointing.  The noise level was just awful.  It was impossible to carry on a conversation.  They have since added things to muffle the noise and it's much better.  I think they still need to work on that, but it's better.
As for the food.....Back in 2005 I tried Chicken Erbe Fini....(not sure of the spelling).  It's chicken, cooked in a ton of garlic and it was served in a bowl with their spaghetti.  I'm not a huge fan of chicken, but this was delicious.  At some point it was taken off the menu and I was now going to have to find something else to eat.  The server told me that I could still order it, the chef would still make it.  
Last night we had dinner there with family and when I ordered my Chicken, the server said....ahhh, you must have been coming here for a while......it's been off the menu for at least 4 years.....not to worry.....we will still make it for you...and I was a happy diner!!!
Thinking back over the years, whenever we have out of town company, we ALWAYS take them to Nora's.....and some of our friends ask if we can go there again when they come for another visit.  I can also say that of all the different people and food choices, we have NEVER had a bad meal.  
I do have one little issue.  We had dinner there last night.  We always order the small house salad, no onions to share.  The lettuce last night tasted and even looked different.  It was much thicker and had a little different taste than the usual Romaine lettuce.  Our server checked and they said it was the same.....I don't know about that.  

We all just wish we had more self-control when that darned garlic bread comes to the table.....YUM!

My cousin suggested dinner here and I'm glad he did. Good food, cute atmosphere, good service and I really enjoyed the live music that night. I'd go again to try some
of their other dishes.

First time at this yummy Italian place. I sat next to a regular, and he told me to get pasta with vodka sauce or to get the Melrose. I went with the Melrose, which is a super rich pesto dish I got with chicken. It was delicious! Full of pine nuts too! I could only eat about half of it. When I come back to town, I'm bringing my husband there!

A friend from out of town introduced me to Nora's about six months ago and it's easily now my favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas off the Strip. As an Italian who's lived in Vegas for 10+ years and has close family members living in Italy, I'm embarrassed and angry at myself for not trying this place years ago.

I was skeptical when I saw it was situated in a small space in a dingy strip mall, but my concerns were squashed when I walked in and saw how busy it was on a weekday night. In fact, I highly recommend making a reservation if you're the impatient type who doesn't like to wait (especially since their waiting area is extremely small).

The starters are all excellent with the Calamari Fritti, Antipasto Salad, and Steak & Arugula Bruschetta being my favorites. The entrees range from the Italian classics to the Crazy Alfredo, which is easily one of their most popular dishes. It features fettucine Alfredo filled with chicken, sausage, jumbo shrimp, porcini mushrooms, domestic mushrooms, roasted bell peppers, sun-dried tomatoes and jalapeños. 

The prices at Nora's are also more than reasonable, especially for the "basic" pasta items (cannelloni $9.95, lasagna $10.50, rigatoni $12.95, fettucine carbonara $12.95, fettucine Alfredo $10.50, pasta primavera $10.50, etc). 

Whatever you decide to order, the food is exceptional and it's just as good or better than many of the Italian restaurants on the Strip. Nora's location and building may not live up to your standards, but the quality of the food will make you forget all about it.

Came here to see a friend sing, and really enjoyed the whole experience.  This place has a wonderful atmosphere - both upbeat and intimate at the same time.  I tried one of the cocktails - it was on the stronger side, so I admit I didn't finish it - but the red wine I had two glasses of (by suggestion of a friend) was fantastic.  The food was also really good!  I had the eggplant parmesan (and much to my lament, I forgot to take a picture of it before I ate it) - delicious!!  This is one of the few places in town that features jazz musicians on a regular basis, so if you like that vibe, this is the place for you!

This Italian restaurant is off the strip in a small strip mall. What a great find!
We ordered the Chef's Special (amazing dish with baked eggplant and the best seasonings; this was the best of the dishes); Chicken with fresh (I mean fresh cut/peeled artichokes), and the classic, deliciously made lasagne. 
We had no reservations; the place was packed and we were still seated within 15-minutes. Efficient!
Our server, Don, was excellent, he did everything right.

My goodness soooo worth the trek from the Strip. My friend and I were debating whether to do this or have a celebrity chef Italian cuisine on the strip. So glad we chose this. It takes things back to the simplicity of good home made Italian food. 

We had aranchini balls to start with which was very good. I had the Veal Chop special for my main and it was the best Veal Chop parm I have ever had.

We got there around 21:30 and the restaurant was still full on a weekday in Feb, but we were seated quickly.

Service was very friendly and efficient despite of it being busy. If your in the mood for excellent home made Italian comfort food this is highly recommended. I'm still drooling thinking of the food.

Nora's been a favorite place for Italian food for a lot of my friends and even my manager. The first time I had Nora's, I was not impressed but fast forward about two years after my first visit, I gave Nora's another try. I'm glad I gave Nora's another try because I've enjoyed every visit thereafter. 

There will always be a wait at Nora's. Always. I would suggest for you to make reservations if you know you want to go and have dinner there. Sometimes, if they are backed up and running late.. you will still have to wait about 10-20 minutes even if you have a reservation. 

The food is really good depending on what you order. Their pastas are amazing. I always order a pasta with arribiata sauce, al dente pasta, and extra spicy. I love how they put a lot of garlic flavor into it and they give you a good portion. I always have enough to bring home for lunch the next day. The one thing that I've tried and absolutely do not like is their chicken, which is what caused me to not go to Nora's after my first visit. I had ordered a chicken parm dish and it just did not speak to me. Therefore, it doesn't matter if you get a chicken parm or if you add chicken to your pasta (I tried that too). Their chicken is just not good. Their chicken is pretty hard and dry..very very dry. Even when I have it in my pasta with a sauce, it is still dry. 

Nora's also gives you the first basket of their garlic bread for free. Complimentary on them. It's really really good. It's usually toasted nicely with tons of garlic and butter on it. It's so delicious. We tend to gobble that basket up!

As for the service, it seems pretty average to me, especially when they get busy. 

Overall, definitely worth a try, worth a visit...worth several visits. It's also great for families and friends to dine together!

In a single word: Spectacular.

Recommended as a great date night type of place, we visited Nora's on a Friday night. From the moment you walk in you realize the great vibe and upbeat atmosphere in this place. The beautiful decor, inviting patio, and cordial staff make a lasting first impression.

After only waiting for a few minutes, we were taken to our table and enjoyed some fresh Italian bread and olive oil. Our server was ridiculously attentive and really made us feel special and well taken care of throughout the night. His recommendations for the food and wine were on point, with every dish being freshly prepared and bursting with flavor. I will say that the Crazy Alfredo was great, but really lacking in the shrimp department (only ?!?).

At the end of it all, we had 4 glasses of wine, an appetizer, two main dishes, and two desserts (sorry, I do not remember all the names). The best part? It all came to $100 (not including tip).

I will keep this place in mind for the next time I want a romantic dinner with my better half.

First time dining with Nora's. Boyfriend made a reservation for 2 at 8pm. We arrive and place was packed! But we experienced no problem with our reservation and was sat to our table right away.

Items we ordered were:
-Sangria was good but not memorable. (Awesome that you get a free sangria with yelp check in).
-Complimentary garlic bread was soooooo goooood!! Hot fresh crispy yet soft bread lightly buttered and seasoned with fresh bits of garlic. Very addicting.
-Caesar salad was good but I've had better. Greens were bright green and crisp. Fresh baked homemade croutons as well as pieces of garlic bread. Dressing wasn't too heavy on salad. Just tossed perfect.
-Calamari was okay to me but the sauce it was accompanied with was good. 
-Cheese ravioli with vodka sauce. Generous portioned Raviolis were nice and fluffy. Tender when cut. Vodka sauce was full of flavor.
-meatballs were an option to add to your pasta dish or as a side. They were delicious and tender as well. 
-Oreo Tartufo as dessert. It was pretty much an Oreo ice cream chocolate truffle ball. Was a little hard to cut into as first. Might want to wait till it melts a bit more. It was alright, nothing spectacular.

As far as service goes, it was excellent!! Our server had a smile on his face from start to finish of service and was very friendly. All staff seemed friendly, even a couple of the chefs gave us a warm smile on the way out. 

A place with smiling faces and warm welcomes as well as great food is a "go to" in my book! Will be back soon to try other items!

Nora's Wine bar...There is not enough praise that I can give about this place.  It is my wife's and I most favorite place to eat at for italian food.  We come here about 2-3 times a month.  The atmosphere here is always friendly, people are kind and its a great hole in the wall for locals.  

Usually when I go I get chicken Marsala but replace the spaghetti with Alfredo Carbonara.  The procuitto is simply amazing.  They're appetizers are really fresh and all items are great.  

Bottom line its a great place to go for some italian food with a good atmosphere.

Between 2 other friends, we had their Vegetarian Pizza & Lasagna. Delicious! Then we had this Cookies & Cream with Oreos dessert. That definitely hit the spot! I will be coming back to try out a few other menu items that caught my eye :) Thank you

Although this part isnt necessarily relevant, our server Anthony, who looked/sounded like a NY Italian was cute :) lol

I'm on to your trick Nora's. Telling people that their is a 20 minute wait and then seating them within 10. In all seriousness, they are jammed packed.  With the crowd coming to eat in those numbers on a Thursday, it is impressive. 

Little events were off throughout the dinner, but the food was good enough to overlook them. A wine/cocktail menu was not presented until I asked. A talk with Robyn L. a while ago had me searching for the Pilgrim's Passion. Ordered that for my friend and I got the Berry Explosive. Both were amazing and worth the $9. It took some time for them to come to the table. I wouldn't have noticed if the waitress didn't come to apologize, so that was nice.

The garlic bread came out to tide us over. Surprising that the basket had about ten pieces in it. All were heavy on the garlic. I could smell it when brushing teeth later that night. Oh baby, does that turn you on? They ran the gambit in texture though. Some were burnt, some crunchy, while others were soft and drenched in butter. Most were edible and enjoyable. Dinner is more fun when playing roulette with free items. 

At least there was no losing in dinner. I had ordered the Alla Nora and it was a bountiful feast. A pile of spaghetti topped in meat sauce, eggplant, and cheese is thrown in the oven or a salamander to give a nice crust. My friends were also as happy with their Tomato Basil Pasta and Crazy Alfredo. Packing most of the dish to go home, I am looking forward to tomorrow, because I always enjoy cold pasta for breakfast.

We were staying nearby with no car, so we walked over after yelping it. We got a table in the kitchen and were treated well. Great pasta, the scallopini was a bit salty for me, but I generally don't use salt, so I may be over-sensitive. The waiters were nice and friendly. This is a well organized place that obviously has been doing it right for a long time.
Great service all around for my 1st visit at there new location. I will be returning!

I'm am shocked this place has an average 4 stars. We were highly disappointed, the only things that saved the night was the free glass of wine with Yelp check in an $10 off coupon I got for my birthday.

Not to be a nit picker but my food wasn't up to par so I might as well complain about the dirty with sauce table cloth as well. Otherwise the restaurant itself was nice. Lots of room, it really filled up the longer we were there. Our waitress was average, she helped with questions but otherwise wasn't very attentive.

We were given some small pieces of complimentary garlic bread to start, it was average, nothing special about it. I'm a big fan of Arncini, so we ordered a plate to start. Ick! I ate one and didn't even want to finish that one. It had good crunch but the taste of the inside was not appealing, I make Arincini at home and have had it many other places and this was the worst I have ever had. We didn't even finish them or the bread and my husband is a bread fiend.

On of the menu items I saw had gotten lots of good reviews and states its a best selling dish was the Crazy Alfredo, I love Alfredo and wanted shrimp but also wanted to try something different so I ordered it. The dish was piled high but it didn't seem like Alfredo sauce, it was more like they threw Parmesan or mozzarella in the pasta, it actually started to harden as it cooled. The spice of the jalapeño wasn't over powering which was nice. Disappointed there were only 2 shrimp in the dish. Tons of sausage. The fettuccine tasted like box pasta. My friend got the same dish and was disappointed as well. Her husband was the only one that was pleased with his dish which was the Chicken Mount Etna. My husband got the Gnocchi with Vodka Sauce and added Chicken. OMG! I felt so bad for my husband, his gnocchi tasted like wet balls of wall paper paste, no taste, and the sauce did nothing to help. We've had gnocchi before also and these were very heavy and gross.

I just wanted to get out of there, I can't believe I wasted by birthday dinner on Nora's, I will never go back or recommend it. My husband wanted to give me to give 1 star but my dish was at least edible.

The food here was phenomenal! I had The Melrose which I highly recommend. The tiramisu was perfect. The wait staff couldn't have been nicer and were very attentive. Along with how great the food and the service was, the prices were comparable. I would've expected to pay more but when I got the bill, I was pleasantly surprised! The location was off the strip, which I liked as well. I would highly recommend this to anyone and I will definitely go back!

Don't be fooled by the strip mall pizzeria "look" to this place. I'll admit..when I walked inside...I still sensed "spaghetti joint"..leave your preconceptions in the parking lot! Its not fancy inside..but this spot serves up some terrific cocktails..excellent food and very professional service. waiters seem to work in teams...and they are very friendly and efficient. had a cocktail called a  cable car--capt. morgan mixed with  orange curacao. absolutely delicious. my son had an old fashioned....wife and daughter split a nice bottle of pinot grigio. for openers we shared mozzarella sticks...very good. 2 of us had the veal parm.....the other two had the shrimp scampi. we all gave our meals very high grades. Best part of the meal are the prices....incredibly reasonable. we all split some decadent dessert. Ok..so its not romantic or intimate...but if fantastic Italian food is your goal....you have found yourself a gem in the desert! Mangia!

I had dinner with my Family at Nora's on New Years Eva and the food was outstanding!  I had the Ouso Buca and I would recommend it to everyone.

Just think this place started at a one room pizza joint and is one of the best finds in Las Vegas.  Next time you are looking for great Italian food, go to Nora's...........

They start you out with a basket of perfectly toasted garlic bread. I ordered veal parm. They served it as a bone-in chop and it was perfect! I had a nice bowl of spaghetti as a side dish. The pasta was done just right with a great marinara.

Great food, good prices and it's away from the Strip. Highly recommended.

We ate at Nora's tonight on 2/18/17;
It was a 60th Anniversary party.
The food was good.
The management was terrible.
Did not walk us over to where the party was, I had to ask.
The hostess had no idea, when I gave her they're name.

The party was 20 people, she should have known.

We had a problem with the service not picking up the empty plates.
The manager walked by, I waved to him but I was ignored.

The manager never came over to ask if everything was alright.

When we booked this anniversary party, we said between 20 to 22 people.
There was 20 people who came but we were charged for 22.

Because the bill was over $1200.00 we asked if they would remove the cost of the two they charged us. Management refused.

Even though a restaurant has good food, if the management & service is on the lower end of the spectrum it ruins the experience of dining at that establishment.

There we're other concerns that we're not mentioned on this review, that we're never mentioned when planning this anniversary party ahead of time.

What happened to this place?  The prices, food, and service are NOT what they used to be!  They garlic bread is half of what it used to be in portion, and in taste.  The sauce was brown, and bland. It was not the fresh red sauce we used to get.  We are both literally, and figuratively sick to our stomachs.  Both of us are sick now.  I've been burping up the sauce, and we both had deuces wild, if you know what I mean!  I had been going to Nora's for more than 20 years!  NEVER again!  Disgusting!  I should have gone to Roma on Spring Mountain.  We paid dearly for that mistake!

Upgrade... Nora's delivers again. Their bar had some great mixologist creations and as always the meat sauce cannot be duplicated. We had a crew of 20 and they really took care of us. This is a Las Vegas classic place to eat home style Italian food. I will always come here when in town.

Dined at the original location several times with friends but never thought to do the check in or review.  Loved it then,  and i think i love it more with the new location.  Takes the ambience to a new level. Service is amazing as always...the antipasto is the best.   Nice for a intimate dinner or even to show up with friends. Hope you enjoy as much as i do.

We were looking for a nice Italian restaurant in Las Vegas and Nora's did not disappoint. Portions are large and service is quick. The waitress stopped by the table several times before the meal was delivered (the restaurant was almost 90% full) to check on our drinks and make sure we were happy. The meals were outstanding and since my daughter is vegan, they added more vegetables to her meal instead of meat. We will be returning here the next time we take a trip from Los Angeles.

There are some dishes that are fire and others that were just ok. We ordered:

Arancini - Fried Risotto Balls that were pretty good...like a lighter, less cheesier fried mac and cheese ball

Garlic Bread - Not the best but decent

Italian Wings - DON'T order these if you are trying to eat your entree...these got me full as fuck with how heavy they are....ok wings but they are heavy and will get you full if you eat these alone....

Fettuccine Carbonara - EL FUEGO! One of the best pasta dishes I've had in recent memory....

Baked Rigatoni - Not my favorite...and was bland...

Overall it is a very good local restaurant with high quality food at a reasonable price.

This is a really good place for Italian. I bookmarked this based on reviews and bit does it live up to it. From the outside it looks small but when you get inside it's 3 rooms full of tables. There's a full bar so that helps if there's a wait. 
 I had the linguini with meat sauce and meatballs. It was pretty good. It's not the best I've had but it was definitely up there. My girl had the tortellini in Alfredo sauce. Now this. This is the one. There Alfredo sauce is booommbbbbbb. I actually opted to take my linguini home and help her finish hers. We had garlic bread complimentary with the meal. It was good garlic bread. Also had mozarella sticks....they were only aight tho. 
Service is great. Portions are good. Prices are fair and the food is bomb.

This recent visit we had a big birthday party celebration. I tried the Lemon Clams, they were great small clams with the butter sauce. Then, tried the Calamari with the amazing with the sauce. The Shrimp Melrose was the wrong order I ordered, the Crazy Alfredo was what I wished I ordered instead! The Shrimp Melrose was too saucy for me & Crazy Alfredo was hands down the best pasta. 

Our server Don was amazing & accommodating and surprised the birthday celebrant and us with tiramisu which was amazing and decadent!
This is about the best pizza I ever had food is so incredible good best Italian food ever it can get little busy but is worth the wait.

Upon reading my previous review, I was wrong. 4 stars isn't a high enough rating. 5 stars all the way. My favorite meal in Las Vegas, amazing seafood/pasta, great garlic bread, friendly service. I only wish they have shuttles to/from the strip, for those occasions when you don't have a rental car. 

Definitely eat here.

My husband and I ate here last week it was my first time. The service was great and the garlic bread was very tasty. I ordered chicken Francese and it was very delicious. He got the pasta alla Nora. My chicken dish came with a side of spaghetti and the sauce was watery and there wasn't enough for all the noodles. And that could be just a preference thing but the sauce was definitely watery. I think maybe the noodles weren't drained well before they put the sauce on. But we will definitely be back!!!

Absolutely fantastic atmosphere, food, and service.  My boyfriend and I attempted to make a reservation, but we were advised that they were fully booked.  We decided to head in anyways and try our luck. They said it would be a 30-45 min wait.  It definitely didn't take as long as anticipated or maybe it did, but we found a seat at the bar and had some wonderful cocktails at the bar with a very intuitive bartender with glasses. We were informed that our table was ready in no time. It was a great evening the whole way through our meal. Our waiter informed us that it was his first evening serving and you would have never known. The service was impeccable and the food was phenomenal. I am Italian and I felt as though I was back at my grandmother's house having an authentic Italian meal. We had the calamari, chicken milanese, and gnocchi in red sauce with meatballs. DELICIOUS!  I would recommend this place to any and everyone!!! buon cibo e mangiare :)

I don't know if I would drive all the way out there to dine here, but if you are in the area the food was very tasty.  Here are my gripes : if you check in on Yelp there's a special for a fresh glass of wine, well they didn't want to honor that for the Sangria, thought that was really cheapo of them.  Second complaint, my girlfriend ordered a grilled chicken dish [aka means healthy typically] it was swimming in olive oil. Like she was moving the chicken out of the oil. Third, the definitely don't have the best garlic rolls, while they are good, we ordered a side of tomato sauce to dip them in.

Morale of the story....Panevino is still my favorite Italian for a "locals spot" in Vegas.

Of the Italian spots in Vegas I've gone to thus far (quite a few), this has definitely been the best. Off the grid a bit for tourists, but definitely an easy access location. When you see a restaurant in a strip mall, I think you're always a little wary, but this place definitely shines. 

Staff was super friendly and got us seated fast (without a reservation). The caesar salad was fresh and delicious-- which is great, because I can't even count how many Italian joints try to pass off jar caesar dressing as fresh- ugh. The gnocchi with vodka sauce was super delicious. 

Unlike the others, I wasn't terribly impressed with the garlic bread, but hey- you can't win 'em all :)

I moved to Las Vegas around a year and a half ago from NY and had been  in search for a taste of home. Thank you Nora's, I now feel I have found it. This is most authentic New York style Italian restaurant you can find outside of Little Italy in NYC...From the crafted cocktails to the apps and entrées down to the cannoli and espresso, I have yet to be disappointed. This is one of Vegas's Crown Jewels and I'm positive that we can all expect the same quality of fine food and service at their new location...

Great food, friendly place and real authentic.  Meatballs yummy and antipasto deliish!!
Teramisu and canolli's wow!

Horrible food! We've been there 3 times so far, the first 2 times were tolerable, but we picked up some Fettuccine Alfredo and a vegetarian pizza. My husband had the pasta and it tasted like it's been prepared in a fish frying pan. My pizza was easily the WORST pizza I have ever had and I've had some bad pizzas in Las Vegas. The tomato on the pizza looked like they have dumped old cans of tomato on the pizza. It was tasteless. A few hours after eating we both started having terrible stomachaches and coughs. Felt like the food has bleach in it the way it was burning through my colon and throat. I'm never eating at this place ever again, 33 dollars down the drain.

Food and service were excellent it's a little loud but that's to be expected on Valentine's Day Decour is pretty cool are you my friend shrimp scampi bangin arancini Fire haven't had the Oso Buco yet and the wife got the Branzino Not sure of it yet but everything else is been great highly recommended trust me I'm a chef. And I slept at a Holiday Inn last night.

Love this place! I'm not too crazy about Italian food but when I crave good pasta, this is a great pace to be! The exterior and interiors lookVery rustic and modern at the same time. Food is spot on! We came here for my dad's bday dinner, and my fam loved the food!

Chicken fettuccini
Shrimp Melrose
Chicken cafrioci
Margherita pizza with garlic
White sauce pizza with spinach
Calamari
Mozzarella sticks
Nora salad
Tiramisu
Cheesecake
Bread pudding

These are stuff we got! I had the shrimp melrose pasta and it was 5/5! The free garlic bread was so yummy! The Nora salad was very light and different. It has a sour zing to it that is very good. Calamari was amazing with the sauce!!! Love it! I'd definitely be back! Also, my servers were all amazing! Love this place and will recommend it to all my fam and friends for sure!

PS always make reservations! This place is hella busy!!!! And always be on time because they can only hold reservations for up to 15 mins from the time of your scheduled reservation

This is one of my favorite local places to go and eat lunch with my friends and family.  food has always been really good. The service is the only reason I am giving it 4 stars. The service has always been either really good or well, not so good sometimes. The free yelp offer was good. They bring u a very decent Pinot Grigio for the wine. Our server was not bad. He could have been a little more attentive to us tho. Sometimes it seemed he would kind of disappear and I had to go find him twice. Overall a very good restaurant. I would come back here.

First, the service. This is the reason I'm knocking a star off. The girls at the front desk weren't very nice.  The server was ok,

Fortunately for Nora's the food is great. We ordered the mama salad (I think that's what it's called) and chicken rigatoni. Both were very good, lots of flavor, and high quality.

Always busy. Full of locals. Two good signs!

Nice bar, good food, low-key vibe. Strip-quality meal without the strip headache and prices!!

Pro tip: their version of the Moscow Mule is called the Sicilian Mule and includes Italian liqueur limoncello instead of lime juice. Might very well be the best Moscow Mule I've ever had!

Nora's is the B O M B ! ! !

Came to Las Vegas for a meeting and finished it off with dinner. One of the guys suggested Nora's. 

The ambiance is excellent with very friendly staff. We were fortunate to be guided by Angela. She had a great attitude and was very helpful with our choices. Gotta say her personality was stellar.

We had a nice Pinot Noir that paired well with the baked Rigatoni Special & spicy sauce I ordered. It was sooooo delicious and comforting. Love great pasta! Love Nora's!

Absolutely will come back here again next time I'm in Las Vegas.

Worth every penny! This is my 50th time and They have perfectly maintained consistency in both service and quality of the meal.  It is very laid back and a great place to have a long inviting meal with everyone- even the customers tend to be very nice at nora's.  Don't change a thing, we always look forward to lunch or dinner at Nora's!
I have eating here several times and enjoyed it every time. The food is fresh, the service is professional and friendly and the prices much cheaper than any Italian place you'll find on the Strip.

I still like The chicken alfredo at carrabbas better but The pizza here was great along with The service, Check in And you get a Free glass of wine (And it's actually good!) will definitely go back. Bring a sweater because they keep it pretty cold in there!

Just had lunch at Nora's I decided to have the lunch pasta with meatball. The red sauce was perfect and the meatball was tender and tasty It put the place near my house to absolute shame. Service was good food was great and price was decent what more can u ask for Nora's is my go to Italian restaurant from now on and that's high praise from a NY Italian. You must try if you haven't yet.
Greg and I sat at the bar and were served by Michelle, who totally rocked!  Chicken Marsala and Chicken Parmesan were awesome!  Great food and awesome service!  Can't wait to come back!
GREAT FOOD! Very nice yet casual place. Really enjoyed the garlic bread and entrees we all had. One of the better local restaurants in Las Vegas! Suggest trying it out!

This place is great.  I thought the prices were pretty fair.  I got the Linguine Calamari and it was fantastic.  I am such a sucker for fresh squid.  Attentive service and overall good experience.  With prices like these, I will be sure to make my way back here.

Great hidden spot in the valley if you are looking for a local Italian restaurant.  The entire family loved it.  First, we were served fresh garlic bread as an appetizer.  When I say fresh, I mean you can actually watch them make it in the kitchen when you walk in.

Second, the sauce is good, which is always important.  The spaghetti, Tomato & Basil, and my Veal Parm all were good because of the gravy.  In top off that, my veal was tender.  Finally, my wife had the Crazy Alfredo, which apparently was the highlight of dinner.  She talked about it all night.

I was happy with the service too.  Our waiter was patient with me taking time with the wine order.   I was also happy they took our leftovers and boxed then up for us, which is always a plus.

Will definitely be going back.

Food good, I was too late to get my favorite rib eye sandwich. Pizza and chicken strips. Awesome garlic bread.

Lurch for a waiter....
I've tried to give this place a second, third, fourth...chance. What was once my go to, is no more.
Best place to have an Italian food, listen to live jazz music, meet great people.!!!
5 stars for their sea bass so delicious even better if you compare to expensierbplaces and the pasta not heavy great taste really satisfied with the service definitely will come bac

If you are in Las Vegas, you must stop here!

We ate here last June and are eating there again this upcoming Sunday.  I am disappointed in myself for not remembering to write this review sooner.  The food, atmosphere, wine selection, and prices are crazy low when you you think about what you spend when staying on the strip.

This has become a staple for my company when we are here on business. 

From the exterior a Non-Local would not think much of the restaurant because it is located in strip mall.  HOWEVER, trust me when I say this is probably some of the best Italian food in the Las Vegas Area.  

The Chicken Mt. Etna was unlike anything I have ever had (and I live just outside of NYC).

Another local Vegas gem hidden in a strip mall! I've eaten here several times and order take out occasionally. Sauces are amazing, pasta al dente, and it's all fresh. I love that it's an authentic restaurant but offers a variety of delicious dishes not found at most Italian places. Huge fan of their Farro salad!! Chewy & healthy!! The Arrabbiata sauce is spicy enough, so good that I get it with angel hair.. Yum! Nice cozy ambiance, great fir a date!

Mom and I had dinner here recently at their new location. Even with a reservation, we waited about 15 minutes for a table.  The place was packed.  The one downside - it was super, super noisy.  They did not sound proof the restaurant well.  

Our waitress was a bit busy too and did not come by as much as she should.  But the food was tasty and worth it.  

i started with the House salad - Romaine lettuce, mozzarella, pepperoncini, olives, onions, tomatoes.  Good toppings, and you never can have enough cheese.  Mom had the Pasta Faggioli soup.  She said it was very  good.  Lots of veggies.

For entrees, I had the Chicken Carciofi - Bone-less chicken breast with fresh tomato, artichokes, and capers. Served with linguine.  Mom had the Veal Parmigiana - from the leg, served with spaghetti and tomato sauce. We both liked our meals.  They were good sized portions.  Good sauces, good cheese.  The garlic bread is good too.

Definitely a good family style Italian restaurant.  It is quite noisy and very busy but it was a good experience.

Um.......YUM!!!!!!! I understand why this place is always packed. I've had the chicken masala, antipasto salad, the branzino, the crazy Alfredo, the lasagna, and the pizza, and it's all been consistent and delicious. The best part though, is the bartender/mixologist Adam. He makes the most amazing drinks and is super knowledgeable. He is one of the many reasons why we love Nora's!

One of the best Italian restaurants I've been to. It's off the Strip so the prices are really reasonable. I had the spaghetti and meatballs with whole wheat penne pasta and split a Caesar Salad with my wife. Good beer selection. She had the eggplant parmigiana. They have pizza too.
Everything about this place is amazing. The food, drinks, and staff are the best. By far the best Italian food I've had in Vegas, reminds me of being back home in NY. I can't wait to go back.

Once in awhile, I have a craving for Italian food.. and when I do, it has to be GOOD Italian food.. so I come here! 

Nora's is a cute little restaurant in a plaza that is just Bleh.. but once you walk in the doors, the smell and the bustling waiters invite you in to their little world. There's always a busy bar with patrons eating and drinking on there, as well as 2 little rooms that are always full of people happily enjoying their food. 

I've ordered a couple of different things here but my all time favorite as to be the clam linguine. I have asked the chef to make a "pink sauce" each time, which is a combination of white and red sauce, and it's delectable. The flavor is great and the chef is not cheap with his clams! There's a ton in his dish and it's worth every penny. 

The breadsticks here are also very very good. It's made with real garlic and really hits the spot. The first basket is on the house! But I always order another basket :)

The white sangria here is also a good choice. A few sips of that always makes my night fun. 

I will keep coming back. See you there!

We have coming to Nora's for years, even when they had their small restaurant in a strip mall. Outstanding Italian cuisine, great service, wonderful atmosphere. The pasta dishes are all wonderful, and we've tried just about everyone. The wild boar with pasta is great, as is their desserts. The new location is a little noisier than the old facility but the quality and quantity of the food didn't change.

Four people dined at the restaurant which is a very busy and popular place. We ordered basics. One pizza Margherita, chicken parm, chicken Marsala and shrimp over linguini.  After waiting an hour to be served, all three chicken or shrimp dishes were served cold. The chicken parm had two small pieces of chicken, the chicken Marsala was covered with brown goop, and there were only two shrimp on the plate. The pizza was served hot but the dough was soggy and under cooked.  This was a long time to wait for poorly prepared food.  While this place is popular there are much better local Italian restaurants.

Our experience at the new Nora's last month at lunch was not pleasant. The restaurant was moderately busy, but kitchen production was very slow. Our server was literally missing in action.

But we went back a month later thinking our previously experience was only a one-off. The restaurant was NOT busy at all...lunch middle of the week. Kitchen production was again slow and our server was slow as well.

Though I rate the food at Nora's five stars plus, service is still a major problem. We won't be going back.

Excellent and good priced. Came here with the family amd we all enjoyed everything that they had to offer. Good selection of wine and beer, as well as appetizers and entrees. We hadthe regular cesar salad which fed 4 of us, mozzarella sticks, yum, and the portiins of the dinner meals were huge....if we werent staying at a hotel we would have packed up and ate left overs for our drunken state later that night!! Overrall we will definitely be back our next visit to vegas!!! A must go italian restaurant!
This place is VERY good! I lived in Italy for two years and the food at Nora's is definitely authentic!

This is my first time eaten at this place for Maisel am my employees enjoyed every bit of your food we had a good time we will spread of words to our friends and our neighbors and our business nearby and we will generate our business bigger and bigger if we spread words aroundYour Italian cooking style is good and Best We will see you soon

Like I said earlier, I came to investigate the hype.  Unfortunately, the wardenis not a big fan of pasta so I had to go solo cause Yolo.  Not too mention, the place is pretty close to the office.

I opted for the gnocchi with vodka sauce after learning that crazy Alfredo is only offered at dinner.  Also. I been seeing gnocchi at at the world market and contemplated making it at the crib.  Because it primarily consists of potato and basically a dumpling, it is rather filling and pretty heavy.  The vodka sauce was excellent and the good came out in a flash.  Let's not forget about the fresh garlic bread....whoa!  My garlic gauge is enhanced so I love how they load it with butter, seasonings and garlic, and lots of it!

The server was very accommodating as well and assisted with activating the closed captioning feature so I could watch ESPN's Around the Horn.  There was a minor mix up when paying the bill however, where the waiter charged me for the couple eating next to me.  No biggie, but I sure can see others having a stroke over it.  I still broke him off as if the mishap never occurred.

The ambience creates a true modern Italian experience and the speakeasy lounge music was a nice touch.  The decor provided a cozy feel and the dining area is closed off to the world, giving you that presence of intimacy. 

I am definitely coming back again, especially during dinner too complete my investigation of the do called "crazy Alfredo."  Maybe I can convince my partner in crime to come with, but until then, it might be several solo dolo trips for muah only.

We visited the new location last night for an early dinner.  The dining room was full before 5pm and tables were only available for reservations.  So, we ate at the bar which is very nice.  Unfortuantely, I had loud just married guy who thought he was at a club and  an older woman who was wearing my moms cologne on my left.  The Crazy Alfredo was very good and I would return just for that.  I tried a Moody Tongue beer however the bartender didnt know what kind of beer it was...?  I would come back to try other food but make sure I had a reservation.  Lastly, I would put a nicer sign on the old building stating that they have moved and announce the restaurant coming soon.

The garlic bread is delicious.  Order a side of marinara to dip it in and you'll look like a real Italian.  

The Crazy Alfredo was packed with shrimp, sausage, chicken, and half a dozen other items.  And it had just the right level of spiciness to complement the many other flavors packed into it!  

My dining companion was looking for something simple and ordered the gnocchi with  marinara.  He enjoyed the dish immensely.

This is one of those hidden gems that will put smiles on visitors' faces forever!

Went there the first time and food was pretty good and service was average.  Tried to go back, they told me to call ahead next time, 45 minute wait.  So next time I called ahead and they told me 1st come 1st serve.  So I go down and they tell 30 minute wait.  Offered for me to sit at the bar when they had several tables open.  Maybe I didn't look like a "Nora's customer".  Not going back again.

Always great, everyone I take compliments the food
From dinner to the great lunch specials you can't go wrong

All I have to say here is I love it love it love it!!  Try the manicotti.  THE BEST!!! The prices are decent, the atmosphere is ok.  A bit of a small place and if you go on Friday or Saturday nights make sure you have a reservation.

If I had written this review several years ago when they were at the older, smaller location it would've gotten a 4 or 5 star. I loved it then. But I hadn't been back in a long time because it is far drive from where I live. I found out they moved into a nice larger building so I was anxious to go, so I talked my family to take me for my birthday. I had heard they were quite busy and should make reservations, so we did. And good thing cuz they were very busy. We got our table and it was very loud in there. Could not hear any of our conversations we practically had to yell at each other. 

The service was fine and it was nice they gave me a free dessert for my bday. But the food, was just average. I got a steak. Wasn't bad but nothing to rave about. My husband got the chicken marsala. It was kinda strange that everyone else's meal was pretty good size but his chicken was small and dinky. And the side of pasta was as bland as could be. This is an Italian place. Shouldn't it be amazing.? My husband did love his old fashion though. 

So bottom line... it's just not worth the drive for me. There are 2 amazing Italian places near me that I would rather go to.

Love this restaurant! The food and service are always top notch.  As always, we start with the antipasto salad and the arancini. Recently we thought we would try the osso bucco. Wow! Topped the meal off with the warm chocolate cake. What a fantastic meal!

Stood in a line for 15 minutes while everyone stared at the hostess on a long reservation telephone call. It seemed like there wasn't enough staff at the front or with the servers as I observed. I've been here one previous time, and the lack of customer service along with the average tasting Italian food is not worth it.

We were big fans of Nora's at the old location. It was local, warm and friendly, and really felt like a family owned business. While service was a bit hit-or-miss at times, the quality of the food more than made up for it, and when the staff made mistakes, management was always quick to offer compensation. We always felt we were going to a friend's house for lunch or dinner. And there was a definite Vegas "vibe" to the place; one could imagine the old-time mobsters having a meeting at the back table.

Alas, the new restaurant looks and feels like a chain restaurant. The decor and atmosphere are similar to any Macaroni Grill. With the exception of the music (jazz standards, very nice), the restaurant could be picked up and directly transported to any large city in North America. The mobsters, I'm sure, have found another Vegas haunt. The romance is gone.

The food remains pretty much the same, if you're lucky enough to have it delivered before it gets cold! The service is dreadful. My first experience was take-out. The pizza was brought out first, and the hostess informed me that she was waiting on the chicken. After about five minutes, I asked if the pizza shouldn't be held someplace to keep it warm while waiting for the chicken - "oh, we have no place to do that." REALLY? The pizza was cold before I got back to the car! And although apologies were offered by the front staff, but no mention of any compensation.

We went for lunch, and experienced more bad service: We had to hail a waiter to get water and drinks after 15 minutes of not being acknowledged. We ordered pizza and chicken again, and a regular house salad. The pizza was lukewarm. I guess the same thing happened that occurred with our take-out order. The server never even apologized for his lack of attention (nor did anyone else). And the bill came to eighty bucks for pizza, chicken piccata, salad and two glasses of wine ((which we had to order by intuition; a wine menu was never proffered).

It's a damned shame to see a cozy, friendly familiar place turn into a cookie cutter chain restaurant. I'm afraid we'll be looking for a new Italian "joint."

What a thrill to enjoy Nora's outstanding cuisine, with our favorite waiter Don, at their New Location!  The new facility is excellent, very nice, but not gaudy.  Don once again was everything a great waitperson is.  He was attentive, but not excessive.  His service support staff is always watching for needs, but they don't hover.   
I don't get to Las Vegas as much as I'd like, but when I do I always enjoy dinner at Nora's at least once, twice if we can.  Last Wednesday was our first in the new facility.  We will go again later this week.  Thank you Nora's for keeping your outstanding menu cooked to perfection, employing a staff of excellent quality and friendliness.  The new facility just adds to our enjoyment.

Never heard of it before....  Apparently this place is a "hidden gem" of Las Vegas.  Tonight, our Food was good. Service was ok... Nothing to write home about there! I will say the Snow White pizza is exceptional.

This restaurant is a place our family has frequented many times. We hadn't been there in about 2 years. It has become a lot more casual then it was previously. We had a 6pm reservation, and we were seated around 6:30. The food was very good, nice size portions, and good service. Unfortunately we told them when we made the reservation it was a birthday, and again when we checked in. They did nothing. Yet they were celebrating other birthdays in the restaurant. Extremely disappointing. I like Noras, but it used to be better.

Came here with a friend the other night for dinner and had a very pleasant experience overall.

Ambience--
Upon entering, I felt as if I left Las Vegas and was teleported to 1950s Manhattan. Very classy and cozy.

Service--
Service was on point. Our waiter was attentive but not overly so. Water and wine glasses were never left empty until we were done.

Food--
Normally, I'm not a huge fan of Italian food, but damn does Nora's make me want to change my mind. The shrimp scampi I had was flavorful and generously portioned. The shrimp itself were cooked just right and also very large and plump! My friend's veal marsala had great flavor to it as well. The highlight was probably the juicy, crispy amazing garlic bread. Wish I could have some right now!

Nora's is a great local spot that is suitable for families, friends, and especially dates. Too bad it closes so early!
Good Italian food at a reasonable price since it's off the strip. Will definitely be coming back again.

This is by far my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. My family and I have been going here for years and my husband and I even had our rehearsal dinner here. Everything from their dishes to the drinks are great.  My personal favorite is the baked ziti. You can never go wrong at Nora's.

We came to Nora's again this year and they did not disappoint. Everything was right on point. When we come to LV next year Nora's will be our first stop yet again. Freshness, quality, quantity, value, and service. No need to go to a restaurant with a certain chefs name attached where you will pay 40-50% more for items that simply can't match Nora's daily effort. Try it once.

Favorite spot in Vegas for Italian food. Been coming here for over 20 years now. It's a great date spot or if you just want to have a family dinner. I order take out all the time. Love the Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo it's by far my favorite dish. Staff is always polite and knowledgable.

I was here on a date. It was a great experience. Had the seafood pasta and it was super yummy. Great wine selection, but I feel like we should have went with another wine than the Ripasso we chose. Amarone next time?

My favorite Italian restaurant for the last 11 years! This a local hot spot! Newly designed and fresh service staff! Rudy is my all time favorite bartender! Best martinis of my life! I always get the penne al la vodka and I've never been disappointed! I've never had a bad dish here! So glad they changed the garlic bread... it is better than ever! And they are open for lunch.... soooo good!!
We went to this place for the first time tonight. It was very good food. We will be back for sure.
Service is always great and the food is awesome.  Truffle fries was a disappointment as it was recommended.  The veal and salad lunch special was great.

I went there with my wife and our friend the decor is very nice the hostess was pleasant and friendly.  Our waitress an older lady seemed nice but not too friendly not really informative as too what was on their menu that we might want to try not asking if we want appetizers not letting us know about the special meal they had for the day.  The bus girl was very helpful and nice.   As for the food it was fabulous very flavorful and tasty because of the food i gave it a four would be a five but the service was so disappointing i would go again just to see maybe the service-was just a blip.

Gr8 westside Italian restaurant w/good service, fine food and classy ambience.  Pasta dishes are amazing and nice selection of salads, appetizers and entrees.  Bar is fantastic w/full selection of spirits.  Nice patio dining and indoor tables give you privacy.  Intimate dining rooms for groups and meetings. 
Can have wait time and parking lot is not big enough.  However, family friendly and generous portions for leftovers.

Def was not impressed here at all. 

We sat in some weird side room with really bad lighting and like 4 tables total. The rest of the restaurant was lively and busy and had live music, nice decor and was decorated for Christmas. But for some reason, this room seemed like a late addition that might be used for private parties but had no ambiance. Totally underwhelming and odd that the restaurant wouldn't follow through with the same design in this other room. 

The service was whatever and the food was mediocre. The appetizers were good but the gnocchi with vodka sauce was 17.50 and wasn't anything special. My husband enjoyed his pasta, but not enough to return. 

I've wanted to come to this location for a while but hadn't had the chance. And now that we tried it, I think there's way better places. And I'm sure sitting in that lame little room was a factor.
Food and service were excellent. Had the eggplant Parmesan and veal scallopini. The servings were very generous and the price was reasonable. I would definitely return the next time I'm in the area.

looking for good italian (without spending your entire paycheck) in las vegas was a bit difficult, but with the help of good ol yelp! i think i found it!! :) nora's was just as good as all the reviews i read! we had family in town and we were all craving linguine with clams... i decided that i didn't want to spend $35 on the strip for that so decided to go to nora's on flamingo (down the street from the palms) we were very pleased with the experience! as soon as we walked in, we got a big whiff of that yummy garlic aroma! that was the sign *this is going to be a good a$$ dinner*
there were 4 of us and we all ordered something different just so that we could get a taste of the different dishes on the menu... first came the garlic bread! DE-LICIOUS! then the ceasar salad came out, great amount of dressing! not too much, not too little! 
linguine and clams, shrimp scampi over linguine, crazy alfredo and pepperoni pizza were to follow...
we were all very happy with our selections! the clams were small, yet plentiful. the pizza tasted very fresh and oozed with cheese! 
we are all definitely big fans and coming back to nora's when we have that italian food craving! i highly recommend this place for good italian food at a reasonable price!!!  BIG THUMBS UP!!!

Nora's a Las Vegas staple!! It has been around since I was a kid. Me and my family have been going for years. The food is always great! If I am wanting Italian food this is one of those spots that will definitely be considered, it's is in my top 5 Italian restaurants in town. Though the chicken Marsala doesn't come close to my uncles it is one of the many I've tried that comes close. 

I used to love getting the zeppolis for dessert as a kid. They are fried pieces of dough with powdered sugar sprinkled on top. If you've never had Zeppolis definitely give them a try. You won't be disappointed. 

If you have never ate at Nora's I would give it a try if I were you. Very tasty Classic Italian food!

Nora's is definitely an Italian spot you want to hit up if you're into Italian food and wanting to dine away from the strip. I got the Rigatoni special ($15) and my girlfriend got the Alla Nora ($12.50). Both prices and portions were perfect for what we paid. In fact, my dish was probably 60% meat if not more. The ratios for my dish was incredible and left me feeling beyond satisfied. Additionally, I might add that my girlfriend's dish had exquisitely fried and crispy mushrooms to compliment.
Pro tip: don't build your own pasta unless you're willing to spend a lot more. You will get more off the original dishes if you do substitutions. 3 pieces of shrimp (literally 3 pieces only) is a $5 charge and 5 pieces is an $8 charge. To me, that's absurd for an establishment that's not necessarily upscale.
To conclude, I would come back here and try another dish because I know I'd leave satisfied and pleased. However, I'd simply hope that the wait to be served isn't as long. There were probably 2 waiters in our section running around, while 5 other employees were cleaning tables together.

Eating in this old school Italian restaurant you will feel a thousand miles from the Las Vegas strip.  I had to try this local hangout before it moves a few blocks away.
