The house salad with Italian dressing, and the linguini with white clam sauce is one of the best combos you will find this side of Italia.  If you are looking to get away from the lights of the Las Vegas Strip this Italian restaurant will make you feel at home.

Flavorful Italian food, beautiful atmosphere. Definitely make reservations for a Saturday night. We opted for dining on the patio in order to get seated immediately and the staff was so accommodating by making sure the heat lamps were all on. Our waiter Nick and busser Anthony were the best part of our experience. Impeccable and personable service from start to finish. Definitely left smiling and will recommend Nora's.

Another restaurant I like to bring my out of town guests and it never disappoints.  Food is great here and very reasonably priced.  They take reservations and it would be wise to make them since they are usually busy for dinner, especially on Fridays and Saturdays (closed on Sundays).

Classy italian restaurant that'll knock your socks off.    

Went on Sunday 12-20-15 at 6:30 with my yelpy friend Jamie P.  She was nice enough to make us reservations and the place was packed so I'm glad she did that! We had 4 adults and a baby in our party and the hostess threw a hissy fit because she said the reservation is for four....not five people...so we'll have to wait.  I was thinking can't we just pull up a high chair to the table?  The answer was no.  Ended up being seated about 7PM and no food on the table until about 7:40 but that's the *only* puny little complaint that I have.  

$95.83 got us a small 4 Staggioni pizza, a margarita, a whiskey sidecar cocktail, an appetizer of clams, a house salad, a chocolate cake, two coffees, and a ginger ale.  The table and napkins are real white linen and the table is covered by white paper.  Crayola crayons were brought out for my boy which I thought was cool (none of that cheap-o Rose Art shit).  

I originally wanted the Branzino but they were out :( *sad violin noises* 

The clams were hot and fresh and the menu says it comes with 12 but I swear there were at least 2 dozen in my bowl.  The menu says  "12 Manila Clams, Evo, Lemon Parsly" and I'm pretty sure that's not how you spell parsley and shouldn't it be "EVOO" if they are trying to say extra virgin olive oil?  Whatevs....it was $14.95 and the clams were hot and sweet and wonderful.  I only had one that was sandy but the rest were awesome.  

The 4 Staggioni pizza had pizza sauce, sausage, pepperoni, bell peppers, onions, mozzarella, and olives.  The small was $15.45 and worth every penny.  I loved the puffy crust and I'm enjoying the leftovers today as we speak.  

The chocolate cake must be ordered ahead of time (at the time you order your entrees) and was a steal for $6.50.  It is a rich, soft centered, Valrohna chocolate cake adorned by a vanilla sauce and pistachios.  Valrohna is a type of rich chocolate heavy on the cocoa side.  I absolutely loved this.  It's making my mouth water right now just thinking about it! 

With Olive Garden being the only other italian food I've experienced, this place blows it out of the water.  It would be a great place to take a date or family members that come here from out of town.  I liked it a lot!  And I liked the good company even more. *wink wink*

We had 5:30 reservations at Nora's Cuisine for dinner, for my birthday (11/17). Good thing too - by 6:00 it was packed!
This is an Italian place on W Flamingo & Jones, in a strip mall. It gets very good reviews on yelp and TA, has reasonable prices and they do my favorite dish - Veal Marsala. I had signed up for email specials and had a coupon for 1 free appetizer and dessert and another coupon for 10% off. They accepted both coupons! The dining room is all tables and chairs with butcher paper topped white tablecloths. The entire ceiling is covered in trinacria (the 3-legged symbol on the Sicilian flag). Casual enough for jeans. The lady at the next table was also celebrating her birthday, today! Again, small world. She said I had to try the Berry Explosive - she was RIGHT! The food was the best Italian we've had in 20 years - I kid you not - I wish I could write a description of how it tastes besides saying OMG it was good!

Garlic Bread
Arancini (4) for an appetizer
Crazy Alfredo for hubby
Veal Marsala for me
Tiramisu for dessert
Berry Explosive (I'm hooked - it went well with the meal too - go figure)
Jack for hubby

The bill came to $49.00 - deal of the century for food & drink this good! I'll never come to LV again without eating at least one meal here.

I saw this place on yelp before coming to Vegas and I knew I had to try it. My boyfriend and I sat at the bar and we were immediately greeted by the bartender Michelle, she was amazing and super friendly! Anyways we ordered the calamari appetizer which was very good. For our meals my boyfriend got some seafood pasta he said it was pretty good.  I got the shrimp scampi which was also really good. The portions here are huge, we had a lot of food left over but we didn't end up bringing it home with us since we had no microwave in the hotel room.  I suggest either coming here on a empty stomach or sharing a dish with someone.  We definitely plan on coming back next time we're in Vegas which will hopefully be soon!

This place was amazing. I ordered the salmon piccata . My husband had the rigatoni special. We both loved our food. The server was very nice and efficient.  The prices are good. The wine was great, I highly recommend the fried risotto balls for an appetizer. We came here to celebrate Valentine's Day. It was such a nice dinner. I highly recommend coming here. We made reservations just to be safe and got seated right away.

My daughter and son in law took me here for my birthday and it was the first visit for all of us. We had a reservation made the day before but when we got there we had no table and had to wait about 15 minutes. Why make a reservation ??? The receptionists were not welcoming or very friendly however the wait staff was efficient. We tried several appetizers and all had different main courses and tiramisu for desert. The food was good but certainly not great and definitely not worth driving all across town to dine there. We tried it but we won't go back !!!

After seeing the response from the manager/owner I feel compelled to update. 

Look, I'm not insulting your customers, I'm insulting your food. Actually, the description I gave was more a compliment because I could have been a lot more brutal. 

It's kind of like The Varsity in Atlanta. If you like greasy burgers in cheap white buns, somewhat  average chili over an even more average hot dog, then it's your place! The place has been around for years and it has a loyal band of Georgia Tech alumni that would swear by nothing else. To them, it's comfort food and brings back memories of their school days - and that's great. It's been around for 50 years and it'll be there another 50 years... It doesn't change the fact that the food is crap but their customers will rave about how great it is. 

I think it must be the same with your place. You have loyal customers, for whatever reason, but don't even begin to pretend that you're dishing out good Italian food, because you're not. Well, not to me you aren't. I'm comparing it to Italian food that I know to be good. I've been all over the world - including Italy - and I know the difference. Your food is no different to what you would get out of a Stouffers box or at an Olive Garden.

went there for our daughter's birthday-food was delicious as usual, service
was fine

An Italian restaurant.  The portions are MASSIVE and are easily big enough for 2 people to share.  The ambiance is similar to an Italian restaurant kind of like Macaroni Grill but much nicer.  Service is friendly.

Complimentary garlic bread - Really good, 4/5
The bread is super good.  I believe only 1 basket is served per table but it's great.  

Crazy Alfredo - $23 - solid 4/5
As noted above, the portions are massive on this thing & big enough for 2 people to share.  The pasta is solid.  Comes w/ chicken, sausage, shrimp, and jalapenos.   I'm not sure if the jalapenos are necessary but it's pretty good.

Appetizers worth mentioning -
Bruschetta - Average, 3/5
Shrimp appetizer - average, 3/5
Caesar salad - pretty good, 3.5/5

Pizza - I didn't like the pizza.  The crust is extremely thin, which is what I like, but it was soggy and flaccid.  It fell apart when I tried to eat it.

Have been wanting to try Noras for quite some now to experience the hype it's known for. Food was absolutely delicious (was a little disappointed they were out of clams) however our sever (Erica I believe was she name) talked us into the mussels with the lemon prep and WOW! The energy gave of very welcoming and family oriented. We sat outside and watched numerous patrons and families keep coming in (even though it was Memorial Day and were closed an hour early) Noras seemed to keep welcoming all! My only reason for 4 stars was the service overall was slower than expected however we will return and keep the hype alive!

I think the thing I love most about Nora's is that it is a little bit casual and a little bit dressy, oh and the food! The tables are covered in white linens and butcher paper which gives it a formal feel without the pretentiousness and cost. Whenever my parents are in town we head straight to Nora's to appease my Italian loving dad.

The Italian food is hearty and delicious. Every table starts with a basket of crunchy garlic bread. The pieces are covered in garlic and a good size, so you won't feel so guilty about eating 10 of them. You want to order an appetizer, either the mozzarella caprese or an antipasto, trust me they are both seasoned perfectly and hit the spot. My current favorite pasta is the Rigatoni Special, I mean it has meatballs AND sausage, you can't go wrong! I will say that I have had the lasagna and I'm not such a fan. It wasn't really special and I'm pretty sure mine is better. My husband always gets the Pork Tenderloin alla Siciliana. The pork is melt in your mouth tender and the side of potatoes really puts it over the top. My dad is a sucker for their giant bone in Rib-eye, seriously it's giant so bring your appetite. The pizza is just as good as the pasta, but I always end up ordering pasta. Oh and be sure to pre-order the chocolate cake, you want the chocolate cake! It's so melt-ey and molten-ey and lava-ey, all the -ey!

Nora's is really the best bang for your buck when it comes to Italian food in Las Vegas. The prices are good, the ambiance is great, and the food is fantastic!

We came to Nora's after reading the reviews on Yelp....
I live in. Orange County Ca.....New York & London and Im 3rd generation in the food business....
I consider Las Vegas to have the finest restaurants in the USA.....
So.....in that light....
I was quite disappointed with the meals we ordered at Noras....
Scarpetta......El Molina and Ferraros are all 3 head and shoulders better than Noras....
Atmosphere.....staff and service were all very very good and Noras....
Food quality excellent.....BUT execution in the flavor department......was lacking....
I was disappointed.....they could be a 5 star Vegas based restaurant.....but it isnt  now.....

Best server in town!
We had a great meal at Noras tonight but what made our experience really special was the server, Don! He was the perfect combination of professional and super friendly. He made great menu suggestions which we took and we loved our food. I had the Oso Buco and my husband had the Gorgonzola topped filet. They were both very good and my husband especially liked the fresh, grilled veggies that go with the filet; they were arranged beautifully and had a super smoky flavor.

I would certainly recommend Nora's for a fine dining experience. Ask for Don, he's the one with the beautiful smile.

Got some takeout from here today..

Ordered the Crazy Alfredo
Caesar Salad
Calamari

Everything was pretty good, but honestly nothing really stood out to me as craveworthy.

Crazy Alfredo was pretty good, a TON of meat. Pretty rare that you run out of noodles before protein, but I was left with a pile of chicken and sausage after all the noodles were gone. Flavor of the sauce was decent, tasted like a bell pepper alfredo sauce.

Caesar salad was a bit disappointing. Not bad by any means, but it is pretty hard to mess up a caesar salad. The dressing was just a bit too creamy for my liking and didnt have that tangy salty flavor Im used to with caesar salads. Could use some shaved parmesan too.

Calamari was just good, pretty basic dish. The sauce was interesting though.

The main downsides were an hour wait for pickup even though the restaurant wasnt exactly packed, there were plenty of open tables. Price was a bit steep, came out to $50 for an entree appetizer and salad. Also I specifically asked if the meal comes with garlic bread and was told yes, and they forgot to put it in the bag.. pasta without garlic bread is just sad..

Probably wont come back here for a while to be honest, just nothing to write home about, and so many other places with better tasting food in Vegas for much cheaper.

Service really really sucks. Food was great but overall experience left us with a bad taste in our mouths. Came here with a party of 5. We sat outside and ordered drinks and food. Food came out and drinks came out before our utensils. We had to ask 3 different people until we finally saw our server to let her know about the utensils. We also ordered 2 bottles of wine and the server just dropped them off without opening them. She walked away expecting us to have our own wine opener. Manager excused it as her being new. I guess common sense isn't part of the job application. Came here to celebrate but left very underwhelmed. The old Nora's has way better service than this place. Sucks so bad.
We love this place I have been here on many different occasions. My sons 9th birthday, we bring Everyone that visits us to this place because of the great food. We shall see you soon Nora's

My friend and I went out to try this place for the first time after having it recommended to us several times. It's was FANTASTIC. Our waiter Sebastiano was so sweet. And whoever was working the grill was on point! Will definitely be going back.

This is one of my favorite Italian places in town ! The ambience is very classy with live music playing the numerous times I've been here, definitely a great date spot. One of my favorite dishes, which is one of the more basic dishes, is the cheese tortellini with alfredo sauce. Oh and be sure to pre order the warm chocolate cake you won't be disappointed !!

Nora's is my go to Italian spot. The food there is amazing. I even had them cater my wedding rehearsal dinner. Today I tried the shrimp scampi appetizer and loved it. You should definitely dip the bread in the sauce. Service is great but it can get crowded during peak times.

We never go to Vegas without visiting Nora's. The best pizza in my opinion. I don't have to ask for extra sauce or thin crust. They do it all perfect.
The prices are great for the portion sizes that you get  The garlic bread is amazing. They bring the first basket to you complimentary.
So far, I have not had anything there that I didn't love.
Waiters are professional and quick.

WOW GREAT FOOD! First timer very impressed. Waitstaff friendly food was good. Prices were more then reasonable. Too bad it took me so long to find this place. I wish it was bigger so we could walk in and eat when ever we wanted . But reservations is the way. You must make them or you will wait. Possibly not eat.

Pros: The food tasted good, prepared well. Service was good.

Cons: The dessert was frozen solid.

The caesar salad had a nice thick dressing and the croutons were great. The gnocchi were like little pillows, but the accompanying alfredo sauce had a weird, subtle seafood taste to it. The spaghetti was al dente, and had a nice herby marinara sauce. The cookies & cream tartufo was served frozen solid.

Meh, this place is alright. We tried to make a reservation but the lady on the phone was unintelligible so we just went and had to wait about 15 minutes for a table. We sat in the "kitchen area" which is not a great place to sit due to all the servers constantly going back and forth. 

Once seated expect the server to make a concerted effort to get the table to get a salad (which are $11.50 to $17.90). The unaware diner might get the sense that they come with dinner as the servers never really let on that it doesn't and you have to pay for it. 

Of the 3 dishes our group got I'd only recommend the Fettuccine Carbonara which is alfredo sauce, ham & prosciutto. If you're on a diet you may want to steer clear though as there is some serious fat in this dish....we took the remainder to go and after being refrigerated the fats all solidified into a hard pasta-brick. Hmmmm.

The Alla Nora is over-rated. For one thing the spaghetti was overcooked so bad that I could never twirl it into a forkful...the spaghettis would simply break so I had all these tiny sections I had to fork up. Plus it says there is eggplant in it but I couldn't find any...? Meh.

I have been coming to Nora's for probably the past 15 plus years and have never had a bad experience. Glad they opened the new larger location, but reservations are still highly recommended no matter what day of the week it is. I love the caprese and antipasto salads. For pasta, the Alla Nora is probably one of my favorites. And their specialty cocktails are amazing! They also have gluten free penne pasta. Nora's is my happy place!

Service has dropped off since the move but large numbers keep coming.   Food is great to make up for the service drop off.  Time will tell if owners care about customers and service.  It is a decision they need to make soon!  Bad habits are hard to change. Nicer location is not an excuse for a decline in service

The portions were fantastic, thank you. We got the lasagna, rigatoni, meatballs, etc. Salads were so big and everything was fresh. The garlic bread was great. For 8 people, it was a feast. We highly recommend this place. It made for a perfect Christmas Party at our office.

I LOVE this place!!  We went with friends and had an array of amazing appetizers (Bruschetta, clams, rice balls, shrimp scampi, Calamari, to name a few)!! The wine was perfectly selected!!  We were so completely satisfied, we skipped entrees and went straight to the dessert!!! The Tirimasu is authentic and delicious!!! I can't wait to go back (tomorrow night)!!  The whole experience was great!!!

I came here with my family for my birthday dinner. Found them on yelp, trying new restaurants. The ambiance and decor was amazing. Our server was very attentive. We had truffle fries for an appetizer, and they were also amazing. The bread is made to order and fresh. All of our food was beyond expectations. We will definitely be back.

This is the best Italian food found outside of Rome! Skip the Strip and go visit Nora's stunning new building on Flamingo!! 

This place was actually the first restaurant recommended to me by an Uber driver when I moved to Vegas over a year ago, and at that time it was still in the little strip mall up the street. It was my favorite then and it is my favorite now. 

The food is to die for. There really aren't even words to describe how perfect this restaurant it. The quality, for the portions for the price cannot be beat and you'll always go home with leftovers that still manage to taste as delicious as they did hot out of the oven! 

The wait staff was professional, knowledgable and attentive and the food came out hot, well-plated and absolutely delicious. (Although I almost could've dined on the pre-dinner garlic bread alone!) 

My one and only complaint was that, when I made my reservation online, I specifically put in the notes asking for a "quiet table," or one with a nice view, as this was a (very promising) First Date. To my disappointment, the Hostess placed us right by the door and next to a party of 8. Fortunately, they arrived towards the end of the meal, but the restaurant was not packed and it was a shame my request could not be honored, or even acknowledged. 

Not to worry, the date still went very well, and I'm sure we'll be back for another one in the very near future!
We love the food.  Great atmosphere.  Good selection of Grapa.  Staff is very friendly.  A little on the pricey side

Nora's was a favorite of my husband and I for years, however, on the recent visit here, the service was horrible . Our waitress was rude and inattentive. On top of the bad service, the food was greasy and not as flavorful. Would not go back!

Been wanting to try out the new place since I saw the building going up ! Super excited about it ! Used to dine at Nora's small place all the time . Friend from work and I decided to go this past Thursday night at 8 pm. The place was packed . We went on a wait and decided to take seats at bar when they opened up . I'm not a crazy yelper so I will just share my honest opinion ...We work at a small Italian restaurant on the Strip but we love Nora's and we couldn't wait to try the food, as he's never eaten here. Food was awesome . We shared a white pizza , mussels , truffle fries and bruschetta appetizer . Food was on point , hot , fresh and the bill was only $46 . Pasta will be next time as we will return !!! We had such a good time, we sat at the bar and laughed, talked, watched the game,watched the hustle and bustle of the night... only low point was the younger male bartender . Rudest service I have had in a very long time. Never once said hi to us when we sat down . We had to ask for menus , ask to order , sat with piles of dirty dishes at the end is our meals , he asked me to move my purse so I would not hit his shaker cups, just plain nasty. Have us dirty looks all night . I mean we were dresses nice, we are polite , we work in the business , 20+ years for me and 35 + for my friend , we didn't ask for anything but menus and to order. The 2 female bartenders were busting their butts back there. When we first walked in to hostess desk , we put out name on the list and went to bar to get a drink, the dark hair bartender , young was super sweet and made one kick butt martini, probably one of the best I have ever had . Me and my friend actually talked about it for 2 days! It was perfectly crafted . So all and all , the experience was awesome , I will be back and I'm super excited about Nora's but thought the bartender should be aware that he should be a little nicer to his guests . I mean I know we can all have a bad day but it was almost uncomfortable sitting there at the bar for some reason with him . Anyways Nora's you guys ROCK!!!!$

Finally found a Italian place worth returning  amazing from apps to main course. The only thing I would say negative is the room they put us in was freezing so I asked to move into main room other than that I would definitely give it a perfect review.

I was in Las Vegas over the weekend for a half marathon - so naturally I needed to carb up pre-race. My friend found Nora's through Yelp and the Vegas Yelpers did not steer us wrong! What a delightful place. The ambiance was much more than expected for a strip mall, and the wait staff was pleasant and the food was SO good. The garlic bread was addicting and we had two family-style salads which were delish. I had spaghetti with eggplant, ground beef and red sauce for my entree and it was very good. The only very small hitch was that we traveled with a vegan who wasn't able to eat the pasta because it's made fresh with eggs. For us non-vegans, that was a big plus! For the vegan, he ended up with a small pizza with some red sauce and veggies (no cheese) and a salad. Still pretty good! 

Although I don't get to Vegas often, when I do I hope to make it to Nora's again. Enjoy!

I thought Nora's Cuisine was expensive for what it was. For an appetizer, I tried the calamari and the taste was forgettable. For dinner,  I had the Fettuccine Alfredo with Chicken and that was good. They also had garlic bread, but I didn't really care for it. Something in my gut really, really wants me to like this place more. Maybe because the rest of the party enjoyed it or maybe I didn't order the right thing. We'll see if I ever make my way back.

Since I last reviewed Nora's two months ago, I have been here twice more, and each time it just gets better and better.  Wonderful food smells of pizza and other Italian delicacies strike one's nostrils as soon as the front door is opened; the friendly service has remained generally excellent regardless who I was served by; and the food has continued to be piping hot and always delicious.  I now realize that the Veal Parmigiana is as good and tender as the Veal Marsala; the Garlic Bread is consistently delectable (my group of 4 polished off 2 baskets); and the Chicken Soup is on the same high plane as the homemade Pasta Fagioli.

On my latest foray I enjoyed Antipasto Salad, and could barely finish half of it.  I look forward to eating the remainder later at lunch today.  Topped by chunks of fresh Mozzarella Cheese, folded over curls of tasty ham mixed with leafy greens, ripe wedges of red tomato, black olives, pepperoncini, and more, all coated with a dripping light Italian Dressing, beckon.

The Chicken Soup, which I was smart enough to order as a bowl rather than a cup, contained thin lengths of chicken just as I preferred, mixed with cooked celery and pieces of tomato, swimming in a hot, very tasty chicken broth.  It took many tablespoonfuls for me to finish it all, and almost ruined my appetite.  But not quite!

With considerable effort I also finished off a large cheesy and tomato sauce-covered medallion of Veal Parmigiana accompanied by smoking Spaghetti Bolognese with mushrooms added, as I had decreed.  Diane got a requested bowl of extra Alfredo Sauce to ladle over her Veal and Penne Alfredo at no extra charge.  Here one can have whatever the tummy desires!

For good reason, Nora's will remain one of my several fine, go-to Italian restaurants in Vegas!

We were there 3/27 Service was awfully, waited for a food more than an hour. Steak was burned. Waited for the check for 30 minutes, and seems like no one cared about it unless we asked 3 times. We never saw our waiter to asked for anything.

Nora's was recommended to me by a local, while on a flight. She said, "if you want the best food in Vegas, go off the strip to Nora's."  Finally made it there tonight and it didn't disappoint. I had the Salmon Piccata, which was fantastic. Cooked just right and paired well with spinach and capers. Great flavor. Also had a caesar salad and garlic bread and both were great. Got the food to go, so didn't experience the service, but the hostesses were very pleasant and helpful. The restaurant had a really cool vibe to it.

Love Nora's!!
After several visits to the original location I don't think I've sampled anything on the menu that wasn't amazing! 
The Gnocchi is definitely homemade as it's not too tough or too soft (the Vodka sauce with this dish makes for a great pairing).  The pizza is also amazing (NY style and not greasy). 
The waitstaff is always very friendly and attentive.

Make reservations as the dining room is fairly small and the wait for a table could be long if you're a walk-up.
The only semi-negative comment I have about Nora's is the dinning room (wish it was a big larger as the space tends to fill up with conversation and become loud during a busy night).

I like the food and atmosphere at Nora's, and the prices aren't terrible. Their dishes are a good size and flavorful. I had a chicken dish the last time I went, which was delicious. I don't remember it's exact name, but it was one of the dishes not served with pasta. The sauce was fantastic. The desserts are good, too. I'd recommend coming her for Italian food that is not at a chain restaurant.
What a beautiful NYE dinner! Great service and so delicious!! Sebastiani and his assistant, Marco gave us beautiful service. We enjoyed ourselves immensely thank you!! We will definitely return!

We went on a Sunday night.  The restaurant has two rooms to seat people.  In our room were two other tables.  We ordered our meals.  We got garlic bread, which was great.  While we were waiting for dinner it took the waiter a long time to refill our waters.  He was walking around and passed by our table a few times without checking on us.  Once we got our meals, which took a bit of time because of the large party in the other room, the food was great.  I ordered a cup of coffee, $2.00+, with desert.  We were very polite and understanding during the long waits.  I drank my coffee and waited for a refill and he would just walk by.  He came by once and I asked if I could get a refill and he was a little put out by my asking.  The real slap in the face came when the manager came by and I voiced my disappointment with out service with her.  I was polite and said I had heard such good things about the restaurant I was surprised at the service.  Her only action was to "give" us a calendar of their recipes.  Which I had seen her give out to everyone who came through the door.  The food was great however I won't be going back again.  There are many other places to spend my money for real local food.
Great food ..!!  Ok service ..!!  The new location is convenient to get to.  They are a little scattered when they get busy.  Good to see the same quality of food ..!!

Great atmosphere. Don our server very polite n courteous   Food was very tasty. Basic menu with daily specials. But again very flavorful. Friends recommended this place   Will definitely come back to try other dishes 

2nd update. It's been 6 months later. Back in town, one of the favorite places to go.

I used to really love this place. Since they've moved to a bigger place and have hired a bigger staff, somehow they've gained this weird, shitty attitude. If you can't accommodate your customers with their large amount of extra seating you have, then hire a larger staff. Isn't that why you moved into a bigger building in the first place? For more business? I called around 7 pm on a Tuesday, was told it would be a 25-35 minute wait which I was not happy with but because I really love their food, I was willing to wait. I literally walked into the restaurant 5 minutes later and was told that it would then be an hour long wait due to their "reservations and walk-ins" coming in just recently. They don't accept reservations for less than an hour when you call but yet an hour wait is somehow acceptable to them. Sad.

Yuck!  I visited this place with a friend after a number of people recommended it to us.  Food was inedible!  We ordered a salad that was wilted and drenched in bottled dressing, pasta puttanesca (which we figured no one could screw up - but lo and behold, they destroyed it), and a veal dish.  We had to send the veal back because it was so tough and chewy, they very graciously took it back to the kitchen, but sent a new one to us that was just as terrible.  We didn't eat hardly anything and then left without even taking the food home as it was that bad.  We couldn't figure out why anyone would recommend it.  I do have to say the service was very good, but that's the only redeeming thing we found about it.

A must for amazing authentic Italian cuisine.  Went with my resident Italian chef and he gave it a thumbs up.  The steak rivals those from steak houses.  The Cheese Tortellini is perfection.  I loved the spinich/ricotta cheese pizza.  
The food is amazing, but the service may be a bit slow.  We went for 9:30 dinner on a Saturday night, the service started great then slowed... Had to wait on water refills and kitchen was slow, tough the food/wait is worth it.  If you go to Vegas and like Italian, this place is definitely worth checking out.
I love this place. I love their italian antipasti salad. YUM! :) Our server was very attentive. I can't wait until they open their new location.

I love this place!!! The ambiance is great, with live music on the weekend.  I had the bruschetta and rigatoni gorgonzola both were great.  The rigatoni chicken was so go I didn't want to eat it all because I wanted to eat some later to enjoy it twice.  Get here early or make reservations.

DL and I were promised a free breakfast and a $100 Visa gift card just for "touring" some new Time Share units and giving our "opinion".  An offer we couldn't refuse.  After 1 1/2 hrs. of unrelenting, hard sell, we left the sales office feeling even $200 wouldn't have been compensation enough.  The only good thing to come of the grilled-over-the-coals experience was the salesman's recommendation of Nora's.  We decided to take the Visa card and go there for dinner.  All I can is, "all's well that ends well", and it all ended very well, indeed.  The salesman has redeemed himself with  us!   

We're barflies and love to eat and drink at the bar.  It's a great place to sit if you don't want to be rushed or have your dinner tete a tete constantly disturbed by well-meaning waitstaff.  Love Nora's white and gray-streaked, beveled marble bar.  Elegant.  You could slice cheese on it!  I like my Manhattan's chilled to almost frozen and I told our friendly bartender to "shake the hell out of it."  He shook it all up like Elvis and poured it into a thickly frosted martini glass.  Peeling the lemon was a show in itself.  

Our first order was a tower of veggies--zucc., eggplant, Belgian endive, all topped with two fat slices of red bell pepper and arriving perfectly blistered from its bake in the wood burning oven.  You could taste the mellow woodiness in every bite.  Each leaf and ingredient in the house salad was lightly coated with the most perfectly balanced and seasoned House made Italian dressing.  I've been trying for decades to make a dressing like that at home, and still haven't succeeded.  We finished the entire generous portion between the two of us--a first for salads for us.  We usually get bored halfway through.   

The pizza was made with all imported cold cuts.  Flavor burst from all points on the compass with every bite.  It's the kind you can fold and eat neatly.  The crust, including the bottom, was browned and lightly charred and I saved a few crusts from the rim to have with my coffee this morning. The surrounding crust was surprisingly light to the touch even though it had the appearance of a dense peasant bread.  You won't break your teeth on it.  Nowadays, pizza has come to mean "salty, oily, and characterless", as in almost all chain foods.  Or overly precious and pristine, (think "white" pizza) as in many high-end bistros.  If you're bored with all that--you are in for a surprise.     We are relatively newcomers to Malbec and don't count ourselves among the experts.  We got the least expensive bottle and were well pleased.  It complemented and held its own against this hearty fare.    

An interesting aside:  How do all the girls gathered around the reservation podium stay so anorexically thin with all those aromas and glorious visuals swirling around all night?  Inquiring minds want to know.

New location is nice.  Much nicer than the original place however, it is overshadowed by the TERRIBLE service.  They greet you well in coming in but after that, the service took 2 hours to get lunch (and they were not even crowded).   The waiter was non-responsive or attentive and more interested about talking to his/her fellow co-workers.  

Lastly, we had to request for our bill half way through the meal since we did not have any more time to waste for lunch and they had to manually take our credit card number down since their POS register was down.    Now I am concerned about credit card fraud.

I went on a date with my girlfriend here because we passed by Nora's several times and thought it looked nice from the outside. I made a reservation for 8:30 on 11/4/17 It was already a late dinner but we took it because that's the only time they had available. We got there at about 8:15 and told the hostess that we are there for our 8:30 reservation... we weren't seated until about 9:10. It was ridiculous!!! At that point we wanted to leave already because we were so aggravated with the staff and their scheduling. I tried to ask the hostess about 4 times if we are going to be seated anytime soon, she answered   
"give me a couple of seconds" every time. Our experience started off terribly but after we got seated things went alright. We both got different types of pasta and it was pretty good. But when I got close to the bottom of my plate there was so much oil I had never seen that much oil in a plate before, It was pretty gross. Safe to say I will never go back to this place again.

I have been to Nora's a few times now, the service is always impeccable. The first time I went I had lasagna and it was smothered in so much cheese, I barley picked at it. I did enjoy my soup & bread. 

I made a return about a week later and opted for the Chicken Carciofi. I don't enjoy meals that are overly buttery, greasy, heavy, so I asked the server about the dish. My plate was amazing I finished every last bit. They won me over.

Great renovation! Beautiful place maybe eliminate some of the tables sitting next to the kitchen made me feel less than special. That seat shouldn't exist.
The food was delicious. I had a red sauce pasta recommended by our waiter. This place is really loud! The tables are way to close to the bar so I felt like I had to scream across the table. Also people are standing up around the bar area. Maybe as a courtesy to the table guest they should be politely asked to have a seat.
There is a patio area can't wait to take advantage.
5 stars with hopes of serious change considerations.
We will return..

Excellent, excellent food - and even better service! We had a house salad for the table, and a bottle of the Chicanti wine (both were delicious). For my main course, I ordered the Rigatoni Special, with meatballs, sausage, onions, bell peppers, and tomato sauce. It was delectable. The meat was cooked to perfection, and the noodles were just the right amount of al dente. Our server / waitress was incredibly attentive. Not once was my water glass less than half full, and whenever my wine glass approached empty, she was there to pour me another from the bottle. Thank you, Nora's! We will definitely be back again.

Dined at Nora's tonight, recently moved within a few blocks of it. I knew it was popular so a few minutes wait for a seat at the bar didn't bother me. I was dining alone, Michelle was pleasant and attentive. Had two glasses of a Sauvignon Blanc which I felt was just about right for portion size and price. My (smaller) size Caesar Salad could have been a little bigger, and I like larger croutons than what they serve. However the extra taste of anchovy in the dressing was a welcomed treat. Too many Italian restaurants these days seem apprehensive to add a little of the salty goodness. The initial basket of garlic bread was too soft, and more of a "butter sponge," would have preferred some crispiness in it. I ordered the Linguini with white clams. Michelle paced the meal just right, it was served very hot, thank you! Pasta was a perfect al dente, sauce was very enjoyable with a nice balance of garlic, herbs, and butter. I requested a few slices of an alternate bread to finish the bottom of my bowl. A nice hot french style bread was brought and I preferred it way over the first serving. Did not partake of dessert, I rarely do after an Italian meal. 
  So glad to have this kind of quality restaurant in my neighborhood, don't have to drive, and park, at the Strip for a great meal. Plus I appreciate the neighborhood prices. Very lively atmosphere! Happy people all around and music at the right volume. I'll be back!

My mom wanted to try an Italian place while we were in Vegas and we thought the reviews looked good. It doesn't look very fancy from the outside but we were very impressed by the time we left! I had the Crazy Alfredo and have wanted it for every meal since! 
I would eat at Noras every time I go to Vegas!

Finally.  After a good 6 years of knowing about this place, really ever since dining at the old/extinct location on Rampart/Charleston like 20 times, it was about time I came to the original.

As I understand, they've expanded onto the original.  What used to be a pizza kitchen with 3 tables, went left, and went right, and now has 3 distinct rooms with 3 distinct different feels.  When reserving a table, make sure you specify.  The family room (quiet and better for families), the casual (still 3 tables, attached to the kitchen), and the ritzy (connected to the bar, very nice, and hip).  PS.  One little TV in the bar doesn't quite cut it.

(1)  One free Sangria with Yelp check-in with 1 purchased.  A $7.50 value, giddy up.  Could be more fruity and less sharp.  (4.0 stars)

(2)  Pasta alla Nora ($12.50) -- It has everything I wanted.  Pesto, meat sauce, eggplant, and pasta.  I added a meatball for $1.50, and it exactly fixed the spot.  Huge portion.  (4.0 stars)

(3)  The Melrose with Shrimp ($17.50) -- a creamy pesto sauce with sun-dried tomatoes, pine nuts, and medium-size shrimp.  A little heavy-handed with the sauce, but better than not enough.  (4.5 stars)
 
The service was nice, but wavered between unavailable and forgetful.  Overall, this place just makes me happy.  It would totally be my everyday place if I was local.  For out-of-towners, if you are looking for an easy-peasy spot away from the strip, this is your place.
Totally love this place!  My family loves to get the back private room every year for Christmas.  Their appetiser platter is the best!

We went here on a Friday night and enjoyed a good meal. Hubby had a baked pasta, and I had their pasta special with chicken, shrimp, etc. with Alfredo sauce. Both dishes had tons of pasta! 

Hubby's dish tasted really good. I liked the tomato sauce. My dish was eh, for me. All of the meats were good, but the sauce lacked flavor for me. 

We ordered desserts: a chocolate thing and the panna cotta. Both really good. The coffee was incredible! 

The service was nice and prompt. We'd return to this place.
love the joint!  'nuff said, let's eat

I literally have no complaints about this place. The food was FANTASTIC. Everything from the drinks to the apps to the entrees was delicious! Even the garlic bread that comes to the table was amazing! I had the penne a la vodka and added some veggies...it sounds basic but somehow they took this average dish and made it amazing! Our server was very friendly and service was fairly fast. Will go back every time I'm in Vegas!

Best Italian food in Vegas!!!!

10.0- Arancini balls are amazing. You can't just eat 1. So addicting

10.0-- fettuccini carbonara with chicken. Alfredo sauce was great!!! Best that I have ever tasted. Very authentic and fresh tasting

As I mentioned before, this is my favorite Italian restaurant.  Since it is on the other side of town, I rarely get to come here and I usually do so to celebrate my birthday every year.  The past couple of years have been awful.  I went this past weekend for my birthday dinner.  I had mentioned to them that last year they didn't have the warm chocolate cake, and I pre-ordered two of them and double checked to make sure it wouldn't be forgotten again this year. Sure enough, our waitress admitted she forgot to put in the order.  So we had to wait a long time after we were done eating dinner just so I could have the cake.  This wouldn't be a huge issue, except that the service was so awful and slow the entire time.  We were there almost 3 hours because it was so bad.  If the food weren't so good, I would never come back again.  Please hire better servers at this place!

I guess their one bad dish is the one I got...Chicken Parm.  It was tiny (definitely not $13 worth of chicken-I actually thought it was an appetizer).  It's not breaded and had no taste.  Their marinara is pretty bland, very watery.  I noticed most everyone on here gets a dish that doesn't involve their marinara.  Their garlic bread was good.  My son liked the Fettuccine Alfredo a lot.  The service was friendly, but slow to get the food to the table.

I guess I would try this again, but would order something different.  Do not get the Chicken Parm.

We were there for dinner Sunday evening. I had the Cannelloni and it was very tasty...  The sauce and filling were delicious.  The service was fabulous and everyone in our party of seven each enjoyed their meals a lot. It was our first time there - and we will be back.  I had a comment and they emailed me back the next day.  Yep - we'll be back.

Went there today for Valentine's after reading the great reviews!  Well obviously people in LV do not know what good Italian food is!  OMG the most awful meal we  have ever had. Hubby order Veal Milanese and I had the Alla Nora as it was recommended to me.  Well the Veal Milanese was over fried like a piece of shoe leather  - practically burnt and bone dry - no sauce  as it did not come with any  - seriously!!  A dried out piece of veal!!  Any the Alla Nora was a grease pit of spaghetti and burnt eggplant - the worst thing I ever tasted!  The server did not even care that I did not eat it.  He was pleasant though.. like we said he did not do the cooking.  As for the antipasto - not much on it - boring!   First and last time going there...
Finally we went after hearing so many positive responses about this place. Great place, amazing food and superior customer service. Definitely will be back

I've been here on quite a few occasions and I have to say that I've never been entirely enthralled by this place. 

The food is just ok, nothing amazing. The pasta is generic and not particularly flavorful. A little on the overpriced side as well. I enjoy the garlic bread, which is pretty good. I have had some very good baked ziti, so that's been the saving grace here. 

The service is ok, but I get irked at having to wait for a table here. There's always a long wait. There are better Italian restaurants in town and there are worse.

We came here today for lunch. Took awhile to get our order but that's because the bartender was also acting as a server. I had a cappuccino (yum) and the chicken Marsala with a house salad. My husband had the pork tenderloin. Both were so yummy! Perfect! I also really like the ambiance in here, white marble bar and brick interior very classy. Just found a new Italian spot without strip pricing!

The food was excellent with pasta which i would say was homemade. Was with a party of six and we all enjoyed of food vey much but the service was horrible. If you go there and like eggplant check it out. My five year old and her friend loved the pizza and both had 2 pieces and some pasta which is great for little ones. Might have givven it five stars but they really must work on their service issues. By the way make reservations if your going after 6pm...

This is a true local gem.  We found it during a downpour.  The food is a delight.  Very authentic and beautifully plated.  This service was absolutely impeccable!  Foodies everywhere need to try this gem.  We all had different items ,  Chicken Marsala, Veal Canneloni and the Crazy Alfredo.  All were perfectly prepared.  This place is also child friendly.  The servers are so kind, providing crayons and making sure the wait isn't too long.  I highly recommend.

This is supposed to be the best Italian in Las Vegas . It was a huge disappointment. Party of 7 reservations at 7:30 on a Saturday night ; we waited 25 minutes past our time for them to squeeze us on a table that fits 5 comfortably. Ridiculous. Then the lighting was that of a cafeteria scene. This is supposed to be a nice Italian restaurant. Not McDonalds . It was noisy. We might as well of went to a buffet for the ambience and the food quality. Food was greasy and had no flavor . Terrible experience.  Won't try again .

Nora's is my favorite Italian restaurant in the valley.  I've eaten in many times, picked up food and pizza to go, and recommended this place to many friends.

The restaurant is decently sized with two dinning rooms on either side of the kitchen & main room, adequately lit, and is warm and cozy.  The service has consistently been genuine and friendly.

For starters, the garlic bread is delicious.  I always have to remember to stop eating it so I can save room for my actual entree!  That and I don't want to smell like garlic on date night.
The gnocchi and vodka sauce are a delicious combo.  I'm a meat and starch kind of girl, but that dish is so good on it's own I don't even need to throw in anything extra.
The crazy alfredo is crazy huge and packed with so many ingredients and flavor.  This dish could probably feed two people.
When it's a special, you MUST order the osso buco.  It's much more pricey than normal Nora's items (~$35), but it's soooo worth it.  It comes with a little spoon for the bone marrow, which is absolutely delectable.  This is my favorite dish in the world, and it nears perfection here.

If you're an Olive Garden/Carrabas/chain Italian restaurant kind of person, give yourself a well deserved real Italian meal and go to Nora's.  It doesn't disappoint.

Date night seal of approval!

Before last night I would have always given Nora's a 5 star!  Last night something went terribly wrong.  I will go back again with the expectation that it was a BAD night.  I have been going for years.  I ALWAYS got the Baked Ziti until the past year I discovered the Crazy Alfredo.  If I'm going to splurge and have pasta, this is the dish I usually want.  But deciding between the two can be difficult.  Not anymore.  Last night I felt like red sauce so ordered the ziti which I just had in early Jan and they hadn't done THIS to it.  It's $13.95 and they reduced it to about a 1/3 the size.  I think I could have counted the number of macaroni in the (no more than) 3/4 in shallow dish about 5 inches in diameter.  Whaaaaaaaaaat are you doing?!  My companion order the Crazy Alfredo and it looked to be the usual dish/portion.  And he loved it!  You could always count on Nora's to be consistent in the past.  You never had to worry about what you would get but last night was far from the usual.  My ziti was always piping when it hit the table.  Last night I could eat it straight away.  We actually waited quite a while for our food.  After I got mine, I think it was because it had been sitting up on the line for awhile or they found some from the lunch hour to re-heat.  (A side note, Nora's, I was a little perturbed that after I told the busboy twice to leave the remaining bread on the table, that at some point while I was in conversation he came by the table and picked it up.  Trust me that you need to reiterate to your bus staff not to clear a table without ASKING the diner first.)  I will go back for the Crazy Alfredo (until they change that) and my second is now my first rated for Baked Ziti which really sucks because I love the mounds of ricotta on the top.  A highlight for me.  Please fix this situation so I can update my review!

Just ordered $70worth of food, $100 in gift cards and they would not let us sit at a table to drink wine and await order.  Sent us to the bar without enough seats.  No one sat at the table we were asked to surrender in the fifteen minutes we were there.  Never been upset with Nora's before!  This treatment was rude and unnecessary.

I mean, it's not the best. But it's not the worst either. You can tell they have their customers on lock so I feel like they don't really train their staff to go above and beyond. 

Food: I got the crazy alfredo which was pretty good. I liked the elements entailed to it such as the Jalepeno for an extra kick, bell peppers for texture and a hint of sweetness and sausage for a heightened flavor. Still, it wasn't anything impressive that would amount to a total of $20 something per plate. My girlfriend got the pasta with meat sauce but wasn't impressive as her dish mostly had cheese. Quite disappointing to say the least. At the end of the meal, we received a complimentary dessert in celebration of my birthday which was one of the most exceptional tiramisu I've ever tasted. 

Service: it was okay. Nothing outstanding but for the type of restaurant they were, I expected a little bit more attention. Our server wasn't at all enthusiastic and made it seem like we were just another customer. Quite disappointing. 

Ambiance: beautiful venue as this is their new location. I really felt like this restaurant belonged in summerlin or even the Strip. It was modern with a dash of classic. 

Overall: I mean, I wouldn't be in a hurry to visit again. If you're a huge fan of Italian, I do suggest to give them a try but I wasn't too impressed.
